3.description: The people that work here creep me out. I notice a mafia like closeness to the workers and many of the guys that seem to frequent there regularly. One guy, (chubby bald older) who makes the keys is rude, condescending, and, in my experience, was not helpful at all. Today, he was downright manic. Home Depot may be a megastore, but nobody creeps me out there. People don't condescend you bc you may not be a handyman who already knows what they're doing. This is a boys club, and i want no part of it.

1.description: Pleasantly surprised, when I went in with a toilet tank problem, to be shown how to fix it rather than buy parts. And all the clerks I encountered were friendly and polite.

2.description: It breaks my heart to write this as I've been coming here for 10+ years. The staff is generally friendly and quite knowledgable. I like that you can get in and out quickly, unlike the big warehouse places.....but. I recently had a bad experience and don't know if I'll be back. I bought $60 worth of LED Christmas lights and within a week about 25% went out. Another few days and the whole 4 sets crashed. The family had the flu and we didn't leave the house between Christmas and New Year's. When I try to return them (credit would have been fine) I was treated like a criminal. "There's no guarantee on lights" "It's after Christmas and those were on sale (so what?)" Nothing like "I'm really sorry, I know you're a regular customer..." It's the old adage that you're only as good as your last time-and this one was very poor.

9.description: This is probably the most unpleasant store I have ever shopped. The people lack any warmth or personality, and because I'm a woman, I am NEVER asked if I need help. I have to seek it out. However, I watch the male service people ask the men who are shopping. Double standard.  I just had another negative experience with an Ace associate over the phone. Down right rude.

10.description: Stopped in to pick up an extra shovel before the big blizzard (for my car), and they had ample stock and a super friendly cashier!

4.description: I love this store. I go out of my way, to come here instead of wasting my time at another ace. Friendly service who always try to help. I have a home depot right near my house but to me I would rather come to a less crowded environment. Free parking, free fresh popcorn too! Paint mixing to any specification.  Keys made even chip ones.

6.description: Absolutely, hands-down the best hardware store I have ever been to. I love coming here.Just a few weeks ago, we had a bananas rainstorm during morning rush hour. Being a good hippie, I had gone to check on my rain barrels before dropping off my husband at the train. My "system" was not working and my dual-barrel setup was totally overflowing at my foundation.Forty-five minutes later, I'm standing in the Edgebrook Ace, holding a toddler, and dripping wet. One of the guys there BUILT me a pipe/flange/coupler thing of his own design (he glued it and everything). I'd just gone in to buy a length of pipe and plumber's tape. I was amazed. And then I installed the thing. It works like a champ, doesn't leak and now I have no more overflow problems.I heart you, Edgebrook Ace.

12.description: Worth the DriveHelpful, informative, timely, diligent.Three Saturdays ago I drove to a local Ace Hardware in Chicago to buy an expensive Weber gas grill.  I knew the make and model.  All I needed was help in getting the grill to my house.I walked into the "other" Ace Hardware and stood by the grills.  Then I looked for someone to help me, no luck.  It's Saturday afternoon and there's nobody around?  Walked out immediately.Then I drove to Edgebrook Ace Hardware.They were helpful.  And very busy.  Customers everywhere and salespeople everywhere.  It took only a few minutes to find not one, but two salespeople that helped me.They were informative.  They knew that the Weber Genesis grill that I wanted was not in inventory and had to be ordered.  They knew exactly what kind of grill I needed to hook directly to my outside wall gas line (no tank needed).They were timely.  I was in and out of the store in 30 minutes.  My stove was ordered and I believed they would have it in stock in the next week.  They did.They were diligent.  When the grill arrived at their store, they assembled it flawlessly.  They delivered to my house when they said they would.  And finally, they installed it just as they had promised.I shudder to think what would have happened if I had purchased my Weber Genesis grill at the "other" hardware store.If you're looking for a big ticket item like a Weber Genesis gas grill, give Edgebrook Ace Hardware a try.  The price was competitive and the service was great.  Thanks guys.

5.description: Always like coming in here....the place is organized well and the staff are social and the customer feels like he is well greeted and if there is a question to be asked, the staff drops what they are doing and hit help mode.  Customer statisfaction is a big thing to me, and the care and needs of the cutsomer.

13.description: You can't go wrong with your local Ace. I like that when I walk in the door someone asks me if I need help and then walks me directly to the aisle, shows me my options and then I'm on my way. It's like the valet of hardware stores. Plus I hate big box hardware stores, I get lost and the employees are the opposite of helpful. It may be smaller but 99% of the time it's a waaay better experience. So glad to have one in the hood.

11.description: I've been living in a world of big boxes too long and I can't stand it anymore!  Something must be done!  For the people who've been told by some idiot that what you want isn't available because they don't make it anymore, or for those who COULDN'T EVEN FIND the idiot to give you bad advice: Make your stand.  Give your patronage to the worthy.  The Edgebrook Ace Hardware, is such a place.Here you WILL FIND a KNOWLEDGEABLE STAFF and a plethora of services.  You may not find the cheapest of the cheap, but you will find things...

8.description: This is probably my favorite hardware store.  They've pretty much got anything and everything you'd need to maintain your home.  True, the big box stores have all the stuff you'd need to BUILD your house, but if you're just looking to replace or repair something, then this Ace IS THE PLACE.  My favorite aisle is the hardware aisle, where all the screws, nuts, bolts, and other misc. things are.  Everything is out in clearly marked, well organized bins and NOT wrapped in plastic and/or boxed up.  So if I'm looking for just one or two little pieces it's easier to find.  They have a great lawn and garden section as well.  The staff is very friendly and very knowledgeable.  I try to shop there for all that I can, and I only get the things they don't carry at the big box stores.  Luckily that's not often.Thanks Edgebrook Ace Hardware

0.description: Love this place, and I drive by several other hardware stores to get to it. Great staff and the store has everything. Even pickles!

7.description: Please support this Ace Hardware!!  You will not get this kind of service at the big stores.

58.description: This place is amazing on so many different levels.  The service from Nick is always personal and friendly.  Many reviews for this place have already talked about how great the food is, etc..  But what I wanted to comment on is just how darn clean the place is.Really.  The place is so clean I was automatically thinking of the old adage, "so clean you can eat off the floors..."My wife and I were done with an exhausting and stressful night of running errands with our two kids and were really hungry.  So we stepped in and were so glad we did.  We will definitely be back.

56.description: Best gyros in town. Plus great fries and shakes. Nick and the family are awesome, and know my whole family (and basically everyone). I love Papa Chris'.

29.description: My go-to place for Gyros! Great menu selection and there always happy to see you. Appears to be a family run place. Decent parking too.

42.description: Pretty good food here. The lady at the front was super nice. Food came out pretty quick also. The cheeseburger was great and a nice size. I Curly Fries with cheese and it was good. Fries were nice and crunchy. Had a small coke and everything cost me $9. Not bad.I would recommend splitting the curly fries if you have a friend with you, I barely put a dent in them. It's a huge serving. I will def come back when in the area and have a craving for a good burger.

23.description: Figured I'd update my review.  This is still a decent option for "charred" foods.  Typical char-type restaurant with a few Greek options often found at places like these.  Stuff like, gyros, Saganaki, kebabs, Baklava as well as typical American fast food favorites as in cheeseburgers, BLT's, hot dogs and a lot of fried items.  They often offer a special combo of the day and it's priced just above $ 5 dollars, which comes with a side and drink.  These days, prices like these for a decent meal are hard to come-by.  Since it's Lent season, figured I'd stop in for a lunch of a fried fish sandwich and side salad.  The weekday afternoon was busy with repeat customers that are often referred to by name.  A nice perk to being a "repeat."  The shop is never busy, it's comfortable and approachable whether you're dining solo or wanting to be joined by a few.The place, although dated, was clean and comfortable enough for enjoying the time spent.  If you dig typical fast food, you'll get your moneys worth.  But these days with more "local" food restaurants offering "made-from-fresh" items (i.e. hand cut fries as opposed to frozen), it's kind of dinosaur in a modern world.  A place for the "Joes" to grab a convenient meal.

47.description: You would be hard pressed to find a place that treats you any nicer than they do at Papa Chris' and the food is delicious.

8.description: I'm having the best cream of chicken soup I've ever had!  Great service and food. Beef sandwich tender, juicy and tasty. The curly fries are just right. You can't go wrong with anything here.

31.description: One of the best shish ka Bob sandwiches I have ever had, highly recommend. Overall great food, great service, average prices.  There salads are a nice size also, and they always offer extra feta.  Never had a bad meal and I will continue to go.

34.description: I went in to buy hubby and I some hot dogs one very snowy night not too long ago.  If you are going to sell a hot dog in Chicago, make sure it's on a poppy seed bun! That was the only thing wrong with the food here.  The fries were crispy outside and tender inside.  I order the cheese sauce on the side and it was nicely melted.  I'll eat here again, but probably not a hot dog.  A Chicago dog MUST be on a poppy seed bun.

16.description: This place was soooooooooooooo good! I was not expecting it to be great, but I was wrong! The cauliflower was so tasy, the cheese fries were delish (merks cheese, I think), the polish sausage was so good I wanted to get another one immediately.  I wish I was closer to this place!!

13.description: First time here, even though my grade school classmates came here all the time. I think they sponsor my grade school, Wildwood, but I'm not sure. Cheese fries were delicious. Had a cheese burger too, which was just right. Will try their gyro next time.

11.description: I decided to try this place out based on the earlier reviews and went here the first week of October.  I ordered the Chicken Parmesan Sandwich, Cheese Fries, Baklava, and Root Beer.  First thing I noticed were the portions were large and second the food was delicious.  Place was clean and is a great bang for the buck.

39.description: Love the gyros and curly fries. Great milk shakes. Fast, friendly service. My favorite place for take-out.

37.description: I've only had the francheezee and gyro here but both have been great! The lady at the front is always very friendly and the prices are reasonable.

0.description: Great food, great people! They are always consistent with the quality of their food, and I've never had anything there I didn't like. A few of my favorites are their Greek chicken dinner, chicken sandwich and double cheeseburgers. Nick, Pam and Cathy are always super friendly, it's a nice environment all the way around.

38.description: By far the best gyro in the Chicago area!!

51.description: I expected more from the hot dogs.

27.description: Good, good, and more good. Try the Big Stan, gyros, the ribs, and so much more. This place has got you covered.

32.description: WOW what a monster gyro plate. $9 and some change for a plate that I simply can't finish in one sitting. Quick, hot, and a great pita. Staff was friendly.Thank you!

54.description: Very Good food, Nick and his family are awesome and the fact he knows everyone who comes in there is a testament on how good the food and service is, and he also supports the local community of little leaguesGreek Chicken and milkshakes are the bomb.

48.description: Oh Papa Chris'! You're getting 4 stars from me just for the cheese fries alone! Those are soooooo good!This place was the hot spot when we were in 5th grade. It was a big deal when someone went on a DATE to Papa Chris'! Seriously!So, what to try? Cheese fries are delicious, I said that already, but it bears repeating. I hate it when cheese fries are bad, and these are very good. Hot dogs are standard good hot dogs I guess. Nothing to write home about, so that's where they lost my coveted last star. If I was in the area and jonesing for those cheese fries I'd go, but I would probably not make a special trip out there if you know what I mean.

44.description: One day, I had a sudden urge for a good burger around work, so I searched through Yelp and ended up finding Papa Chris. I usually don't write a review if I've only been there once, so I waited until my second visit.On my first visit, I went with a small Greek salad with chicken and curly fries. The food was amazing, especially the curly fries with honey mustard...mmm!! On my second visit, I had a cheeseburger with curly fries...also delicious though I probably wouldn't get a burger from there again. I am not a lover of fries, ever, but my friend told me to get them and they were so good, I couldn't resist again. I love the location (very close to work), the food, and the great customer service. It's a great restaurant for a fast and delicious lunch. I will def be back to try some of the other items on the menu, however, it may take me awhile to go back because I got in a severe car accident on my way back to work last week and I just don't want to go down that route for a bit.

24.description: YUM! Where can you get delicious Chicago food at a great value. The gyros was excellent and the tzatziki sauce tasted homemade. Crisp crinkle fries that were not greasy at all. The regular hot dog was okay. The dog itself was rather small and it was too "bun-y". Probably would order the 1/4 pounder one next time. Really great helpful and friendly owners and staff.

7.description: Papa Chris' Place is always a great destination for fast food good! Their burgers and hot dogs are perfect. Customer service is very friendly and courteous and the restaurant itself is kept very clean. Definitely recommended!

49.description: I live right around the corner and have been coming here for 12 years.  The place is clean and friendly.  The food is delicious.  They have daily specials which are very good prices with an entree and fries.

40.description: While my mouth said yes yes, my body and well being afterwards said no no.  I ordered gyros there thinking it they would be like any other Chicago hotdog/gyros place.  After ordering them I should have noticed the red flags, such as the gyros being DOUSED in grease and the fries being as stale as a month old bagel.  Silly me continued to eat both and finish my meal.  The several days after that ensued were as if they came out of a horror film.  It felt as if Hercules clobbered me in the stomach and I was left to rot in a desert.  Never again will I venture to this food poisoning factory.

53.description: I appreciate the family run business.  I do.  But they do NOT have the "BEST GYROS IN TOWN."  In fact, they don't have even have good gyros.  Now maybe it was an off day, but my gyro had about 2 lbs of dry, cold gyro meat, with a mound of uncooked white onions and some of the most bland tzaziki sauce my tastebuds have ever experienced.  Crinkle cut- ie, frozen french fries were served completely unseasoned.  I was thoroughly disappointed after reading all these glowing reviews....and I promise you can find much better gyros elsewhere.

30.description: I've lived in the area my whole life. I've been eating at papa chris for at least 15 years. Simple, good, neighborhood place. Owners work it themselves. They are always there. Nice people. The only thing I've ever had that I don't like was the Beef. Otherwise everything I've had has been great. Food is very affordable. Eat for 2 for under $20 easily. Recommend.

46.description: This place sponsered my little league team when i was a kid. The owner and his wife are the nicest people i've ever met!  Great fast food, and great service!  Nothing has changed about this place since it opened. Newer establishments like Ivy's, could learn a thing or two from this place.  Just like when I was 8, I go back whenever I crave good fast food. :)

1.description: We stopped by this place on a whim after playing racquetball. It was a great place to go eat yummy fried foods after working out. It was great because it is super clean with a nicer ambiance than most tirple-D-esque places even though we were in sweats. They have double doors which I love so those sitting next to the doors don't freeze when they open! It was nearly sterile clean, and you can tell they are a member of the community.  The food was standard (in a good way) and was served quickly. I was questioning how hot the fries could be since they were ready nearly moments after ordering but they were  .  The gyro platter is a little expensive but honestly, 2-3 people could easily split it.They were also super nice in regards to our hyper toddler who was only calm when gulping down the gyro meat.We will be back.

55.description: went in for free gyros day and walked out.  After waiting in line an hour, (coupon states  no limit) I had 3 coupons to bring home for dinner, would only honor one.  I can NOT bring one gyro home...reallly???  they want the rest of my family in that packed place ..line out the door????  Lady behind the counter was stuck up and bitchy.  I guess they have a high opinion of themselves.  They should post something on the door so you do not wait foerver then have to walk out empty handed or try to feed 4 people 1 gyro.  P.S. to the beyotch behind the counter- chicken gyros are delicious, get over yourselves.  I'll stick to Edens.

9.description: Hotdogs everything...way too much onions.  Fries cold and soggy.   Beef barley soup terrible. Have had can soup better.    Location clean and nice.

26.description: Been coming for over a year now for maybe twice a month. HAS NEVER FAILED. Always friendly, always fresh and very tasty. What else can I say?

25.description: Great food and great people! Can't go wrong!

12.description: Was in the area with a friend, saw this place, so thought we would try it.  Typical Greek joint, 1000 things on the menu board.  Friendly service from the lady at the counter....ordered 2 hots dogs, fries, 1 gyros, tamale, soup and a cheeseburger.  The hot dogs might have been the worst I have ever had, stale, stale bun with a very average dog inside.  Fries are the normal frozen out the bag crinkle cut.  Soup was very salty.  Excellent cheeseburger with the right amount of crust to the burger.  Very average gyros...they aren't buying the top quality gyro meat...sauce was great.  The tamale probably was good, but couldn't get the strings off the ends to try it...just through it away.  Saw some people eating the chicken next to us....looked very good.  All in all, probably won't be back.  The hots dogs at Al's Beef just down the road are super.

59.description: I think I still come back to this place just for their amazing cheese fries.

21.description: This is one of my favorite local places. The owner and his wife are very friendly and the food is great. If you're in the mood for a burger, fries, and a coke I say eat here. Nice place to eat during those hot summer days.

17.description: This place has been around for a long time I drive past it while I'm out working all the time but stopped in for lunch for the first time today. Had a gyros and it is every bit as good as twin on Harlem. Maybe even a little better I hate to say it. Absolutely delicious cooked perfectly just the right amount of onions tomato and cucumber sauce. I wish I had stopped in years earlier but will stop in for lunch every time I'm in the area now!

10.description: We absolutely love this place! The food is always good. The best patty melts. And the people that own it are super friendly. They always seem to remember us. Burgers and polish are good choices too. Pleasant atmosphere and clean.

5.description: Figured I'd update my review.  This is still a decent option for "charred" foods.  Typical char-type restaurant with a few Greek options often found at places like these.  Stuff like, gyros, Saganaki, kebabs, Baklava as well as typical American fast food favorites as in cheeseburgers, BLT's, hot dogs and a lot of fried items.  They often offer a special combo of the day and it's priced just above $ 5 dollars, which comes with a side and drink.  These days, prices like these for a decent meal are hard to come-by.  Since it's Lent season, figured I'd stop in for a lunch of a fried fish sandwich and side salad.  The weekday afternoon was busy with repeat customers that are often referred to by name.  A nice perk to being a "repeat."  The shop is never busy, it's comfortable and approachable whether you're dining solo or wanting to be joined by a few.The place, although dated, was clean and comfortable enough for enjoying the time spent.  If you dig typical fast food, you'll get your moneys worth.  But these days with more "local" food restaurants offering "made-from-fresh" items (i.e. hand cut fries as opposed to frozen), it's kind of dinosaur in a modern world.  A place for the "Joes" to grab a convenient meal.

3.description: Really solid burgers and dogs. Nicely charred meat, crispy fries. Good value, super quick, and friendly service!

35.description: Fantastic fast food (get the cheese fries) and the warmest/friendliest family owned joint in town. Been coming here since I wad a kid. It was out "peach pit". Say hi to Nick and friends for me...

19.description: The first thing I noticed was that the place was immaculate. There wasn't a speck of dirt, grime or dust , not even under the tables. I ordered a tuna melt, some mozzarella sticks and a slice of baklava. Tuna melt was solid, can't really screw that up. The mozzarella sticks were a home run. Most places like this will overcook them. These were golden brown with perfect gooey cheese inside. Now, for the finale..... The absolute best slice of baklava I've ever had. The piece was gigantic and oozing with honey goodness. This was my first time at Papa Chris's, but definitely not my last.

28.description: Food is average at best.  Owner is very unfriendly and acts like he's doing you a favor serving you.  Wouldnt go out of my way to visit him anyway.

45.description: I stop here every time I'm in town.  This place sponsored my little league team 20+ years ago and the same folks are serving  up the same quality food.  I love that I can bring my kids to this friendly, family run business and show them my picture on the wall.

33.description: Best mozzarella sticks on the planet, been eating here for 20 years and is still one of my favorite hot dogs and gyros in the city!

43.description: 5 stars just because the curly fries are AMAZING!!! Burgers are pretty average. Grilled chicken sandwich is pretty good, and i think that's all i've tried there... But all I've gotta say is CURLY FRIES!!! YUMMMY!!!

2.description: Went here on a whim. The person behind the counter was super-nice! Inside, the place look somewhat dated. We ordered grilled chicken sandwiches and some mozzarella sticks. The chicken was rather bland. I would think it's no more than a sliver of chicken, maybe 4oz, on a bun. Nothing worth mentioning, but definitely not worth the price they were charging for them.The mozzarella sticks were your standard sticks. They had decent breading and gooeyness. The plus is that there were plenty of seats inside and parking was ample

18.description: I come here for lunch all the time. Usually take it to go. They have never messed up and order. It is cheap and tastes great! They know me by face and love their customers!!! :) Go try it for yourself!

41.description: I had the Gyro Plate last night and it was PHENOMENAL!!! FIRST off and most importantly, the lamb is Kronos (if you know only one thing about gyros, know that Kronos is the leading supplier of premium gyros in the USA) which I definitely prefer but don't always expect. SECOND, the pita was perfect...soft in the middle, crispy on the outside, and not oily. THEN their HOMEMADE Tzatziki sauce is really, really good and I'll even say...second to none! Lastly, all the "extras"  like the rice, tomatos, and grilled onions were fresh and delicious. Lastly, this place has super friendly customer service and a VERY generously priced menu (too generous if you ask me-esp for being in Niles)...I put them in my top two and will be a lifetime customer.

52.description: I grew up eating here and Nick has seen me grow up. I can't say anything bad about the place, it isn't trying to be anything it isn't. If you're looking for lunch and you're in the area, stop by and have a gyro.

50.description: Im not going to lie, I have only has the Gyro plate here but it is hands down the best Gyro in the area. for around $8 you get enough meat to feed 2 people. Their Tzaziki sauce is around average but what the sauce lacks the gyro meat makes up for. I have never been disappointed with a gyro at this place

4.description: Best place around for hot dogs,beef sandwiches,gyros!  Friendly owners,staff.Food is always fresh! Love papa Chris's! Bathrooms are so clean so is resturant!

6.description: Nick and the crew do a great job - really courteous - excellent food. My son loves the fish sandwich and cheese fries - I love it all. Nice environment.

22.description: This place provides consistently high quality year in year out. Very good food always served hot and fresh. Friendly efficient service.A quick  serve restaurant where you order and pick up your food at the counter. Their menu is rather extensive beyond gyros, hot dogs, burgers and fries. Unlike many of their competitors their food doesn't taste like it was sitting under a heat lamp for a half hour. There is ample seating.

15.description: The gyros here is one of the best I've ever had, super delicious and moist with a side of fries, pita bread, the homemade sauce and a large drink.  Makes for a great lunch stop.  The business is family run which I like and the fresh Greek desserts like the baklava with honey and cinnamon is so good.  I've also had the traditional rice pudding which I enjoyed.  Great place for a meal, will be back soon.

57.description: Yet another spot where my customers wish to go quite a bit. Pretty much everything on their menu is fantastic. More often than not, Papa Chris himself or his wife is taking your order. They are very friendly and its really refreshing to buy from a family establishment that also serves great fast food. Papa Chris' Place is another Chicagoland staple. You can get all of the Chicago favorites. For one reason or another, I find myself getting a Gyro everything almost every time. Their Gyro is Kronos but something in the way they make it turns out to be one of my favorites in the entire Chicagoland area. Add Cheese Fries to that and you are on cloud 9. Don't forget, although you dont fill your own soda, they will refill it for you if you bring it up!

20.description: My favorite place! I love their hot dog with fries! Their service is good because it's fast and the people are friendly, too!

36.description: We tried going here late one evening and as we were exiting our vehicle someone came out and told us they just shut off the grill.  :(  Being determined we returned the next evening.  Come to find out it wasn't staff that came out to tell us it was closed it was a customer... nice customers here!  The staff here was super-friendly too and we couldn't be more excited to see an ambulance pull in so they could grab something to eat.  If anyone knows the good places it's them right!?I ordered a gyro and fries to eat-in.  The gyro was quite good. TONS of meat, fresh pita and flavorful sauce and a generous order of fries.  My friend ordered the spinach pie, which I guess was a mistake since she is from Greece and knows the good from bad.  Unfortunately this tasted like it was made from frozen spinach... bitter and bitter could be.  She also ordered the balkava which was better than the pie.I will return here, they were such nice people and my meal was very good and a good value too, I just will not be ordering the spinach pie.  :)

14.description: I love coming to this place. Very clean & the workers are so sweet. The food is absolutely amazing. I always get the gyros with fries & a coke. I've had the cheese fries & the seasoned fries both good but I like the seasoned fries more. The gyros are the really tasteful & well stacked with meat! They give refills on drinks, thats always a plus. I can eat this place everyday. Wish they had one in the suburbs.

3.description: I have been going to this location on and off since it opened. I go about 2x a week. I have stopped going a few times. The first time, I spotted and pointed out mold on my flatbread. My sandwich was remade. The second time, the oven was not on. The guy told me it would take a few more minutes to wait for toasting. I waited. When toasted, my sandwich was only lukewarm; this was gross because it was a breakfast sandwich with bacon and egg. I ended up throwing it away. The last time, I got a 6-inch sub to go. I was the only customer. The last thing I said was "spices only". Then I moved to the cashier to pay. I took my sandwich back to work for lunch. It was drenched in oil. Extra calories and unappetizing. The staff here knows me: I never get oil on my sandwiches. They are generally friendly and welcoming. However, they need to listen and pay more attention if they want to keep their regular customers. I draw the line at inedible food. Three strikes and you're out a customer. Goodbye.

1.description: My first time going to this Subway store on one of the coldest days of the year and I'm so glad it was warm inside! I tried the 6 inch sub tuna sandwich on Italian herbs and cheese bread as well as the chopped salad with chicken which surprisingly good! Service was excellent! Restroom was clean!

2.description: Brand new Subway!  Typical Subway store, but that's a good thing.  Clean, good service and consistent food.  If you can't get to Bari or Graziano's then Subway will do.  I'm a Sub snob so I will drive all the way downtown for my Sub but the kids wanted to try this new Subway because it's close to home and they were curious.  Busy corner so parking can be a problem.  If you have a taste for a great Hot Dog visit Ivy's across the street.

0.description: Update there is new management and ownership here.  The employees were happy to tell me  that great news.  So now instead of handing them a couple bucks and saying put this in your pocket I can throw the money in the tip jar. It might not appear like a big thing in the big picture but the way the employees are treated does relate back to the service and the food purchased. If he was trying to screw employees out of tips who knows what else he was doing? So great service and friendly employees the star rating goes back up because he is not there any longer :-)

36.description: If I had known the experience I was going to have, I would have gone anywhere else, even SuperCuts.  In the beginning, everything went as expected: consultation, wash, condition and into the chair.  As she was cutting I didn't realize how much was being cut.  There was no discussion as to how much I wanted take off, but I never thought she would have take the liberty to just chop off a considerable amount of hair without consultation.   I don't know who's haircut she was giving me, but it was no where near what I came in with and this was only to "clean up" the cut I already had.  When all was said and done about five inches of hair (my friend's estimation) was off and I was not seeing what I wanted.  Told her I would work with what she had cut, and was ready to go.   From all appearances, it looks like very professional salon, but my stylist was a butcher.   I would never recommend this salon to anyone.

29.description: I first went to Aqua Salon to donate my hair for Locks of Love (it was one of the few nicer salons that offered a cut with donation). The person that cut my hair was Veronica and I have to say she did an amazing job. I have always had long hair and with the 12 inches that you have to donate i went to above shoulder length so i was a littler nervous. Veronica took over an hour to properly cut and lightly layer my hair. I have been going to her ever since. She is very honest and professional. I asked her about a certain color and she told me that different highlights would be better and she did a great job.Since then my sister, and brother now go to Veronica and they love her as well. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that you get the product push from a lot of people. But you can just say no and they are good about it.

42.description: So happy with my hair cut by Margaret!!!  She listened to exactly what I wanted and the whole experience was very pleasant.  Will have her cut my hair again!

23.description: Went in for a haircut yesterday. Everything was perfect! When I walked in, I was immediately greeted and asked if I wanted a beverage (wine, beer, water, etc.). Since I had an appointment, I did not have any wait time at all. Got the haircut from Carla, who pretty much ROCKS! She talks you through the whole thing, and makes sure you get exactly what you want. I walked out looking amazing! Carla does wonders, and knows what looks good on your face type. She doesn't rush at all and takes her time to make sure everything is perfect (I mention this because a lot of places just try to get you in, and rush you out as quickly as possible, and that makes me feel annoyed since I'm paying for the services). Aqua's prices are extremely reasonable, and the service is impeccable. Highly recommend Carla!

31.description: I am so sorry to hear people had bad experiences here.  I really think it depends on the stylist you go to.  I have been with Ana Ortega McCole for more than a year and she is the BEST!  She is friendly and we always have a great conversation.  I also always feel fabulous when I leave.I have straight medium length hair and I always just go for a cut.  What I love about Ana is that she talks, but not too much, always gives me a great cut that looks like what I ask for, and she has given me great styling tips when I ask without just trying to push salon products on me to buy.  When I am explaining to her what I want she is looking at me and asking questions so she really gets it.  At other places I've been to they half listen while they are washing your hair and then you wish you had brought a hat when you are leaving.  She is not at all like that.So, I say it is worth the drive and if you go to Ana, you won't be disappointed.(She also shared with me that the owner has recently cracked down on some of the staff that weren't so great so for those who had a bad experience, try it again!)

34.description: I won't be back.  This is my second time here.  I went when the business first opened and, foolishly, came back.  I had an 8:00 p.m. appointment to have my hair cut.  I arrived at 7:50 p.m. and sat in the back until 8:25 p.m.  No one acknowledged me and I felt like I had been forgotten about.  I was 'this close' to grabbing my coat and leaving out the back door when my stylist suddenly appeared.  The cut was just okay and certainly not great for the price.  Noel should have at least acknowedged that my stylist was running behind, but she was only pleasant when trying to sell me products when I was paying my bill.

16.description: I just started going to this salon after many years at Mario Tricoci.  I was tired of the factory feel of Tricoci's and the prices as well.  I was referred to Miriam who is a wonderful personality and did a great job on my color, cut and blow dry.  She explained everything to me and after a short discussion about how I want my hair, I was satisfied with what we decided.  The decoration of the salon is warm and cozy.  Its not rushed (like my previous salon) and coffee in a coffee cup (not paper) was a nice touch.  I had a wonderful experience over all.  I read some of the previous reviews and either the salon got their act together or some of you girls either did not speak up soon enough or have had extremely pleasing salon services to be unsatisfied by the customer service of Aqua.  Maybe I'm biased because I used to work at Tricoci's as a spa coordinator and 1) know what to ask for and expect and 2) know when someone has sh*tty customer service or the customer is just impossible to please.  My only dissatisfaction with Aqua is when I went to check out the girl at the desk was not professional.  I booked my next appointment with her and asked for a reminder card but she refused to give one to me and pointed out the next appointment was on my receipt.  I told her I don't hold on to receipts and needed a card but continued to refuse to give me a card!  She rolled her eyes at the stylist when she asked her to put my appointment in her books.  It wasn't a joking roll of the eyes either.  Of course I forgot the appointment and when I got a reminder call, I had to cancel it due to another obligation.  I did mention to the person who called me why I forgot about the appointment and was told that the person who booked my appointment was no longer working there.  Over all: pretty satisfied.

11.description: Almost three full years later from the time of writing the original review of this place, I get a message sent to me by the owner.  In this message she apologizes for my experience, admits they did not handle that original promotion well, and was just generally cool about the whole explanation (the reason it was so late in coming was that she had not had an owner account until now).  I write back and say I appreciate the apology. She then offers to colour my hair for no charge.  Now I can hardly refuse this offer.  Since the time I had been in this salon my hair is easily 3 times the length it was, and colouring is difficult, time consuming and expensive.  I meet with Miriam, who is very nice and is very careful about explaining everything in detail.  I got colour, a conditioning treatment and a blow-dry and I am pretty pleased with the results.  The whole time there was very professional, courteous and pleasant.  I don't like writing bad reviews, really I don't.  I do like it though, when a business owns up to their mistakes and wants to right a wrong.  This shows true professionalism and it seems to be getting rarer and rarer in this day and age.  I only bumped this review up to 3 stars because while I definitely felt like I was getting a 5 star experience, I know my time there was a little bit special and I would like to return on another day to see if things really are still up to that level.

39.description: I love this place. Getting your hair done really is a treat and they truely make it feel that way.I came here about two years ago, with long hair that I wanted to donate to the Locks of Love program.  I called a few places and talked to a few stylists and finally found Amber. I was concerned because my hair is very thin and i've never really had a good experience at a salon. I made an appointment and i've never looked back.Amber is really super sweet and is very attentive, as well as intuitive. You tell her what you want and she makes it happen!  So many other places have cut my hair the way THEY wanted to. At Aqua, they listen to you. Please go see Amber!

37.description: This was all wrong. I went here as part of the pretty in pink promotion for a single process color and conditioning treatment.  Denise was the stylist.  After the deep conditioning treatment, Denise puts a towel on my head and hands me a comb. Hair dripping, in the middle of the store, I'm asked to comb my hair (and dry it).  I wasn't even led back to the styling station (another stylist was looking on so apparently this was normal).  I've NEVER been to a salon where I was asked to comb/style my hair regardless of if its a promotion or not.  I wasn't going to debate this so I gave Denise her comb back, and with my wet hair, paid up and left.When my hair finally dries, I realize my hair coloring is bad.  I now have black hair with bluish black ends (instead of my original dark brown hair.) To fix it I went to a different salon for a color correction.  It was explained to me that 1. the color was left on too long and 2. the color was not applied properly.  Since my hair is relaxed it is more porous, needing a shorter processing time. Also, my ends did not need the same amount of time/color than my roots since I had a previous single process color and this was a touch up (it was explained as color accumulation).Denise used a dark brown color, applying the color down to the ends in sections (instead of applying the color to the new growth first and leaving the ends for last).  She left the entire color on my hair for 25 minutes - never checking my hair to see how the color was taking. The result: black hair with even darker ends with a bluish tint. She knew my hair was relaxed and previously colored during the consultation but I was put in a one size fits all without any adjustments. WHY GO TO A PROFESSIONAL?After digesting the mistakes I called the manager, Noel.  She was receptive and apologetic.  She was sorry about the bad coloring and how I was treated. She said that combing is definitely included (what happened? Especially when none of the other stylists spoke up and just gave me blank looks?). Drying Is not included.  That's fine if that's how they want to run their salon.  I think drying is a common courtesy once they shampoo your hair and it allows you and the stylist to check the coloring results. But their decision to leave clients with wet hair is the least of their problems.  The BIGGEST problem is the lack of customer care - care in giving a profession job.  How can there be no adjustments for different hair types? How can you not care enough to check on the hair to see how the color is taking?  How can you have pride in your profession and ask a client to comb and style their own hair, sitting in a shampoo chair?  Denise did the bare minimum and a very BAD job at that.  As a layperson, I could have done a better job at home.  But that's not the point.  The work was lacking in care and it was the first time I felt offended when leaving a salon. The manager waived the fee for my service. I was offered the opportunity to come back.  But what's the point? As I said to her - thanks but no thanks.  p.s. I resent a subsequent poster saying that the negative reviews are from people trying to "score a bargain." Why would I pay for crap?  Having moved to Chicago, I thought this was a great opportunity to find a good salon I can come back to.  (And on the flip side this is a great opportunity for them to build clientele.)  Because it is a promotion or package, does this mean I should get sub-par skill and poor service? No.  There's no excuse for a bad service.

0.description: Great salon!  I've been back in the Chicago area for 4 years and it's taken me this long to find the right stylist.  Nertila is great!  She knew exactly how to color my hair to keep it looking healthy and natural looking.  She's does a great cut as well.  The salon is nice and everyone seems so eager to make your experience a goodt one.  My parking meter was running out and they even ran outside in the rain and added time.  Great salon, definitely recommend it.

38.description: I went into this salon for a special they had advertised. I was put off immediately when the girl who was supposed to do my hair came up to me and announced my highlights would be an additional $20 than what the special offered. It turns out, she was trying to get me to do something completely different that wasn't the special I signed up for. I told her no, got the treatment I scheduled at the price I was told, but ended up leaving with sopping wet hair because a blow out would have been $20 more. From other places I've been, I think a blow out after highlights is part of the expensive cost of highlights.I wouldn't go here again.

27.description: I brought my daughter into Aqua Salon for her "back to school" hair cut after receiving a e-flyer regarding a school fund raising promotion. My daughter was a little nervous about going to a "Real Ladies Salon" instead of her usual "kiddie" hair cut/toy store place. But was set at ease by Carla, who's new to Aqua Salon. Carla immediately notice my daughter's chlorine damaged hair and suggested a special conditioner. (Usually I'd think this was a ploy to sell me unneeded hair products. But my daughter's hair was in really bad shape.) Anyway, whatever Carla did was magic! No more clorine build up!! Just pretty brown hair! And, a great hair cut to boot!! Getting my daughter's hair cut at a 'real' salon, makes a huge difference!! And, once more, the price of a kid's hair cut was a little less that the "kiddie salon" we'd gone to previously. Besides, being offered a beer or a wine while I waited was a really nice touch!!

32.description: Ashley is great! Unfortunatley in the year I've lived in this neighberhood I'd never heard of Aqua, until they came up on pretty city's $31 for breast cancer awareness list, so I decided to try them.I got a cut/conditioning treatment, eyebrow wax and color.The salon atmosphere is great, much more modern than most of the salons in the area, they have a salon manager who seems to be there must of the time who was a great help to me via email, and checked on me and the other clients a few times during our services to see how we were doing.My cut & color are great! I l will absolutley be going back and recommending aqua to others ( Ashley is who I'd recommend since I dont know the others) she was very attentive, super friendly and most important gave me great results

13.description: Tawni is Awesome!! I am so happy I found this salon and especially Tawni! It is close to home and is an inviting place. The salon is a modern place with a beautiful tropical fish tank and waterfall behind the check out desk. Offered while there is wine, soda, water with lemon, gourmet coffee of your choice made fresh with each cup and always a delicious snack.Now to get to the most important part ~ your hair. Tawni is excellent at listening to what you want and respecting it. My hair has never looked so good since coloring and highlighting my hair. My hair is hard to highlight, it pulls in a orange color and Tawni uses a toner in my hair after high lighting. Something my previous hair stylists didn't and I went to some top rated salons like Mario Tricoci. It used to take me a few washing of my hair until I was happy with the color now I leave the salon loving my hair color right away. Tawni is great about listening that I like my hair longer and cuts just what is needed. She always does an excellent cut with long layers to give my hair body. She also saves me money by telling me I would be fine with high lighting my hair every other time which saves me a lot and more gentle on my hair.Tawni is also great at doing eyelash extensions. I have never had long eyelashes before and I am loving my eyelash extensions and have received many compliments on them as well as my hair.I definitely recommend this salon and of course Tawni!!

24.description: I've lived in the neighborhood for the past 17 years and I remember when the salon used to be Dior.  I was never pleased with Dior because it was a blue haired old lady salon.  When the shop was taken over, I was pleasantly surprised and extremely happy that when I asked for my hair to be dyed back to my natural flaming red color. . .I got it.  I used to be told by the Dior staff that the color wouldn't work in my hair.  Well they were WRONG!I come to the salon every other month for a hair coloring and brow waxing.  I usually have Veronica, Amber, or Anna take care of me, but I'm willing to let the newer stylists take a chance with my hair.  I always have stellar service by the stylists.  I did have one really bad experience, about 2 years ago, with a newer stylist because when I asked for layers in my hair, she cut chunks of my hair with no real flow.  I let the manager know the following day that I was not pleased.  The manager remedied the situation when I came back for my next coloring by not charging me for a hair cut.I've even used their services to have makeup applications for different events I needed to attend.  I was very leery of having a makeup application because I didn't want that "caked on" feeling.  When Veronica was done with the application, I felt so beautiful and received many wonderful compliments.  A friend of mine was visiting from Australia because we were going to a wedding  that weekend and my friend had her hair and makeup done.  She looked stunning when it was finished and has told me, as well as the staff, that she can't wait to come back to the states for a visit just so she can come to Aqua again.Thank you ladies for making me feel gorgeous!

7.description: I get my best haircuts from Redken trained stylists and Aqua offers them in a casual but glamorous neighborhood setting. The stylist really listened to what I wanted and had the skills to make it happen. They also provide the option of using an all natural product line if you are sensitive to artificial fragrances or chemicals. Just ask. The salon also has various incentives for new clients and for coming back, which I will do!

40.description: The first time I went to the salon i was very disappointed with my stylist. For starters, margaret, she was very unfriendly, hardly said a word. When I tried to talk to her I would barely get a response. Secondly, she did not know how to work with curly hair and was struggling. The owner was nearby but paid no mind to what this stylist was doing.  I felt there should have been better communication between the owner and this obviously rookie stylist as I've seen done in other salons. I requested my hair be blown straight. She didnt use the right brush from the get go nor enough heat. I 've had this done for years and this girl did not know what she was doing. My hair looked terrible!!!!!!!! I left with my hair looking stiff like a board. I had so much crap in my hair I went right home and washed it immediately.  And I had requested someone who knew how to work with curly hair when I made the appointment! I gave it one more shot since it is in the neighborhood. I tried a different stylist Amber, whom I'd seen working on a client with thick wavy hair on my previous visit. Unfortunately, she was just okay. She was more experienced but not a great stylist. She also put way too much product on my hair. So much in fact, that i could pull it off my hair and scalp. Needless to say I ended washing my hair after getting home. I gave this salon two shots I won't get burned a third. Its a nice looking salon but not very professional with regard to customer service, communication bet. stylists, or asking for assistance if the stylist is over her head.  Unless you have straight hair do not go to this salon!!!There are way more salons in Chicago just as pretty and with a more talented staff and attentive owners. It seems the owners are more concerned with looking like a good salon than being one.

30.description: Love this neighborhood salon - is a breath of fresh air in a neighborhood know for "blue hair" lady salons.  Makes me feel like I'm going downtown. Stylists are good and as is ease of making appointments.  Will be back!

1.description: Very happy with this salon. I have been here multiple times and have left liking my haircut every time. I just got my haircut by Joanna and she did a fantastic job! I will definitely be back. I have had trouble getting appointments last minute so I recommend making your appointment at least a week in advance.

9.description: I've been there a few times because I was loyal to one of their stylists who no longer works there. Every time I walked in no one would greet me.  The other stylists liked to gossip and chit chat with each other and the guy behind the counter took too many minutes to acknowledge my existence.  He seemed so busy chatting on the phone and stapling papers.  The atmosphere is really snobby.  Thank goodness my stylist left so I never had to go there again.

26.description: Aqua is fantastic-my new favorite salon in Chicago. Kristy is my stylist and she is out of this world wonderful and so talented. I went in last week seeking a totally new look-I had never gone incredibly short before-and when she was finished I was completely transformed with a look that my coworkers continuously complimented the next day. I feel confident and happy in my great new style. Thanks Kristy!

25.description: Almost three full years later from the time of writing the original review of this place, I get a message sent to me by the owner.  In this message she apologizes for my experience, admits they did not handle that original promotion well, and was just generally cool about the whole explanation (the reason it was so late in coming was that she had not had an owner account until now).  I write back and say I appreciate the apology. She then offers to colour my hair for no charge.  Now I can hardly refuse this offer.  Since the time I had been in this salon my hair is easily 3 times the length it was, and colouring is difficult, time consuming and expensive.  I meet with Miriam, who is very nice and is very careful about explaining everything in detail.  I got colour, a conditioning treatment and a blow-dry and I am pretty pleased with the results.  The whole time there was very professional, courteous and pleasant.  I don't like writing bad reviews, really I don't.  I do like it though, when a business owns up to their mistakes and wants to right a wrong.  This shows true professionalism and it seems to be getting rarer and rarer in this day and age.  I only bumped this review up to 3 stars because while I definitely felt like I was getting a 5 star experience, I know my time there was a little bit special and I would like to return on another day to see if things really are still up to that level.

12.description: I was very excited to discover Aqua Salon when I moved to the neighborhood about 7 years ago!  I think Amber and Rosy are very talented and would recommend either stylist.  It's a very nice, professional salon and I'm very glad to have something so nice nearby.  Also love that you can drink a nice cup of wine while having your hair done!

21.description: I tried Aqua last week when I needed a cut at short notice and truthfully I wasn't  expecting much. Don't get me wrong, I love Edgebrook but it's not exactly style capitol of the universe! However, Aqua literally took my breath away. Even mid-afternoon on a weekday, there was a nice buzz of activity with a choice of stylists available. The space is beautiful with polished wood floors, water accents and relaxing but upbeat music. Everyone was really welcoming and I was offered an array of beverages before my stylist, Carla, sat me down and we discussed my cut. She listened carefully to what I was looking for, made great suggestions and is clearly very knowledgeable about all things hair. While most cuts look good straight from the salon, I have to say that several days and washes later, it still looks amazing. Thank you Carla!~ If you're looking for a Michigan Avenue salon experience with neighborhood prices and a friendly, knowledgeable staff then I can't recommend Aqua too highly.

17.description: So I tried out Aqua because I got a free Belly and thought this is a neighborhood place and why not try it out.  So I read the reviews and was scared.  Not so good.  I tried it out anyway and when I made the appointment I asked to have a stylist who knew how to cut curly hair.  Bob told me about the different levels and suggested someone with a few years of experience.  I wasn't sold on this idea because I've had plenty of bad haircuts, meaning the stylist would cut so much off my hair, not really knowing curly hair, and subsequently causing me to wait a year for the 1/8 inch they cut off to grow back.  And that's because they chopped it. And definitely took more off than I required.On to my experience:Joy was great!  I liked her immediately when she told me if she cut my one length hair in layers, and began the shortest layer where I suggested that my hair would shrink and I'd hate her for it.  Of course, I know this, but to hear her say it and then not over cut my hair was great.  She explained she would cut it once and style it and dry it and then see what I thought.  Not a novel idea, I've heard this before, but in the end she was on the mark with her suggestion.  The cut is great.Try her out, whether you have curly hair or not.  I'm sure you'll be happy.

10.description: I had a free haircut from Belly. My appointment was with a stylist named Rosy. Beginning with the guy who took my reservation over the phone to the followup call I received insuring that I was satisfied- this place exceeded all expectations. I got a great haircut first and foremost. The little extras that made the experience special was the warmth of all the folks who worked there and their cheerful attention to detail. Aqua does a lot of charity work in the Edgebrok neighborhood which says a lot about there commitment to the local community and not just the bottom line. Bottom line is that they won a new customer- and an enthusiastic one!

5.description: Called Aqua Salon to make an appointment when I moved into the area.  They assigned me to someone. When I got to the appointment, I waited so long that I told the receptionist that I wanted a different stylist or I'll leave. They quickly gave me to Joy and apologized for not telling me that the stylist they had assigned to me was running behind. (and she never bothered to tell me either)  Joy is great. Glad I was assertive on my behalf. I won't allow establishments to waste my time when I am paying them for a service, right? Plenty of salons out there, including my old salon, which is just far enough away to be a hassle but not impossible. Joy is great, the salon fluctuates on customer service, but I go there for Joy.

35.description: What a find!  I've been here once for a haircut and condition and can't wait to go back.  I found it by accident - looking for a haircut on the way home from work - between Park Ridge and Portage Park - by way Touhy/Caldwell/Devon/Cicero.  There's ample street parking, metered, as well as lots of cute places nearby that I'm ready to try out - an Irish bar, an Italian Restaurant, and Al Primo Canto (on Check, Please last month) -all on the same stretch down the street.  The salon is a storefont that's somewhat modern looking from the outside, and totally clean and brand new looking on the inside.  I think they even have a waterfall wall.  My hair stylist was on time and was professional - Margaret.  She sat me down and listened to what I wanted and gave me exactly that.  Also, she did that thing you and I hate - diagnosed what was wrong with my hair like I didn't know from years of bleaching the crap out of it - but then she gave me free samples of stuff to try and fix it.  And guess what, it was the best thing ever and I've spent a lot of money on it since happily.  (Pureology in case you wondered).  This is a great - somewhat out of the way - salon for all ages and all styles, they seem to cater to the neighborhood, but their look could work with anyone downtown to Lincoln Square.

19.description: loved the service, they were easy to book, easy to park, and my hair looked amazing!  thank you!

28.description: I went to Aqua because it was in my new neighborhood and it had fairly good ratings on Yelp.  I was pleasantly surprised at the experience and had a good haircut there despite it being my first time.  I think it takes a while for your hair stylist to get to know you and your tastes.  My stylist, Veronica, did a great job listening to me and cutting my hair the way I wanted it.  It didn't turn out exactly perfect but I think that was my issue not being able to communicate what I wanted.  Veronica took a long time and did just what I asked her to do.  You could tell that she had really good skills and the cut looks really cute.  I will certainly go back to Aqua.  I made an appointment the day I had my hair cut and the staff was courteous and polite on the phone and at the salon.  The pricing was competitive for a salon of that caliber.  It's nice to have such a good place in the neighborhood.

3.description: Love my cut, Megan did an awesome job with my short bob! Great customer service and the coffee want bad either! Only reason I didn't give aqua 5 stars was street.pay.for.parking, boo!

33.description: I won't be going back....  I tried this salon because they have a new client special on a haircut and color...  But once I got there I was told that I needed some kind of special color treatment that cost an additional $20.  I paid the extra money and my hair did look nice at first, but then the color almost entirely faded after less than a month.  I called the salon, told them I was disappointed about this, and this is where things went downhill fast..  What amazingly horrible customer service!  (For the record, I am not a difficult or chronically dissatisfied person.  I am actually quite easy-going, and this place managed to make me mad!)  I would not recommend Aqua Salon to anyone!!

43.description: The salon's ambience is relaxed, contemporary, and detail-oriented; this is kind of how you'll feel about your haircut experience as well! Noel has been doing my hair for 3 years, and my friends and family were always so impressed that they all drive from the Northwest suburbs down to Devon St to get their hair cut and colored.

2.description: Ive been at Aqua a few times and ive always had a fabulous experience. Nertila is my stylist and I would never go to anyone else. She colors, cuts, tones, pretty much everything and im always extremely satisfied. She also makes you feel special while in her care. Go to Nertila!

18.description: I just got a cut and style by Joy the other week and her name says it all: JOY!!!!!! I have tried everywhere and in the past few years have NOT ONCE left a hair salon happy and satisfied, just always felt like: good enough but not in love. She was professional and didn't rush and had a modern style and I just love her.The salon had a fire a few months ago so they're working around the corner on Central for the time being until the salon is up and running again, I think they're working out of Salon Louise? It's across from Happy Foods and is worth going to temporary location till there open again, I never thought I'd see the day I wouldn't have to rush home and try and "adjust " the hair to my liking, my day has come!!

41.description: Pretty good place for a haircut. I get my hair done by Noel. They're always friendly here and coffee is good. I got my DH going here too. I did get my hair highlighted once. It turned out ok. The color was a little darker than what I was thinking and I'm disappointed that they don't also style your hair after a $90 full head of highlights. Instead they let you leave the salon with wet hair. You would think that salons would want people walking out of their doors with the best styles possible for all to see, regardless of how much a person spends on hair. Oh well. It's still good and close to home.

4.description: I have tried this place several times since it opened but never found a stylist who keeps me coming back on a regular basis. Too bad; it is convenient.  Last week, it took a stylist 4.5 hours to cut and color my hair.  I specifically told her that I didn't want to see any red in my hair and I now have red tones. Today, they called to tell me they could not keep my daughter's appointment -- just hours away -- with the preferred stylist. Sorry folks, you've just led me to write my first ever yelp review. Bad service, nothing special in terms of quality and as expensive as any quality salon.

6.description: I really want to support this local business, but I just can't find a stylist there that has really done a good job with my haircuts or my eyebrow waxes.  I have tried them twice for haircuts, and twice for waxes.  My husband also tried them for a haircut and was also not impressed.  It is very modern and clean, which I like, but the talent isn't there.  The first haircut I had was ok, and the second one was a bit painful...the stylist was burning my head with the hair dryer and scraping me with the brush.  I have fine wavy hair, so I need someone who is delicate, can give me a cut that adds volume, and can recommend products (not just those sold in the salon) and ways to style my hair.  Since I live within half a mile of this salon and it is clean and ok, I will go there if I really don't have the time to go somewhere else, but I'm never happy about it because I'm only going to get an ok cut, and I'm going to pay a high price for it.

22.description: I just started going to this salon after many years at Mario Tricoci.  I was tired of the factory feel of Tricoci's and the prices as well.  I was referred to Miriam who is a wonderful personality and did a great job on my color, cut and blow dry.  She explained everything to me and after a short discussion about how I want my hair, I was satisfied with what we decided.  The decoration of the salon is warm and cozy.  Its not rushed (like my previous salon) and coffee in a coffee cup (not paper) was a nice touch.  I had a wonderful experience over all.  I read some of the previous reviews and either the salon got their act together or some of you girls either did not speak up soon enough or have had extremely pleasing salon services to be unsatisfied by the customer service of Aqua.  Maybe I'm biased because I used to work at Tricoci's as a spa coordinator and 1) know what to ask for and expect and 2) know when someone has sh*tty customer service or the customer is just impossible to please.  My only dissatisfaction with Aqua is when I went to check out the girl at the desk was not professional.  I booked my next appointment with her and asked for a reminder card but she refused to give one to me and pointed out the next appointment was on my receipt.  I told her I don't hold on to receipts and needed a card but continued to refuse to give me a card!  She rolled her eyes at the stylist when she asked her to put my appointment in her books.  It wasn't a joking roll of the eyes either.  Of course I forgot the appointment and when I got a reminder call, I had to cancel it due to another obligation.  I did mention to the person who called me why I forgot about the appointment and was told that the person who booked my appointment was no longer working there.  Over all: pretty satisfied.

15.description: I love this place. Getting your hair done really is a treat and they truely make it feel that way.I came here about two years ago, with long hair that I wanted to donate to the Locks of Love program.  I called a few places and talked to a few stylists and finally found Amber. I was concerned because my hair is very thin and i've never really had a good experience at a salon. I made an appointment and i've never looked back.Amber is really super sweet and is very attentive, as well as intuitive. You tell her what you want and she makes it happen!  So many other places have cut my hair the way THEY wanted to. At Aqua, they listen to you. Please go see Amber!

20.description: Tawni is Awesome!! I am so happy I found this salon and especially Tawni! It is close to home and is an inviting place. The salon is a modern place with a beautiful tropical fish tank and waterfall behind the check out desk. Offered while there is wine, soda, water with lemon, gourmet coffee of your choice made fresh with each cup and always a delicious snack.Now to get to the most important part ~ your hair. Tawni is excellent at listening to what you want and respecting it. My hair has never looked so good since coloring and highlighting my hair. My hair is hard to highlight, it pulls in a orange color and Tawni uses a toner in my hair after high lighting. Something my previous hair stylists didn't and I went to some top rated salons like Mario Tricoci. It used to take me a few washing of my hair until I was happy with the color now I leave the salon loving my hair color right away. Tawni is great about listening that I like my hair longer and cuts just what is needed. She always does an excellent cut with long layers to give my hair body. She also saves me money by telling me I would be fine with high lighting my hair every other time which saves me a lot and more gentle on my hair.Tawni is also great at doing eyelash extensions. I have never had long eyelashes before and I am loving my eyelash extensions and have received many compliments on them as well as my hair.I definitely recommend this salon and of course Tawni!!

8.description: I just went to Aqua on Thursday for a haircut.  Amber was my stylist and I couldn't have been happier with the entire experience!  The salon is beautiful inside and the staff could not have been friendlier!  I read yelp reviews about them not drying hair, etc. ... this was not my experience at all.  I wanted a change of hairstyle and I gave minimal guidance to Amber and asked her to do her thing.  She gave me a cut that flattered my face shape and had great layers and worked with my wavy hair.  I left with a dry, beautifully styled head of hair.For years I went to a salon on Oak Street and I can tell you, the haircut and experience I received at Aqua rivaled any downtown salon I have been to.I'd highly recommend Aqua!

14.description: I went into this salon for a special they had advertised. I was put off immediately when the girl who was supposed to do my hair came up to me and announced my highlights would be an additional $20 than what the special offered. It turns out, she was trying to get me to do something completely different that wasn't the special I signed up for. I told her no, got the treatment I scheduled at the price I was told, but ended up leaving with sopping wet hair because a blow out would have been $20 more. From other places I've been, I think a blow out after highlights is part of the expensive cost of highlights.I wouldn't go here again.

28.description: Overall:  SOLID great tasting Mexican food in the burbs,  good prices,  and convenient for shopping around the area!The Deets: I went here after driving past it many times, and I finally saw a good deal online - went in, and I was not disappointed.  (They could certainly use a larger sign... so don't miss it as you drive by).  Burritos are a great deal and are a good size! I tried out the carne asada burrito with all the fixin's.  It was definitely enough for 2 people (although I happily stuffed my face and ate the whole thing).   I would not say that there is anything extraordinarily different about this place than others, but it is great food at good prices.  Looking for some solid Mexican food,  then stop on by.

1.description: First off, I would like to know the story behind the name of the restaurant relating to the photo of the woman toiling away cleaning the floor on their signage.  According to their website it's a family establishment.  If there are four brothers behind this restaurant, who is that lady working hard to make tortillas! Is it Mama!?The place.  Pleasant, colorful and inviting.  If you work in the area, this would be a comfy place to grab a "cheap" bite.  The "weekday warriors" or 9-5ers tend to favor quantity over quality type places and this is another example of just that.For me, the location is hit or miss and most recently missed its mark.  I wonder if there are (really) four brothers and whether they all work the kitchen at either location.  I also wonder whether it's true per their website that they make food fresh?  Unlike photos on their website indicating flat tops and a fryer at their main location (?), this one has got dual microwaves that often get a ton of action more than the single flat top that hardly sees any.  It's really unfortunate to wait some amount of time only to realize that a majority of the cooking was done in the microwave.  Pssshaw!  Food can be okay, I guess it depends on who is working the kitchen that day.  On my most recent trip the food sucked.  The cook was spending gross amounts of time chatting up the counter person or rather, she was starry eyed around him while he was lazily getting to preparing my order.  A pollo burrito suizo looked and tasted like a Denver omelette.  It's got me wondering whether the cook got his start at IHOP.  Assorted and diced peppers, onions and tomato topped and filled my burrito which was also stuffed with chicken chorizo maybe? I don't understand why since I ordered a regular burrito, not a breakfast burrito and expected pulled chicken rather than chicken sausage...  It was edible, though not appetizing.  Beyond this, I've had their chilaquiles a couple times and its tastes are different every time.  Something I came to realize though is that, food in general is just not awesome.  I wouldn't call it cheap either, like some other reviewers might call it.  This is the outskirts of Chicago where I assume rent wouldn't be as expensive as say on Lawrence ave, but in comparison it's almost 20% more than its competition elsewhere in Chicago.  For instance, a tamale at most taquerias might cost a dollar or a dollar and some change, here it's $2.99 for one piece and it's pretty dry and crappy.Although I'm giving it a 2 star rating, it isn't disgusting.  If you don't mind microwaved foods, cheap quality and a general lack of care for food, it could be a 3 star experience.  Easy.  Next time, it'll be time to try TBK instead!

9.description: Service was kinda not that great the food was good they got lunch specials it was very warm inside no air but all in all just ok

29.description: Right down the street from me...never been in here...went for a walk with mom and stopped in.Seemed to have the mom and pop feel, which I really liked; mom and dad at the grill..daughter at the counter, tv on telemundo.  Loved it.  They have a special of the day, we had the weds special, a toaco and 2 empenadas...totally delicious (i went back the following day to order to more, 2 bucks apiece)  Loved it.  Friendly and clean, always seemed to be a table full of someone enjoying a meal.  Will be back.

23.description: Not bad Mexican food--- the menu is surprisingly lengthy.  Personally, I thought it was a little bland. It actually worked out great though because my 10 mo old loved the rice and beans!

5.description: Make sure you have time to stop by here because everything is freshly made...I'm 100% pure Mexican born in the USA and my mother whom is from Mexico makes food from scratch... This place makes homemade breakfast just like my mom... No rush enjoy the food Extremely clean even the bathrooms are clean fresh and welcoming...I have not had lunch here yet however I did order a taco asada with a Mexican breakfast and it was delicious!Coffee here is awesome made like in Mexico with that old fashioned taste only thing missing is pan de Dulce "Mexican sweet bread"I would compare this to a high class restaurant except without the price and without the look but the food is amazing and affordable

31.description: Not bad but there is much better in the area,, their tacos are kinda bland as well as their salsa,PS: Their air conditioning sucks

25.description: This place closes at 8 which upsets me because the food is really good. Its a really small place and kinda hard to pull into if you're driving westbound. But it's really tasty and pretty cheap.

12.description: Very good food, competitively priced, and does delivery. Steak burrito amd nachos are awesome. The portions are a bit smaller but i would trade that any day for quality. Great find! Would recommed it to all.

37.description: I was a fan of the original location 4 Hermanos when I lived nearby, so I was happy to see this one open up after I moved to the area. Atmosphere: It's ok - very clean, and a good number of tables for such a small place. The service is simply ok, perhaps a bit slow. Food comes out quick & hotFood: Try the Chorizo tacos. Seriously. Very good chorizo, fresh chopped onions, cilantro, and a lime on double corn tortillas. Simple and absolutely perfect. The chorizo is perfectly flavored. I crave these. The Horchata is also good. Prices are reasonable and there are nice specials. Overall a great little neighborhood mexican restaurant

21.description: I would never visit this restuarant again.Customer service was horrible. The waitress did not understand english that well and messed up on our order and wanted us to pay for something she messed up on. When I was given my bill it was not a regular invoice so it had no charges on it just the total. When i asked for a bill with the charges that became an issue. When I was finially handed my bill with the charges I was being charged for something that I did not order. When I asked them to take it off I was treathen with them calling the Police on me. I stood my ground and explained to them that they can do whatever they wanted, however I will not be paying for this. The food was not even the best to deal with any of this hassel. I had the burrito and the meat was very rancid and tasted as if it was cooked on a dirty grill so it caused my BF stomach to hurt for hours after we left the place. If I could they would have no stars from me. Save yourselves the time and stomach ache or the runs find another Mexican joint in the area. I guess that explains why the place was completely empty when we got there.

16.description: Solid prices. Delivery is quick, food is good. They use better quality meat than the hermanos in Jeff park. A solid go to for delivery or a quick take out.

17.description: My taco run continues in the suburbs with a stop at this little gem.  A little joint that you can easily miss, even if you are looking for it.  Their rice and beans portions are a little small, but the tacos make up for it.  I will go out on a limb here and say that they have the best barbacoa tacos I've had so far.  Try them!
