10.description: I am *very* disappointed. I wanted to enjoy Mexican on this Cinco de Mayo, but this restaurant has ruined my whole day. I put my order in via GrubHub at exactly 11:46am to be delivered to my office that is two miles away. I got my food at 1:20pm. I'm sorry, but that is not good delivery. Even though the food is decent, I will not be ordering delivery from them again. I wish I could say otherwise.

11.description: Decent cheap Mexican eats here.  I had a lengua burrito dinner here for $7.99 and it was decent tasting, good sized, and filling.  Wife had a tamale and steak taco and they were ok.  The dining space is plain and small.  Parking is also awkward right out front and you have to back up onto busy Touhy to get out.  Nonetheless, good for an economical Mexican meal.

26.description: I was very happy with my experience at Hermanos Too.. Went there for the first time tonight with a Groupon. The service was very nice, we were the only ones there, and there were great $5 specials. The only thing I have to say that was disappointing was the hours. It closes at 8! What Mexican place closes at 8?Anyhow, I will be back!

27.description: Their daily $5 specials are unbeatable. The meal, plus chips, rice & beans for $5 is awesome and it's something different everyday. Plus they're good all day, not just for lunch.My favorite are the tostadas.

35.description: Oh My - so amazed! I thought I was a huge fan of Wholly Frijoles. Well! Thank you 4 Hermanos cuz your chimichanga was amazing. Almost a buttery texture with the tender chicken inside. AH! Freakin' fantastic! The staff was MUCH friendlier too!

8.description: Single handedly the best burrito I've ever had. Great staff. Would recommend to anyone craving authentic delicious food.

0.description: 4 stars for 4 Hermanos Too!4 tips for you:- There's perpendicular VIP parking right up against the storefront on Touhy.  Thinking about getting out of the space onto such a busy road makes me really nervous and not just because I'm an Asian female driver.  Do you know how busy Touhy gets??  So drive a wee bit more east, and there's street parking at Touhy and on Hiawatha/Moody (not sure why there's 2 street signs on that pole there). - Tons of choices: breakfast, gorditas (kind of like a taco, but with 2 separate fried tortillas enveloping the sandwich), tortas, fries, tacos, and burritos galore!  Market price guac was $6 or $7, and the creamy, chunky portion was about the size of a cup of soup.  Oh, but let me tell you that the serving of tortilla chips that came with it was literally 7 separate sittings worth of chips for me.  That mound of chips would literally fit into a gallon size plastic baggie or more.  AND they're super crunchy and fresh!- Friendly staff.  The girl who took my order was pleasant and said she hoped I would like my gordita as I was leaving.- They deliver!  $10 minimum, with a $2.50 delivery charge.

38.description: This is a tiny storefront Mexican joint sandwiched between a medical supply store and a real estate appraisal office, across the street from the Niles Target store on Touhy, but on the Chicago side to the south. Seems when I'm in the area I end up going to Papa Chris just a block away 95% of the time, but this time I felt like having me some Mexican. In what is looking more like "Try New Mexican Restaurants Week" for me, I thought I'd come in here at noon. I've been suspicious but curious about this restaurant for at least a year but never tried it.Well, it's not a seedy joint at all. Not crowded either despite the noon hour and people having lunch. Only one other person was ahead of me in line. A few more people came to pick up carry-out orders while I ate there.The place has some large paintings on the wall and an Aztec calendar. They appear to be big fans of President Obama, with 4 pictures of him on the wall, plus a pair of commemorative Obama plates, in addition to the mandatory Our Lady of Guadalupe image, which seems to be at almost every Mexican place I've visited.Of course, I had to do my benchmark steak burrito test on the place. I got a small table off to the side and the lady from the counter brought over a basket of chips and a squirt bottle of hot salsa. The salsa was perfect, just the right amount of flavor mixed with the right combination of hotness. And in what seemed to be no more than 2-3 minutes, my burrito was ready, along with a side of beans and rice. I also got a horchata for my drink.The serving size was excellent, contrary to the review by A.A. The burrito was cut in half but it was a manageable size and not skimpy either. If it could be any better, I'd add a bit more sour cream inside, but otherwise a stellar burrito, complemented well with the hot sauce. Beans were seasoned just right and the rice was fluffy and light, bright yellow in color. The horchata was good but a little more vanilla would put it over the top. The food is really good overall and a few minor things don't really make a big deal for me. A good little place on the far NW side of Chicago and certainly a fine local alternative to Taco Burrito King. And there's a BYOB sign on the door for those who are into that.

20.description: Stopped in for a evening snack and to check out the place.  Very authentic feel of this family run place.  I grabbed two carnitas tacos.  The meat was tender - not terribly flavorful but that is what the cilantro, onion and salsa are for.  Price was great - a couple tacos for a couple bucks.  Will give them another try when I have an appetite for more and can check out other items on the menu.

19.description: Nice people. good food. not the burrito (SF-Mission St style) i was looking for, but good, nonetheless.

33.description: I was looking for a quick place with authetic, simple tacos and 4 Hermanos Too nailed it!  The al pastor tacos were delicious with a few chunks of pineapple, cilantro and onions.  They reminded me of the tacos I had in Cabo.  Served with rice and beans, it was just right.  This place is tiny and no-frills, but the food is great.  I will definitely be back!

2.description: Great little taco joint in a small retail strip. Seems to be family owned. Staff is friendly, food is served promptly, always fresh and tasty, and reasonable prices. My "go to" street taco place in the north suburbs.

34.description: This is a nice little taco joint a bit west of the Village Crossing Shopping Center. We were making several stops in the area today, and decided to grab a quick lunch here. They have some very reasonable daily specials. Today was the 3 taco dinner for $5, which is what Christopher opted for. It was pretty good, and certainly plentiful and is served with beans and rice as well as the basket of chips and some spicey hot sauce. For $5 it was a deal. He also said the horchata was good too.I had the enchiladas suizas. It was pretty good as well. The beans and rice were average, but there was a tasty little salad that came with it as well.If I am in the area, I would certainly consider stopping here again. Like I said, you can't beat the $5 daily special.

32.description: Good eats, decent prices. My girlfriend and I tried this place out for the first time the other day. In the dictionary this place's picture is right next to the definition of "Hole in the wall". It's really tiny, with about 8 or 9 tables squeezed in to a space the size of most people's living room, but the effect is a very comfortable, 'at-home', meal and I must say I am a fan. The service was a bit lacking though. There was only one very overwhelmed looking woman doing just about everthing in the front of house. Right after we came in, she had to get a massive to go order ready for a customer and 4 other large tables came in and sat themselves. It took us about 20 minutes of patient waiting after finishing eating before we where finally able to get our check, settle up and get out of there. I totally understand how that goes though and I almost just wanted to get up and go help her take an order! I have to imagine with all of the great reviews on here, that this was a one time thing, so I will definetly be heading back to give it several more chances. The food was fantastic and very reasonably priced. The daily specials are the way to go, I got two loaded steak tostadas for 5 bucks! Even the chips and salsa where top notch. If you haven't checked this place out yet, get to it!

18.description: Stopped in for a evening snack and to check out the place.  Very authentic feel of this family run place.  I grabbed two carnitas tacos.  The meat was tender - not terribly flavorful but that is what the cilantro, onion and salsa are for.  Price was great - a couple tacos for a couple bucks.  Will give them another try when I have an appetite for more and can check out other items on the menu.

13.description: Good food and prices, if somewhat haphazard service

4.description: My fave hole-in-the-wall Mexican place for finger foods like nachos, tacos, burritos, and tortas.  They serve breakfast and dinner meals too, but we go to another place for that.  Been coming here consistently (1-2x a month) after getting "abused" by Los Comales's increased prices and poor service.They have $5.95 daily specials, including on the weekends.  See my pic.  M (burrito dinner), Tu (3 taco dinner), and W (torta dinner) are the best days.  Their taco meats aren't greasy, and the double tortillas don't stick together, making it easy to separate them into two tacos (pro tip)!  Their super nachos are my fave nachos in the world!  Each chip is individually loaded with refried beans, cheese, diced meat (your choice), sour cream, tomatoes, and guacamole.  Get them with chicken or steak - both are great!The only problem is their parking lot is too close to the street, so it makes it difficult to back out into the constant flow of traffic on Touhy.  FYI - they're located across the street from Target & Costco.Don't come here.  I want there to be more for me!

24.description: We moved to the suburbs almost a year ago from chicago, and are having the hardest time finding decent vegetarian mexican food. We go to the target across the street alot and decided to give this place a whirl. Their food is pretty tastey! They have vegetarian options, are extremely affordable, and kid friendly, so we are easily able to bring my son here. Its small inside, but big enough to sit down and enjoy a quick meal out. Oh, and their salsa is SUPER delicious!

6.description: Agree with Christina C on this place. Wanted not to cook for once. Mexican sounded good. There were yelpers claiming everything is fresh - great lets do 4 hermanos.  Ten chips and a hot sauce arrive. I get the steak torta dinner special. They only serve refried beans not black.    No thanks. Rice is old and mushy. It's been sitting a while with the added package of cheap frozen beans/peas/corn combo making it mushier.  Ick. Steak torta  no flavor. I added hot sauce and guac for flavor. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing but who thinks this place is good? Not me. I'd rather have flavor and great ingredients instead of value. Won't be back. Suggestion I would make to restaurant. This is a hands on dining place like many fast Mexican places. Put a napkin dispenser on the table - one single napkin is not enough !

22.description: I came here with a groupon and my boyfriend. I wasn't expecting much since I was already told this was more of an "eh" restaurant. Honestly, I wouldn't go back. The food was okay, there wasn't air conditioning so the place felt like an oven, the didn't have fountain drinks. Their cans of coke were a dollar and they had bottles of coke for 2 dollars.. Needless to say I got water.As I was ordering I noticed they were a mexican diner that only served burritos. No tacos, no enchiladas, just burritos.. I got a steak burrito, on the menu it says all burritos come with beans, rice, sour cream, and guacamole. As I was ordering, I was asked if I wanted beans and rice with my burrito... Well yeah! It comes with my meal right?? No! I had to order the dinner burrito if I wanted that which was 2 dollars more. It isn't a bigger burrito, the dinner burrito just comes with beans and rice. I didn't get the burrito dinner. I just got my steak burrito. My boyfriend got the steak burrito suizo dinner. He reeaaalllllly liked his. The difference between a suizo is it is topped with sauce and cheese. Mine was okay, bland but okay. Oh! And I got my beans and rice. c;Here is the kicker, as I was paying with my groupon (groupon was $14, the bill was $16) I was told that my entree was not applicable.. I do believe it was since groupon will tell you if a  menu item isn't covered by the groupon... But I didn't fight it and just paid for my wntree out of pocket.. So not to pleased with the place and I won't be going back.All in all its just eh food that is a bit overpriced.

15.description: Just got this delivered. Ordered the torta and fried burrito. They were both basically inedible. Did not taste good at all and the meat was rubbery. Guac tasted horrible! I gave it a couple of stars for quick delivery and good pico de gallo. I would not order from here again.

7.description: Really didn't care for this restaurant. Came in for lunch and ordered the Tuesday taco special. The waitress gave me chips and salsa. There was like 10 chips in the basket. The tacos were ok. The rice was very mushy. Definitely don't think I'll be back.

36.description: Was hoping to come across a good mexican place on the NW side but unfortunately this place was not it.  Had the steak tacos and weren't all that.  Quality of steak was below average and i didn't like the lettuce and tomatoes on a taco.  Of course, this was how it was decribed on the menu so that's my fault for not ordering cilantro y cebolla style.  I will go back again to try the tacos al pastor but until then this is really about the same as TBK.

30.description: You can always count on a decent lunch special from 4 Hermanos.  They have a rotating array of Mexican standards, and for a $5 lunch special, you really can't do better for the speed or convenience (not to mention price).Nice lunch spot in the Niles area.

3.description: This is one of my top local Mexican spots.  I used to make the trip out to the Los Camales, but this place has better service, and a more comfortable atmosphere.  They have recently remodeled so it's very clean and spacious. The only downside is the small parking lot out in front.  My top dishes there are the Super Nachos, Al Pastor Torta, and the Steak Burrito.  All the tacos are pretty solid too.  Their menu also includes american food, such as breakfast and burgers.  I'll usually order my torta with a side of fries which is nice.  This is my top place for a quick Mexican meal.

14.description: I came here with a groupon and my boyfriend. I wasn't expecting much since I was already told this was more of an "eh" restaurant. Honestly, I wouldn't go back. The food was okay, there wasn't air conditioning so the place felt like an oven, the didn't have fountain drinks. Their cans of coke were a dollar and they had bottles of coke for 2 dollars.. Needless to say I got water.As I was ordering I noticed they were a mexican diner that only served burritos. No tacos, no enchiladas, just burritos.. I got a steak burrito, on the menu it says all burritos come with beans, rice, sour cream, and guacamole. As I was ordering, I was asked if I wanted beans and rice with my burrito... Well yeah! It comes with my meal right?? No! I had to order the dinner burrito if I wanted that which was 2 dollars more. It isn't a bigger burrito, the dinner burrito just comes with beans and rice. I didn't get the burrito dinner. I just got my steak burrito. My boyfriend got the steak burrito suizo dinner. He reeaaalllllly liked his. The difference between a suizo is it is topped with sauce and cheese. Mine was okay, bland but okay. Oh! And I got my beans and rice. c;Here is the kicker, as I was paying with my groupon (groupon was $14, the bill was $16) I was told that my entree was not applicable.. I do believe it was since groupon will tell you if a  menu item isn't covered by the groupon... But I didn't fight it and just paid for my wntree out of pocket.. So not to pleased with the place and I won't be going back.All in all its just eh food that is a bit overpriced.

1.description: Excellent skin care, products and professionalism all in the comforts of Edgebrook.  Dorina is fantastic, I have been a client of Dorina for over 10 years.  The location is perfect too, on West Devon and easy parking. Dorina really takes time and care with every facial she performs.  She ensures the products are the best of the line and uses the right ones for the client's needs.  Her experience, professionalism and attention to detail makes me really feel special when I come to see her.  I always leave with a healthy glow.I would recommend Dorina to anyone who is looking for skin care.  She is the best.

0.description: I have been going to Dorina for at least 15 years. She is professional and excellent at what she does. She provides individualized care to her clients. The products are phenomenal too! I would highly recommend Dorina Skin Care. It shows that Dorina enjoys what she does. I really appreciate her honesty and integrity.

58.description: Amazing ice cream, very friendly crew. Can't ask for anything more. U HAVE to try the "this sh!t just got real" flavor.

56.description: There is nothing better than excellent ice cream in a fun atmosphere. Here are just a few reasons that this is basically the best place ever on a summer evening:1. the murals! they are always changing, so fun, and actually really smart and funny, if you take the time to read all the little captions.2. the ICE CREAM. hello delicious. This is just classic ice cream with an awesome variety of flavors. the zoreo (zanzibar chocolate ice cream with oreo pieces and some kind of white swirl-- frosting? marshmallow? WHO CARES) is incredible, but the simpler flavors are standouts too. I love getting just good old cherry ice cream with hot fudge.3. the SAMPLES. they are not stingy here. a lot of the flavors are pretty interesting, and they let you try them all. heck, the encourage you to try them all, and last time I was there, six samples were FORCED on me. literally. not counting the ones I requested to try.4. the staff. what great kids! and the owner can't be beat. he knows his regulars, hires great people, and keeps the always busy shop looking great.I don't even live that close to this place but it just makes me so happy that I always want to go.

29.description: Amazing service! They literally ask you to sample all their unique delicious flavors! They also have a ton of different cones and toppings. The owner is really cool and has interesting life stories. The place always has great decorations.

42.description: We were in town in between meals and decided for some dessert. Amazing, amazing ice cream in a really cool, unique atmosphere with amazing service some high quality sit down restaurants don't even provide you. Most of our group got a flavor called "Shit just got serious". Some of the best "real" ice cream I have had in a while!

23.description: I mean, wow. Just wow. Phenomenal ice cream and as many tastes as you want. Love it and wish I lived closer, but it's going to be a regular stop on the way home from Ravinia.

47.description: By far the best place ever! I owe my own ice cream shop and I still come here!!!!!  HahahaThe owner is awesome. Great person great service!!

8.description: I haven't been here in a few years, since briefly having moved out to Hoffman estates. Not much has changed! Expect excellent service. A barrage of samples, whether you like it or not! They do not skimp on letting you taste their wide array of ice creamy goodness! I opted for the fat Elvis, which i always get (banana ice cream with peanut butter and fudge ripples). And the "this s@!* got serious" which is a salted caramel ice cream with pretzels or some other goodies. Honestly... I get so indecisive but can only handle a single scoop. They were kind to let me do half of each! And, we got there late in the day. This place closes at 10, and we were not hurried to leave, even though my friend and I just hung around to chat until 10:30. No pressure from the owner/worker at all. They really cater to customers! The interior can be a bit quirky... And this place only accepts cash. But it's so delicious. They give you a good vibe. and it's a small business I proudly support!!!

31.description: There is no better ice cream shoppe in the Chicagoland area.Open year round (unheard of in the Midwest) until 11 PM every night of the week, you'll experience over 30 ice cream flavors which on any given day to choose from, with an inventory of twice that...at least.  Glowing lights, huge patio chairs (weather permitting), great music, wall and front display decorations (changing at least 4 times per year) and the kindest staff are just a few of the outstanding parts of Chocolate Shoppe in Edgebrook.You'll be bombarded with free samples and employees are constantly walking around with glasses of water.  I don't know another ice cream spot that offers that type of service.There are unique cones and edible cups to enjoy your ice cream in and if you need a party cake, there is nothing more delicious that one of their personalized ice cream cakes.  Chocolate Shoppe is a pillar of the community and has been for over 30 years (originally an independently owned Baskin-Robbins) so if you have not been, it's worth the trip from wherever you're coming from.  Ask to say hi tot he owner, Ron.  He'll love to say hi and chat and remember you the next time you return.A true treasure in Chicago - don't ever change.

34.description: My friends and I had just finished a spa day at King Spa, and were craving something sweet to finish our day. It was after 10 PM, and our options seemed limited, but a Google search turned up this place. It was as sent by heaven above. The place was awesomely decorated with a liberal political mural. The staff offered us samples without us needing to ask, as well as water. The ice cream was amazing, the staff was super friendly. As we were about to get in the car they stopped us to give us a mini dreamsicle cone. Even though this place isn't close to where I live,  I want to come here every time for ice cream!

16.description: This place just makes me happy.  The service is completely over the top friendly and welcoming!  Flavors are just surreal - how can there be so many amazing favorites to choose from?!  Can't wait to come back.  Maybe tomorrow!!!!

13.description: This place is the best! I've been coming here since they opened. They are always decorating for holidays or occasions, for example, when everyone was talking about Ebola they added a smiling Ebola strand as a joke. Right now it's of course Halloween and everything is covered in some type of decoration. They give out samples without you even asking! I hate when I go to an ice cream shop and they give you an attitude if you ask to try their flavors...I always feel like I'm being annoying if I ask for more than two samples, but these guys are more than willing to help you be confident in your decision. Highly recommended, bring cash tho cause they don't accept credit cards.

11.description: This is one of my favorite ice cream places ever. I was with some friends, and we were looking for a place to eat late one night and we stumbled upon this place while, what seemed like, driving in circles. The ambiance was incredible and the shop was busy even though it was late at night. The music,beautiful murals, flags, and puppets in the window all add so much character to this little shop and made my experience there thoroughly enjoyable. The employees were all friendly and offered tons of samples without us even having to ask for them. The flavors were all very unique and delicious, making it difficult to pick just one.If you find yourself around Devon, it is well worth your time to stop in!

39.description: Love the ice creams and love the customer service. We usually go there whenever we make a trip to Devon.

37.description: Great place, good music, great customer service. Nice young man gave us 15 samples to try....wow! Sat and ate inside, nice place for some great ice cream.

0.description: We have been going to this ice cream place for years. In summer, we probably go 2-3x a week.That tells you how much we love their ice cream. Halley's comet is one the favorites. Staff is very friendly, and they always give you lots of samples. Only cash accepted!!  I remember first time, we went and of course like a lot of people- you expect plastic to be accepted. We didn't have any cash, but already were holding ice cream. It felt very embarrassing. But, one of the guys said no problem, he said where the nearest Atm was  and after we finished our ice cream. We left , got the cash and came back to pay. We don't go anywhere else, this our # 1 ice cream place in the area.

38.description: I pass this place almost everyday and finally decided to stop in tonight to try it. Matt, The guy working, was so friendly and helpful. Customer service at its finest. Thanks for your friendliness I will definitely be coming back. The ice cream is delicious!

51.description: Hands down the best old fashion ice cream shop! I've only gone s handful of times and each time I've gone I leave satisfied yet wanting more.  The staff is kind and always suggesting another flavor to try.  I'm sure that you can just go in and get your ice cream fix from the gazillion samples they give. However since the ice cream is so delicious you just keep wanting more.  As an added bonus, the eerie yet interesting decor will really captivate you.

27.description: So disorganized.  I know - let's have no recognizable line at all and just keep handing out craploads of samples to the group of 8 people at the front while other people who know what they want and are ready to pay just stand waiting forever.  Great plan!  Honestly, the local Dairy Queen (also run by teenagers) operates much more efficiently than this.  Good ice cream but I will be sticking with the trusty DQ blizzard to avoid the hassle of going to this place.Side note:  what is with all the socialist crap all over the walls?  Keep it to yourself - people just want ice cream.  No one wants to be barraged with your political garbage while waiting for their waffle cone.

32.description: At first I loved this place. It was obvious from the street packed with people out front that it was popular. The staff was incredibly friendly and offered sample after sample. Everything I tried was great. Ended up landing on the Zanzabar dark chocolate ice cream which was incredible. The vibe is hella weird. Looks like a wax museum threw up on a kids' haunted house. But hey, whatever makes you happy. Just as I ordered, tons of people slammed into the place, right as I realized they were a cash-only establishment. Being someone who lives in the 21st-century, I generally carry no cash. I had to search for an ATM for about 10 minutes before I landed one in a gas station 2 blocks up and then pay the $2.75 ATM fee. I was in a big rush and needed to just stop in really quickly, so I almost just ditched and let them keep the ice cream, I was so annoyed. But then again, the ice cream is great, so I got my head level. If you're not gonna accept debit cards, at least have an ATM onsite for the love of Jesus. Or better yet, get a free Square reader.

54.description: This place is amazing!  They hand you samples after samples of ice cream until you actually order something. The quality of ice cream is really good and the flavors. The cones are freaking delicious! They also have a nice little area to sit outside. They even go around giving you free water. The only downside is cash only.

48.description: I haven't been here in a few years, since briefly having moved out to Hoffman estates. Not much has changed! Expect excellent service. A barrage of samples, whether you like it or not! They do not skimp on letting you taste their wide array of ice creamy goodness! I opted for the fat Elvis, which i always get (banana ice cream with peanut butter and fudge ripples). And the "this s@!* got serious" which is a salted caramel ice cream with pretzels or some other goodies. Honestly... I get so indecisive but can only handle a single scoop. They were kind to let me do half of each! And, we got there late in the day. This place closes at 10, and we were not hurried to leave, even though my friend and I just hung around to chat until 10:30. No pressure from the owner/worker at all. They really cater to customers! The interior can be a bit quirky... And this place only accepts cash. But it's so delicious. They give you a good vibe. and it's a small business I proudly support!!!

44.description: Walked in, saw your new mural referencing Ferguson Missouri and comparing it to Syria?  Really?  Did you happen to know that you are in the middle of city worker neighborhood?  Filled with COPS? Did you even read one word about the actual case in Ferguson?  I can say you didn't because if you did, you wouldn't have put it on your wall.  We have been customers for years as well as the rest of our family.  Instead of walking or biking to your shop, we will now be getting in the car and driving a few miles away to DQ because I am pretty sure they won't put some liberal CRAP on their walls.  Shame on you.  You just told 90 percent of the customers that you don't support them.  That means, you don't get another dollar from us.  NOT EVER!  Bye Chocolate Shoppe Ice Cream.  It was nice knowing you.  You damaged our relationship beyond repair.

24.description: Maybe I missed something but thought this place was just ok!  I was very confused on the decor of the place. Is it Halloween still?  Political stands? Music was loud for an icecream shop.  What?  but was there for ice cream anyhow.  I got a malt and have to say have had much better ones. My kids however liked it.  My son even got the low sugar chocolate ribbon (he wanted it)  and loved it.  Enjoyed sitting outside.

7.description: Who kicked the other reviewers dog who complained about the free samples in line?! There is always that one person who will complain about such awesomeness that exists in a world where stuff like that doesn't happen anymore! Anyways, we love love love the chocolate shoppe!! The people that work there come to work and get this -- they actually want to be there and it shows. They have rock start attitudes about working and they treat customers amazingly! The ice cream is also divine. I'm a chocolate peanut butter cup gal myself and so is my guy. It's a monthly stop for us that will continue to be with our kids :) we adore this place! Oh and the Halloween decorations have been on point since I was a little one!

49.description: Endless samples of their many (and I do mean many) varieties of ice cream flavors AND excellent quality ice cream?  This is a great place to go to!!  Their choices of cones is also impressive as well if you need some extra sweetness ;-) !

40.description: Wow that was awesome went to baskin Robbins on Cicero and they were out of strawberry ice cream so my lovely girlfriend looked very disappointed that she wasn't getting her strawberry shake so I remembered driving by this place one night and seeing it packed I said it's gotta be good so I drive over there expecting the place to be closed its 930 pm by the way open sign on and just a few people leaving and were immediately greeted by a young man with spoons of different ice cream I thought this was awesome I ended up buying three pints and a strawberry shake my picky girl said was delicious there open to 11 and I'm done with baskin Robbins great place for ice cream

53.description: I love using Yelp to find new places and to check in, but I haven't written a review yet...until now!I have driven past this place many times while on my way to Loyola and I finally decided to walk in. The decorations were amazing and creative! I usually take forever to decide on a flavor. The man behind the counter made it easier for me by randomly giving me 4 samples of ice cream. I didn't even ask him for a sample. The flavors were inventive. I feel like everyone could find something that they would enjoy. This place has a variety of hand-dipped cones...peanut, M&M, sprinkle...you name it!  The staff member even passed out cups of water. This place is cash only, but there is an ATM down the block. Definitely come here for some delicious ice cream!!!!

30.description: The best ice cream, amazing selection, fantastic atmosphere, and great service! I'll drive 30 mins to come here.

46.description: HOLY MOLY!!! This place is spectacular!!! Wyatt greeted up with a smile and spoonfuls of deliciousness! The ice cream selections are the BEST in the city! The murals on the wall encourage conversation and the music made the experience complete! Thank to the owner who was kind and available! I LOVE the Chocolate Shoppe!!!

1.description: This is the best ice cream I have ever had! It is so creamy and the containers in the cases are void of any of those ice crystals you see in other ice cream shops. My husband and I come in here so I can get my fix of the flavor, "This shit just got serious." Yes, that is the real name of the flavor and it's my favorite thing in the world. It's salted caramel ice cream, chocolate, sea salt fudge and salted cashews and if they ever retire it, I will curl up into a ball and sink into a deep depressive state. My husband is a big fan of the Zanzibar chocolate flavor and says it's the best chocolate ice cream he's had. Upon walking into the shop, you'll probably wonder if you're actually asleep and this is part of your nightmare by the shop décor. It's um, different. Then, you head over to the counter and you are bombarded with sample after sample of different favors of deliciousness, making your decision much harder. After you decide on a flavor (TSJGS, I'm telling you!) You pay (cash or check only) and can either eat-in or if it's nice out, relax on their chairs outside and someone will bring you a cup of water. If you buy in pints, like we've started to do, because we're hideous (don't look at us!!) you get a pint card. Collect 7 pint cards and you get a free quart! I don't know if the location is a plus or a minus because it's conveniently located close to the Devon entrance of the North Branch bike trail, so after getting fit riding 20 miles, we pass this place on the way home and put those calories right back where they belong! As is the motto of the shop, "If you want nutrition, eat carrots."

55.description: Yeah for ice cream! I remember when this place was a 31 Flavors and didn't realize they went independent. The place was decorated as if we were back in a renascence time period - very original. I hear the owner changes up the decor theme often. Worth it to see what the next theme will be! They have lots of ice cream flavors and Italian ice. They also have a variety of cones with chocolate and sprinkles on them. The staff were great. One girls behind the counter was offering us sample after sample. She was very attentive - great customer service. Once we ordered we sat outside where they have lots if chairs. Two of the staff came out and offered us water about every 5 min or so. Again, great service! My friends and I wanted a place to get desert after dinner. Most ice cream places in the area close by 9. It was great to see the hours here were open until 11 pm! Check them out if you want to get out and accommodate that sweet tooth. You won't be disappointed.

9.description: At first I loved this place. It was obvious from the street packed with people out front that it was popular. The staff was incredibly friendly and offered sample after sample. Everything I tried was great. Ended up landing on the Zanzabar dark chocolate ice cream which was incredible. The vibe is hella weird. Looks like a wax museum threw up on a kids' haunted house. But hey, whatever makes you happy. Just as I ordered, tons of people slammed into the place, right as I realized they were a cash-only establishment. Being someone who lives in the 21st-century, I generally carry no cash. I had to search for an ATM for about 10 minutes before I landed one in a gas station 2 blocks up and then pay the $2.75 ATM fee. I was in a big rush and needed to just stop in really quickly, so I almost just ditched and let them keep the ice cream, I was so annoyed. But then again, the ice cream is great, so I got my head level. If you're not gonna accept debit cards, at least have an ATM onsite for the love of Jesus. Or better yet, get a free Square reader.

26.description: I'm a little embarrassed, but I've lived in Chicago (north side) all of my life and I went to the Chocolate Shoppe Ice Cream for the first time this past weekend! Cookies and Cream for life! Service and festiveness were awesome!

25.description: Amazing, fun, energy-charged, eclectic atmosphere that scoops up a generous quantity of free samples as you approach the cases of crazy-named and delicious ice cream. The outside seating area is also fun. We're definitely returning.

12.description: The Chocolate Shoppe is unlike any other icecream shop you'll encounter. And it's a must see on the holidays. Let's start with the decor. Ron, the owner, has the wildest imagination. He changes up the decorations about 4 times a year. You can always count on an epic halloween theme. He doesn't just through some things up, he creates an in depth theme and experience for his store. He spends months planning and drawing and gathering materials to create this new world upon entering his store. The artwork inside is sublime and the themes always relate to every age. As for the icecream it's delicious. Super creamy, lots of exotic flavors. My favorite is the Haleys Comet which is a chocolate, vanilla swirl with caramel ribbon and rolos! There are more choices of cones than any other icecream place I've ever seen. There are waffle bowls, waffle cones, and sugar cones all covered in different combos of chocolate and toppings. My favorite are the Oreo sugar cones. It's like finally being able to choose a topping for a cone instead of having to get it in a cup! If you want to pick up an icecream cake for an event they also specialize in awesome decorations. Charlotte who makes all the cakes is a super talented artist who can match any idea. Currently I saw a super cute dinosaur cake and an Elsa from Frozen cake. They also have decadent cakes for any occasion with many different icecream fillings and crusts. We usually get the mint chocolate chip cake with Oreo crust and hot fudge and cookie decorations. Makes you want to eat dessert first!Every time I go to Chicago this is a must stop location for me. It's definitely worth seeing if not tasting!

59.description: I came to visit Chicago and most likely, a visitor would just come to a place only once but this place was so good, I had to come back!  Even checked in on yelp and I am not a Regular (only for those 2 days though:(.  )  Right when you walk in, you can't help but feel like you are at a circus!  The decor of this place is so colorful and bright, it just makes you feel like you are part of a circus.  As we reached the counter, there are employees who are just scooping samples of ice cream and just handing them out!  They are soooo nice!!  They just want you to try everything!!  Now I don't feel too guilty just standing there and asking for samples.  They basically just grab a whole punch of sample sticks, scoop scoop scoop, and start handing them out like money!!  I literally tasted at least 5 samples in about 2 minutes!!  My favorite was the key lime pie!!  So delicious and tastes like a real pie!!  All the flavors that I tried were super delicious like the coffee, coconut, and just even plain vanilla!  I can't remember how much it was but it is reasonably priced I'm sure.There is outside seating so you can sit on cute wooden chairs.  The awesome service continues on this hot night when an employee comes out with cups of ice water!  WHAT?!?! we didn't even have to ask!!I loved this place so much that even when I was full from dinner, I had to come back out here for ice cream!  The only thing that sucked was the ice cream melted super fast so I had to eat it quickly!  Not sure if it was the heat or ice cream but nonetheless, awesome place!!

21.description: Great atmosphere - after plying us with about 10 free samples, we tried Rocky Road, Zanzimint, and an espresso whiskey. All excellent! Great selection of tasty cones, too. Definitely coming back soon.

17.description: The ice cream is one of a kind! Super amazing. 30 minutes later and still on a food high. They give non stop samples and their decor is interesting as all get out. Yes

10.description: So disorganized.  I know - let's have no recognizable line at all and just keep handing out craploads of samples to the group of 8 people at the front while other people who know what they want and are ready to pay just stand waiting forever.  Great plan!  Honestly, the local Dairy Queen (also run by teenagers) operates much more efficiently than this.  Good ice cream but I will be sticking with the trusty DQ blizzard to avoid the hassle of going to this place.Side note:  what is with all the socialist crap all over the walls?  Keep it to yourself - people just want ice cream.  No one wants to be barraged with your political garbage while waiting for their waffle cone.

5.description: This place was AWESOME. Came here on a cold Chicago night (because what ice cream connoisseur doesn't love ice cream even on a 30 degree night, right?) and I couldn't have been happier. My friend and I were greeted with endless samples of all sorts of ice cream. It felt like I was in Heaven. Like seriously, endless samples - and they were all amazing.I settled on the Fat Elvis, a mix of peanut butter, chocolate, and banana in a chocolate and mini M&M covered waffle bowl - again Heaven.Service was AWESOME and the Halloween decor was amazing - we were told it changes from year to year and nothing is ever used twice. I'll definitely be back.

3.description: CASH ONLY!! Yelp reviewers, you let me down. I'm in disbelief this location has 4.5 stars. Almost $5 for ONE scoop of ice cream! Just one scoop!?!?! This must be a local favorite because I've been to many other Ice Cream shops in Chicago and I never paid $5 for a scoop of ice cream. Gosh I felt awful bringing a group of 10 here. From the moment I took cash out to pay, the ice cream was already melting. Then, I got the most itty bitty ice cream scoop on the planet. If you think a melting baby sized ice cream scoop is worth $5, you have not been to many ice cream shops in Chicago. They had some good music though, they should play "Everyday I'm hustlin" But hey, they are making great business selling their ice cream for a steep price. So why stop right? If I was the owner, I wouldn't change my prices if the customers keep coming back.The ice cream brand they sell is called "Chocolate Shoppe Ice Cream" which is made in Madison, WI. Their are three other shops in/near Chicago that sell this brand (Skokie, Forest Park, and one on the outskirts of Chicago). Besides that, George's Ice Cream in Andersonville is the only one I know that is not named "Chocolate Shoppe" that sells it. George's gave me a better overall experience than here.

35.description: The staff is very helpful and very friendly. As soon as we walked in they offered a few samples.  Both samples I tried, I ordered full scoops. Another staff member was walking around offering cups of water. There's plenty of seating inside and outside.

19.description: Best service and most unique ice cream shop in town.  Highly recommend the dark chocolate ice cream.

28.description: This is one of my favorite ice cream places ever. I was with some friends, and we were looking for a place to eat late one night and we stumbled upon this place while, what seemed like, driving in circles. The ambiance was incredible and the shop was busy even though it was late at night. The music,beautiful murals, flags, and puppets in the window all add so much character to this little shop and made my experience there thoroughly enjoyable. The employees were all friendly and offered tons of samples without us even having to ask for them. The flavors were all very unique and delicious, making it difficult to pick just one.If you find yourself around Devon, it is well worth your time to stop in!

45.description: This place is wonderful. Everyone is super friendly and even without asking they gave us several different samples. After eating ice cream it is nice to have some water, before we can ask for it someone came to our table with glasses of iced water. Can't wait for it to get warmer so I can go back,  sit outside and enjoy my ice cream

33.description: As far as the best ice cream in the city (possibly the Midwest, possibly the country, possibly the world) you have found it! Congrats! Welcome to the Chocolate Shoppe. I have been here twice and loved it both times having basically the same experience.You first walk in and realize, whoa a lot of political imagery. From what the staff tells me, they bring in local artists to decorate the place and sometimes it gets political. You don't have to like it or even agree with it. YOU DO HAVE TO ENJOY THE ICE CREAM. Because it is fantastic.The next thing that will happen is that you will be greeted with an overload of samples. The chocolate shoppe has a lot of flavors (I don't know how many, 50?) and the people behind the counter will graciously let you try whatever, to the point where you will try flavors that you likely don't want, but hey there is ice cream in front of you and you want to make sure you leave no stone unturned right?Then you get your ice cream. I always get the Zanzimint, because it is the best but I understand if you get something different :). The richness and quality of the ingredients is second to none, and I would know as I went to college on a dairy campus.Long story short enjoy your ice cream and enjoy Chocolate Shoppe!

43.description: This place has ridiculously delicious ice cream with fantastic service and freaky decor. As we were reviewing all of the flavors we were given approximately 6 different tasting spoons. I chose the fat elvis and zanzimint on a plain cone, while my hubby had the banana split with pistachio and @$!# just got serious. The flavors were rich and delicious. As we were eating our ice cream we were given ice water at our table. Then as we were getting ready to leave we were given a sample of vanilla soft serve with orange sherbet on the cutest little plain cone I've ever seen. It was a very refreshing dreamcicle flavor. We were also given a brief history lesson. The same owner has been operating at this location for almost 50 years and he plays all the music, mixing it up based on the customers walking in. It started as a Baskin Robbins but went private after the Baskin/Dunkin merger. Their microdairy is located in Wisconsin. They plan to have organic offerings soon.  Highly recommended, can't wait to return to try more and wishing them continued success.

2.description: 4.5 stars. This place probably has the best ice cream I have ever had in my life! Strange ambiance on the inside - it is always decorated in different types of themes including employees dressing up in costumes. Always entertaining to see what type of decor they have up each time you stop in. They will also give you about a million samples of different ice creams each time you go in. Ask they consistently switch out flavored for different seasons such as pumpkin during the fall.Parking is convenient and the inside is always clean. They also have a nice seating section outside during the summer. Only downside is they do not accept credit cards (cash and check only).

18.description: Salted caramel ice cream on a pretzel ice cream cone dipped in dark chocolate and sprinkled with almonds. That says it all! I love love love this place.

41.description: I am really torn on this place. The ice cream was outstanding!! They had a wide variety of flavors, a variety of dipped cones and flavored waffle cups. They tasted amazing and I filled up quickly. I was nearly placed in a chocolate induced coma of deliciousness. On the other hand - this place was shoving their political ideals down my throat. There was a giant mural on the wall with very political quotes and pictures. They compared ferguson to Syria. Ok.Now whether or not I agree with these politics is irrelevant. I just wanted to eat my ice cream in peace without a political agenda. I'll go elsewhere next time...to a place that serves ice cream and Keeps their political agenda to themselves.

52.description: I'm definitely in the minority here.. The real attraction of the Chocolate Shoppe Ice Cream for me is the variety.  LOTS of flavors, and a choice of cones beyond belief - a simple cone, a dipped cone, a dipped cone with jimmies, a waffle cone, a waffle BOWL, a waffle bowl dipped and coated with candy.. the possibilities are endless. As for the ice cream itself.. I wasn't crazy about. I appreciate the quality ingredients, but the ice cream alone here doesn't do it for me.  What did excite me was the STUFF in the ice cream - I like STUFF in ice cream, so I did enjoy the Heaps of Love (vanilla ice cream packed with Oreos, brownies, cookie dough, caramel ripple, pecans and chocolate ripple). I hate to poo on the party, but I probably won't go out of my way for Chocolate Shoppe next time.

50.description: The Chocolate Shoppe is unlike any other icecream shop you'll encounter. And it's a must see on the holidays. Let's start with the decor. Ron, the owner, has the wildest imagination. He changes up the decorations about 4 times a year. You can always count on an epic halloween theme. He doesn't just through some things up, he creates an in depth theme and experience for his store. He spends months planning and drawing and gathering materials to create this new world upon entering his store. The artwork inside is sublime and the themes always relate to every age. As for the icecream it's delicious. Super creamy, lots of exotic flavors. My favorite is the Haleys Comet which is a chocolate, vanilla swirl with caramel ribbon and rolos! There are more choices of cones than any other icecream place I've ever seen. There are waffle bowls, waffle cones, and sugar cones all covered in different combos of chocolate and toppings. My favorite are the Oreo sugar cones. It's like finally being able to choose a topping for a cone instead of having to get it in a cup! If you want to pick up an icecream cake for an event they also specialize in awesome decorations. Charlotte who makes all the cakes is a super talented artist who can match any idea. Currently I saw a super cute dinosaur cake and an Elsa from Frozen cake. They also have decadent cakes for any occasion with many different icecream fillings and crusts. We usually get the mint chocolate chip cake with Oreo crust and hot fudge and cookie decorations. Makes you want to eat dessert first!Every time I go to Chicago this is a must stop location for me. It's definitely worth seeing if not tasting!

4.description: This place is so unique and wonderful. The decorations are outstanding and the staff is so friendly and welcoming. The moment you walk in you get bombarded with samples to try. All of the ice cream flavors are divine. Anyways, everything that my husband and I tried, we loved. We ended up ordering their best seller "This $&@! Just Got Serious" (salted caramel ice cream with rich sea salt fudge and salted cashews) and the "Praline Pecan" (maple ice cream with caramel ripples and pecans). Both were delicious! I can't wait to go back and try some more!

6.description: I am lactose intolerant so I stay away from dairy but when the hubs said lets go get ice cream at the shoppe i said yolo, lets do it.  I pass by this place all the time and they have a ton of beach like chairs outside so i was definitely intrigued. Going in the store they bombard you with tasters. You dont have to ask for them, they just keep coming to the point that by the time you have decided which flavor you want, you are full. Gotta say, the ice cream is pretty kicka$$. They have tons of options to choose from but I am boring and always choose pistachio. My husband had the banana split and it was perfect.When you sit outside they come with glasses of cold water and just hand it to you. Major bonus in my book as sweets are overwhelming for me. As far as the decor goes, I am not sure whether dont I get it or i dont know if its too much. Its weird and funny though so if you have a sense of humor you will appreciate it. I love the place. I plan on going again. Sorry stomach.P.S. they have ice cream for dogs there. Kinda cool

22.description: My favorite ice cream in the city.   I love the fact that when you come in they give you tons of samples.  Munchie madness and this s@&t just got serious are my favorite flavors.  They walk around with glasses of water.  I love the loud rock music that they play too.

15.description: High end neighborhood ice cream spot with unique and awesome flavors. This is where a foodie would go for ice cream. It's a very family oriented neighborhood spot with lots of charm. They are really cool about letting you try the flavors and always quick to hand out cups of water to everyone. I sampled a bunch of flavors and they were all so amazing. I'm really looking forward to coming back and trying more flavors. Only downfall is that it is a bit expensive. Either way I'm happy to spend the money for that quality and vibe.

57.description: The second you walk in the door employees are handing you samples upon samples of ice cream. I'd say I received more than 10 FREE samples, didn't need to even ask for it. The prices are fair, the environment is great, and it's a local business you want to support. Colorful and exciting flavors and decor, if you're in the area or live in the area, this should be your new favorite ice cream shop!

20.description: I am lactose intolerant so I stay away from dairy but when the hubs said lets go get ice cream at the shoppe i said yolo, lets do it.  I pass by this place all the time and they have a ton of beach like chairs outside so i was definitely intrigued. Going in the store they bombard you with tasters. You dont have to ask for them, they just keep coming to the point that by the time you have decided which flavor you want, you are full. Gotta say, the ice cream is pretty kicka$$. They have tons of options to choose from but I am boring and always choose pistachio. My husband had the banana split and it was perfect.When you sit outside they come with glasses of cold water and just hand it to you. Major bonus in my book as sweets are overwhelming for me. As far as the decor goes, I am not sure whether dont I get it or i dont know if its too much. Its weird and funny though so if you have a sense of humor you will appreciate it. I love the place. I plan on going again. Sorry stomach.P.S. they have ice cream for dogs there. Kinda cool

36.description: I really wanted to like this place because it's walking distance from my house but I've been there several times and I always leave disappointed. If you're going to get a scoop of ice cream on a cone it's fine, however, I like milkshakes and their milkshakes leave much to be desired. They are runny and WAY overpriced. Today I went in there and ordered a chocolate peanut butter milkshake extra thick and what I received was a little bit of peanut butter cup ice cream drowning in milk. Not the same thing as chocolate ice cream and peanut butter! Such a disappointment! For the $6.34, I could have gone to Whole Foods and bought the ingredients to make several milkshakes. Lastly, it's 2015 people, don't operate a business that only accepts cash and checks. It's a little thing called Square, look into it!

14.description: I am really torn on this place. The ice cream was outstanding!! They had a wide variety of flavors, a variety of dipped cones and flavored waffle cups. They tasted amazing and I filled up quickly. I was nearly placed in a chocolate induced coma of deliciousness. On the other hand - this place was shoving their political ideals down my throat. There was a giant mural on the wall with very political quotes and pictures. They compared ferguson to Syria. Ok.Now whether or not I agree with these politics is irrelevant. I just wanted to eat my ice cream in peace without a political agenda. I'll go elsewhere next time...to a place that serves ice cream and Keeps their political agenda to themselves.

12.description: The shop is quaint and colorful as are the co-owners!!  They know their stuff and are very talented.  I would recommend them to anyone, friend or not.  I get the OPI No-chip mani and regular pedi on a fairly regular basis and have yet to be disappointed, though I doubt I will ever be!  Free french mani/pedi's are almost unheard of....wait a minute, they are unheard of!  They listen to want you like and even make color suggestions!  Can't say enough good things about these ladies!  They even serve refreshments from time to time!

3.description: My nails looked horrible, but Julia was nice enough not to say anything. I was driving by and saw they were open, and decided I'd stop in to see if they had time to do a pedicure. She was with another client, but took me about 15 minutes later. They had great colors - I hate going to a place that seems like they have 10-20 polishes. This place had tons of them. Usually I'm a red or purple girl, but I went with Light My Sapphire this time.I want to get a manicure as well, but I can understand that it wasn't possible to accommodate a walk-in manicure and pedicure at 2 in the afternoon. I have an appointment next week to get a no-chip manicure, which I'm kind of excited about since I've never tried it.The shop is small, but there's enough space to get what they need done. Julia was really friendly too. She said their hours are 9-6 Monday through Saturday. I know I called once as well, and received no answer, but I think it's likely that they were with clients and couldn't get to the phone. And since I didn't leave a message... well...Thanks, Julia!

1.description: Love this place!!  Vivian does an awesome job and gives the best no-chip manicures and pedis!  They last really well.  Also she does a great job on my cuticles, never nicks me unlike experiences I've had at other places.  This has become my regular place.  Thanks to my neighbor for recommending!!

2.description: Went to the Nail Lounge today and brought my 3 daughters.  We all got beautiful mani/pedis with Vivian.  Love it!

9.description: Loved this little neighborhood salon. Julie has a great personality and does a great French Manicure. Will definitely go back and recommend to friends!

10.description: I am surprised there aren't more reviews - there are tons on other review sites.  This little gem is just down the street from a Lee Nails, yet miles apart in quality.  No all-in-one spa baths - it isn't sanitary - yet the pedicure massage was as good as any I've gotten.  They also don't ever use the blade... did you know it is against IL health code to do so?  English-speaking, professional and friendly, this is a far cry from the awful assembly line nail salons in the area.  Recieved a complementary nail polish change with my pedicure, AND - when I inquired about the OPI chipless, she looked at my nails, and since they were not entirely healthy, she recommended against it (which lost her $$$).  I will go back, and will recommend to others!

4.description: Woohoo! I think I've finally found a local nail salon to call home. It's a cheerful space with 2 manicure tables and 2 pedicure chairs. I stopped by on a weekday afternoon so I was able to walk in. I'll definitely setup an appointment next time.Julia is sassy and fun. No one else was in so we tried out 6-7 different colors. LOVE their selection. They've got the tried and true along with the newest colors. My hands and feet look great. And you can't beat $40 for a mani/pedi with a 3-day guarantee.

6.description: After trying to wait forever at Lee nails, i decided to call to see if there was an opening.  I certainly got lucky that day.  She told me to come in and i did not hesitate.  There is free parking in the back (a big plus for me since i hate paying for parking). Vivian helped me pick a new trendy color.  I love the cute little setting and the colors of the place.  It was very comfy, quiet, and relaxing.  Her prices are reasonable.  Vivian is amazing woman.  She's fun, happy, caring person who can carry on a conversation.

0.description: I first called The Nail Lounge back in the summer of 2009. My mom and I were looking to get mani/pedi's done and did not want those massage/jet foot tubs as I worked in a salon for many years and have seen how disgusting those tubs can be when not cleaned properly. So, I hopped online to do some research and eventually read a wonderful review on yelp. Given the popularity of those massage chairs, finding a nail salon without them took awhile. I called and made an appointment and it has been heaven ever since! Juelz and Viv are amazing! They really thought about every detail of the shop from a clients perspective. They are also so friendly and welcoming! When the time came for my wedding, they pulled out all the stops and made what was a very stressful time into a relaxing day with my closest friends. I adore this place and go in every 2 weeks for a flawless no-chip. It's more than just nails, it's therapy! Treat yourself! You won't regret it!

5.description: I would be happy to review an actual manicure, but I didn't get one. This morning at about 10 I purchased a Groupon now for a $12 manicure @ The Nail Lounge. I then tried to call the number that was listed in Groupon to make an appointment - a 312 number. The mailbox was full. So I figured I would just stop in. After paying $1.75 to park on the street, I walked into the shop @ 10:45. Vivian was there, finishing up a manicure. She asked my name; I told her then also told her I had a Groupon and tried to call but the mailbox was full. She asked what number I had called - I told her, but she said that I needed to "scroll down" to get the right number (like it was MY fault that the number was wrong). She then told me "she had another person coming in at 11 for a manicure; you're welcome to wait and oh, there's a Starbucks down the street if you want." I said fine, I would wait. I waited until her 11 walked in just to be sure she wouldn't be able to take me, then went down the street and got a coffee, sat for a few minutes and walked back. When I returned at about 11:15, she told me that she had a pedicure coming in at noon, and wouldn't be able to take me after her 11:00 afterall. I really couldn't believe my ears; did she not know this before? Did this other person call and so Vivian decided to take her at noon anyway, even though she knew I would be back? I was so angry I just left after mumbling that it didn't work for me. I went to Lee Nails at Devon and Central, parked for free and paid $15. I got great service and was home by 12:15This shoddy customer service @ The Nail Lounge really demanded that I write this review. I won't go back.

13.description: I got the best manicure of my life here!  I get manis every once and a while and I decided to treat myself with a Groupon Now today.  I called and made an appointment for right after work.  Julia helped me pick out a shade and gave me a great manicure.  I swear it looks like a no chip, but better.  She finished with a quick dry that made my nails really shiny.  To top it off, we had a great conversation that i felt like at home :-)  This place is a little out of my way, but I will come back for the great service.  The only thing I regret is that I walked out without tipping.  I don't know where my head was!  I'm so sorry, but I will be back!  Totally recommend it!

11.description: I had an amazing time here. I had a no chip done with Julia who is super funny and also a pedicure. I like how they use the plastic liners in the pedicure bowl to ensure cleanliness. They had SO many fun new colors to choose from, so I opted for a fun spring color. My nails and feet look great :) And Vivian helped me keep my todler busy by painting her nails too!!! She showed them off all day :) Thanks ladies I will be back soon!!!

8.description: This is definitely the best nail salon on the northwest side. It's a tiny and super cute place located on Devon Ave. and owned by two women who have been BFFs for many years. The atmosphere is fun (they play great music, too!) and the service is impeccable. I went there for a no-chip manicure and had Vivian as my technician. She does great work and is very friendly. The Nail Lounge has a great selection of polish colors from which to choose. I did get a small chip on one of my nails about four days in, which was a bummer because I thought no-chips were supposed to last for two weeks, but that was my first one and so I have nothing else to compare it to. Also, service here is by appointment only, which is different but actually great because you will never have to wait long, and the owners will basically open the shop for you whenever you can come in, whether it's a Sunday afternoon or ten o'clock at night. I highly recommend this place!

14.description: Can anyone tell me what the hours of operation really are??? I've made 3 trips here in the last 3 weeks (all on different days and times) - and they've been CLOSED!  Actually, make that 4 trips (I went twice today). I've looked up their hours online and the hours of operation are not accurate. Today, for instance, I purchased a GrouponNow deal which was supposed to be used today. I went at noon only to see the closed sign in the window with a "will return at 2 pm" sign/clock display hanging.  I returned at 3 - they were still closed. Frustrated, because I purchased a groupon for TODAY, I decided to call at 4PM - no answer, they were closed. Other days, include going on Wednesday for their 30-no chip wednesday special. Again, closed.  What gives? This place is about 15 minutes away from me and I thought I would give it a try based on the past reviews, but please do yourselves a favor and call ahead. If they don't answer, they're closed.

7.description: We just had a nail party for my daughter there this past weekend and had the best time.  Vivian and Julia were so nice and made sure everything was just perfect.  I definitely recommend The Nail Lounge..

12.description: Pizza here is never better than C- but it is only 2 blocks from my house cheap and quick.  Tonight the pizza was F-, so salty I am still regretting eating 1 piece before throwing the pizza in the garbage.  No matter how much water I drink I am unable to get the salt taste out of my mouth.  Tasted like someone opened a salt shaker and dumped the bottle on the pizza.  If it was free I wouldn't order another pizza from here.

3.description: Best customer service ever!  To the two man crew who was working on 12/3/15 at about 915pm, you guys are wonderful. .definitely coming back here!

1.description: Ever since the company decided to put more effort into making better quality pizzas i find us buying more pizzas here than pizza hut. Pizza was good, service was fast and price was affordable!

2.description: After quite a few orders with no problems, the quality of pizza from this store has gone downhill fast.  I stopped in and ordered a hand-tossed pizza, and they used a crust that had been tossed hours before and sat out for God only knows how long.  I saw that they were actually going bad sitting out and when I got home it was clear that I got one of those pizzas.  When I called to complain, they said they would record $5 off in their little book at the store, and I should ask for it the next time I ordered.Last time I ordered, I got a pizza that was really bad.  I can't believe someone pulled this out of the oven and didn't decided to make it again.  One side of the pizza was raw and the other overcooked.  The pizza was only cut twice, so there were only six pieces - two of which were 1/4 of the pizza in size.  The overcooked side of the pizza was also physically damaged, having been curled up overtop of the pizza like it was resting in the box at an extreme angle.I called the store and they didn't pick up the phone.  I e-mailed Domino's about this and got no response.  So now I'm telling you all about it.  Avoid this Domino's location.

9.description: Wonderful, friendly staff even right before closing time on a weekend! Everything was done quickly and I was in and out in under a minute.

10.description: Good luck to the new business on the block!

4.description: Really shitty service! The order was completely wrong. First told me that they will get me my order will be corrected and then an hour later once when I called back, the manager said sorry. Shittiest manager I spoke to. Zero customer service. Oh and we were stuck with the wrong pizza. Never buying again from this location

6.description: Usually these guys are good,  but today there was ONE delivery driver.  I waited over TWO hours to get my order and after calling them a 2nd time.. I was told they tried contacting me and the order was cancelled.  After hanging up,  I checked my phone log only to see zero missed calls and my order is still pending for delivery!! So aggravated at how unprofessional this whole thing was handled.

15.description: They do a good job here.  Have ordered several times- only one of them was not the best experience, and they took a step to make it right.  Every other time has been excellent service, value, and food!

0.description: Good food from a chain pizza place. Ordered online and despite the slow delivery everything came hot. Pizza was good. I ordered one of their chicken sandwiches and I loved the flavor. Nice bread and tasty tender chicken. Delivery lady was real nice. I've ordered from here a few times and tonight's order was probably the best.

5.description: Really terrible service twice now. Over 2 hours to get my order before I cancelled it. What's even worse though is they lie to you. I offered to come pick up the order since they said they were short on drivers. They said it had just left the restaurant and I would have it in 10 minutes. It didn't show up even though I waited another hour. Ridiculous. Other locations get it right. This one doesn't care.

13.description: Why can't Edgebrook attract better quality business? Dominos is crap compared to other options found in other areas. Thankfully Villa Rosa is a better option and is in the area. For quick takeout Homemade Pizza would be a better option, but only tacky businesses locate in Edgebrook. I guess Edison Park is still my favorite dining area locally. This is the fault of the lame chamber of Commerce.

11.description: What can I say but this is not the Dominos of days gone by. Thank goodness! Those were the days of the thick globby tasteless crust. Blah.  We love the thin crust. Throw a few ingredients on it and voila! A quick meal! They do have other pizzas of varying thickness but we stick with the thin. The veggie sandwiches are really good, they are a little smaller in size than how the picture looks but with the cooked veggies and melted cheese on a crusty roll it's quite tasty. I have also had the pasta bowl Alfredo w veggies on several occasions and it's a nice size serving and quite good.  We usually get some cinnamon sticks with the glaze to finish up.  Oink! :-). I place the order online for pickup, and it is always ready pretty quickly and usually that's within the 15 minutes they quote you. You can save your favorite orders and they have a lot of coupons when you order online so you can usually get some pretty good deals.  The employees are always friendly when you walk in so that's always a positive !

8.description: We will never order from this place again. Despite the fact that the food across the board is mediocre, at best, my fiancé and I decided to order a pizza tonight from dominoes because it was late and we hadn't eaten. An hour and a half after ordering and still no pizza, we call and were told the pizza wasn't coming because the delivery driver could not figure out where we lived. Instead of calling us, they just didn't show up. Regardless of the fact that not one of the employees could speak a proper and grammatically correct sentence, we gave them the benefit of the doubt and placed our order anyway. We won't be doing that again. Save yourself the headache and always stick with ANYWHERE else if you're ordering pizza late or at anytime during the day. These fools should not be allowed out of their homes, if they even have one.

14.description: The pizza is great, but the last 2 times, and also as i write...their pizza is taking an hour, plus, to get here. Are they no longer making and delivering pizzas in 30 minutes or less?? Anyway, villa rosa is a half a block away, and fantastic. And local. I do love their parmasean twists...so i wait, knowing other domano's deliver more efficiently. Bah!!!!

7.description: This is not a review of dominos in general. Just this location. Terrible! I ordered pizza 2 hours ago. Are you kidding me?

56.description: I saw this place while I was across the street at the post office and decided to give it a try, and I'm glad I did. Fast and friendly service, and the menu has some really interesting things on it - especially all the gourmet hot dogs. I had a burger in mind before I came in, and I stuck with that. I also had a side of sweet potato fries. They were great, crispy and a lot of them. By the condiments are a variety of salts, more than I'd ever seen. I'll have to come back to try a hotdog.

29.description: Food is fresh and was good quality. Burgers are juicy and fries are not greasy. I would have given 5 stars had the burger been seasoned. Actually the fries were also bland. They have a nice variety of gourmet salts but for some reason no seasoning on the meat. Sure you can salt as you eat it but its not the same. I was watching them grill and a polish got a bit too charred on one side. Rather than serve it and try and hide it like Ive seen other places do it went straight into the trash bin. All in all still  room for improvement but I will be back. Food is good quality and staff was friendly.

42.description: I'm always on the look out for a good burger and Ivy's delivered!Excellent burger cooked perfectly. Amazingly not too greasy but not dry at all. This has never been easy to pull off but they manage very well.Surprisingly they even started serving Kona coffee which I love but rarely see.See you soon Ivy's!

23.description: Yes, Ivy's Burgers, Hot Dogs and Fries could easily be considered one of the Ivy League restaurants who specializes in burgers.  Having attended UPenn, an Ivy League college, I'm biased and I'd say that Kuma's Corner (my favorite burger in the Chicago area) is the equivalent of UPenn, but Ivy's Burgers would be like Yale - you don't want to like them as much as you do, but you know they give all the others a run for their money.  Sooooooo, what I'm trying to say is that Ivy's Burgers is an elite burger joint that maybe isn't as wild n' crazy as Kuma's but gets down to business when duty calls...and duty definitely called when my fiancé and I walked into their doors.We were on a mission to try one of our last stops on our crazy burger quest and what better way to do this then by being mister and miss piggy and ordering the chili cheese fries AND the chili cheese burger.  Can you say 5-hour workout?  However many calories were consumed in that one sitting, though, that food was damn good.  Damn good.  Those chili cheese fries and burger came in such huge portions that it was more than enough to split between myself and my fiancé.  You may be thinking we were crazy to get all of that chili cheese deliciousness, but where else are you going to get it?  They really do it up right at Ivy's.  Even with the chili cheese fries (which were obviously full of flavor) we put some Cajun salt - from their selection of about 12 salts - on our fries which made it 10x better (if that's possible).  I could have eaten a whole platter of those fries, but that would be bad...very, very bad...but oh, so good.  You want to know what else was oh so good?  Their strawberry milkshake.  It had real strawberries in it and it was quite possibly one of my favorite strawberry milkshakes around.  Ivy's puts a great spin on some of the classic foods we all love to eat so if you're on the look-out for a burger and sides with all the fixin's then you can find it right here.I have absolutely nothing bad to say about Ivy's - the price was right, the food was great and the service was as fine as could be.  The atmosphere was relaxed and for a Sunday it was fairly quiet so we got to enjoy or messy burgers in peace.

47.description: We consistently get great food from this place.  The staff has always been friendly.  It has become our local go-to spot for hamburgers and got dogs.  We are not originally from Chicago so we were determined to find a great Chicago dog...after trying a bunch of other places this was our favorite and it was right around the corner from where we live!!  One time we got some to go food and a few items were left out of the bag.  My wife called and it was handled extremely well by the staff who resolved it in an "above and beyond" manner.  I could not recommend it more.  We are in once every couple weeks now.

8.description: Always hard to make a choice, but I haven't gone wrong yet.  The fresh cut fries are awesome, as well as the hand dipped shakes.

31.description: We love coming here because the food is really great quality and great taste. Burgers are a specialty and while most love the Merkt's Cheddar Burger, I am partial to the Swiss Cheese Burger. The hot dogs are good, too because the topping are really fresh. The fries, oh my!  The garlic fries are terrific and the sweet potato fries melt in your mouth. The have daily home made soups, too. (My mouth waters thinking about them.) Oh, don't forget to try the milk shakes; you won't be sorry. The owner Tony is a friendly, customer-oriented, hands-on kind of guy. He really cares about quality - he has to order "special" onions for the hot dogs because they have a sweeter taste.  And this place is clean. (Your mother-in-law would approve.)Prices are appropriate for the quality and quantity. If you want cheaper, find a guy with a cart on a street corner. You get what you pay for.

34.description: Burgers, fries, and sweet potato fries.  All were flavorful and filling!  I will definitely come back here if I have a hankering for a good burger!

16.description: Burgers here are absolutely delicious! Real, fresh meat. Just a little tip unless you like medium rare ask for well done. They have amazing fries as well as other great options. Very friendly staff!

13.description: We are new to the area and are always stopped by ace hardware on the weekends. we are so happy we found Ivy's! The burgers and hot dogs are delicious and their fries ARE SO GOOD!!!

11.description: I love this place so much! Seriously such an amazing burger! You can tell everything is fresh here.
