The fries are great also and I appreciate the fact that you can choose how to season it. There is a table that has all kinds of seasonings so you can add as much as you want. The portions are great for the price! The owner of this place is kind. The staff also has no issues. I love coming here. Completely recommend it. I even had to purchase the shirt they sell :) thats how good it is!

39.description: I was undecided town and decided to give this place a try based on the reviews from yelp. Glad I did. their hamburgers are delicious!

37.description: Burgers are good, customer service even better! Have been there three times and will continue going. I only wish the fries were better, but the owner is very attentive and clearly cares.

0.description: So due to some personal issues...I hadn't visited this place in a long time.  I stepped in and it was like I wasn't gone...Tony came out and was happy to see me, friends I hadn't seen in months happened to be there, so I ordered the pepper and egg special they had and I wish I took a pic but I inhaled the sandwich it was so good.  The chocolate shake was so smooth I wish it was a bigger serving.Not only was the food good,(I should say phenomenal) seeing friends a bonus, but the overall the vibe of the place was relaxing with rock playing over the speakers and everyone was big so social..I am going to say this was the highlight of my day.Sorry I was gone so long Tony.

38.description: The Japan hot dog was interesting. Toppings seaweed salad. Way to go thinking outside the box flavor.

51.description: By far the best beefburger and beef hotdogs in the area.The kitchen is open.  There are no secrets.  No frozen prepared or microwaved bs.Everything is prepared fresh daily and cooked to order.They take great pride in the ingredients that they use.  You can truly taste the difference in good quality.I appreciate the fact that there is a variety of salts available including truffle sea salt.  The owner gets it.  And I am so appreciative that he wants to give back to the community by hosting dining out days for local schools and donating often to various causes.Support your local business....especially this one.

27.description: Came there at 10.15 before the opening time on 10.30 on Sunday.My first impression was spoiled as I had to wait outside in the drizzling rain.I looked at a grill man, full of hope he would let me but he didn't look back. I sighed and return waiting into an open store nearby.Ordered coleslaw burger and fries. Tastes SO different! The burger meat is cooked in its own fat, no additives, and you can taste it right off your very first bite. The owner told me their philosophy is not to use salt, if you want some they have a number of seasonings on the shelf by the counter. Layer of pickles is thin and light on sodium, so next time I will ask for extra pickles.I liked the young lady who took my order and the owner who passionately disclosed behind the scene magic happening in the process of delivering a burger at Ivy's.Solid 4 stars. And I will leave another star for the improvement room.

32.description: Horrible experience.   The owner doesn't believe in air conditioning and prefers to prop the door open.   Therefore, be prepared to eat your meal on sticky tables and chairs with flies and wasps buzzing all around you.Also, why serve French fries with no salt???

54.description: This place is awesome! I can't believe I hadn't heard of it before! My co worker suggested it at work for lunch, so we went with it. Boy, am I glad we did! I had the portabella sandwich and sweet potato fries and it was great.To sum it up...#1 Order was CORRECT!#2 Food was DELICIOUS!#3 Condiments/Silverware IN THE BAG without asking!Also, the owner was super cool and friendly and threw in some soup for everyone. The soup was awesome as well.Ivy's will definitely be one of our go-to lunch spots from now on!

48.description: Taco Tuesday was a delicious surprise. The blue cheese burger was AMAZING! Parking was easy and the owner was so friendly, he even gave us free drinks and extra cheese:) I will for sure be back.

44.description: This place is top notch!By far the best burger I've had in the city.  Fresh ingredients, great service and a cool atmosphere.Whether you have one of their amazing burgers, a specialty hot dog or chicken fingers, you will NOT be disappointed.My favorite is their patty melt which is always juicy and delicious.  Fries with Merkt's cheddar are also fantastic.  They also serve amazing malts and shakes made with fresh ice cream.The only burger place worth visiting again and again.GO HERE NOW!!!!!

24.description: Everything I have had here has been amazing! I usually come for a jumbo dog, but on occasion have ordered their Merks cheddar burger...to die for!! Love their shakes too!!

7.description: Came there at 10.15 before the opening time on 10.30 on Sunday.My first impression was spoiled as I had to wait outside in the drizzling rain.I looked at a grill man, full of hope he would let me but he didn't look back. I sighed and return waiting into an open store nearby.Ordered coleslaw burger and fries. Tastes SO different! The burger meat is cooked in its own fat, no additives, and you can taste it right off your very first bite. The owner told me their philosophy is not to use salt, if you want some they have a number of seasonings on the shelf by the counter. Layer of pickles is thin and light on sodium, so next time I will ask for extra pickles.I liked the young lady who took my order and the owner who passionately disclosed behind the scene magic happening in the process of delivering a burger at Ivy's.Solid 4 stars. And I will leave another star for the improvement room.

49.description: I popped in here today after looking for a hot dog in the area and not feeling like heading up to Superdawg for the lunch rush. I was glad I did. Everything about the hot and hand cut fries was perfect. Natural casing dogs, good snap, not overcooked. Simply perfect, and it's been getting more and more difficult for me to find hot dogs I like in this hot dog town. I haven't had a chance to try anything else, but the burgers are on the list for next time--they looked fantastic. Fries were perfectly cooked: crispy outsides, creamy center, not too heavy on the salt, skin-on. Simply put, it's a 10/10 for me for their hot dogs with fries.

40.description: Great restaurant, great food, very friendly owners. Any time you give a toddler free ice cream you get 5 stars.

53.description: The hubster and I have been frequenting this gem for about a year now. It's one of my fave's...the food is always perfect! Fresh ingredients, done right, each and every time. I LOVE the Merkt's Cheddar Burger! It's my stand-by and I can only live about 3 weeksat at a time without it. Who am I kidding? 1.5 weeks. The BBQ pulled pork special is delicious as well and their hot dogs, well...slap your Momma good! (Don't slap your Momma, just bring her to one of the best restaurants on the NW side!)Here come the feelings....I LOVE this place because I LOVE Tony! He is the kindest man. I want so desperately for him to be a millionaire because he really deserves it! He genuinely loves what he does and likes people! He has always remembered us and gone above and beyond to care for my nephew with severe food allergies. When the hubs had back surgery, he snuck in another burger for the patient!  Just so thoughtful. In summation....GO NOW, bring everyone you know, enjoy Ivy's delicious eats and give my man Tony a high-five for me.

30.description: I heard about this place 3 hours ago from my brother so I had to try it. I had to go with some classics, a Merkt's Cheddar Burger and a Chili Cheddar Dog. Let me tell you, neither disappointed.  The hotdog had a nice snap and the chili and cheese were plentiful but not overwhelming. The burger was classic Heaven. The patty was very moist and had a deep char flavor. The accompanying vegetables were very fresh. I can't wait to come back and try the more adventurous items. The best part, it is 200 yards from the Caldwell Forest Preserve bike/running path. Burn off a few hundred calories first, then treat yourself after your workout!

46.description: Had the Swiss burger and parsley garlic fries... Amazing!My kids had burger and steak tacos, also delicious! The service is great as I forgot to have the cashier give me the $5 discount through yelp ass and remembered it after I had already paid the order so he gave me the shake I ordered on the way out free of charge as the shakes are five bucks.Will definitely come back again!

1.description: Omg! What a  burger! It's soo delicious the meat wow!Juicy tasteful it's  incredibly Good! The fries, very good crispy!This place is small but  cozy enough to enjoy they have  a wide variety if you want hot dogs! Staff is friendly and helpful to make your  order the way you want it!I must say I was very impressed. The soups  are like honemade! It's worth the drive to relax and enjoy this Tony was the king  he was so nice make eveyone feel Welcome!***** 5 stars!

55.description: I can dig this place. I went to Ivy's with a friend for lunch the other day. I had never been here before and was amazed by how unique the menu was. From Japanese hot dogs to Greek-style burgers, it was hard to choose what to get. I ended up choosing the Caprese burger, which ended up being a great choice. The burger was well put-together with the right ratio of burger patty to other fresh ingredients. My friend and I also split a large fries. At Ivy's, fries are not automatically salted; you salt it yourself, selecting from a huge salt selection ranging from traditional to very adventurous, like aged merlot sea salt. We had fun trying out and choosing the right salt for our fries. I liked this place and will definitely be back.

9.description: We stopped in here a couple weeks ago. He really liked his food, but I wasn't happy with mine. For me, it was just their style of what I got, I didn't like. The owner is so friendly, everything is super clean, and everything they were cooking and everything that came out looked delicious. I'll be back to try some  more stuff!

26.description: Brought the wife and kids here.  Owner was incredibly personable.  The foot is absolutely the best of comfort food.  Cheeseburgers, cheddar fries. all top notch ingredients and all perfectly done.  You wont be disappointed.

25.description: Awesome burger and cheddar fries.  Been here twice and very consistent.  Friendly service.

12.description: Ivy's is the best place to eat in Edgebrook and the surrounding area. Perfect for grabbing dinner after getting off the Metra just a few steps away. Reasonably priced, great food, great atmosphere, and awesome people. Way better/faster/cheaper than the Chili's-type place. Highly recommend trying it!

59.description: Service is great. But.....the hot dogs are not Vienna Beef- imposters! Very often too much fat in the hot dog. And to make things worse- I end up with a hotdog not fully heated-cool on the inside, this has happened  4 or 5 times in the last yr. I try to avoid eating there during the lunch hr so as to narrow my chances for a cold center, under cooked fatty hot dog.The chili is not one of my favorite recipes, the burgers are ok. Haven't tried the soups-yet.The shakes are good! Great salt choices!They need to switch to Vienna Beef dogs-not those fatty, not so good hotdogs.

21.description: Live in the area and finally had a chance to stop in...I regret not coming sooner. Ivy's is awesome! To start off with, the decor and place  is very clean, modern, and friendly, perfect for the area.I heard about the garlic fries and I couldn't be any happier, so delicious! They have so many different spices/salts to pick from! The staff was absolutely some of the friendliest i've ever encountered and really made a good impression, definitely part of the reason i'm coming back. I felt welcomed and it has that friendly neighborhood vibe I love. Ivy's is definitely becoming a new staple for me. I can't wait to go back!

17.description: I've been looking all over Chicago (literally) for a place with great gourmet hotdogs and hamburgers. Well, this is it.The dogs include the usual Chicago and chili varieties, plus others named after cities and countries. I tried the most unusual, the Japanese Dog, and wow, was it good. Yes, the seaweed salad and pickled ginger go well on a dog, but the superb flavors of the dog itself really shone through. Best hot dog meat I've had, for sure.But the burger was actually better. A think, juicy patty with a crisp, seared crust, piled high with all my favorite toppings, plus cheddar cheese and (of course) bacon. That bacon really made it a home run, with its smoky flavor, and the bun had enough integrity to hold the whole handful together. Just describing it has made me want another one.I also tried the garlic fries, which are hand cut and tossed with fresh Gilroy garlic, herbs and olive oil. If that sounds good, you're right. The owner made sure I knew they were unsalted, and pointed out a whole rack of seasoning salt shakers to choose from. His recommended smoked salt was terrific on them.It's easy to see that the owner's hands-on approach makes this place special, and I can imagine it's often hard to get a seat, as there are only a few tables, but I was served quickly, and the wait time for everything to be prepared fresh was definitely worth it. I'm all ready to go back and try some other gourmet combinations and maybe a shake, too.

10.description: I love the awesome service! The menu is pretty simple and you can experiment by adding different garnishes and the variety of spice rack and condiments they have on one table! The food was delicious- we ordered Chili Merkt's Cheddar Burger added bacon side of bbq sauce with side of fries and Sheboygan Bratwust!

5.description: Would consider this a hidden gem because I only noticed it because I was eating at another restaurant across the street.  Really small location and hard to notice while driving down the street on Devon.  I love this place because of the unique and wide selection of hot dogs.  One of the biggest things that caught my eye was the size of the condiment station.  There are a million sauces and seasonings to choose from.  Will definitely go back to try the rest of the menu!

3.description: Yes, Ivy's Burgers, Hot Dogs and Fries could easily be considered one of the Ivy League restaurants who specializes in burgers.  Having attended UPenn, an Ivy League college, I'm biased and I'd say that Kuma's Corner (my favorite burger in the Chicago area) is the equivalent of UPenn, but Ivy's Burgers would be like Yale - you don't want to like them as much as you do, but you know they give all the others a run for their money.  Sooooooo, what I'm trying to say is that Ivy's Burgers is an elite burger joint that maybe isn't as wild n' crazy as Kuma's but gets down to business when duty calls...and duty definitely called when my fiancé and I walked into their doors.We were on a mission to try one of our last stops on our crazy burger quest and what better way to do this then by being mister and miss piggy and ordering the chili cheese fries AND the chili cheese burger.  Can you say 5-hour workout?  However many calories were consumed in that one sitting, though, that food was damn good.  Damn good.  Those chili cheese fries and burger came in such huge portions that it was more than enough to split between myself and my fiancé.  You may be thinking we were crazy to get all of that chili cheese deliciousness, but where else are you going to get it?  They really do it up right at Ivy's.  Even with the chili cheese fries (which were obviously full of flavor) we put some Cajun salt - from their selection of about 12 salts - on our fries which made it 10x better (if that's possible).  I could have eaten a whole platter of those fries, but that would be bad...very, very bad...but oh, so good.  You want to know what else was oh so good?  Their strawberry milkshake.  It had real strawberries in it and it was quite possibly one of my favorite strawberry milkshakes around.  Ivy's puts a great spin on some of the classic foods we all love to eat so if you're on the look-out for a burger and sides with all the fixin's then you can find it right here.I have absolutely nothing bad to say about Ivy's - the price was right, the food was great and the service was as fine as could be.  The atmosphere was relaxed and for a Sunday it was fairly quiet so we got to enjoy or messy burgers in peace.

35.description: Great burgers with  almost any toppings you can think of.   Juicy, flame grilled, deliciousness. You will not be disappointed.  Tasty fries (with a plethora of seasoned salts). Awesome hot dogs. A good number of creative different choices of craving inducing foods. All freshly made with care. A neighborhood gem.

19.description: Wanted to come here for a long time...and worth the wait! Delicious and a very nice atmosphere...eat at Ivy's!

28.description: Really cute neighborhood place with great food!  Chicken fingers are made fresh and are delish.  Really nice staff as well, highly recommend! Update:  Since my initial review, my husband and I have been back several times.  Amazing burgers, fries and shakes!  Plus Tony is such a great guy...we love supporting his business.

45.description: There's lots to say about a restaurant trying to compete for burger and hot dog supremacy in the Chicago city limits. But for those that are residents of the Northside of Chicago, please flock and make it a point to go to Ivy's!Burgers are my absolute favorite, so seeing that Ivy's has maintained a high standard got me curious.  The fiancé and I ordered:-Green Chile Cheeseburger-Chill Cheese Dog-Chicago Hot Dog-Japanese Hot Dog-Small Fries-Oreo ShakeAll of the food was superb and not by flavor alone, but because of quality.  We were able to speak to Tony (Owner) about Ivy's story and we were convinced from their effort and extent of how they source their ingredients.  Their beef, chicken, and produce all have a story and specifically a reason why Tony has them in his establishment.  Speaking to Tony behind the counter reminded me of the charm that Doug Sohn had at Hot Doug's speaking to his customers. That conversation alone elevated my experience and thus made Ivy's a must have for me.Ivy's is no frills/casual dining spot, and if you want a great atmosphere, seasonings galore, and high quality food, please go!

33.description: I love the awesome service! The menu is pretty simple and you can experiment by adding different garnishes and the variety of spice rack and condiments they have on one table! The food was delicious- we ordered Chili Merkt's Cheddar Burger added bacon side of bbq sauce with side of fries and Sheboygan Bratwust!

43.description: Loved it when places like 5 guys gave the chains a run for their money. Now the mom and pops are doing the same thing....democracy and free competition at its best.  This burger place rocks!  The cashier super friendly, great smile!!!!   Gads my heart just melted.  Then to follow it up with the juiciest freaking burger I've ever laid my mouth on, OMG, my trip to Chi-town just got better.

2.description: Another great burger place.  This one is in my hood in Edgebrook.  It's very difficult to quantify, but the burger I had is very good it was a green chili cheeseburger that had roasted tomatillos, jalapeños, cilantro, lettuce, tomato, onion  & pepper jack cheese.  I also added smoked applewood bacon.  It was delicious.  The fries were hand cut & cooked very crispy w/no salt.  They have an assortment of 14 different salts that you can season them to your own personal tastes.  It's a nice touch especially for those on a salt restricted diet to be able to season their food to their own preferences.It's a nice little neighborhood restaurant with metered parking on Devon Avenue & free parking in the back with an entry into the restaurant from the parking lot.  The owner Tony seems like a very nice guy.  He welcomed me, introduced himself thanked me for coming & asked me how I liked the food.  They also have an assortment of specialty burgers, hot dogs & fries.  They also have specials on different days like steak taco Tuesday or Asian chicken tenders.  I plan on going back and trying some of their other food.

18.description: Really cute neighborhood place with great food!  Chicken fingers are made fresh and are delish.  Really nice staff as well, highly recommend! Update:  Since my initial review, my husband and I have been back several times.  Amazing burgers, fries and shakes!  Plus Tony is such a great guy...we love supporting his business.

41.description: Just tried with my girlfriend! The burgers are really amazing and the meat is cooked in front of you! Good choice of toppings to customize your burger! Definitely to try if you like burgers!! The service is friendly and place is very cozy.

52.description: Sometimes a small hot dog place can surpass your expectations. The dog selection here is superb. The burgers are fabulous. Really great. Fries are fresh cut and served piping hot.    Great service in a small 20 or so seating place    But a standout here is the cleanliness of the place. Really clean. Really sparkling.    I had a burger with merits cheese spread and bacon one time while my wife had plain burger. Both were terrific. A good number of burger combos are offered, as well as toppings and salts and seasonings. For the Fries.    I had a jumbo char dog at another visit and have worked my way slowly through the fine array of different kinds of dogs fro different regions they offer.      Note they have parking in back if you can't see a street spot     Love this place as my new go to burger place.

50.description: Good local burger joint. I can see why people would complain about the price but that's what you pay for good quality products. Didn't like the Japanese hot dog but the other choices are very good...I recommend the Mexican hot dog or Greek hot dog

4.description: Tony is the best! I had a great Greek chicken sandwich and the bun was delicious and my friend had chili. It is a little on the spicy side so he got a burger and loved it. wonderful place great atmosphere love being here on a Saturday evening

6.description: They have Merkt's cheddar cheese fries, guys. That's all you need to know. However, the Chicago dog was really good, even with the unexpected addition of a few cucumbers. I had a bite of my sister's burger and it was really solid. Everything was made fresh and not too greasy. The fries were handcut and crispy crunchy. Delicious. So, about 10 different hot dog variations, burgers, chicken sandwiches and fries is about all they do here, but this is stepped-up fast food that you don't have to feel too guilty about. A must try if you're in the Edgebrook 'hood.

22.description: Burgers were on point!!!!!. Juicy burger with all the toppings with sweet potato fries. My husband had the garlic fries which were awesome he also said that the chicken sandwich was great. This place is a must try.  I would definitely recommend this place. If I am.in the area I would visit this again. Five stars all the way

15.description: Live in the area and finally had a chance to stop in...I regret not coming sooner. Ivy's is awesome! To start off with, the decor and place  is very clean, modern, and friendly, perfect for the area.I heard about the garlic fries and I couldn't be any happier, so delicious! They have so many different spices/salts to pick from! The staff was absolutely some of the friendliest i've ever encountered and really made a good impression, definitely part of the reason i'm coming back. I felt welcomed and it has that friendly neighborhood vibe I love. Ivy's is definitely becoming a new staple for me. I can't wait to go back!

57.description: Had a Cobb Burger with garlic fries and a drink. Burger is good, you can taste the flavor in the meat even with all the ingredients. Save a $1.50 and get regular fries, garlic fries weren't that good or at least not $3.50 worth.

20.description: There's lots of places in and around the city to get burgers, hot dogs and grilled chicken sandwiches.  These places may appear to offer a generally similar menu on paper, but Ivy's takes it a step further.  A giant step.  Let me explain...First, there's the variety Ivy's offers.  You can get any sandwich you want finished with any combination of toppings:  all the typical burger/sausage/chicken toppings are offered, but also Greek, Caprise, Danish, Japanese, Cobb, Mexican Sonoran and many more.  Have you ever tried to choose from a selection of 20 or so different seasoned salts and spices?Second, is the quality of every ingredient Ivy's uses.  They serve nothing but the best: the meat for the burgers, the quality of the chicken breasts, the all-beef hot dogs, the fresh-cut fries, the hand battered chicken tenders.  Everything is fresh.  Everything is top quality.Third, Ivy's takes pride in what they do, and it shows in the quality, presentation and taste of every menu item I have had the pleasure of trying.  Everything is made to order.  Everything is home made.  Everything I've tried has been excellent.Personal favorites are the 1/3 lb. burger with Merkt's cheddar cheese and bacon.  Their battered and fried chicken fingers with an Asian General Tso's type sauce is addictive.  The blue cheese burger with grilled onions and, of course, bacon, is featured in my dreams, (now that I've been forced to diet by a cruel and merciless wife).  I've left instructions that I want to be buried with an order of Ivy's garlic fries.  But even while dieting, I'm not suffering too badly.  The grilled chicken breast sandwiches have been a life-saver.  Try the Caprise with fresh mozzerella, plum tomatoes, fresh basil leaves and balsamic.  Or go for the Greek style with homemade tzataiki, kalamata olives, feta cheese, plum tomatoes and fresh oregano leaves.  Delicious, satisfying, well thought-out sandwiches, and they're even diet-friendly.So, what are you waiting for?  Stop reading and go to Ivy's!

36.description: I liked it. I had a Merkt's chedder burger with fries at this place and they were both really good. The burger was juicy and the fries were cooked right. Parking is kind of annoying because there are only meters, so use the back parking lot. Will definitely come back.

14.description: There's lots of places in and around the city to get burgers, hot dogs and grilled chicken sandwiches.  These places may appear to offer a generally similar menu on paper, but Ivy's takes it a step further.  A giant step.  Let me explain...First, there's the variety Ivy's offers.  You can get any sandwich you want finished with any combination of toppings:  all the typical burger/sausage/chicken toppings are offered, but also Greek, Caprise, Danish, Japanese, Cobb, Mexican Sonoran and many more.  Have you ever tried to choose from a selection of 20 or so different seasoned salts and spices?Second, is the quality of every ingredient Ivy's uses.  They serve nothing but the best: the meat for the burgers, the quality of the chicken breasts, the all-beef hot dogs, the fresh-cut fries, the hand battered chicken tenders.  Everything is fresh.  Everything is top quality.Third, Ivy's takes pride in what they do, and it shows in the quality, presentation and taste of every menu item I have had the pleasure of trying.  Everything is made to order.  Everything is home made.  Everything I've tried has been excellent.Personal favorites are the 1/3 lb. burger with Merkt's cheddar cheese and bacon.  Their battered and fried chicken fingers with an Asian General Tso's type sauce is addictive.  The blue cheese burger with grilled onions and, of course, bacon, is featured in my dreams, (now that I've been forced to diet by a cruel and merciless wife).  I've left instructions that I want to be buried with an order of Ivy's garlic fries.  But even while dieting, I'm not suffering too badly.  The grilled chicken breast sandwiches have been a life-saver.  Try the Caprise with fresh mozzerella, plum tomatoes, fresh basil leaves and balsamic.  Or go for the Greek style with homemade tzataiki, kalamata olives, feta cheese, plum tomatoes and fresh oregano leaves.  Delicious, satisfying, well thought-out sandwiches, and they're even diet-friendly.So, what are you waiting for?  Stop reading and go to Ivy's!

1.description: I really wanted to like this place!!. I'm all for shopping local and giving the little guy my business. But the stock was sparse and what they had was quite over priced.  I'm not sure if the owner runs this business as a hobby, or if his business is just hanging on by a thread.   It's a shame because the store is in a good location for me, and if it was worth my while, I would be stopping in quite often.  If you are on the Northwest side and are craving a good Cigar, you might just want to pass this place up.

2.description: Just had my first visit.  Don't know if I'll be back.  I believe the Dominican Cohibas I bought were fakes.  The band design looks like a bastardization between a Cuban and Dominican.  I guess at $7.85 a pop for a churchill size, I should have known.Followup:  Upon further research, the cigars I bought were fakes.  Will not go back.

0.description: I apparently left my review as a tip so I'll just write it here.I come by for a cigar man and it was really really nice for some type of new cigar that they were going to carry Bill and his wife Gloria we're awesome place has some new furniture in it so it looks a little different on the inside but its small but they had to back open where people are sitting outside so you're smoking a cigar, eating some food from sponsors that they had for the event and it was really really chilled out... so relaxed even I closed the place.

3.description: Both my mom and I have been clients for at least 10 years. This the only salon that will take care of your feet and do it right. Clean, reliable and great communication. They have helped me out on several occasions with quick gift certificates and just have been always there. I highly recommend Alla, she is our go to girl and she is fantastic at her job.Easy parking on the side street or right in front on Devon. Also next door is an ice cream shop and its good, watch-out it is hard to resist.

1.description: Totally fabulous salon!  Nadine did a fantastic job on my hair. It definitely needed some TLC. All my expectations were made.  From color to highlights, to cut.  Everything!  Walked out very pleased :)  Even my hubby loved my new shade of blonde and I'm a brunette ;)  I will definitely be going back to Nadine for my hair again!

2.description: WORST HAIRCUT EVER. I am now scrambling trying to find someone who can fix the mess this place made of my hair. I even had a picture of what I wanted, and the "stylist" said she could do it, but what I got was a choppy, unblended, asymetrical, mullet. It's so short in all the wrong places that I ultimately have to just let it grow out and never return here. This is not a professional haircut. It looks like I cut my own hair in my basement, while intoxicated. It is so bad. I've never had such a horrible haircut, on anyone! These other reviews do not match my experience.

9.description: Bonnie is my hair stylist and she does a wonderful job.  I went to Mario Tricoci for years, I live in the city, and wanted to support a local establishment.   This is my second time going to Bonnie, and I cannot wait to go back.  I got highlights and a hair cut.  Everything looks great.    Bonnie exceeded my expectations again, and I couldn't be happier.   I would strongly recommend her to anybody looking for a great hair stylist at a reasonable price.  She is lots of fun and makes the experience enjoyable. You will not be disappointed!

10.description: I've been going to Nano's since it opened! Nadine has been doing my hair for almost 10 years & I refuse to go to anyone else. She is amazing, super chill & very personable. Makes you feel like you are part of the family when you walk in. I'm always greeted with a hello & smile from everyone their. I always leave feeling & looking great. This is the place to go if for ALL of your spa needs. They offer so many services & are very thorough in making sure you get the attention & care you want.

4.description: Highly recommend Nadine, she is super friendly and knows exactly what she's doing! I came in with a groupon and was treated wonderfully. I had pretty messed up hair from a previous perm/bad haircut and Nadine worked her magic and knew just what my hair needed. This salon is clean and uses great products for hair. The neighborhood is also super cute (but I may be be a little biased since I grew up around there) with plenty of street parking in the area. Will definitely be coming back for my next cut :)

6.description: Nadine is the BEST!  She really knows hair, really knows hair coloring and highlights and always aims to please. I have been going to Nanos  Hair Salon for over 5 years and think that its about time that I give her a shout-out!

11.description: I'll never know if they are good or not. I purchased a voucher through dealfind a few months ago and still have not been able to get an appointment for a mani/pedi. Whenever I call, their phone either goes straight to voicemail or they can't make a "dealfind appointment". Apparently, they have one person who takes care of "those customers" and they have real limited openings. If you are there to pay in full, suddenly their schedule opens up. I'm trying to get a refund through dealfind so I can be done with this place.

5.description: Nadine was fantastic at assessing my hair's needs. I came in for a haircut, but I was trying to grow it out from a disastrous hackjob I'd had about 3 months ago. She was great, told me I'd need to keep growing, that she couldn't do much other than clean it up and thin it out, and then didn't charge me for a whole haircut, because she hadn't really cut it. I have to say, she did a wonderful job. I couldn't really explain what I wanted, but she figured it out and gave it to me, and was totally reasonably priced as well. Really great experience, I'll be going back in 6 weeks!

7.description: The salon overall is very nice. Clean and personal. Nadine has been doing my hair for a few years now and I refuse to go to anyone else. She's fantastic and does exactly what I ask. Definitely recommend her. Aurea does my eyebrows and does a phenomenal job. The best I've ever had. Nobody else is as good as her and the price is good as well.

8.description: From my cut/style and brow waxing to my mani pedis I've experienced nothing but GREAT service across the board.  I'm so glad I found Nano's and cannot say more about how well I was treated.  So many times I've had a certificate from sites like Groupon or LivingSocial and when I arrive at an establishment I'm made to feel uncomfortable (you know that, "oh, you're one of those certificate people" look).  Not the case with Nano's.  On every single visit I was treated like a valued customer and this is why I will be back.  Also, I wanted to make sure to note how clean the salon is kept.  You can tell that this is important to the staff and it's so refreshing to see.  I've been to quite a few salons in Chicago and it's wonderful to not have to shuffle through piles of hair and maneuver around toe nails!5 stars and two perfectly manicured thumbs up for Nano's.  You guys rock!

0.description: Nadine is so friendly and down to earth. She is wonderful with color. Always quick to fit you in.RM

1.description: Let me start off by saying that while I haven't been here personally, this place has won my mother's business for YEARS. She's been going to Maria - and ONLY Maria - for as long as I can remember. My mom and I actually rarely get our nails done together because she makes it a point to visit this place and always makes an appointment in advance (I'm more of a 'hey i have some time lets go get manis eh?" kind of girl). She has nothing but outstanding things to say about the services here - and I think it's a testament to Maria that she's maintained my mother's business for so long - even with when she moved and opened this spa.

2.description: Ok let me first start off by saying that this was not my first pedicure so I knew what to expect. I was not impressed! The staff was quite friendly and the pedicure chairs were disinfected between clients that was good but the pedicure itself?...NOT GREAT!! (IF YOU WANT THE REVIEW WITHOUT ALL OF THE DETAILS SCROLL DOWN TO THE END!!)I made an appointment last week and got in today ok fine. I walked into the salon and was directed to a waiting pedicure chair. I grabbed a magazine and sat down and started soaking my feet in the whirlpool, thinking this was going to be an enjoyable service HOW WRONG I WAS!!! The whirlpool chair was alright the jets were not nearly as powerful as the ones I experienced last year, and the back massager would have been nicer if I knew what I was turning on all the control instructions were rubbed off. I sat in the whirlpool maybe 5 minutes before the tech started my treatment. My nails werre cut; fine, filed; NOT SO FINE !, buffed; ok, and cuticles clipped eeh, ok not great. She left the edges rough after filing and left spots of white cuticle growth on some of my toes. Last year at my first pedicure I was told by my tech and friend that I had ingrown toenails on both my big toes. I told my tech this today and she said "oh no you dont there is nothing there". Being that my toes are on my feet shouldn't I know if they are ingrown and causing me pain?!? The exfoliation another standard part of the pedicure was really bad. I have 2 callouses on my big toes and last year they were gently reduced. This year at this salon they were buffed only THEY ARE STILL ON MY FEET! SOMETHING THAT I PAID TO BE REMOVED AND TREATED IS STILL THERE. And what is supposed to be the best part of the pedicure the massage it was barely there most places go from the knee down well not here lower ankle down and it was over before I even knew about it. So tonight at home I will have to re-file and exfoliate my own feet!! I went with a friend and she got a regular manicure nothing fancy (my friend doesnt get acrylics or anything like that). Her nails were done by the same tech and her experience was quite similar. The tech was only going to file her nails when you could definately see they needed to be cut. AND THIS IS THE CHERRY ON TOP THE TECH ONLY MASSAGED ONE HAND!!!!! Thats right my friend walked out of there with half a hand massage!!! They offer SPA Manicures and Pedicures (FOR MORE MONEY!) so I wonder if the better exfoliation and grooming, and massage is offered for these. OVERALL BOTH ME AND MY FRIEND WILL NOT BE RETURNING TO THE FRENCH MANICURE DAY SPA!!! THIS WAS PRETTY BAD AS I GET A PROFESSIONAL PEDICURE ONCE A YEAR AS A TREAT I COULD HAVE SAVED THE 36.00 (STUPIDLY GAVE A 3.00 TIP) AND GOTTEN A MUCH MUCH BETTER PEDICURE SOMEWHERE ELSE!!! SAVE YOUR MONEY BOYS AND GIRLS GO SOMEPLACE BETTER!!!

0.description: Very nice spa space and easy to find street parking.  I went for a pedicure recently and will return for more.  Very nicely done and they really pay attention to getting dry/dead skin off.  The prices are very reasonable, but they do only take cash or check.  Pedicures are $33.Ped and mani stations can accommodate 3 people at a time so nice spot to go with friends.

28.description: I came here one time, and altough i saw a few cans of tuna fish which appeared rather jovial the majority of the produce i saw seemed not only UN-happy, but also slightly IN-edible.

1.description: My shoes stuck to the floor!The snack aisle floor was so dirty that my shoe literally was pulled from my foot- and not just once but a few times.  It felt like I was on hidden camera show. Sad but true. The stock boys kept getting in the way as I searched for my dairy items.  I apologized to them and they just shrugged along. The last straw was the chocolate milk that was 8 weeks past expiration.  I kept thinking that if some 10 year old kid came in and bought this item that they'd be really sick. I added a star for the kindness in the checkout line. If you really need bread or milk I guess they fit the bill. Otherwise is recommend Ada's in Norwood park or Whole foods.

9.description: Technically this is not Niles but after a jog through Caldwell Woods I ended up on the east side of the tracks and I happened to look left and there was this smiley beacon of happy floating in the sky. I didn't even know Happy Foods still existed but there it was. I just had to do a walk through. After many years of slogging through pretentious city grocery stores it was a relief to visit one that didn't cater to such whims, as much. I still spied some gluten free pasta and a smattering of organic products but for the most part is was a wide weird variety of food goods from many different cultures. Not the best produce granted, but the variety made hop for it. It had that small community no nonsense feel even though I'm not usually prone to such nostalgia. Kids stocking the shelves, old folks hobbling through pushing carts and everybody on a first name basis. You have my heart Happy Foods, fuck Whole Foods.

23.description: The bags with the face on it... how can you resist being happy?  I am so glad they have stood the test of time, my now adult daughter and I have recently roamed the aisles as we shopped on a trip through our old stomping grounds.So Jewel and Dominicks are bigger and loftier but here you definitely have that neighborhood feel and we both remember when she would get a lolly pop from the cashier when she would go with me as a wee girl.Happy foods, you still make me happy!

5.description: Loved Happy Foods since they had a location in Skokie (now closed) so I stop once a week at the Central/Devon location. I snap up all their meat counter deals, and love that you can get turkey breast to roast/grill, usually cheap chicken, and consistently good pork product pricing. If you know your pricing, shop their sales. They're great.The down side is you have to watch them ring up items, or double check your receipt. Every other week there is a price issue, however, they have always cheerfully refunded, I would prefer if it did not happen any more.

25.description: I don't know if slabs of dead, cooked animals makes you happy... but they sure make me smile! I go here pretty much specifically for their deli counter. The lunchmeat is hella cheap and that really speaks to the bargain hunter in me. They also have fresh sausages that are delicious. Their meat isn't always as cheap as, say, Jewel but when they have specials I snap it up.Their bakery section... yum. Everything is fresh. I love their bulk chocolate covered pretzels. I think they put crack in them... so addicting. The rest of the store... meh... and that's the reason I'm only giving it three stars. Their produce is hit or miss. The last time I was in I bought a bag of baby spinach... and didn't realize til I got home that it had expired the day before. Slimy spinach is ewww. Also, most of their other products are priced significantly higher than chain stores. While I get the whole "supporting the small business" bit... I can't help but wonder... who's going to support ME if I spend $30 more a week on groceries by shopping there? I go for a few specific items but when preparing to engage on a mass shopping expedition, I head elsewhere.

12.description: This place has been around for a long time, but I only recently started coming here for my protein needs.  The meats are fresh and of good quality. We like to get the thin sliced chicken breast and breakfast pork chops here.  Never had a problem with the food or the staff.  I'll continue to give them my business.

21.description: Great local grocery store.  Beer and wine also.  Best prices around!

16.description: I have been stopping in at Happy Foods for many years now. When I was working in the burbs, it was a quick and easy stop to pick up groceries and sometimes pre-made meals to make my life easier.In the past few years, we have been faxing over food orders and having everything delivered. I love it. It is so nice to be able to get the staples delivered and not have to go into Dominicks or Jewel. Thea who does the shopping for us is terrific. Mom will make up her list, fax it over and if there are any questions Thea calls her and everything runs smoothly. We even get our poinsettias for the holidays from Happy Foods.We simply love Happy Foods, with their cute smiley face bags!!!!

17.description: I don't know if slabs of dead, cooked animals makes you happy... but they sure make me smile! I go here pretty much specifically for their deli counter. The lunchmeat is hella cheap and that really speaks to the bargain hunter in me. They also have fresh sausages that are delicious. Their meat isn't always as cheap as, say, Jewel but when they have specials I snap it up.Their bakery section... yum. Everything is fresh. I love their bulk chocolate covered pretzels. I think they put crack in them... so addicting. The rest of the store... meh... and that's the reason I'm only giving it three stars. Their produce is hit or miss. The last time I was in I bought a bag of baby spinach... and didn't realize til I got home that it had expired the day before. Slimy spinach is ewww. Also, most of their other products are priced significantly higher than chain stores. While I get the whole "supporting the small business" bit... I can't help but wonder... who's going to support ME if I spend $30 more a week on groceries by shopping there? I go for a few specific items but when preparing to engage on a mass shopping expedition, I head elsewhere.

10.description: I run in here if I really need something quick as it is in the neighborhood. Prices can be a little high which is why I don't regularly shop here.  The employees are friendly unless you get a teenager. Then they are either super sweet or ignore you as they chat up the cashier or bagger of the opposite sex.  That's a pet peeve of mine whether it's an adult or teen. Acknowledge me dammit!! :-/

11.description: Loved it in Skokie, love it here. Awesome bakery department...friendly helpful staff. Delicious prepared foods. Easy parking. Great prices. My go to grocery store a few times per week.

26.description: I shop here at least once a week, and virtually everything I need is right here!  It is a nice local store, not overly expensive, and it has a good deli too!

27.description: Anyone remember that episode of Sesame Street where they had an animation of a little girl who was asked to go get milk, eggs, and a stick of butter from the store? (For those of those who don't remember the story or didn't never saw it, she starts walking and chanting "milk, eggs, and a stick of butter" but eventually the things in the list get replaced with things she sees on the street.  She's completely forgotten what she was supposed to get from the store, but the grocer knows she's there for milk, eggs, and a stick of butter.)  As large a diversion as that was, this store is the grocer.  While by no means the one-man corner grocery, it's as close as we get in today's world of one-stop shopping and supermarkets.  While they aren't all that much cheaper than supermarkets, and on a very rare occasion the produce isn't worth it, the guys in the produce section know their stuff.  The baker even asked if we wanted a fresh loaf of bread since there were some just coming out of the oven!  Now that's service!

0.description: Happy Foods is gem on the northwest side of Chicago.  They have been around for years providing stellar service to the community. You might not be able to find fifty different brands of cottage cheese, but do you really need that many? What Happy provides are solid staples one needs, along with top notch butchers( professionals, not teens with hacksaws) a good bakery, nice produce and a small, but very good ethnic section at very fair prices. The bakery carries Allegretti's Chocolate covered Pound Cake as well as O'Connor's Brown Bread and Soda Bread, FANTASTIC.Everyone working at Happy Foods is helpful and always friendly and willing to go the extra mile for their customers.  More stores should model this practice.

20.description: I have been on a "little guy" kick lately so imagine my surprise to find one of the last IGA stores left in these parts.   This particular store is the perfect antidote to the super chains and the large scale McJewelz and Dominicks in the area.Super friendly staff, that does things the way I remember when I was a kid, i.e. they take the cart to your car and load your groceries, the baggers are local high school kids from the hood, there is an old school butcher with fantastic cuts of meats and they offer personalized service.The recent addition of a wine and spirits department is what brought me here.   While not a Binny's by any stretch of the imagination they do have a pretty decent selection.  They do however offer great values on everyday wines (same product is $7.99 here, $13.99 at Whole Foods, for real) and they even had close outs for the $3-$4 range.  FOR.AN.ENTIRE.BOTTLE.OF.DECENT.WINE.

19.description: Best grocery store in the area; hands down this is the place to go for all of your grocery shopping needs.

2.description: This place isn't anywhere near my house, but for some reason they sent me a "Welcome to the neighborhood" flyer with a few no-strings-attached $5 vouchers.  So I figured, "Have coupon, will travel."It turned out that this is one of those medium-sized neighborhood grocery stores that Chicago does well.  Selection on grocery and frozen items is not extensive, but they tend to excel at produce, meat, and deli.  Nobody would ever really go out of their way for these places, but it's nice to have one on your block.  Anyway, I won't become a regular here due to geography, but it's a solid store.  The people are super friendly, and prices are more reasonable than one might expect.  The deli sold me some killer sliced turkey which actually tasted like real roasted turkey breast rather than lunchmeat, on sale for $5.98/pound.  I found some good produce bargains too, such as a bag of ten flawless gala apples for four bucks.Also, I happened to notice apple fritters in their doughnut case.  It was neither the greatest nor the worst, fairly middle of the road.There is a small parking lot to the side (much appreciated).3.5, rounded up due to the enormous smiley face greeting all customers (not to mention passersby).  Plus they sent me another set of coupons a week later, so I went back for seconds.  I got twenty bucks of free stuff!

18.description: The bags with the face on it... how can you resist being happy?  I am so glad they have stood the test of time, my now adult daughter and I have recently roamed the aisles as we shopped on a trip through our old stomping grounds.So Jewel and Dominicks are bigger and loftier but here you definitely have that neighborhood feel and we both remember when she would get a lolly pop from the cashier when she would go with me as a wee girl.Happy foods, you still make me happy!

13.description: Cool place...I believe there are 2 of them....clean and brightly lit interior, and helpful people.  Alot of good stuff inside and it gives you that mom and pop feel....it was also alittle pricey...which for the area isn't too suprising.  You can park on the street if you like to pay...but it does have it's own parking, which I think got alittle smaller as now they are building smoething in the corner in front of it.

4.description: Super friendly store! The staff is very helpful and happy lol. Will stop by again if I'm in the area!

24.description: I am not sure if Happy Food is part of a chain or if it is independent, but it sure has the feel of a smaller, local, cozier, friendlier corner grocery store. We lived in Edgebrook for many years and this was our stop down the street - it is nice to go back after the years and get the same neighborhood feeling about the area and Happy Foods which is a true reflection of the community.

6.description: Happy Foods butcher & deli are great,,,,,my big problem with this store is the inaccuracies at the check out  on each & every visit I have had.  Most recently, being over charged $2.00 on an advertised item.  Fortunately, I reviewed my register receipt while I was in the parking lot (instead of finding out after I got home).In addition, the expiration dates on many dairy or other perishables are a day or 2 out. You have to dig deep to find items that have a somewhat longer shelf life.  What gives Happy Foods?  Is this how you treat your customers......

22.description: Very nice local grocery store that has just about everything.  They recently got a liquor section which is pretty decently stocked.  The quality of foods at the deli is also really good.

15.description: Happy Foods is a small grocery store with a great deli counter. Most items are the same price or at least close to the same price as larger grocery stores. But it's a local place, so I don't mind paying a little bit more. If we don't support local places all we will have left will be Costcos and Walmarts, so you can pay an extra dime for orange juice. There my rant is done.Anyway, great deli items and awesome ready-made lunches/dinners for when I don't pack a lunch or feel like ordering out at work.  Great butcher counter too for when I feel like splurging on a nice steak.Do yourself a favor and start shopping here, we need to keep places like this around.

7.description: I love this place.   Great service, great meats, pleasant butcher, pleasant manager in the morning....I will not go to the local grocery stores anymore! the food quality, freshness,Selection and Deli is far superior to any grocery store within the 5 mile radius! they doa great job....the small town feeling......I'm ant imagine how any person could rate thisPlace low....I would certainly lquestion his judgement !

8.description: The only time I ever really shop here is if I want to pick up something on the run or I don't feel like driving all the way to Jewel on Touhy and just need a few items. It's close to my apartment so it's convenient. Other than that I avoid this place. The prices are higher than other stores, the selection is smaller, and the staff are not very friendly. Multiple times I've either had a cashier who doesn't talk to you at all, or they prefer to carry on a conversation with their coworker while you stand there and feel unwelcome. Even being greeted feels forced and sometimes unfriendly. I've worked customer service jobs for many years and I consider their interactions to be unprofessional. In my opinion this place should be called "Unhappy Foods."

3.description: Great prices and selection of organic products for a small grocery store! Friendly and awesome staff! Keep it going.

14.description: Not a bad grocery store if you need to make a quick stop for something and are in the area. I swung by there one night after running an errand in Park Ridge. Their selection isn't going to be as good as a Jewel, but it gets the job done. The aisles feel a little closer together than normal, but that may have been because they were restocking the shelves when I was there. They have plenty of staff working there, and they are really friendly.

29.description: It is okay, nothing that will blow you away.  Solid is probably the best word to describe Villa Rosa.I have had better, but also much, much worse.  No horror stories for me, it is okay.  Which makes me wonder . . . What is everyone else eating to give so many 5 star reviews?  I mean is there a secret password for the really awesome grub?

42.description: Very good Pizza with super fresh toppings, nothing comes out of a can here.  BYOB

23.description: I recently moved into the neighborhood and Villa Rosa has become a weekly thing for my family. Very simply, this place is what a neighborhood pizzeria should be.

47.description: It seems the only people who have reviewed Villa Rosa is the people who grew up in Edgebrook eating it. I am also in that grouping. However my memories were not that fond. I thought it was pretty much like a jacksthincrust from Jewels. The thin crust was usually soggy and floppy with no support for the toppings. It would just hang there limp in your hand. The sauce was good but contributed to the soggy pizza effect. The toppings were your run of the mill standards. I was preferred the eye tailian sausage and peppers. Nothing extraordinary here and so many other places you can go to get pizza for the same price. For nostalgia I am giving it an extra star but I see no reason in going back.

8.description: Looking for a good place to grab a pizza on a Good Friday during lent followed by some ice cream. My parents were in town to see their grandson and this turned out to be a great place to take everybody. Maria was our server and she immediately got a high chair for our little guy and was attentive throughout our meal. Pizza had a great crust/sauce and the veggie combo platter was pretty good. Salad was really fresh. My dad had to use the..uh.facilities..and was told it was in the back. He was impressed on his way back that everything was being made from scratch. Good place for a quick pizza and good service. We'll be back.

31.description: Been ordering with the guys for years and always delivered on time..You guys are the best. Thanks for always being on time and business always is professional. Spread the word everyone..these guys are great!

34.description: Had a good Chicken Sandwhich from here the other day I'm going to have to try one of their pizzas soon they always smell good when I walk through the door.

16.description: Some of the best pizza that I have had in a while.  One question, though.  Who the hell doesn't accept credit cards in 2013?  The pizza would have had 5 stars if they accepted credit cards, but I arrived to pick up my pizza and had to leave to find an ATM.  I was pretty pissed until I ate the pizza and it was fantastic.Edit: Raised them to 5 stars because they now accept credit cards.  I would honestly say that it's 4.75 stars, which is really good, because unless you order well done, the cheese isn't cooked enough. Maybe that is just MY taste. Isn't a little browning on the cheese standard?  Still great pizza and fresh ingredients.

13.description: I ordered from here about 6 times now and It always come fresh and hot!  Great thin crust and the  Baked Mostaccioli with melted cheese and the fettuccine Alfredo were both delicious.

11.description: What can I say but we have returned numerous times and always have a great experience.  Pizza, salads, always good choices! The young man who we have had as our server  a handful of times is the best! Full of recommendations and great service to go with his nice smile!  And soap! :-)

39.description: It is really too bad, but my experience after giving this place yet another chance still hasn't done any good. After I posted my first review of the extreme tardiness of delivery and the fact that they never even called to say they would be late, I received a number of notes from Nancy, the owner. Promises to make it up and prove them better, never happened. I started ordering from Rosati's but attempted to give this place another try, I do believe in the small places and the community business. I place an order in the middle of the day, 2 simple pizzas and sodas. Told "within the hour" (it used to be 45 minutes). Well, again, after an HOUR and FIFTEEN minutes, no pizza and no call to say they are running late. I call and again, get the young-can't help you- have to speak to the owner-no I cannot take anything off your bill- the driver is really on his way-person. Well the driver wasn't on his way because he was able to bring me the gift certificates after calling me back. Another promise that the owner would call me once again did not happen. They refused to compensate on this order, just giving me gift certificates to use in the future. By the time I actually received my order it had been an hour and 40 minutes! My point to Nancy before over and over was good old fashion common courtesy, if you are going to be late, then call- and don't give me 20 excuses. At least give me the option to come pick up my food if you cannot deliver it on a timely basis. But despite all that, nothing has changed.

37.description: Ok, so I needed to update this review for two reasons.  One, we have tried the pan and oh jesus god, it is SO good.  We had the pan pizza, which I normally don't care for, but this crust was amazing!  The sauce is of course homemade and the proportion of sauce to cheese to crust is perfection.  Second reason for the update is just to thank Carlos and the rest of the team for always providing such great food and customer service.  We planned a small dinner for our friends anniversary last night, and then realized neither of us felt like cooking.  So after much pondering, we said "call Carlos!"  We told him we needed dinner for four and could we do something family style - he made some great suggestions and we decided to get the pasta w/ sausage and meatballs with a salad.  What arrived at our house was two enormous pans of food.  Everything was absolutely delicious, right down to my favorite garlic bread.  I know I can count on this restaurant to take care of us anytime and it is appreciated!  Our friends were very impressed, full and happy.  They even asked if we had extra menus to take home.  :-)  Thanks again for a great meal!

0.description: We were in Chicago for the weekend of my son's Basic Training gradation and found this amazing pizza.  The crust was thinner than the traditional Chicago style, but still delicious. The staff was courteous and the food was scrumptious.  Salads were good - only vital info is that restaurant is BYOB.

38.description: This establishment has been here forever but got new owners maybe 10 years ago.  It remains a really popular neighborhood pizza joint but I think it could improve a lot and become even more popular.  They make a thin crust pizza and you can get just about any toppings you want.  Unfortunately, I think they must use a cheap cheese.  It just doesn't taste as fresh and chewy as, say, the pizza from Whole Foods.  Also, there is a ton of grease on the pizza.  Whenever we order it, we take paper towels and gently press them on top of the pizza to soak up some of the grease!!  With so many great thin crust pizza places now, Villa Rosa just isn't in the same league.  Come on guys, use a better cheese and upgrade your food.  The price is right, however.  I have tried the fried zucchini sticks and they were pretty bad: hardly any zucchini in them.  Mainly, we get this pizza when we have crowds of kids over and want something inexpensive but edible.

27.description: Good stuff. I really like their pizza and it's great crispy crust. I've even had a few of their lunch specials. Never tried their deep dish, but the thin crust is well made and tastes great.

32.description: Great place and good customer service.  Great local family pizzeria.  The owner is an former army solider, and the professionalism shows.I went here a couple of days ago to grab a slice of pizza....and they didnt have the sausage slice I wanted so he asked me to wait....and I did.  Took alittle more than 10 mins like he mentioned, but one comment I overheard him say while I was waiting assured me that I was getting what was an expectation of good food."That isn't the type of pizza I serve."So I waited the extra couple of minutes and on top of it he comped me another soda...which he didn't have to do...and to be honest I didn't expect him to...but was appreciated.Interior was cool and the menu was all on the wall.  Parking is streetside so you do have to pay the meter.

48.description: Christ, I grew up on their pizza.Top Notch, Top Notch!How 'bout a Fresca?

44.description: Very friendly business and good food. There's no delivery charge before 3p. The Italian po-boy is huge! I've also had, and enjoyed, their pizza, spinach ravioli (not on the printed menu so ask), and burgers.I must wrap this up because it's almost lunch time and the thought of Villa Rosa is making me hungry!

24.description: The pesto pizza is very tasty, with a strong garlic flavor. I ordered delivery and requested pie cut. I guess the chef realized after that he missed that request on GrubHub, so he sent a $5 coupon with the pizza apologizing for the error. I thought that was pretty good customer service, and I will definitely use this coupon! The pizza was yummy, even if it came in squares. ; )

7.description: I was looking for a pizza place on Yelp and picked this place based on their reviews. Ordered the "Chi - Town Delight" and it was really good. My girl didn't like the extra cheese but I don't think she minded too much because she had two plates. :-pMy only complaint which I wish I would have paid attention,  the price on their Yelp Menu shows $20.50 for the Large but I was charged $23.00

49.description: I guess since I just got pepperoni pizza it was okay... But their mozzarella sticks were really good and the customer service is excellent... They cater... have pasta... so they get the extra star making it a total of four...It's right by the edgebrook library so I see myself and the kid going there a lot =)

40.description: Without a doubt, Villa Rosa has the best thin crust I've ever had. Any time I have friends in town and they start asking about the famous Chicago deep dish, I say "yeah that's good, but try this pizza". Most of them have agreed it's the best pizza they have ever had.I have eaten at Villa Rosa for over a decade and I don't think I've ever tried anything but the pizza. Why would you?! I think the absolute best is Sausage and Onions. That combination works perfectly with their distinct slightly-sweet sauce. The crust is other worldly. I might have to go back to the neighborhood and have one tonight.

30.description: OH YEAHHhhh, how did I not know about this place sooner while living right next to Sauganash my whole life? Anywho, discovered this pizza joint not too long ago and glad I did. Their thin crust is oh so tasty..Cheese and veggie is my usual here. Sidenote: they really load on the veggies here which I love. I haven't tried any of their appetizers or pasta but am willing to try in the future.I usually pick up from here, but ordered for delivery one cold, lazy Sunday for my family and I. It was delivered on time but the pie was goofed probably from while it was en route. :( So I called them up and they were apologetic and didn't hesitate to fix my order. Received the correct pie in what I think was less than 25 minutes. Mistakes happen, but the way they handled it was just above and beyond. I can tell they are all about good customer service which I highly believe all businesses should practice, but unfortunately not all do. Anyways, thanks Villa Rosa, I'll definitely be back!!

46.description: Ok, so I did grow up in edgebrook. I did eat their pizza every Friday night. But, I'm not also 31 years old and have eaten PLENTY of other pizza and can tell you... this is not anything CLOSE to a Jack's thin crust at Jewel.  I like the crust... it's a little chewy in the ends and it has that cornmeal grit on the bottom. YUM! I have always gotten a thin crust pepperoni and broccoli when I order from there... but everything is good.  I don't live in the neighborhood anymore but when I am in the area, I grab a pizza to take home!

1.description: Pizza ok nothing to write home about.  Owner operator very friendly.Pizza:Toppings - ok, averageSauce - lackingCrust - okConclusion:Pizza is ok, I wouldn't come back again with so many other options to try.  It's not bad pizza, it just lacks the wow factor.- Cons, pizza is pricey for being mediocre

9.description: I have to say, I've been looking for a favorite pizza place and this is it. I haven't really had anything I didn't like there. What remains outstanding is their meat lasagna. It's the best I've had in Chicago. If you talk to the owner you'll understand why the food is so good. Everything is freshly made with the best ingredients they can find. I'm really impressed. When there, don't forget to order the cheesy garlic bread. It's cracktastic.

26.description: Yay for Villa Rosa!This place is fantastic. My husband and I were looking for places to dine with an 8 month old infant on Mother's Day. I was worried that my son would disrupt other diners so we decided on Villa Rosa because of its casual atmosphere. We made a great choice for my first mother's day - The food was unbelievably good! The owner and his daughter took great care of us, ensuring that we had everything we needed. They are kind, caring people who dedicated to customer experience and the quality of their menu. Everything is made from scratch. We ordered a pasta dish topped with the meat sauce which was outstanding. It was so great that I mentioned it to my father (who lives in Edgebrook) and it prompted him to come in at a later time. He reported back on how great the food was and that the meat sauce was out of this world.I am very picky about pizza and toppings. I usually order a large pizza with mushrooms and green peppers. I find that most restaurants/chains are skimpy with the toppings. So I find myself ordering extra/extra! Not Villa Rosa - there was no opening on my pizza. The owner covered every available slot with a topping, I really felt like I got my money's worth. Also, I believe that they roast their green peppers ahead of time in olive oil and it made the peppers so tender.I grew up in Edgebook and moved out of state five years ago. I am truly bummed that I won't be able to dine here on a regular basis. However, with my parents living in the area, I can't wait to come back every time I fly in.Thank you for a great holiday meal!

25.description: We are fans of the half cheese and half green pepper and onion pizza. Perfect amount of tomato sauce, cheese, onions and green peppers. The pizza had us wanting more. The only thing disappointing were the fried mushrooms. At least, they got the right formula for pizza...yum!

12.description: This is our go to thin crust in the neighborhood.  Not a cornmeal crust so if that's your gig it's not your za. They delivery it hot and fresh.  Crispy gooey deliciousness. We have probably tried most of the pizzas in the area and like this best, next to Lou's deep dish of course.

21.description: Villa Rosa is a very enjoyable restaurant. I give four stars because while I really like It, It is expensive so we can't eat there often. The portions are very large allowing you to split a meal. My children enjoy the pizza. The resturant has a nice neighborhood feel, is kid friendly and the owner is a very kind man. I recommended the Tortellini soup.

17.description: I've been coming here for years and I love it. It is family owned and has very friendly staff. My favorite is the chicken Caesar salad, but I've liked almost everything I've ordered. The pizza is deeeelish too. They make everything fresh so there is a little extra wait, but totally worth it!

10.description: Real good thin crust.   Been grubbing here over 20 years.   Always solid.    Surprisingly good beef sandwich.

5.description: Great fresh food made with quality ingredients and excellent customer service every time. BYOB. What more could anyone want? Very happy you are in my hood. Satisfy your Italian, wing and pizza cravings here. Check out their awesome daily food specials. Maria and the high school guy rock the customer service there. Keep up the great work and the passion for food burning. Wishing Villa Rosa longtime success.

3.description: On the coldest night of the year so far, we decided to take a walk to our neighborhood restaurant. Nice, small family owned place. We ordered 2 appetizers (mozzarella sticks & bruschetta), minestrone soup and thin crust, cheese pizza. Food came out hot and yummy. The mozzarella sticks were delicious and the pizza was cooked just right with the perfect amount of sauce and cheese. Owner even asked if we were warm enough and offered to turn up the heat.

35.description: OMG!!!!! I have over 18 years in the food and beverage / service industry. Let's start by discussing the food. Amazing, everything tasted so fresh. I was there with a large group of family and friends. We ordered a wide variety of food and it was all-delicious. The Pizzas are available in everything from ultra thin to thick. The sauces are superb. The Pesto pizza is breathtaking. The beef and hot pepper pizza is unforgettable.The staff could not have been more attentive. They noticed things we needed before we even ask for them. I was talking with a server only to find out this is an actual family owned and run business. The husband and wife along with staff and family actually worked on the floor. The front of the house is charming in a family friendly old school pizzeria, hip kind of way. The kitchen looked spotless, I have food sanitation licensing from the city and state so I am very picky about that. If you like great food, fantastic pizza, impeccable customer service, and very reasonable prices, Villa Rosa Pizza & Pasta is the restaurant you want for yourself and your family.

19.description: Great pizza always, love the chicken tortellini soup, yummy bbq wings, the lemon chicken is so good!

28.description: This place is amazing! the Hawaiian pizza was delicious, it had the perfect touch. And they have zig zag fries!! Yum yum, the owner and his wife are really nice. Great customer service. I will definitely keep this on the top of my list when ordering.

45.description: I've never been to Villa Rosa before in my life, and I didn't grow up in Edgebrook. I did get some gift certificates that my partner and I decided to use before we went to the movies up at Village Crossing.We didn't have the pizza, instead I opted for the chicken, spinach and mushroom risotto ($14). I will admit that I've not eaten enough risotto in to really know whether this risotto was good or excellent, but I did enjoy it very much. It was rich and creamy, lots of chicken, mushrooms and spinach. I could only finish about 1/2 of it. The rest I took home for leftovers.The BF had the 1/2 slab of ribs and shrimp combo. Unfortunately, they were out of the jumbo shrimp, so he had the popcorn shrimp instead. Also, quite good and a fair price. They served it with roasted potatoes which were excellent - a great change from french fries!Soup and salad came with both entrees and both were completely satisfying. The service was polite, friendly and attentive. Even though we didn't have the pizaa, the meun (a giant blackboard on the wall) looked really inviting and some of their house specials sounded really good! The offer pan, thin crust and extra thin crust -which is my personal favorite.The place is definitely a throw-back to the olden days of "pizza joints" and probably not a place for a first date, but as a place to stop before going to the movies, I'd recommend it - I'm sure we'll go back again. I also grabbed a menu for delivery.

33.description: I love in Skokie, and decided to try this place due to the closeness to our house and a deal on Restaurants.com. i'm sooo glad we did! It's a small, quaint place that I noticed was bomming with a lot of takeout and delivery orders and a very large but thorough for Italian menu. I had a hard time deciding what to order. We tried the cheese bread, house salad, shrimp scampi, and pasta with choice of sauce and side of meatballs. All were fresh, delicious, and definitely worth the wait. The salad was huge and awesome! They weren't stingy with the shrimp as a lot of places are, and the meatballs were huge! The marinara sauce was flavorful and it was a very healthy serving of pasta and my daughter had enough left for 2 more meals. We plan to be back several more times, to try other things on the menu. This place is a gem.

43.description: Everyone working there seemed very friendly.  Very low-key and comfortable.  The pizza and house salad were perfectly portioned and just right.

2.description: This was my go to place for pizza and pasta. Tried to place an order for delivery and was told will be there in an hour - hour 10 minutes tops. Waited an hour and a half to call them and find out my order has been sitting there and they are waiting on the driver. No thanks. Drove to portillos. Would have done that earlier if I knew my order was just sitting there. Everyone gets busy but dont promise delivery times you cant deliver on.

18.description: Great place and good customer service.  Great local family pizzeria.  The owner is an former army solider, and the professionalism shows.I went here a couple of days ago to grab a slice of pizza....and they didnt have the sausage slice I wanted so he asked me to wait....and I did.  Took alittle more than 10 mins like he mentioned, but one comment I overheard him say while I was waiting assured me that I was getting what was an expectation of good food."That isn't the type of pizza I serve."So I waited the extra couple of minutes and on top of it he comped me another soda...which he didn't have to do...and to be honest I didn't expect him to...but was appreciated.Interior was cool and the menu was all on the wall.  Parking is streetside so you do have to pay the meter.

41.description: Good neighborhood pizza joint. Friendly staff.

4.description: The whole family is in love with Villa Rosa pizza & pasta!  I have had a couple different kinds of pasta from there and they were delicious!  But, I ordered a thin crust pizza with Italian beef, green peppers & onions, I don't even know if it's actually on the menu, but they made it... It was so amazing that I had to write a review!  I'm extremely picky when it comes to sauces, and the sauce had just the right amount of flavor. The seasoning was perfect! You can just taste that the ingredients were really fresh. The kids & I loved that it wasn't greasy. The crust was super thin, I was amazed that it was humanly possible to get a crust that thin!   My husband commented on how he hasn't had a  pizza that good in a very long time. My mother-in-law was also impressed.  And I have to add, the owners are the nicest people ever!  I definately think that you should check them out!
