6.description: I've been here about 6 times in the past 2 years, while I do really enjoy their pizza; I find them a little pricey so I do not come here often.  I've only had a handful of items from their menu - I've had their thin crust sausage pizza, fries, bbq wings and caprese salad.  All very good items, I especially like the pizza with its crispy crust, flavorful sauce and generous amount of sausage.  There is nothing special about their fries and wings, I've had better.  It's hard to mess up a caprese salad, so I think caprese salads are great anywhere you go, however; I am a little disappointed that they do not use enough basil, so the salad lacks that basily taste that I love so much.  PLEASE add MORE basil!  Maybe I just LOVE basil!  I put it on everything.Our waitress was not very friendly.  She forgot our straws, plates for our pizza and the pizza server.  I did not let this put a damper on things because in the past we've had very nice wait staff and I was looking forward to sinking my teeth into the pizza.They have a small bathroom that you have to go through the kitchen to get to.  It is a small, clean bathroom stocked with plenty of t.p, two kinds of hand soaps and paper towels...all the necessities.  I was also very happy to see that their kitchen is clean, which makes me feel really good about going to this place.I will be back again.

22.description: Small, casual, friendly neighborhood atmosphere.  Terrific broasted chicken and HUGE wings.  I actually like these better than their pizzas and pastas.  Very fresh salads.

15.description: Good pizza, good service. My new favorite pizza spot.

20.description: Some of the best pizza that I have had in a while.  One question, though.  Who the hell doesn't accept credit cards in 2013?  The pizza would have had 5 stars if they accepted credit cards, but I arrived to pick up my pizza and had to leave to find an ATM.  I was pretty pissed until I ate the pizza and it was fantastic.Edit: Raised them to 5 stars because they now accept credit cards.  I would honestly say that it's 4.75 stars, which is really good, because unless you order well done, the cheese isn't cooked enough. Maybe that is just MY taste. Isn't a little browning on the cheese standard?  Still great pizza and fresh ingredients.

36.description: If I could give Villa Rosa more than 5 stars, I would. This is perhaps the best pizza I have ever eaten.  The extra-thin crust is the absolute best- like a little slice of heaven. I will always order my pizza from Villa Rosa.

14.description: Always great food and friendly service. Their sauce is great. Can't go wrong with their thin-crust pizza either.

3.description: I called and am reviewing solely on my phone conversation. The arrogance was unreal. Then after the rude conversation I was told she had no appointments in the near future available. I had a friend call later and she gave her two available appointment times for the next morning or the morning after that. Couldn't believe it.

1.description: I have been a Papagraphics customer for 10+ years, with wedding invitations, followed by birth announcements.  I've met with Alison numerous times, and she treats each customer with the upmost of respect. The craftsmanship of each invitation or announcement is impeccable, and I wouldn't consider going elsewhere.   I think Mary S has left a review for the wrong company

2.description: I feel compelled to write a review based on the incredible customer service and amazing craftsmanship of Papagraphics. They have just completed invitations for my wedding and all guests have commented on how spectacular the invites are. It was very easy to work with the team remotely and I would highly reccommend their product to any bride or event host.

0.description: I was referred to papa graphics from several people.  And  when I went to their shop they were everything and more !!! The custom invitations were AMAZING!!! One was prettier then the next.  I had a hard time deciding what to choose for my daughter's wedding and wedding shower cause there were so many beautiful designs.  I can't wait to mail these out to the people on our wedding list!! Everything is just beautiful from the paper, the font, and the beautiful broach we chose on our invites they will for sure make an impression on all my guests!!  Thank You Papagraphics for making our events beautiful with your unique and beautiful designs on our invites.Donna S.

4.description: I just wanted to let everyone know what a great job Alison did on our wedding invitations. When I picked up them up I could not do anything but smile, they were beautiful, elegant and something I haven't seen. I got so many phone calls and text messages saying how beautiful they were. I would recommend Papagraphics to all my friends and family. Alison I could thank you a thousand times and it wouldn't be enough. Our invitation will be one our family and friends will not forget.

58.description: My girlfriend and I checked out king pho after passing it a hundred times in the car. We came for a late lunch around 230 and there were only about three other tables there, which is my favorite time to go to a restaurant. Our server promptly addressed us and was very nice and accomidating. She answered all of our questions, which happened to be a lot because neither one of us had been to a restaurant like this before.I got a fried rice bowl with chicken that came with sweet sausage. My friend got a rice dish with pork. Both of our entrees were great, but we wanted to try their pad Thai!!! Sooooo happy we did. I don't have enough to say about the pad Thai. It was the bomb! The only thing I would knock is the broth for the pho. We ordered it on the side to possibly add to our dishes and it had a very strange flavoring! It is super aromatic. It almost tastes like someone took a handful of flowers and let them seep in water for three hours. Just not my cup of soup, so to speak.Other than that, it's worth checking out and VERY affordable. It was so cheap for all the food we got.

56.description: Great place for pho. I started coming here while looking for a new pho place and I've found the spot. The food is great overall. Great pho tai, tasty crab rangoons, great pot stickers and eggrolls. Definitely worth a taste. There's a ton of street parking and the space inside is very open.

29.description: Great tasting, generous portions at a decent price served by a friendly staff.

42.description: Noodles were a tad over done, however steak was better than most places. Service was sufficient. Place was clean except for a right under our table a gathering of ants over a piece of food. Not too bad, not exceptional.

23.description: Hands down my favorite Viet joint outside of Chicago. Clean, contemporary interior, BYOB and the most delicious food!  We always get spring rolls, pho and share a bahn min (which come with fries).  We have tried other entrees too and they have all been great too. Service has always been fast and friendly.  For $40 we get spring rolls, bahn min, 2 regular pho, and entree and bubble tea. Free parking in the back is a big plus!

47.description: The food is really good but the service is horrible! I really liked the appetizer platter.  I had a flank and brisket Pho and it was good (have had better), it wasn't hot enough for me and lacking noodles. Also ordered of the kids menu   friend egg with rice and sweet sausage YUMMMMMMMMMM, it was a large portion for a 5yo. I would put 5 stars if the service was better it really does lack!

8.description: Every time I come here, I'm never disappointed. I order the pho tai (#51) which comes with slices of meat because I don't really like to have a lot of different things in my pho. It's a very generous portion and very filling. I've also tried the sesame chicken wings and they were really good and flavorful. One thing I didn't like was the fried rice. It tasted a bit charred and it wasn't my taste. My overall experience here is always positive.

31.description: What a wonderful place to eat! Food is fresh and flavors blend so delicately.  Wait staff were helpful and just the right amount of attentive.  I felt like I was in Saigon.

34.description: We always biked past this place on our way to and from the North Branch trail and finally decided to stop in, as we were starved from riding all day and I really wanted to try their banh mi. We were seated promptly. It was pretty busy for a Sunday early evening. I really like the layout of this place. It's very open. We ordered a thai iced tea, the chicken wing appetizer, pineapple fried rice, and the lemongrass chicken banh mi. Everything tasted delicious! The banh mi came with fries, which I thought was odd, but they were really good fries, the seasoned kind. I was pleasantly surprised at how good the lemongrass chicken banh mi was, as I've only eaten it at Ba Le in Uptown. I'm so happy to know there is good banh mi closer to home! The amount of food we got was a little aggressive as we had a lot of wings and rice left-over to take home. Next time we come, we'll know to order less. The service was very good and we didn't wait long for our food, despite how busy they were. We left feeling completely satisfied and talking about what we wanted to try the next time we come back. A++

16.description: My girlfriend and I checked out king pho after passing it a hundred times in the car. We came for a late lunch around 230 and there were only about three other tables there, which is my favorite time to go to a restaurant. Our server promptly addressed us and was very nice and accomidating. She answered all of our questions, which happened to be a lot because neither one of us had been to a restaurant like this before.I got a fried rice bowl with chicken that came with sweet sausage. My friend got a rice dish with pork. Both of our entrees were great, but we wanted to try their pad Thai!!! Sooooo happy we did. I don't have enough to say about the pad Thai. It was the bomb! The only thing I would knock is the broth for the pho. We ordered it on the side to possibly add to our dishes and it had a very strange flavoring! It is super aromatic. It almost tastes like someone took a handful of flowers and let them seep in water for three hours. Just not my cup of soup, so to speak.Other than that, it's worth checking out and VERY affordable. It was so cheap for all the food we got.

13.description: Do yourself a favor and order the #50 filet pho. You will not be disappointed! I've lost count of how many times I've had the #50. It's consistently good! Flavor is on point each time! I've gone to other Vietnamese restaurants in Vietnamese town and they weren't as consistent as king pho. You get huge portions for a decent price. I've had expensive pho from places in the Gold Coast and king pho beats them all! On my list of "last meal" options.

11.description: The place rocks! Nice atmosphere.Pho is very good! Everything is fresh and very flavorful. Highly recommend!

39.description: What appalling service! Walked in, made eye contact with 2 employees but no one acknowledged us. After standing by the door for a couple of minutes, we were seated then ignored. We had to ask for menus. The server turned her back to walk to another table while my husband was asking about my iced coffee which never came 15 minutes after I ordered it and they gave us our check while our plates were still full of food, as if they couldn't wait for us to leave! Didn't bother to ask how the food was, if we wanted dessert or if we needed refills on drinks. My husband told the server how horrible their customer service was and a couple seated next to us said they felt the same way. They were not busy and even if they were, that is still not an excuse. The food wasn't bad but nothing special that other Vietnamese restaurants don't offer. For the first time in my life, I did not tip because the service was THAT bad.

37.description: This is good pho at a very reasonable price! Save yourself a dollar and go with the regular rather than the large size. It's just about the same portions but in a smaller bowl. We walked in and the place was rather large. It was pretty quiet, seeing that we were the only people there besides one more smaller group. Not much of an ambiance but it really doesn't matter for a place like this. They've got Asian decorations hanging by the bar and such. It was in a good neighborhood with a wide selection of restaurants. When we walked in, they asked if we wanted to sit at a booth or a table - I really appreciate when places give you the option. The people were extremely nice and were patient when we were ordering. I ordered the #64 which was the beef, brisket, and tripe pho. It was delicious! I highly recommend it if you want something close to the pho dac biet. They also weren't stingy in bringing us more limes. The waitresses were always filling up our glasses of water when they saw it getting low. My friends got dishes other than pho as well, and they seemed to really enjoy them although it cost a little bit more than the pho. Whenever I'm in the mood for some good pho though, I'm definitely going back!

0.description: I recently enjoyed dinner here with a friend. We lucked out and got a spot in the back lot (it's small). I liked the decor immediately! Our only complaint was that the service was slow. We had to flag someone down to order, no one checked on us after the food came and we had to flag someone down again to ask for the check after we had waited for quite some time. They might have been short staffed, because I only saw two servers and at least 15-20 tables were full. Everyone was friendly though! Luckily we weren't in a big rush. We had spring rolls, pho, a noodle dish and a banh mi. Everything was so flavorful and fresh! I planned to order more spring rolls to go (loved the "crunch" to them and wanted more for the next day!) but it took so long for us to get someone to come over that I forgot.I'm going to be back here soon, the meal was wonderful!

38.description: Do yourself a favor and order the #50 filet pho. You will not be disappointed! I've lost count of how many times I've had the #50. It's consistently good! Flavor is on point each time! I've gone to other Vietnamese restaurants in Vietnamese town and they weren't as consistent as king pho. You get huge portions for a decent price. I've had expensive pho from places in the Gold Coast and king pho beats them all! On my list of "last meal" options.

51.description: Spring rolls were very good. Waited an hour for my food. 4 different people came to my table. They need to designate one server per table. Brought my guests dinner forgot my dinner. There was a woman screaming or at least yelling from the kitchen. Lots of waiters apologizing. If only they could have managed things better it would be good.

27.description: Love this place. It's mine and my family's go-to place for Asian comfort food! I always get their pho tai and fresh spring rolls. If you got kids, they will be thrilled with their ban mi and fries. Service is great, restaurant is clean, yummy food and reasonably priced - what more can you ask for. If you can't find parking in front, they got spaces in the back.

32.description: I've been going here for months, this place never fails me when it come to their awesome Vietnamese food! The food is amazing, with their bahn no sandwiches and pho bowls. I like #60 and the lemongrass chicken bahn mi! A must go here place!

54.description: Pho Real - this place is great!Looking to satisfy your inner-Thai cravings then hit this spot.The staff here is beyond friendly and helpful with the menu. I've religiously ordered the Pad Thai (spicy) up until these last couple of weeks when I tried the Vegetable Pho - which is GREAT! The serving sizes are plentiful. I don't think I've seen anyone get a large portion since the smaller one tends to suffice.The restaurant environment is well themed and makes for a nice dining experience. Service is quick and the food comes out fresh. Each table has plenty of condiments (plum sauce, soy sauce, sriracha, ect...) to enhance your order to your liking too.

48.description: Don't go for take out, especially if it's busy. They'll forget shit and give you no utelsils after a lengthy wait. Avoid this place if there are more than four tables sat.

44.description: Great service and great space! The food wasn't bad, but I've had better! We ordered the vermicelli noodles. I usually get mine w/ pork. My husband ordered the same but w/ shrimp as well. The overall taste of the noodles was really good. I only had a problem w/ the pork...it was so fatty and huge chunky pieces. Not a fan. I love the pork at some other places where it isn't fatty and is served in small pieces cooked well. Would I come back, sure...but I would try the pho next time!

24.description: CleanSpaciousGood for groups Food was Excellent.  Had the Pho #50 & 55 All appetizers were great as well

7.description: First time here heard good things about it and it all seems to be true they should turn the ceiling fans on in the winter just slowly to bring the heat down.

49.description: Was excited that there's a pho restaurant close to home. Had the special pho and the both was bland and the meat was too chewy. Kinda diluted? Went there with my family and none of us liked our food. It was a big disappointment.

40.description: Number 1, straight-up.Went there on a Monday afternoon, around 14.00, so I can't comment on service at any other time.  That said, our server was fast, friendly, efficient, and had our Pho on the table most rickey-tick.  The restaurant itself was sparkling clean, as was the washroom.  No-problem parking was available in the lot behind the restaurant, as well as plentiful on-street parking.  Tableware, chopsticks, spoons, bowls, glasses, all were spotless. Now.  The important part-the Pho.My Lady and I both had the Pho dac Biet.  Most excellent.  The broth was steaming hot, flavorful and intense.  Typical Vietnamese-style and taste, not too sweet, just right.  The noodles were plentiful and cooked-through, the meats varied and tasty.  Rare beef was actually rare, the jellied-tendon was plentiful and fresh, the tripe was done correctly...just all in all, a really, really, really, good bowl of Pho.  The usual sprouts, peppers, and basil leaves were brought out, and the standard condiments were on-table.  Big props for having the bottle of nuoc mam on the table for those of us who like our Pho a little saltier. And did I mention that it was huge?  MUCH larger than many of the Pho restaurants in Chicago.  $9.50 for the large, and believe me, unless you're really hungry, you ain't gonna finish it.  Great value.I've eaten Pho from S.E Asia to South America, and all points in-between, and this place serves a bowl that can hold its metaphorical head up in the company of the best.  I highly recommend it.A note on service in Pho places in general.  These are usually family-run places, and they typically do the best they can to get your order up and out to you as quickly as possible.  Sometimes it takes a bit longer, because there isn't a prep-line, aren't three cooks doing things, it's normally just mama-san, or a cousin, or whoever, taking care of the cooking, so lighten up and cut them a bit of slack.  If you're in that much of a hurry, head on down to Panda Express, or McDonalds, one of those places.  Also, your attitude will directly affect your service.  Call a server with your index finger waving?  Could be it.  Just sayin'.Will definitely return-can't say a bad thing about it.

53.description: I ordered take out last night and that might be why the food wasn't as up to par as a lot of these reviews were saying. I hope to try it at the restaurant next time. I got the pho with beef slices and brisket, crab rangoons, and the spring rolls.Pho with beef slices and brisket: The broth was pretty good. I've had better, but it definitely does the job. Someone earlier had said it has an aromatic somewhat floral taste to it and I would agree. I think the smell comes from the basil. Their basil smelled a little harsher and more aromatic for some reason so that may be why. But beware of the jalapenos! I put all of them in my pho and actually ate one (I love spicy foods) and it was spicyyy. They sure had a kick to it haha The beef was good and tender. I would definitely eat the pho again.Crab Rangoons:After reading all the good reviews about the crab rangoon, I had high expectations. But the shell was overcooked and hard to chew and two of them had barely any filling inside. Sad to say, I was disappointed, but would still like to try it at the restaurant before making my final call on these.Spring Rolls:The spring rolls were ok... I didn't know what the "mystery meat" was... never saw it in my spring rolls before. Seemed like fish cake? Not sure...Overall, the food seemed ok. It's really close to where I live so i will definitely stop by again to get my pho fix. I would like to try the other items like the bun noodle bowls and the thai dishes. They seem pretty good. Will update whenever I end up checking this place out again!

30.description: I was so glad that I found good clean pho restaurant even though I have to drive an hour and half.  But I am now a bit disappointed because they cut the amount of noodle serving extremly!  I don't think I am going this place anymore!so as my friends.

46.description: When we walked in, half the tables had empty dishes and bowls that needed to be taken away.  It wasn't until 45 minutes into dinner that the busboy appeared and started cleaning up.  I don't care about service or decor, unless it's very noticeably good or bad.  I actually liked the decor andthought the remodel or decor was very well done.  I got the Pho with Tripe, Tendon, Meat, and Brisket.  The meat itself was good quality.  Unfortunately, the heart and soul of Pho, or the broth, was bland and tasteless.  I had to junk up the soup with Siracha and Hoisen to get any taste out of the soup.  I haven't tried anything else, but the Pho did not meet expectations.  If you want good Pho in the area, and it's not closed, take the drive to Hoanh Long on McCormick and Lincoln.

1.description: This is an Vietnamese and Asian restaurant. Great place, friendly staff, very accommodating and casual feel. Food tastes very good and good portions for a great price. My number one to go stop for pho soup and banh mi is excellent too. My wife ordered a pork banh mi and I ordered a combo the bread was soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. We got a Vietnamese omelet as an app and we both agreed it was a a great big portion and tasty. both got brisket pho. The soup was spicy and plenty of it for a very good price and we will definitely be coming back for more pho experiences at a local gem...

55.description: The filet Pho here is amazing! Their other food is pretty good too. This is a family run business with quality food and friendly service.There is free parking in the back. Nice, clean, and well lit. We are still trying other menu options but so far have not been disappointed.

9.description: The closest restaurant that serves good pho coming from Skokie, although I do enjoy the pho in uptown Chicago , the pho here is not bad at all. The restaurant is viet and Thai. Every time I visit Skokie, my brother takes me here to eat pho. I always enjoy my meal here because the servers are very nice and friendly. I also like that the place is spacious which can seat quite a number of people. There's parking in the back of the restaurant , however it's not very big. If you don't get parking  you would have to look for street metered parking which can be a pain considering the place is in a busy street of Devon. Overall. Good pho! Nice servers.

26.description: My go to Pho in Chicago area was closed (Pho No 1 - which is 5 Star awesome). So I found this place based in the reviews.  Shrimp rolls are really good and the Chicken Pho is good, not great in my opinion.  Broth is good, but not quite a clean finish in the aftertaste. Surface of the broth is skimmed with small round greasy pools.  Chicken is cut, not pulled and the extra veggie side was sparse.  I had to deduct a star for old jalapeño pictured here and the basil looked a little past it's time as well.Service was pleasant but slow and it wasn't that busy.  I think maybe I was there on an off night as I could tell the fundamentals were there but the execution was lacking.  This was definitely a 2.5 experience but I'm giving 3 stars because based on other reviews it seems they can do better.

25.description: I like this place but the service is veeeeery slow. I can't believe they take forever to clean a table and waiting for my water took them just the same time as the food- a looooong time. I called our waiter 3 times for our water and I got my water after I got my food. Definitely will take my food to go or order ahead of time before getting there.

12.description: This is good pho at a very reasonable price! Save yourself a dollar and go with the regular rather than the large size. It's just about the same portions but in a smaller bowl. We walked in and the place was rather large. It was pretty quiet, seeing that we were the only people there besides one more smaller group. Not much of an ambiance but it really doesn't matter for a place like this. They've got Asian decorations hanging by the bar and such. It was in a good neighborhood with a wide selection of restaurants. When we walked in, they asked if we wanted to sit at a booth or a table - I really appreciate when places give you the option. The people were extremely nice and were patient when we were ordering. I ordered the #64 which was the beef, brisket, and tripe pho. It was delicious! I highly recommend it if you want something close to the pho dac biet. They also weren't stingy in bringing us more limes. The waitresses were always filling up our glasses of water when they saw it getting low. My friends got dishes other than pho as well, and they seemed to really enjoy them although it cost a little bit more than the pho. Whenever I'm in the mood for some good pho though, I'm definitely going back!

59.description: King Pho has the best PHO on the northwest side of Chicago, I used to drive all the way from the northwest side to little Vietnam located far northeast in the city for PHO but ever since I found this place I will never have to road trip again!! The interior of this place also has great finishes. A friendly owner and staff make for a great eating experience!!My New Favorite Spot for PHO Danny D.

21.description: Inexpensive, casual BYOB dining spot with good pho. Families and large parties are not just tolerated but welcomed. We are repeat customers and will continue to be!

17.description: A great little find for a more suburban area. The restaurant itself is clean and bright, decent amount of parking around back, decent service, lots of variety on the menu.This was my first time having pho so while I do not have anything outstanding to compare it to, I really did think it was delicious. I had the pho filet steak...the large size (which by the way, is ENORMOUS); the broth was very rich and full, well-made noodles and steak, lots of fresh garnishes. This place, or maybe pho in general, would be an excellent choice on a windy or cold day to fill your stomach with some warmth.

10.description: I've been to King Pho many times. The soup is always good. Not the best I've had, but they are consistently good. When they first opened, I noticed the portions were bigger... And once they hooked everyone in, I've noticed that they are not so generous as before. By no means am I saying that they don't give enough, I'm just saying that when you get used to something, you kind of expect it that way every time you come! Anyway, the restaurant's storefront itself is situated on a busy street with meter parking, which I never use. I park behind the restaurant (for free) in the small/limited parking lot-I have always found a spot. No worries, there is a door you can enter in from the back lot. The dining area is quite large. It holds many tables in the center with booths around the perimeter. They can easily accommodate a large party. The food is really good. I've tried many dishes and have never been disappointed when it came to taste/quality of the food. I like that their banh mi sandwiches come with fries. They usually give enough condiments for the pho, so I don't have to ask for more. Prices are on the average-higher end for pho, which doesn't bug me too much since I don't have to drive too far for decent pho. Service is decent and place is clean. 4 stars considering location, food, price, service, atmosphere.

5.description: King Pho a nice little surprise in my neighborhood.  My wife and I stopped by after Saturday mass @ Queen of All Saints and as I'm writing my review I see my buddy Chet M has already eaten there.  We got there around 6:30 and the place was packed.  We got the last table right by the door.  It's nice to have a Vietnamese restaurant as one of my favorite places Saigon Grill shut their doors (bummer)We ordered a Banh Xeo appetizer.  A crispy crepe with shrimp, pork, bean sprouts & mung bean.  They accidentally brought the Bahn Xeo Jay by accident, unfortunately the outside looks the same, but the inside had tofu, bananas, bean sprouts served with a sweet and sour sauce.  Like I said the outside of the crepe looked the same so I cut it open.  We brought this to the attention of the server and she promptly brought out the correct order.  (Kudos for the quick correction)  We ordered a large Pho Tai Nam w/tender pieces of beef brisket in a tasty beef broth.  The pho came with the normal compliment of bean sprouts, Thai basil (I love the flavor of Thai basil), jalapeños & limes.  The large serving is a generous portion and was more then enough for 2 people.Overall it was a pretty good dining experience.  The service was pretty good.  The Banh Xeo was excellent in flavor, ingredients and texture.

3.description: Food is very good. My complaints are waiting forever for waitstaff to take orders, no one refilling water, no one checking on diners to see if they need anything AND putting everything to go in styrofoam, including the thermal paper (nasty BPA chemical leaching) receipt (see: theweek.com/articles/492…). I really don't like hot food interacting with chemicals. I wish all restaurants would use paper cartons. I won't get take out from here ever again.

35.description: We were standing waiting to be seated for several minutes with a few empty tables and after we were seated we sat there for 20 mins no one said anything, brought us any water or anything, so we left with out eating!  Other tables looked like they were waiting too.

19.description: I had the beef pho soup and vegetarian egg rolls. I thought everything tasted fresh and delicious.

28.description: I came here on New Year's Day for the first time and the food was decent but the service was terrible.  I figured that was because it was so crowded and they were short staffed.  I ate here again tonight and despite being mostly empty the service was painfully slow again.  The tapioca in the smoothie was terrible and the other dishes just ok after a very long wait.  It's too bad because this place is in my neighborhood.

45.description: A great little find for a more suburban area. The restaurant itself is clean and bright, decent amount of parking around back, decent service, lots of variety on the menu.This was my first time having pho so while I do not have anything outstanding to compare it to, I really did think it was delicious. I had the pho filet steak...the large size (which by the way, is ENORMOUS); the broth was very rich and full, well-made noodles and steak, lots of fresh garnishes. This place, or maybe pho in general, would be an excellent choice on a windy or cold day to fill your stomach with some warmth.

33.description: Having Vietnamization friends I ate allot of offensive Vietnamization food and I have to say that these place is as offensive as it gets, priced reasonably, only complaint that I have is that service some times is but did organized but they do make it up with food

43.description: The restaurant was nice looking and somewhat clean. However, when I went with my parents and when my father ordered the pho special he got less than what was expected but they corrected this by taking it back and giving him more. The pho here tastes good and is cheaper than what you would pay in most Uptown restaurants. I wouldn't come when it's really busy or they might mess up a bit.

2.description: Living on the northwest side of Chicago, I was excited to learn that there was a nearby pho restaurant, and kept saying that I need to go there one day.That day finally came last week, and I was not disappointed. We started with a spring roll appetizer, which were fresh and nicely sized. I ordered the filet steak pho, which was in a typically large bowl. There wasn't a huge amount of steak, but it was quite lean and tender, and it was a fair portion for the price.The only issue we had was that we were seated by the door. I didn't think that this would be an issue, as there was a vestibule with outer and inner doors, but the top was open. The open top meant that when somebody entered or left the restaurant, cold air still came up and over the vestibule. So, given the chance, don't sit by the door in the winter.

18.description: Ate at King Pho while visiting family in Chicago. The chicken pho and Thai ice teas were delicious. Services was a little slow, but the food more than made up for it.

41.description: I really want to like King Pho.  The food is good and the price is right, but the service is so bad that it can ruin your evening.We have been to King Pho several times. Each time the service was bad. By bad I mean the food takes a terribly long time to prepare, the servers forget about our order - or both. One time, the brought my wife's food out at the same time as my appetizer.  Weird, but we have come to expect weird service. By the time I was finished with the appetizer I inquired about my order and the server acted a little surprised. After going to the back to check on my order she returned and said it would be done in a few minutes. My wife finished her meal. I asked again about my order and a different server came up to me and asked what I would like to order. After much confusion (and my wife speaks Vietnamese) I discovered they never placed my original order. Neither time.  We left.Today, we went again and the level of incompetent service reached new heights. My order arrived, but it was not what I had ordered. They then took it from my table and tried to discover who ordered it.  I did not see anyone accept it so I couldn't tell what happened.  They came and took my order again. This time, when it arrived it was in a to-go bag!  They took it back to put in a bowl... but they didn't return. My food disappeared somewhere between the table and the black hole which is their kitchen. I was frustrated and asked how long it would take them to make it again - but I will take it home.  They actually came back in 10 minutes with my order. As I was walking out I peeked in the bag because it didn't feel like it was a bowl of Pho.  It was a sandwich. The length of time it takes to get your order can also be very long. I have personally witnessed several tables, over multiple visits, simply get up and leave the restaurant.  My wife and I have also left after ordering because it was taking too long for the food to arrive.I am not saying I will never return. They food is good and it's a closer drive for Viet food than going all the way to Argyle street, but their service is just so frustrating that I need to take some time away from King Pho.

52.description: I've eaten here twice in the past month and I have to say the food is really good. The portions seem very large and the prices decent. Atmosphere is cozy and the staff are nice and polite. The only thing I noticed is they never clean their condiment containers. As a former waiter that has always been a pet peeve of mine. All in all this is a good place to eat.

50.description: The closest restaurant that serves good pho coming from Skokie, although I do enjoy the pho in uptown Chicago , the pho here is not bad at all. The restaurant is viet and Thai. Every time I visit Skokie, my brother takes me here to eat pho. I always enjoy my meal here because the servers are very nice and friendly. I also like that the place is spacious which can seat quite a number of people. There's parking in the back of the restaurant , however it's not very big. If you don't get parking  you would have to look for street metered parking which can be a pain considering the place is in a busy street of Devon. Overall. Good pho! Nice servers.

4.description: I ordered online and picked up lunch, and not only was my food ready quickly, it was a very good value for the price and tasted fantastic! I had enough left over for a second meal. Will be back soon!

6.description: The King of Pho?  Not quite.  But still a nice place for some pho. Been here a couple times now and I'm a fan. Clean modern space and a nice menu with the favorite Vietnamese offerings. And Bubble Smoothies...can't forget the bubble smoothies.  I've had the Pho with flank steak and the Pho with brisket and I think I like the brisket better--the meat was more flavorful and well...meatier. The broth was really good, fragrant and clear.  The noodles were cooked well and not mushy.  The large serving is huge.  Easily shared with my 4 yr old son and had a lot leftover that my husband was happy to package up and take with him to work. The fresh spring rolls were also very good. Really well made and the ingredients were super fresh. Service is nice, the wait for our food seemed a bit longer than it should be, even considering there weren't very many people dining.  But there is an absence of Vietnamese restaurants in this area so a little wait is worth it. And Bubble Smoothies...can't forget the bubble smoothies.  Coconut.  Yum.

22.description: Firstly, the pho is delicious. The broth is very tasty and the basil adds that extra flavor which I love. The meat is always really good and tender. I've tried the brisket and the Vietnamese meatballs so far. Meatballs are a little different, kinda gray in color and not very crumbly in texture, very solid. But considering ive never had Vietnamese meatballs before I'm assuming that's normal. I've eaten here before, but this time I ordered two phos for pickup at the end of my workday. One for myself the other for my coworker. We planned to return to our separate homes to eat. The only issue was that bag containing the veggies was combied and the two broths and boxes of meat/noodles were separate. So it was kinda difficult to split the veggie bag. So keep that in mind when ordering for pick up.

15.description: Great service and great space! The food wasn't bad, but I've had better! We ordered the vermicelli noodles. I usually get mine w/ pork. My husband ordered the same but w/ shrimp as well. The overall taste of the noodles was really good. I only had a problem w/ the pork...it was so fatty and huge chunky pieces. Not a fan. I love the pork at some other places where it isn't fatty and is served in small pieces cooked well. Would I come back, sure...but I would try the pho next time!

57.description: My family loves King Pho.  This is one of the few places that serves egg noodle pho AND the traditional rice noodle pho.  There are 2 egg noodle soups on the menu, but you could probably ask them to substitute the noodles in any soup they offer.  The bahn mi sandwiches are tasty and come with a side of fries (excellent!).  The appetizers, noodle dishes and rice dishes are wonderful as well.  Bonus points for baby pho - a very generous kid sized portion.Service is friendly, but slows down a lot when the restaurant is full.  The dinner candies provided with the bill are not mint, but a funky fruit flavor.  They are always surprised when we leave them behind untouched.You could get lucky with parking along Devon or one of the side streets.  There is a very small parking lot behind the building, but don't park in one of the spots reserved for Domino's delivery drivers.It's walking distance from the Edgebrook Metra stop on the Milwaukee District / North Line.

20.description: Really delicious pho!!! I like to stop here on the way home from the gym occasionally. They are always really friendly and the food comes out quickly!  There aren't a lot of great pho places but according to my husband king pho is the pho king best! (Hope that doesn't offend)

36.description: One of the better Vietnamese places. Great beef pho, nem nuong and grilled pork chop. Very clean. Good service. Only wished it was closer to where I live.

14.description: Pho Real - this place is great!Looking to satisfy your inner-Thai cravings then hit this spot.The staff here is beyond friendly and helpful with the menu. I've religiously ordered the Pad Thai (spicy) up until these last couple of weeks when I tried the Vegetable Pho - which is GREAT! The serving sizes are plentiful. I don't think I've seen anyone get a large portion since the smaller one tends to suffice.The restaurant environment is well themed and makes for a nice dining experience. Service is quick and the food comes out fresh. Each table has plenty of condiments (plum sauce, soy sauce, sriracha, ect...) to enhance your order to your liking too.

58.description: Excellent. Never had a bad plate.Excellent. Never had a bad plate.

56.description: the worst customer service.  the menu states any order can be made vegetarian.  yet if you order any item and ask that tofu be substituted it will be delivered as is with beef or chicken. then when you call to say you got the wrong order the woman says no you didnt you ordered it with chicken.  and sorry we are closed.  so sad for you.

29.description: My wife and I were pleasantly surprised.  Fresh and flavorful food that is not greasy and heavy.  Very reasonably priced.

42.description: Came here for an early dinner with a friend of mine who lives in the area and who loves this place!Food:-I highly recommend the brown rice- it is ACTUAL brown rice and has that kind of chewy/crunchy texture (you can taste the health!)-I had the thai iced tea and tbh I've had better but it wasn't bad-the Tom Kha soup (my favorite) was decent but I still liked the brown rice better-We ordered the curry and it was really tasty too- not too spicy- but the brown rice was great (with the curry)-Get the brown rice!Service:-service was fast and prompt-waitress was pleasant -street parking right outside but 2 hour limit and it's City of Chicago so expect City of Chicago rates

23.description: This restaurant is such a hit or miss.. Mostly miss.. Making food consistently is not something they are used to. Food tastes so different every time. Not the quite authentic one.

47.description: I very rarely support anything as "the best" in my opinion, but The Elephant is the BEST Thai food I have had ever, throughout Chicagoland plus any Thai restaurants I have tried elsewhere in the US.The ingredients are consistently very fresh, prices are fairly reasonable, and the owner really cares about the food she presents. All the staff are exceptional. This place clearly tries its hardest every day.  I lament Sundays because I can't get any Elephant!I used to feel uncertain about any type of ground meat, including ground chicken, but after I asked the owner if she could propose any "more authentic" dishes, she suggested I try the basil fried rice with ground chicken (not the chicken slices), plus a fried egg on top. Yum! Yes, I suppose ground chicken is okay...I also highly recommend the tilapia pad cha or the catfish ginger - both feature delicious rich fish pieces that have been fried and have a fantastic crispy outside and moist inside, plus are served with lots of fresh vegetables.The Elephant truly may be my favorite restaurant.

8.description: Atmosphere:  BFood: A-Service: B+We have ordered at least a dozen times from The Elephant and I cannot believe I have not posted.  Everything is very good here, the menu is well balanced with something for everyone.  In particular, the Basil Chicken is always something we order and from there we rotate to a number of different dishes.  Be adventurous, try something new!

31.description: Excellent experience here as others said. Fast, friendly service. Cozy setting. Love the BYOB touch - brought a bottle of red and enjoyed it - without any corkage fee. Our group loved the curry dishes, especially the Masaman Curry. And don't miss out on trying their Tom Kha Kai soup - get the large for two people. My co-diners said the Crab Rangoon was the best they'd ever had. And all for a very affordable price!

34.description: Clean restaurant, cute ambiance, and friendly staff. Our waitress was nice very nice and welcoming though hard to understand, but that was ok As far as the food, my family I had had chicken fried rice, chicken pad Thai, and the spicy seafood dish special. We loved everything we ate. One of my favorite parts was the fact that nothing tasted too heavy on oil and had a healthy feel.

16.description: For the trouble of writing an honest review back in September, I received a very nasty message. This time I don't have much to complain about, so, to whomever wrote the ill-tempered diatribe: you can cool your jets.I ordered the Appetizer Sampler. Very tasty. Best rangoon I ever had. Nice little dumplings. I also ordered the Spicy Seafood entree. Lots of seafood! Wow! Not too spicy. I'm convinced the coconut soup will heal whatever ails you. I smile with every spoonful. Wonderful bits of ginger to suck on. I'm arriving at the conclusion that Pad Thai is Pad Thai no matter where you go, that there just isn't much else anyone can do to it. Unless anyone has any suggestions?Oh, I don't know what has happened to the parking situation, but it's kind of tough. The side lot is now blocked off so no one visiting any of the businesses along the Devon strip can park there, and the back lot is reserved for other businesses in the area. I went there on a Saturday afternoon and had to circle around to find a spot.

13.description: Ordered take out chicken pad Thai. With the positive reviews I really expected better. It was really bland in flavor, the chicken was dry, and noodles were overcooked. The noodles were short and broken not how usual pad Thai noodles are which was another indication they were overcooked. Probably won't be returned but they were really friendly and quick.

11.description: I love Thai food! I have been to some mediocre Thai restaurants. However, this was superb!!! I had the Thai chicken fried rice (I always get that no matter what!) and it was fresh hot and so delicious! No sauce or extra seasoning needed. Everything was cooked just right!! I would go back and refer my family!! Service was great as well. I was there with an old elementary school friend and he loved his food as well! The thai ice tea was fantastic as well!

39.description: Awesome lunch special! Your choice of main dish (meat or tofu)  with cucumber salad or egg roll, and rice. YUM! Pad thai is delicious. Egg roll is the best I've ever had, no seriously. It's delicious. Plus the red dipping sauce is so delicious! Service is always fast and sweet. Place is never over-crowded. Plus the art on the walls is so beautiful!

37.description: Friendly staff, cheap lunch special, almost never any wait. DELICIOUS pad thai.  I came in for lunch last week and the waitress remembered that I prefer to eat with chopsticks and like tofu. She offered both without prompt. EXCELLENT service.

0.description: Last night in the bitter cold, Elephant Thai was a delightful oasis. The pad kee Mao with tofu was delicious, and I was happy to share some green curry with my sidekick.The service was SUPER attentive to the extent that our water glasses never got below 3/4 full.Reasonably priced. I would definitely come back to sample more curry!

38.description: The food was good. I'm glad I tried it there. My friend ordered Special Box C, there's pad see ew, garlic chicken, rice, 2 crab Rangoon, 3 fried tofu. I ordered Special Box B, there's green curry, stir fry veggie, rice, 2 sticks of chicken satay and 3 shumai. We were satisfied. We ordered taro in coconut milk for dessert. It was not what I expected. Not happy. But as long as the food was good. I'm happy. The restaurant is kinda small. I went during lunch, so it was packed.

51.description: Currently my favorite Chicago Thai restaurant...flavorful fresh authentic Thai food in a pleasant storefront with fun elephant-themed decor.  Terrific nam sod, lad nar and chicken basil.  Plan on sampling many more menu items, although it is tough since the ones i've tried already are so good i want to repeat them.  My niece and nephew introduced me to this place for lunch one day and i have been going back almost once a week ever since.  Very warm and welcoming place to grab a delicious bite;  super takeout also and if you live nearby they will deliver to you!  Service is friendly and efficient.  Good prices.  Family friendly also, lots of little kids and babies made to feel very welcome.  Wonder if they could do something about the way the front doors work as you do get blasted with cold air whenever anyone new comes in...FIVE STARS.

27.description: For the trouble of writing an honest review back in September, I received a very nasty message. This time I don't have much to complain about, so, to whomever wrote the ill-tempered diatribe: you can cool your jets.I ordered the Appetizer Sampler. Very tasty. Best rangoon I ever had. Nice little dumplings. I also ordered the Spicy Seafood entree. Lots of seafood! Wow! Not too spicy. I'm convinced the coconut soup will heal whatever ails you. I smile with every spoonful. Wonderful bits of ginger to suck on. I'm arriving at the conclusion that Pad Thai is Pad Thai no matter where you go, that there just isn't much else anyone can do to it. Unless anyone has any suggestions?Oh, I don't know what has happened to the parking situation, but it's kind of tough. The side lot is now blocked off so no one visiting any of the businesses along the Devon strip can park there, and the back lot is reserved for other businesses in the area. I went there on a Saturday afternoon and had to circle around to find a spot.

32.description: The food is consistently good here! Love the green coconut curry and the spring rolls. Everything tastes great. Thank you for a great meal time and time again!

54.description: This is actually the 1st Thai restaurant I've been to, but I've had Thai food in the past, so I avoided the Pad Thai and decided to be a bit more adventurous and had the Cashew Chicken. Quiet place. I didn't have their bubble tea, but my friends did and they were quite good. Nothing special, but just as good as Joy Yee's. The service took a bit, but the food was good. Not as great as I would have thought for all the hype, but it's a decent restaurant. Not too many menu options... (they only have 4 drink options; 2 are bubble teas) but enough to keep you entertained for a good while. A tiny bit disappointed that there were only two bubble tea options (mango and pineapple), but it keeps the menu authentic. Overall an okay restaurant, but not good enough for the long trek from my home on the Northside.

48.description: The best pad thai in the city!  Fresh and tasty.  We drive past several other Thai restaurants to get here.The ambiance is fairly casual and colorful.  Good prices.

44.description: A unique Thai restaurant that's worth the trip out to Edgebrook.  Most impressive is that they use real crab meat (not crab stick). youtube.com/watch?v=oG6u…

24.description: I have lived all over the city and this is the best Thai food for both taste and value. Thom ka kai and wonton soup are both very impressive-freshly made from scratch. The special box combo meals are a steal. The famous Basil chicken is tasty and spicy.

7.description: Excellent place even if you are a vegetarian. Nice bunch of folks. Understaffed but very good food. Must try the Red curry and Thai custard.

49.description: A nice, friendly little place.  Service was very good.  I had a red curry for lunch.  It was pretty good, but not the best I've ever had.  Had it with beef but one can also get it with chicken, and maybe tofu, also.  If I'm there for lunch again I'll try the special.

40.description: Wow, this Thai food place is one of my favorites in the city, I ordered green curry chicken, spicy and a appetizer of crab Rangoon. I love the curry it hit the spot in so many ways plus I got it to go and it stayed warm until I got home.

53.description: Have eaten here many times, mostly carry-out. We enjoy the pad-thai. Pricing is very reasonable, food and service are consistent. It's a good neighborhood place. The dining area is  little short on ambiance compared to Chai Asian, another local spot but this is our favorite carry out.

30.description: I have been coming here since the day it opened. It is my go to thai restaurant. It is so incredibly fresh and delicious and the staff is so friendly. Seriously one of my favorite places ever!

46.description: I love The Elephant! I was in Chicago for work recently and I ate here a lot. The food was excellent every time. I particularly loved their Pad See Ewe and Massaman Curry.

1.description: We went to lunch here one weekend ago craving some thai food and the food was yummy just abit pricey for the portions of each dish.Service was good! Place was small and cozy! We ordered the appetizer special, pad see eiw, beef pad thai, chef fried rice, and chicken panang curry

55.description: Okay, let me start by saying that I am INCREDIBLY picky when it comes to Asian food.  I can become very easily turned off, mostly because part of me doesn't totally trust it (sorry, just being honest).  That being said, I had almost given up on Thai food.  The only place I have found to make consistently good pad thai is downtown and I just don't want to drive there every time I feel like having Thai.I feel a bit ridiculous writing a review because I cannot remember exactly what I had, but it was some type of chicken dish and on the list of lunch specials.  It was incredibly fresh and flavorful and came with a cucumber salad, which was also good.I specifically asked the owner for something with no fish sauce (the idea of it just turns me off) and very little oil/not cooked in animal fat (I SWEAR Thai places often cook their dishes in animal fat----not joking, I consistently taste it!).  She was super nice and accommodating and this is officially my new Thai place.  Yay!

9.description: Great food. Nice ambience. Good customer service. I especially love there pad see ew, tom yum goong, and papaya salad.

26.description: I am actually addicted to this place. The food here is incredible! My boyfriend and I eat here at least once a week.  The pot stickers here are the greatest things I have ever eaten. I always get an order to myself because I hate sharing! The pad Thai is also amazing and I'm in love with the spring rolls. I highly recommend this restaurant!

25.description: Ordered delivery the other day with my boyfriend and got our food in the time they had promised. I got the special box A - basil chicken, pad thai, and potstickers. It was soooo good! The basil chicken has some spiciness to it that made it addicting and the pad thai was very good!My boyfriend got a red curry and he ate that all up as well :)I'll be ordering from here again!

12.description: Been going here for years now.  The flavors are great.  My stand by is the chicken pad siew, but all the dishes are great.  They deliver too which makes for a cozy at home dinner!

59.description: Solid Thai food served in a friendly atmosphere.  Neighborhood gem if you will.  Bright red paint, painted elephants in primary colors, seating comfortable enough for  the time and service with a smile.  BYOB.I dig the seafood combo, it's solid for about $11 dollars.  You won't believe how much seafood is offered.  Tiger shrimp pieces, squid, mussel and crab meat, it's all tasty, filling and very good.  Pair that with the appetizer sampler and its a perfect meal.  At least for me.  I dislike their web hosting for it's slow response time, my only other gripe is their last seating time.  They say they will seat anyone in the restaurant by 8:30 pm.  I've gotten turned away at 8:20 pm and it was dead.  WTF.

21.description: Came here with my 8 year old for a mommy/son date. We had a couple appetizers, our go to is Crab Rangoon and theirs was pretty good nothing spectacular but tasty. My son ordered their Chicken Pad Thai and it was pretty standard - yum! I ordered their Basil Chicken and it was by far one of tastiest foods I have ever put in my mouth! I also ordered a small Tom Kha Kai soup and it was so warm and delicious! Really hit the spot! We really loved their attentiveness, too. At one point the waitress accidentally swiped our sweet chili sauce and saw my son had half a spring roll left and brought him a whole new one. The presentation was really lovely as well! Easy street parking. We'll definitely be back!

17.description: Always fresh ingredients and outstanding flavor to all of their dishes.  I can honestly say I've never had a bad meal here (+50 over the years).   Ask for duck next time in your favorite rice or noodle dish.  The BYOB also keeps the dinner bills down!Enjoy!

10.description: Always delicious, always friendly... especially my favorite waitress, Obawon, who remembers my order as soon as I enter.

5.description: Really delicious food. Nice dining space.

3.description: This place just servers delicious food, although during mango season, steer clear of the mango and sticky rice, I can't risk them being out of it when I come by.

35.description: In my book, The Elephant is by far the best choice for Thai cuisine in Chicago. I've been patronizing this restaurant for years with my family and friends and I don't have a single complaint. The service is friendly, speedy, and very attentive. My menu favorites are the spring rolls, the chicken satay, and the chicken pad Thai; I have yet to be disappointed with a single meal taken here. The desserts, however limited, are also to die for. I visited The Elephant with a friend today and she agreed wholeheartedly that the food was great and that the Thai custard and Taro pearls were surprisingly delicious (she was skeptical at first sight). Even though her order was initially messed up, the issue was kindly and promptly addressed and our experience was still absolutely fabulous. The Elephant Thai Cuisine is a great, affordable gem hidden in the quietness of Edgebrook and I would recommend it to anyone who loves Thai food (and even those who don't).

19.description: I have lived all over the city and this is the best Thai food for both taste and value. Thom ka kai and wonton soup are both very impressive-freshly made from scratch. The special box combo meals are a steal. The famous Basil chicken is tasty and spicy.

28.description: Always fresh ingredients and outstanding flavor to all of their dishes.  I can honestly say I've never had a bad meal here (+50 over the years).   Ask for duck next time in your favorite rice or noodle dish.  The BYOB also keeps the dinner bills down!Enjoy!

45.description: Love their chicken noodle soup, fried rice, and chicken satay.

33.description: Probably one of the best Thai restaurants I've ever had (I've dined at many Thai establishments). Always fresh and delicious Thai cuisine. MSG is never added to their food. Service is always on point. The decor makes for a nice get together or date. There is street parking and parking in the back. Do try their Chicken or Seafood Basil, Tom Yum Soup, papaya salad and egg rolls. Elephant Thai is BYOB, so grab a bottle from Happy Foods around the corner. Buen provecho!

43.description: The food is very tasty, great portions and great prices.  Love their Basil chicken, Pad Thai & Praram Chicken. The service is great both eating in or ordering out.

2.description: Wow! Trying to give them chance after chance.  The food is pretty good,but they must have more than enough business to put me on hold for 6 min,hang up on me,then not answer when I call back.  I tried calling back several times only to have them place the phone off the hook.  If your too busy to take orders, then you probably make enough money to hire someone else for a few hours.  I mostley dine in,and everything is fine.  But when i try to order take out...service sucks, to say the least.  Not going to give them any more of my money.

18.description: This is a small cute place with an excellent menu. The Panang Curry here was delicious, but a slightly different recipe/flavor profile than any other Panang I've had. The brown rice here was fantastic, and the shrimp dish my mother got smelled delish. I would come back here in a heartbeat.  My only complaint here was that the service was extremely slow and not particularly helpful. My mother had questions about the menu and our server wasn't very certain on the answers.

41.description: Very good & consistent Thai food. It's a nice neighborhood place. They struggle to keep up when they're busy but the food is always fresh, good flavors & good portions.

52.description: On a positive note, their panang and mussaman curry dishes are very good. not great...but better than their noodle dishes.  their pad sie eu and pad thai (in my opnion) are very bland.  i'll still drive to Thai Pastry on Argyle and Broadway, for the BEST thai food in town.  i guess, if you worked in the area, and absolutely HAD to have thai food, it'd be okay. but please don't go out of your way to come here. there are much better places. They are closed Sundays...which is weird.  but more power to them, as it doesn't seem to be hurting their business.

50.description: Amazing pad Thai and basil chicken dish. Also byob. Very quiet and relaxing atmosphere.

4.description: Fresh ingredients!!  Thai Basil Eggplant w/ brown rice to die for!!!!  Could eat here every day!Have never had a bad dish.

6.description: We have been customers since Thai Elephant opened. It's our go-to take-out Thai. Our 11/04 order just wasn't the usual quality. Don't know if the owners sold or the cook was having a bad day but everything was heavily salted, ruining all the dishes. We usually take the first bite and say "mmmm." This time we said "salty." Garlic Chicken we asked for "spicy" wasn't plus there was no fresh garlic in it, just garlic salt or powder, Panang Curry was salty, watery and tasted only of citrus; Basil Chicken was salty; Pad Keow Wan was incredibly salty. Pad Prik Sod over Rice was the only dish that didn't totally disappoint. Really disheartening as there are no other Thai places nearby. Husband mentioned there was cigarette odor wafting around the cashier area. Yuck.

22.description: Ordered take out chicken pad Thai. With the positive reviews I really expected better. It was really bland in flavor, the chicken was dry, and noodles were overcooked. The noodles were short and broken not how usual pad Thai noodles are which was another indication they were overcooked. Probably won't be returned but they were really friendly and quick.

15.description: Ordered delivery the other day with my boyfriend and got our food in the time they had promised. I got the special box A - basil chicken, pad thai, and potstickers. It was soooo good! The basil chicken has some spiciness to it that made it addicting and the pad thai was very good!My boyfriend got a red curry and he ate that all up as well :)I'll be ordering from here again!

57.description: The Elephant Thai was a great find.  I literally stumbled in during lunch time and it did not disappoint.  The food was flavorful and very good and the lunch special is a great deal!  Oh and you get a yummy piece of candy as you leave.  What more can you ask for?

20.description: Omg i love this place great lunch specials with soup to and s great price love the atmosphere  here friendly staff  too

36.description: Fast service, inexpensive dishes, beautiful presentations.I haven't eaten Thai food but once before so was a bit apprehensive to try something new. I was delighted with my choice of the special box that contained the Pad Thai. It was very good with the peanut sauce and lime juice mixed in. The spring roll with apricot sauce was a nice interpretation and delicious. I loved the egg roll and dumplings. I was surprised the dumplings were fried but I liked the crunch they provided.

14.description: There are not many options for Thai in this area so I have been here a few times. It is a nice, clean restaurant with friendly service and the food is very fresh and healthy looking but... it is just kinda bland. The pad thai is always kinda dry and flavorless. The Tom Kha soup is not very flavorful either. I will go there again though.

3.description: Under new ownership and recently remodeled.  Friendly barbers, lively banter..

1.description: Frank is a true professional! Sophisticated, charming, and talented!! However, Frank the barber relocated (again) to BRUNO Barber Shop @ 7510 N. HARLEM AVE. Call (847)-612-2294 to make an appointment or walk-in during business hours. There is plenty of parking in the back too!

2.description: Looking for Maria Kalamitis? She and Marty are moving to Franco's barbershop on 4716 W. Touhy Ave.  in Lincolnwood !  Contact Maria 8479219919

0.description: Frank's moved again. He's got a chair over at Bruno's at 7510 N. Harlem. He says to park in the back.

28.description: We LOVE Rock Hair Scissors! Great addition to the neighborhood, free parking (in back), they take appointments (no long waits or crowds), offer free bang trims and the atmosphere is fun yet relaxing. I like that they actually wash the kids' hair and not just wet it. They have a loyalty club too...free haircut after 10. Kelly is THE BEST! She really engages kids so they feel special and have fun getting a haircut. She listens to what parents want, always gives great hair advice and perfect cuts. Our oldest has very thick, colicky, longer hair and she cuts it so we don't have to struggle with it every day. Our youngest has super straight, flat, thinner hair and she gives him adorable short cuts with scissors (despite him moving every other second). Both of their cuts grow out really well so we don't have to rush back every month. Lastly, one of our boys has Asperger's with pretty severe sensory issues. Kelly's experience with developmentally different kids has been a blessing. Haircuts used to be terrible for him and she has built his trust, works quickly so he's not sitting too long and lets him take a break when he needs to. He actually loves to go there!

1.description: Used to suffer through trips to Kidsnips. Tried this place and never looked back. We love Kim and have also had great cuts from Kelly,

9.description: I always pass by this place via my metra commute but never noticed it until my husband pointed it out.  We brought our three boys here on Saturday to clean up their looks and see their eyes and ears again.FYI ... We have not found a good hair stylist ever since Tosha left Pigtails and Crewcuts ("P&C") so we have been sticking to P&C due to convenience and that I need to use up my haircut pkg.  I wish I never bought the haircut pkg because I think I have found a new hairstylist for the boys, Kelly! The salon reminded me a lot of KidSnips with all the knick knacks and toys and products you can purchase.   There are individual screens at the stations so kids can pick whatever dvd is available instead of watching the same thing as everyone else.  They have a little "lego" table that a couple kids can play at while waiting and fortunately it is located by the window so kids can occupy themselves watching the trains and cars go by.  They do offer some juice and goldfish snacks as well for the kids.So we met Kelly and she was patient, professional, kind and wonderful with all of the kids.   After all her years of experience as a stylist and being a manager, I can see a future between our boys hair and her.   She understood what kind of styles I wanted for each of my three boys and gave me tips on how to deal their crazy colics (one has thick, stick - straight hair that just wants to sprout out like a fountain,  one with two colics but fine straight hair and one with one colic and baby fine hair).  She would err on cutting the hair longer rather than shorter just to make sure that you could see what was going on to confirm that the way she was cutting the hair was exactly the way you wanted it to be.  This is a big plus, she actually listened and did what I wanted and gave me the results I wanted.  Well, we could have done a tad better with the fading with one haircut but that was our first time and it wasn't anything disastrous like other haircuts we have had.  Another great thing about the salon besides the free parking behind the salon is that they washed my boys hair after using the clippers and before the scissor styling began.  I thought that was going to be extra but it was included in the $18 charge!  Oh and Kelly noticed that one of my boys had eczema so she made sure to ask me if it was ok to use their shampoo on him ... love this attn to detail!  Lastly, I love that that they have early hours.   We got the first appts for the day and we didn't have to deal with the craziness that happens when the customers file in.  Overall I was very pleased with the service and am looking forward to having Kelly as our stylist again.  Don't forget to sign up for coupons and make use of the Belly card. Hooray for Rocks and Kelly!

29.description: so glad to have a kid's hair cut place right in our neighborhood. It's a world of difference when you go to a place that specializes in kids. Snacks, tvs, race cars to sit in, it doesn't get better than that. Plus they let my little dude play with some of the toys that were for sale. He loves going there and that helps make what could be a dreadful experience, so much better.  Oh yeah, there's free parking in the back. Double score!

23.description: Kelly is awesome!  We brought our son here for his first haircut and he is now 4 yrs old and it's still the only place we will take him.  Kelly is great at getting the right cut for his hair type and is so patient and friendly.  Love going here - can't wait for our 10 month old to get his first cut here!

5.description: This was our first time going here for our sons first haircut and it was better than expected. The lady who cut my sons hair was patient and communicated everything she was doing. They played little Einsteins for him, offered juice and goldfish even though he didn't want it. Haircut looks amazing! We will go again because they have a friendly staff.

31.description: We took our 2 year old daughter here for her first official haircut. She is normally a very active child, but the service here is amazing and she was actually pretty relaxed about the experience. They let her pick out which chair she could sit in (she chose the airplane), put in a dvd of Tom and Jerry to keep her entertained, and went to work. The offering of a balloon, juice, and goldfish crackers helped keep her calm and happy/ Definitely worth it for the price for our wiggle worm. We were afraid she wouldn't cooperate, but these ladies are pros and the results are amazing! Will definitely be back!

25.description: Our favorite stylist, Marina, is no longer working here. They have just one other person. I feel like she's hit or miss - sometimes the cut is good, other times not. The complementary bang trims are a nice bonus, so I probably will keep going back.

12.description: I absolutely love this place!  So far we had 2 great visits and no complaints!  Our 3 yr old grandson Nathan's hair cute looks so awesome.  They made Nate's visit feel welcomed and comfortable.  They ease his fears with a movie, snacks and even blow bubbles.  Thanks to all at Rock Hair Scissors, we are looking forward to our next visit!

21.description: This is by far the best hair salon for children! I have a very energetic two year old and every time we come in, they do everything possible to make him comfortable and corporate. The first time we came in was for his first haircut, and they offer a first haircut package that comes with locks of hair, a certificate, a little souvenir to keep the little hairs in and a picture. It's not your average $10 haircut, but a little extra money here goes a long way since they are so amazing with children! Not to mention how cute this place is. I'm so glad we found this gem!

16.description: Best place for kids' haircuts. Staff is excellent, keeps kids happy--my child looks forward to haircuts!

17.description: I just have to highly recommend this place for children haircuts. They are absolutely the best. From top to bottom this place is a blast for kids. The put your child in one of there themed seats and give them balloons, monkeys, video , gold fish, and anything to play with in the store. The employees there are so helpful and great with kids. Kelly is out favorite . They don't try to push any of their products or toys and everything in the there is all natural or organic. We always buy something when we come in just to support this great small business . Coming here's truly a top-of-the-line experience.

10.description: I took a chance bringing my cranky 2 year old in- and I'm glad I did!The girls kept him entertained with snacks, movie, and great personalities.Kim cut his hair and did a great job- frequently checking with me for input (cause mom knows how she wants baby's hair!)Will be back!

11.description: Kelly is so so so sweet and awesome!!!! I absolutely love this place...my son just got his hair cut from here...he looks awesome and although there were tears...they handled is so wonderfully! They set up a dvd player so he could watch his fav show, gave him goldfish crackers and juice. When he started crying, one of the other stylists started distracting him with bubbles and balloons and toys...and then lollipops, cos everything would pacify him for a bit then he'd start crying again. The lollipop transformed him haha. Anyway - these people know how to deal with children. I didn't have to grab my son's head and hold it in one place (did it everywhere else i got his hair cut) which used to make him cry like crazy. The decor is so happy and kid-friendly. The chairs for the toddlers are little cars and trucks...my son loved the airplane one. They have parking in the back (turn on Lehigh Ave)...but street parking in front is also available.Best place to get kids haircuts...definitely make a visit if your kid hates cuts...he/she will love it after this experience!

26.description: Great experience taking my 20-month old nephew here today.  He was comfortable the whole time, loved sitting in the plane and watching Elmo.  The staff was great dealing with him and were fun to chat with for the adults.  Free parking in the lot behind the storefront.

27.description: I've taken my 22 month old son here twice and we love it. Kelly and her team are patient and skilled. My son's hair looks great and they do a really nice job making both parents and kids feel comfortable and welcome. Our search is over. This place is for us!

0.description: I took my 7month old today for visits hair cut & kelly was awesome!!! It was easy and quick. My son was calm the entire time because of her.A little pricy but def worth it! Will def come back.

20.description: My favorite spot to take my son for haircut. They make him feel welcomed and comfortable.  They always ease his fears with a movie and a snack.  We love Kelly :)

19.description: Great place. Kids love the airplane, car, and train seats. They get to watch a variety of kids dvd's, and have juice and goldfish while getting their hair cut.  Great stylists too. All for a reasonable price.

33.description: We found this place in the neighborhood to get our kids hair cut.  It's great!The last time I took my 3 year old to another kiddie hair cut place he freaked out.  I don't blame the other place, kids are like that at times.  What I like about Rock Hair is the service.  They let us get there a bit early to let my son try to get comfortable first.  Then they tried to wash his hair in the special wash chairs, like in adult shops where you sit backwards, but that wouldn't fly this time.  So instead they just wet his head down.During the haircut they let him eat some goldfish and gave him some juice to make him feel at ease.  Additionally they have little portable DVD players with a bunch of kid friendly videos to watch.  My son is currently into Thomas the Train, and they had one of his videos.  The chairs they have are really cool as well.  There's a old style roadster, a red prop plane, a train, and my favorite the Mach 5 from Speed Racer!  (They wouldn't let me sit in it thou...)They also have a few regular chairs with booster pads for the slightly older kids.  In fact they suggested I sit in one of those chairs alongside my son to help calm him down.  They even put a smock on me to show my son it wasn't a big deal.  Again, really good service.There's parking in the back of the store in a shared lot (off of Lehigh I believe) which is really convenient.  The decor of tThe price is very reasonable for a kids haircut.We are definitely going to be back again.

2.description: I brought my 10-month-old son here for his first hair cut and was very pleased with the service and the cut. Kelly was great at making him feel comfortable, and she asked questions about how I wanted his hair to look. He kind of freaked out when the clippers came out, but the whole staff got involved with keeping him entertained with balloons, bubbles, and peek-a-boo. They were awesome. We did the 1st haircut package, which included his after-picture on cute certificate, a lock of hair, and brush/comb set (eh, it's $10 more, but you only get a first haircut once.) We'll definitely head back here for future haircuts.

32.description: We just took our 15 month old here for a haircut and it was wonderful!  They were so nice and he had a good time.  They gave him goldfish and put on a DVD too- it was stress free!  We are going to make this our regular spot.  And I have to say that his cut is great- he has a lot of hair and it's all over the place, but she managed to tame it!

18.description: I took ALL of my children there and THEY LOVE, LOVE, LOVED IT!!!!!!Snacks, movies, so much to look at...We will definitely be back.

13.description: Ashley was able to accommodate us with a same-day appointment for our toddler's first haircut. He was scared to sit down initially, but Ashley swiftly moved in and entertained him the entire time while Kelly gave him a terrific haircut. It was a great experience for the entire family and we're looking forward to the next visit.

4.description: Love this place! I am high-maintenance about my 2 boys hair and Kim does a wonderful job every time!!!! The surroundings are adorable and friendly. The staff are welcoming. Best of all, my kids don't cry!!!

24.description: I just have to highly recommend this place for children haircuts. They are absolutely the best. From top to bottom this place is a blast for kids.
