The put your child in one of there themed seats and give them balloons, monkeys, video , gold fish, and anything to play with in the store. The employees there are so helpful and great with kids. Kelly is out favorite . They don't try to push any of their products or toys and everything in the there is all natural or organic. We always buy something when we come in just to support this great small business . Coming here's truly a top-of-the-line experience.

6.description: It was my my first time here to get my sons haircut. The staff are friendly and welcoming. I have to say Maria did an excellent job on my sons hair! We'll be returning again! Thank you!

22.description: Kelly is so so so sweet and awesome!!!! I absolutely love this place...my son just got his hair cut from here...he looks awesome and although there were tears...they handled is so wonderfully! They set up a dvd player so he could watch his fav show, gave him goldfish crackers and juice. When he started crying, one of the other stylists started distracting him with bubbles and balloons and toys...and then lollipops, cos everything would pacify him for a bit then he'd start crying again. The lollipop transformed him haha. Anyway - these people know how to deal with children. I didn't have to grab my son's head and hold it in one place (did it everywhere else i got his hair cut) which used to make him cry like crazy. The decor is so happy and kid-friendly. The chairs for the toddlers are little cars and trucks...my son loved the airplane one. They have parking in the back (turn on Lehigh Ave)...but street parking in front is also available.Best place to get kids haircuts...definitely make a visit if your kid hates cuts...he/she will love it after this experience!

15.description: We have been been here several times over the last two years for haircuts for my now 3 year old boy and 5 year old girl. They both love this place and get great cuts. The videos, snacks and special vehicle shaped chairs make it a special treat. The stylists are always friendly and quick too.  Oh, and the parking lot in the back is great too. Completely worth my drive from Evanston to Edgebrook.

7.description: Ms. Kelly is great with her skills and way she works with the kids to get best haircut.  We have been taking my almost 6 y.o here for the last 4 years and she always looks forward to it! Parking is easy (and free if there is space in the back).Recommend for kids that have a playful spirit (will they sit in the firetruck, car, airplane?). Turns getting a haircut into a pleasant experience for everyone.  The snacks (goldfish and juice) are a nice extra.They always have good products to browse while your little one getting their haircut, including some that are organic and some that are an absolute must if your kid is in public school (eg Fairy Tales Rosemary Reper Conditioning Spray) which keeps lice away!Would have given 5 stars if their online booking system a bit more automated. Currently you request date/time and they have to call you back before it's confirmed. I get the human touch important so it's a minor issue.

8.description: This is the best place ever! My 15 month old loved it. He got his first haircut there.  They entertained him with bubbles, a balloon, a movie, goldfish crackers and apple juice.  I will never take him anywhere else to cut his hair! The ladies that work there are lovely. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE IT!

30.description: I brought my son here on a whim today and am very glad I did.  I've cut my family's hair for years and know how hard it is to get the little ones to sit still for it, and still come out with a great cut.  Her skills were very good, she was able to understand my gibberish descriptions of what I wanted, and understood that a standard cut wouldn't work for me.  Videos, goldfish, juice or water, and a real knowledge of how to entertain kids (and parents) made a pleasant experience for all involved.  I wish there were 6 stars to give.

3.description: They are always good to my two year old when we take him there. He has curly hair which can be hard to manage. Yet they are amazing.

14.description: Had our son's first haircut and all subsequent haircuts here. They are great!Kim was super pleasant and FAST. Our little man was entertained and engaged. No tears, just a studly little dude at the end of the appt. Very, very happy!

58.description: Thank you Yelp for steering us to this little gem!!! Food was fantastic. I had the corned beef hash breakfast..the best I've ever had. Honey had the roasted veggie omelet with chicken chorizo. Outstanding!! Friendly service and awesome food equals my new favorite breakfast diner! :)

56.description: Good and interesting choices... Cilantro and pull pork on pancakes? who'd uh thunk that one? Loving it!! Delish!

29.description: Classic diner with no frills but consistently good food and coffee.  Maximum seating is 20.  For the cost of a specialty drink at the chain coffee place down the street, you can have a full meal.  Kid friendly and charming throwback to gone by era.  Highly recommend the buddy cakes, although my husband favors the hash.

42.description: Go. Just go. Okay fine. Read the reviews if you want. Assure yourself. Food here is deliciously customized, updated diner fare, best enjoyed with their freshly ground, hot coffee and strictly utilitarian cold orange juice. Steak and eggs, bacon and eggs, potatoes with peppers, made-to-order oatmeal. All very good stuff.Our first visit was on S.'s birthday, last 10.13 Monday. I brought in a bottle of  cold French sparkling and hesitatingly asked the guy behind the counter, who turned out to be Chris the owner, if it would be okay if, I mean of course if we didn't tell him that we were going to have a little in our orange juice as first celebrational gesture. He laughed- Chris does a lot of laughing- and assured us they were BYOB! so we poured him some as well, which he promptly turned to a mimosa and toasted S. Chris later overheard me kidding with S. about how she should have chocolate chip Mickey Mouse pancakes and surprised her with a side as a fun treat with her just-right scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast.  My steak and eggs, potato nuggets and toast were pretty damned good too, steak precisely medium rare as requested. Chris also hand crafts to order generously sized, creamy shakes and malteds using an old style Jadeite green Hamilton Beach shake maker and real vanilla ice cream (with brown bean flecks!) scooped from a two gallon tub, When was the last time you experienced one of those? We hereby attest to their superdeliciousness. AND he packs and then smokes his own scrumptious sausages in a little smoker outside!What a good guy Chris is and what marvelous food he proffers in his tiny BYOB breakfast diner in Edgebrook. Ever smiling, wearing chef's pants printed with artichokes, he ringmastered the perfect beginning to a perfectly brilliant birthday, Thanks again, Chris. We look forward to seeing you often.~Peter O. and S., permanently, increasingly lovely S.

23.description: My biggest complaint is that the staff is too outgoing and friendly to me before I've had my morning coffee. Seriously. That's it - that is the only negative thing I can say, and it is because I am a crab-ass before noon. This tiny counter diner is completely unassuming, and without the recommendation of an Edgebrook resident, I never would have ventured in here. Now I can scarecly recommend anything else for breakfast North of Lawrence Ave. The corned beef hash here is tender and homemade - a real stellar standout in the land of breakfast dishes. Tip: Always check the specials board (or Facebook) for something fun and interesting.

47.description: I lived in Edgebrook for over 20 years and had never been here until I was back visiting one time and saw it mentioned on the neighborhood Facebook page.  I was intrigued -- I'd never really noticed it years before -- and figured it was worth a try.It was good -- Great omelet and English muffin, but the hash browns different from the usual shredded variety that I prefer, so were just okay to me.The place has a very charming 50s diner vibe.  The only warning -- There's not really room for a group larger than maybe four, unless you turn the tables sideways and take over the place, which would be hard to do on a busy weekend morning like when we were there.

8.description: A solid diner that is usually packed with regulars.  It has the look of an old school, diner-relic, leftover from Edgebrook's hay-days but contains a flavor comparable to many Chicago brunch havens.  It's a gem amongst the "diner club," that is for sure.You aren't going to find the lightest pancakes or the newest fad in breakfast.  And if you dine-in, they may or may not offer Wi-Fi.  But, that's a perk suited for the cafe that wants you to sit and sit, ordering mocha-whatevers all afternoon.  This is a f#cking diner.  Sit, sip coffee, chit chat a bit with Chris, eat your food and scoot your butt for the next patron.  You're gonna find a couple chefs dishing up some great breakfast here.I've been visiting now for over a year.  I usually get my grub to go, since my trek isn't long.  My two favorite options would be the breakfast sandwich and the hash skillets.  Get the breakfast sandwich with pulled pork.  Their PP is seasoned, then topped with two eggs your way, choice of cheese and some diced house browns. (Diced potatoes with herbs)  I like the eggs over-easy, so it's grilled but runny all over the place and I can get some yolk intertwined with my potatoes as well.  Of the hashes, I will share with you that my Ma prefers the corned beef hash.  The difference here is that they give you nice chunks of corned beef.  It's not just diced up and plentiful like the norm at diners of this sort.  Since the meat portions are bigger, you get some meatier chunks & a piece or two with some nice fat on it.  This is also tossed with house browns, onions, pepper and two eggs your way.  I don't think I need to repeat myself on how to get the most bang out of flavor in ordering those eggs, do I?Last but not least, the diner is complete with an old school looking malt / milkshake system.  If you think it's deserved, why not try a milkshake.  I like chocolate and I never seem to make it out of there without killing it first.

31.description: Really delicious food and a friendly atmosphere. The chilaquiles and eggs is fantastic. No one makes better potatoes. The sausage is homemade too. French toast is amazing and the young wait staff is attentive. Nice atmosphere, neighborhood feel and they play awesome music to boot! You should go.

34.description: Best breakfast in the neighborhood hands down.  Awesome lunch items as well. Great service with a smile that makes you feel at home.  If the scrapple happens to be on the menu when you're there you must try it (ridiculously good).  Everything fresh & tasty.  You will not be disappointed. New specials all the time so you can try something different.

16.description: Get the corn beef hash...it's sooo good!!! This place re-affirmed my belief that I cannot be a vegetarian. The chef makes his own meats, it is family-owned, and has great coffee.

13.description: TIL: corned beef hash doesn't have to be an aesthetically unappetizing potpourri of goodness.Here, you can taste the glistening  fat on the beef, without having too much hash adulterating that single bite. I enjoyed choosing the amount of corned beef and hash (and yolky sunny side up egg) with every bite.Come here if you like what you read, want to support a family business, and enjoy having your coffee (and soul) filled.

11.description: Great little local cafe. The scrambled eggs and hash browns were cooked to perfection.  Not a ton of parking but street was free.

39.description: Don't come here (because we don't want to fight you for a table).Just what we like in a breakfast place--good coffee, creative but still standard fare and fun atmosphere. Yum!

37.description: I went on Yelp to look for a small neighborhood cafe in which I could enjoy a fresh breakfast with a friend. I was a little worried when I stepped inside because this place is tiny, but I was not disappointed.The staff was friendly and attentive and offered me coffee the moment I stepped in. I decided to try a daily special: the fig, bacon, and goat cheese omelet. It was so incredibly good! My friend's corned beef hash exceeded our expectations. If you want fresh breakfast food, skip the greasy diners and IHOPS of the world and come support a small business. I'm pretty sure that anything on the menu is a good choice.

0.description: It took a Yelp search for me to notice a little restaurant I've driven past and ignored for at least ten years. Thanks you,Yelpers, for introducing me to an authentic neighborhood diner with great food and service. There were at least a dozen things on the menu I wanted to try, but I settled on the French toast with powdered sugar and a side of bacon. The toast was thick and cooked perfectly, with just enough powdered sugar to not overpower it. The bacon was thick cut, not greasy, and a little crispy (the way I like it). I read in another review that the owner smokes it himself, which is probably why it was the best bacon I've ever tasted,My friend ordered a bacon omelet with goat cheese and dates, and it was a real winner. I'm definitely ordering that next time I visit.  We came on a Thursday about 12:45, close to closing time. We were the last patrons, and the service was exceptional. The friendly waitress ("server" seems like overkill in a diner) filled my coffee cup four or five times. About the coffee... I loved it because it wasn't overly strong... reminded me of the coffee the diners near my college campus used to serve. But if you like a really strong brew, when you're done you can always stop at the Starbucks a few steps away.This is a small place with a few tables and a counter, probably accomodates about 15-20 people, so I imagine it's packed on weekends. It's not a good spot for a group larger than two. And everything is cooked to order, so you'll have to wait a little longer for your food. But it's definitely worth it. There's an attached parking area for about three cars, and plenty of paid street parking on Central and Devon. Note that it's closed on Tuesdays.

38.description: TIL: corned beef hash doesn't have to be an aesthetically unappetizing potpourri of goodness.Here, you can taste the glistening  fat on the beef, without having too much hash adulterating that single bite. I enjoyed choosing the amount of corned beef and hash (and yolky sunny side up egg) with every bite.Come here if you like what you read, want to support a family business, and enjoy having your coffee (and soul) filled.

51.description: this is my new-found diner place. come here on any day and try their hashbrown breakfast.  decor is completely diner style mostly counter service. anything you order on the menu is delicious. the breakfast sandwich is another wonderful choice.  i have not had lunch here yet but will make sure i make a point stopping for a lunch meal.

27.description: Fresh, Fabulous Breakfast or Lunch...It's confession time.  You see, I have an addiction - to Chris Burrell's cooking at our Edgebrook Coffee Shop / Diner (6322 N. Central Ave, Chicago 60646, phone 773-657-3974).  How did this happen?  I believe it is because Chris 's place excels at the basic three T's:  Time, Talent, Treasure.  Chris gives you his time and makes you enjoy yours, he has a lot of talent and his prices take little of your treasure to treat yourself to a taste of his.With his small crew, Chris serves up delicious, well-seasoned food promptly and always takes the time to give a genuine greeting.  Do you sometimes wonder what's wrong with our crazy world?  Step into this diner and instead you will see and feel a lot of what's right.  People are happy in here - employees and patrons alike.  And that is true even at 6:30 AM daily when they open for breakfast and already have the hot coffee ready for you.  The simple-looking "diner" menu is deceptive. Chris is not one to boast, so I will do a little of that for him.  Did you know he makes all of his own meats?  That includes things like heavenly corned beef, unique sausage, pulled pork and an incredible chicken chorizo, to name just a few.  You can get any dish customized to your palate here to achieve just the right level of spicy or not.  Because you, the customer, matter here.   Even a little thing like the ketchup is homemade here.   And prices are very reasonable.Chris is a creative soul, so always check out the tasty chalkboard specials as he posts them.  You won't learn about them unless you step inside, so just stop in.  I will share a bit of the culinary fun Chris has planned in honor of our current election period.  I overheard him describing two upcoming new dishes: "Chuy Beef Hash" and "Rahm Schnitzel with Eggs", both of which debut this weekend!  Thanks, Chris, for taking over our Edgebrook Coffee Shop and making this one of its best-ever incarnations. We are lucky to have you in the neighborhood.

32.description: A solid diner that is usually packed with regulars.  It has the look of an old school, diner-relic, leftover from Edgebrook's hay-days but contains a flavor comparable to many Chicago brunch havens.  It's a gem amongst the "diner club," that is for sure.You aren't going to find the lightest pancakes or the newest fad in breakfast.  And if you dine-in, they may or may not offer Wi-Fi.  But, that's a perk suited for the cafe that wants you to sit and sit, ordering mocha-whatevers all afternoon.  This is a f#cking diner.  Sit, sip coffee, chit chat a bit with Chris, eat your food and scoot your butt for the next patron.  You're gonna find a couple chefs dishing up some great breakfast here.I've been visiting now for over a year.  I usually get my grub to go, since my trek isn't long.  My two favorite options would be the breakfast sandwich and the hash skillets.  Get the breakfast sandwich with pulled pork.  Their PP is seasoned, then topped with two eggs your way, choice of cheese and some diced house browns. (Diced potatoes with herbs)  I like the eggs over-easy, so it's grilled but runny all over the place and I can get some yolk intertwined with my potatoes as well.  Of the hashes, I will share with you that my Ma prefers the corned beef hash.  The difference here is that they give you nice chunks of corned beef.  It's not just diced up and plentiful like the norm at diners of this sort.  Since the meat portions are bigger, you get some meatier chunks & a piece or two with some nice fat on it.  This is also tossed with house browns, onions, pepper and two eggs your way.  I don't think I need to repeat myself on how to get the most bang out of flavor in ordering those eggs, do I?Last but not least, the diner is complete with an old school looking malt / milkshake system.  If you think it's deserved, why not try a milkshake.  I like chocolate and I never seem to make it out of there without killing it first.

54.description: Love this place! Very small and charming. Perfect breakfast spot to catch up with a friend or to dine alone. While it's a diner style, the food was way beyond diner quality. Their omelets are awesome, pancakes fantastic and hashbrowns are a little party of potatoes and grilled onions and peppers. I will be back. Love intimate spots with great food and lots of character.

48.description: 4 stars for the current owner reviving this Edgebrook favorite.  One more star for putting an modern spin to the menu.

44.description: Wow what a hidden gem! Small little diner with big flavor. The pulled pork hash was delicious, perfect portion, poached eggs cooked perfectly, and the fresh herbs were excellent. To be honest I wasn't sold when we drove by and it's very small inside, but the laid back atmosphere and great food make it a new go to place. Parking can be annoying if your like me and don't like to pay, but readily available if you don't mind.

24.description: I appreciate the quick and honest response. Now that I understand the circumstances,  you (and your son) did the best you could with a difficult situation. We will continue to support Edgebrook Coffee Shop, no comped food needed.

7.description: David N (below) is an incredibly stupid jerk. If he wanted a "latte,"" why on earth would he pass up the chance to get one at the World's Best Starbucks literally 100 feet from the front door to Edgebrook Coffee Shop? If you're at that SB on say a Saturday or Sunday evening, look for the 20-something redhead barista, Mary. She's the best barista in the world in the best Starbucks in the world. But enough about that, let's talk Edgebrook Coffee Shop."There is no ambience" is like saying there is no vacuum in outer space. The place OOZES ambience, but that's not why I think it's one of, if not the best weekend breakfast joints in the entire state. The menu is standard at first glance, but when the food arrives it kind of punches you in the face with the fact that every single item on that "standard" menu is crafted to be the very best that it can. Personally, I like the smoked sausage hash; it's a mixture of some very high-end sausage, FRESH vegetable ingredients, perfectly cooked potatoes, and two eggs cooked to order (I go for over-easy, I like some egg yolk on my food). I've ordered this dish dozens of times, and the consistency with which it is delivered and the quality of the food is what keeps me coming back.They also have a "special" menu written on a chalkboard, and I've occasionally ordered from it. Let me just say that I've not only never been disappointed with a selection, I've overwhelmingly been impressed with each and every meal. I have not once left the place feeling like I should have gone elsewhere; conversely, I have left the place every single time thanking GOD that I chose the Edgebrook Coffee Shop as the place to eat that morning.The owner is around my age and shares my musical tastes. he has great music playing, there are two flat screen TVs with alternating Jeff Beck concerts and such and the news of the day. Very agreeable. His kids are obviously working the counter, and while as teens they'd almost certainly rather do something else at the moment, you never get the feeling that you're being short-shrifted. They're more than adequate, they kick butt and take numbers. He has a cook or two working the grills and he either watches them plate the finished meals or he plates them himself. There is NO GREASE IN THE AIR. It's immaculately clean and a very fresh feeling environment.It's really the very best place to eat breakfast on a Saturday or Sunday morning. I'm sure if you live in Logan Square or a fake neighborhood like Bucktown you have your fave spots, but for me, being about a mile away, I wouldn't go anywhere else other than the Edgebrook Coffee Shop.

49.description: This is the best "diner" I have been to in Chicago.  It was recommended by a co-worker, and I have since been here twice.  On the first visit, I had the corned beef hash and I have never had corned beef as good in anything.  On the second visit, I had some sort of a chili breakfast dish, and it was almost as good as the hash.  The "hash" browns they serve are not your typical fare.  This is a great place and I look forward to trying even more.

40.description: You will be welcomed just as soon as you walk in by the owner who does everything. A great small neighborhood dinner, closed on Tuesdays.  Very fresh good breakfast/ lunch.

53.description: This place has THE best corned beef hash!!!   The staff is super friendly, the spot is very cozy, and the food is amazing. I know that word amazing is thrown out a lot, but my wife and I frequent a lot of places, and Edgebrook beats 95 percent of them on flavor alone.  This place is definitely worth stopping in for a bite. You will not be disappointed.

30.description: Great breakfast menu but make sure to check out his specials in the blackboards,  they are always unique and delicious!!!  Love the music...kinda vintage rock.  A true gem in the northwest neighborhood of Edgebrook!

46.description: When my wife and I moved into the neighborhood a couple a months ago from out of state, this was exactly the kind of place we were hoping to have in the neighborhood we moved into. Excellent variety of breakfast options on the menu, plus there are always a number of specials to pick from. My wife is a vegetarian, and one of the problems she always runs into is having to order the same things over and over again. She enjoys the Edgebrook coffee shop because she can always pick different things to order. Like other reviewers  said, the place is pretty small and can get pretty full, especially on weekend mornings.

1.description: Reply to owner: If old and dirty is "cozy and vintage", sure. Had your server been competent, I would not have been confused about anything on the menu. I know what peaches and strawberries look like; my plate was only topped with apples. Maybe you should check for overall consistency of your restaurant since neither your server nor your cook seem to have it together. I browsed the other reviews. It seems like it was under previous management. It's a little misleading in my opinion for these scores to still count towards your new management.Your reply is rude and condescending and mirrors your staff. Congratulations on making my point and solidifying my review. You question my Yelp profile--ok. Frankly I would have had a better meal and experience at my favorite local IHOP you mention that I rated 5/5. For me, it's not always about the food. I don't know why I have to explain to you why I rated an IHOP location 5/5, but let's just say the staff there gave me what your staff and business couldn't--not to mention when I go to IHOP I know exactly the type of food I'm getting even if it is mediocre--frankly, that IHOP has served me better food than what I was served at your restaurant that day.I hope other Yelpers read your reply to me. Thank you. Good luck.Edit 2/27/2016: Unfortunately I came back to check out this review. Not only do I come back to see that I'm told to "grow up", but now I'm being accused of what exactly? I don't know who "Gil" is. I have about two inactive Yelper friends added. I need a dictionary? Ok. After paying for terrible food and service, you respond with personal insults and accuse me of cyber attacks? Are you kidding me? I don't know if I should just laugh. I have no intentions to "sabotage" your business. Apparently you're good at doing that yourself.This is my last edit. Have a good one.

55.description: I go to church at Edgebrook Community Church and was happy to find this place to go for breakfast/brunch after Sunday services! First time I went I had the biscuits and gravy which was made from scratch wonderful; next time they didn't have that on the menu so I had one of their breakfast scrambles which was really great as well. I liked the option of getting fruit (which was truly FRESH!) instead of potatoes.I'll be back!!

9.description: This is a great hidden little gem near my home.  It looks like a coffee shop, but the food is anything but that.  This breakfast and lunch joint, has a great variety of breakfast and sandwich options.  I had banana pancakes drizzled with caramel, and the pancakes are killer, slightly crispy on the outside, and light and fluffy inside.  They keep your coffee cup full, and each of the staff worked hard to make you feel welcome.  I probably shouldn't let people know about the place, because there isn't much space, but the owners deserve kudos.  I will be back often.

26.description: I was looking through Yelp for a neighborhood place for breakfast and I found Edgebrook Coffee Shop @ 6322 N Central Avenue.  This place is so tiny if you blink you will drive right by it.  The restaurant is a small storefront.  On the inside there are 4 or 5 tables with 2 chairs each and a counter with bar stools.  I ordered the corned beef hash with Yukon Gold Potatoes, Onions and Peppers, Topped with 2 Eggs over easy, & English muffins.  This was easily the best corned beef hash I ever had.  The corned beef was perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection with the potatoes, peppers & onions.  You add 2 eggs over easy and get the nice gooey egg yolk and you have a winner.I will definitely be back again.I'm back.  This time I tried the skirt steak hash w/blue cheese.  It was good, but I absolutely love the corned beef hash

25.description: Great breakfast place.  Try the special hash, always interesting ingredients.  Welcome edition to Edgebrook.

12.description: A really cute and cozy place that offers nice food, I like their eggs. I did not care for the herbs on the eggs though!

59.description: Love this place!  Wife had the goat cheese, spinach, and tomato omelette which was creamy and delectable.  I knocked down the chili, cheddar and eggs which was super tasty.  The owner makes the corned beef, chicken chorizo, pulled pork, sausage and more in house... just the kind of place I love going to routinely. Be certain to make fun of the owner, he is a good sport.

21.description: Classic diner atmosphere. Elevated diner cuisine. Relaxed and homey environment. Fluid service great tasting food delicious omelettes!!

17.description: Food is always amazing can't say enough about the quality of the food and the inventiveness of the specials. That being said this place needs to be bigger ...the waits are long as it is slammed often. I have on more than one occasion seen people walk out after waiting to long to be even initially addressed. The owners son works here and when he is not busy not paying attention he is getting my order wrong (every time). It is difficult to even get his attention. I find when there is a non family member working that the service is much better.

10.description: My biggest complaint is that the staff is too outgoing and friendly to me before I've had my morning coffee. Seriously. That's it - that is the only negative thing I can say, and it is because I am a crab-ass before noon. This tiny counter diner is completely unassuming, and without the recommendation of an Edgebrook resident, I never would have ventured in here. Now I can scarecly recommend anything else for breakfast North of Lawrence Ave. The corned beef hash here is tender and homemade - a real stellar standout in the land of breakfast dishes. Tip: Always check the specials board (or Facebook) for something fun and interesting.

5.description: Never a bad experience at this fine establishment. The service and food has always been on-point every time the wife and I come to dine. Hashes. I absolutely recommend any of the hashes. Specifically the pulled pork hash. Good lord. I definitely recommend this place to everyone who is a breakfast connoisseur. Try this place out, you'd be a fool not too.

3.description: Typically, exploring the Edgebrook neighborhood isn't easy with Rosa J.'s "foodie on foot" journey, yet she made it work!  I remember last time when hubby and I were attempting to head there for breakfast, the parking situation wasn't in favor of our plan A.  This time there wasn't a fall-back alternative.  Ladies and gentlemen, this is just a fair warning.  If you're an ultra grumpy and edgy individual, Edgebrook Coffee Shop isn't going to be a place to sit quietly and to avoid engaging conversations with the owner and strangers next to you.  In other words, the dude who owns ECS is spunky, talkative, and gregarious.  Anyone who is naturally an introvert or a morning-introvert, I would say "get over it...it's ok to laugh hard on a Monday morning!"  I happily settled on the steak and eggs (medium & over-easy), which came with my choice of toast (wheat) and hash browns.  I liked the a little sprinkle of parsley on the hash browns; it added sophistication and enhance the visual presentation on the dish.  My over-easy eggs were cooked to perfection.  The egg yolks were runny until my last bite of delicious skirt steak.  I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of this entree in this tiny, unassuming neighborhood breakfast joint.  Daddy J., on the other hand, enjoyed his two (2) eggs (over-easy as well), home-made sausage patties, a piece of white toast, and hash browns.  He commented that the sausage patties were unique yet flavorful.  The owner rendered very friendly service by continuing topping off our coffee.      Dining at ECS felt like having gourmet breakfast at the comfort of your own living room.  The owner was wearing his lemon PJ pants busting tables; the cook was taking charge of the flat grill right in front of patrons' eyes.  You're all welcome to visit the "statue of liberty logo" brand coffee shop across the road on Central, but wouldn't you want some hot, made-to-order breakfast instead of scones and muffins?  Edgebrook Coffee Shop is located near Central and Caldwell, parallel to the Edgebrook Metra Station.  If you're a pro on riding CTA buses like Rosa J., 85A (N. Central) can take you to the intersection of Lehigh and Caldwell, and 84 (Peterson) has a terminal stop at Central/Caldwell.

35.description: Great breakfast place! The pancakes were good, but the omelet was amazing! While the restaurant itself was cozy, the food was amazing! I definitely will be going back.

19.description: This place is yummy. It's small, so it can get packed on weekend mornings. Don't let that deter you. It's worth it.

28.description: dont let the outside fool you, this place isnt a hole in the wall under any means. almost everything is made fresh and from scratch as far as i can tell, the owner truly seems to care about his business as well as the neighborhood. packed on the weekends but pretty empty on the weekdays (closed tuesday!). menu is exciting and a good balance between exactly what you'd expect (omelets, hash browns, cheese burgers) and subtly unique offerings (check the specials board, probably hidden behind someone's head all the way in the back) theres definitely a touch of class to everything these guys make, including the handmade hashbrowns, corned beef, and breakfast sausage. (fair warning, the breakfast sausage is heavy on the rosemary or something similar, i enjoy it but others may not). the owner even makes his own ketchup. im equally torn between my fear of this place going out of business because no one even notices that its there and my fear of people uncovering this gem, leaving me nowhere to sit and a line out the door. obviously i'd prefer the latter, this guy works hard and makes delicious food and he deserves success. if he transplanted his recipes to some hipster brunch haven he'd be swimming in money by now but i love the fact that hes bringing fresh unique food to a quiet little neighborhood that needs the excitement, even if its only for a couple hours a day.

45.description: Good food. Hash browns and corned beef hash excellent. Service not very good though. It seems every party had some type of issue. Counter was also sticky. It took a long time to get our simple order too, and they were not very busy. Also it was kind of hot in there the air conditioner they had in there was not doing the job, it was only in the Mid 70's but it felt a lot hotter they would have been better off with the door open.

33.description: I was surfing for a local breakfast spot on Yelp and up popped Edgebrook. I had visions of house-made corned beef hash just over a mile away. We rolled in about 1130 and bellied up to the counter. I politely refused a menu as my mind was made up. But alas, it was not to be. The corned beef tank was empty, so I inquired about the ribeye hash, also sold out so I went for the chicken chorizo hash, two eggs over and English muffin. The food was perfectly prepared and the house-made chorizo was light and flavorful with just the right amount of bite. My mates got the buddy cakes (cornmeal pancakes) with fresh fruit relish which were excellent, light and fluffy with just the right amount of cornmeal grit. The fresh fruit relish was diced cantaloupe, apples and blueberries with a sprinkling of cilantro and an omelette with a side of pancakes. The chef-owner was buzzing around the whole time assuring that all the patrons were taken care of. On the positive side running out of items shows a commitment to freshness and quality but I was still a little sad about not getting my CBH. Next time I guess I will come earlier. On the whole this is a great little neighborhood diner that is taking it to the next level with house-made meats and an epicurean approach to the most important meal of the day. Make sure you check out the specials board for the day's unique food options like Swedish Meatball hash.

43.description: This place NEVER disappoints.  In other places, I usually study the menu pretty intensely before I order.  Not here.  Chris has different specials on his chalkboard and I pretty much throw a dart and get whatever it lands on.  ALWAYS delicious!  Not standard diner fare, it's almost not fair to call this place a diner because the food is SPECIAL!  Flavorful and made with a lot of care.  I ordered the breakfast burger and it was sooo good, I only ate half because I wanted to save the other half to enjoy later.  (Then my husband ate it!  Oh well, guess I gotta go back...)  The place is small ("cozy") and sometimes you have to wait for a seat, but it's always worth it!  He's also very generous to the neighborhood folks who come knocking looking for donations for whatever charity events are happening.  Great place!

2.description: Why didn't I order two reuben sandwiches?!Amazing house made corned beef!  Sliced thickly, melt-in-your-mouth tender, and juicy.  We got a reuben sandwich ($11) and corned beef hash with 2 eggs & toast ($9) - both like we've never had before.  We also wanted to try the chili with garlic bread and pancakes with fresh peaches (special of the day), but they ran out of chili and peaches!  So early in the morning?  Well, it was a Saturday, and they are only open 8 AM - 1 PM.  The kitchen was slammed, which was made apparent by waiting nearly 45 minutes for our food.  Be prepared for a wait when this place is at max capacity.Speaking of capacity, it's a very small restaurant - maybe 15-20 seats along the counter and 4 tables that seat two people.  Not good for groups; come here with 1 or 2 other people at most.  We got here at 10 AM on a Saturday and snagged the last table which was awkwardly underneath a guitar hanging from the wall so I had to be careful not to knock my head against it.  By 10:30 AM, people were waiting out the door.ETC...Staff was friendly.  The front of the house is run by what appeared to be a mother, son, and another employee.  Oh, and it's not that well ventilated.  You will walk out with food odor in your hair.  They have a 3-car parking lot, so street parking is almost necessary, which is easier to find on Devon than Central.

18.description: Today I stopped by for a quick, no hassle breakfast and I got it.I have never had bad eggs at this place.  They are never under done or over done and the ham they use is nice and smokey.  The coffee is great - not bitter at all.I will say one thing that is useful:  You have to ASK for a second piece of toast which I am totally cool with.  Sometimes, I am full and don't need a second slice but sometimes I am a little bit more hungry and a second piece of toast is just the ticket.Keep up the great work.PS  The peppers and onions in the hash browns are a nice touch.

41.description: Good food. Decent coffee. Has real butter upon request. Homemade hash, homemade potatoes - comes with onions and peppers but wiOne slice of toast with meal. Fresh cooked. Small diner feel. Sit at counter or a couple small tables that only allow for 2 people at it. Closed on Tuesdays and only open for breakfast and lunch. Closed by 130pm (I think the sign said). We will go back and try it again.

52.description: Simply, I love this place.  The food is delicious. I especially enjoy the variety of hashes.  Sitting at the counter is a great place here, the service is quick and the owner is wonderfully engaging.  If you are in the area you need to give it a try.

50.description: Found this place when searching for a new Chicago-area "breakfast" venue at lthforum.com. The pics of the corned beef hash looked mighty tasty. I met a friend there on Sunday morning and am pleased to report that it was delicious--and inexpensive. I have to side with the 5-star love-this-place reviewd and simply can't fathom the low-star reviews. For what this is, what you get, and what you pay for what you get, this is 5-star stuff all the way. Highly recommended.

4.description: I was looking through Yelp for a neighborhood place for breakfast and I found Edgebrook Coffee Shop @ 6322 N Central Avenue.  This place is so tiny if you blink you will drive right by it.  The restaurant is a small storefront.  On the inside there are 4 or 5 tables with 2 chairs each and a counter with bar stools.  I ordered the corned beef hash with Yukon Gold Potatoes, Onions and Peppers, Topped with 2 Eggs over easy, & English muffins.  This was easily the best corned beef hash I ever had.  The corned beef was perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection with the potatoes, peppers & onions.  You add 2 eggs over easy and get the nice gooey egg yolk and you have a winner.I will definitely be back again.I'm back.  This time I tried the skirt steak hash w/blue cheese.  It was good, but I absolutely love the corned beef hash

6.description: The secret is out- THIS PLACE IS GREAT! Sometime over the last year or so, this 50's diner was taken over by someone who is lovingly known as Chris the Cranky Chef. Well, he definitely CRANKED it up a notch!I love to support the neighborhood places so I gave the previous owner several attempts to fascinate my senses but not until Cranky Chris Cranked up the grill did the fabulous fascination finally flourish!So what's with the crankiness?This cranky guy smokes his own meat, hand makes his own hash, makes his own sausage... are you kidding me?So, recently he offered a special with this special bacon... unbelievable- YUM! I asked Mr. Cranky why this bacon was so awesome... (if you met this guy, you probably guessed it...) He cured his own pork and smoked this bacon.... Okay, what else would expect for a guy named Cranky Chris, right?It's not over... any ole Joe can smoke some meat, right? (I know; me either) So, it turns out that Mr. Cranky over there adds some special seasoning in the making-of-the-bacon process... Special seasoning?What seasoning?(you know- right?)This freakin guy makes his own seasoning... Cranky Chef Chris makes seasoning called Cranky Chef seasoning. The bacon was awesome! If you have not been there lately, go there before it too late!  There is NO WAY this guy is going to stay contained in that diner... Ten minutes after the Food Network tastes a little cranky awesomeness there's going to be a Cranky Chef show! No, wait! ... a Cranky Chef Channel! (added bonus- they sell the spice there, too!)

22.description: This place was not good. No ambiance at all. It was a diner set up with the grease so exposed I felt like I was getting Coates by sitting there. The best part... it bills itself as a coffee shop. I asked for a latte and the guy says "this is a coffee shop pal. We serve coffee only"... And he wore that fact like a badge. He's just too proud and too far gone.  There was also no music and the conversation the guy was having was loud. I felt like I was in his living room. Idk. It was not a good impression.My friend quickly finished what she got and we went across the street to Starbucks.

15.description: This place was not good. No ambiance at all. It was a diner set up with the grease so exposed I felt like I was getting Coates by sitting there. The best part... it bills itself as a coffee shop. I asked for a latte and the guy says "this is a coffee shop pal. We serve coffee only"... And he wore that fact like a badge. He's just too proud and too far gone.  There was also no music and the conversation the guy was having was loud. I felt like I was in his living room. Idk. It was not a good impression.My friend quickly finished what she got and we went across the street to Starbucks.

57.description: Sit at the counter for service!!  If you're at the tables on the wall, don't expect even 'normal' service levels. No water, drink refills, butter, syrup or even menus without asking or standing at the counter for them!  Another couple came in about 10 mins. after us and their order was taken over the counter, so it went in before ours, so these people that came in well after us had their food and were half way through eating before we even got ours. It's very frustrating to sit hungry watching other people that came in after you eating! Also they should really clean the ceiling fans!!    If however you have a bunch of time or don't care much about service, the food is great. The house made meats are really good, the pancakes and Johnny cakes (they call them buddy cakes) are great and the omelets are spot on! The food is the ONLY factor worth stars.

20.description: Great, quirky old-school diner.  There are tables, but the action's at the counter, where the proprietor seems to be doing everything.  It's got a very hip, very neighborhoody vibe, and lots of folks seem to know each other, but they're perfectly welcoming to strangers.   Breakfast was great, cooked visibly to order.  My corned beef hash was delicious and came with two perfectly poached eggs (if you're a poached egg person you know these things matter) and a side of corn pancakes in lieu of toast was special.  My spouse enjoyed his scramble.  We'll be back.

36.description: One regret:  that we didn't visit Edgebrook the day before this visit too!  Absolutely delicious breakfast in a tiny diner full of apparent regulars.  I had the most amazing hash of ham, pineapple, potatoes and fresh eggs.  The rest of my family loved their breakfasts too...this place is a gem.  Have the hash!

14.description: One regret:  that we didn't visit Edgebrook the day before this visit too!  Absolutely delicious breakfast in a tiny diner full of apparent regulars.  I had the most amazing hash of ham, pineapple, potatoes and fresh eggs.  The rest of my family loved their breakfasts too...this place is a gem.  Have the hash!

1.description: This place is an absolute honey hole, If you love model aircraft, model railroading, collecting airline and railroad memorabilia this place is a pilgrimage, This place is jammed to the ceiling with items, I haven't seen this many model aircraft for sale,  walking in this store is a little bit of a labyrinth, but if you walk single file and slowly you'll get use to it pretty quickly. I spent at least an hour or two just browsing over the merchandise, I spent a good amount of money here, best of all the owner of this establishment is extremely friendly, he even let me one item for free of charge or for less than a buck all because it didn't have a price tag, so bottom line if you are ever in the Chicago area and you like things related to railroads and aviation, make sure you check out this place and prepare to be amazed.

0.description: Wow just wow. Unbelievable selection of new and used HO & N scale trains. Plus vintage photos, train history books and more. This place is packed wall to wall with items, so its not a very wide open kid friendly retail space. And it may be a little disorganized, but when you find the item you want you end up getting a deal on it.I'm new to the hobby and was treated nicely with my rookie questions. The owner is extremely helpful & knowledgeable. What they don't have they'll order for you. I've also noticed many of the local model railroaders come here.

3.description: I think Benjamin's review shows he's not familiar with Aldi, which is why his review is not a fair assessment of this location. Aldi does not accept credit cards, only debit, which is why he was asked for a pin. Tossing your items in a cart is how it's done, because you bag your own items there. This location is slightly larger and definitely cleaner than other locations. I recommend!

1.description: Brand new Aldi on Touhy in Niles.  I don't understand how you give Aldi 1 star?   I shop @ Aldi for the great prices on merchandise.  This store is clean, neat & always has a lot of what you need a very good prices.  Call me stupid, but I just found out about 2 weeks ago the Aldi & Trader Joe are owned by the same company.  Another great company

2.description: I consider it the best Aldi is seen . All very renewed and the organization is 100% , the diversity of products in each department is remarkable compared when you go to other shop. One of the things that I do not agree with the policy of accepting only debit cards no credit . should improve that aspect . Well to the corporation by the opening of this new store!!

5.description: I am giving this Aldi one star today because of my experience yesterday.I typically go to the Aldi on Golf Road (Way better staff), but I needed gas at Costco, so I figured I would go to this Aldi. I always shop at Aldi and I am usually very satisfied with the customer service. I had my 6 year-old daughter and my 4 year-old son with me in the store. My kids were standing at the counter behind the first register waiting for me to pay. I was at the register paying and when I turned around to pack my things, my son was gone. I'm running up and down the aisles screaming at the top of my lungs looking for my son and ready to just burst into tears. All I got from the entire store (customers included) was dirty stares. None of the staff asked me what was wrong and no one offered any type of help.After running all over the store I ran back up to the front and asked the cashier to call security and all I got again was a blank stare like I was crazy.This was the worst experience of my life. What is seriously wrong with people.Turns out my son went to the bathroom and didn't tell me, so thank God I found him. He had to walk in front of ALL the registers to go to the bathroom. At the time there were 3 cashiers, and all registers were full of customers. Not one of them saw a little boy go into the bathroom by himself?

6.description: The worst effing experience I've ever had. I selected a few things the items are disarrayed on the shelves. She threw my stuff into a huge shopping cart bf isn't say anything to me. Then kept asking me for a PIN number on a credit card. Horrible experience at a brand new store. Cant figure this one out!!  You would think a new location would be great. I would rather pay three times more and be treated decent.

0.description: This is the Aldis that was on Waukegan. They closed that one and moved here, which was a shame because many Seniors I know were able to walk to that store, and now they can't because this new one is too far to walk.I love good prices. I love easy shopping, big aisles. That said, I love Aldis. Their best bargain is that they do dry goods and canned goods much cheaper than the other local stores. Canned mushrooms are cheap, and they have a nice selection of spices. We also do a lot of frozen goods like Ice Cream, Frozen OJ,  frozen veggies and Mama Cozzi "self-rising" Pizzas. Again, staples is where they excel, and their dairy section and milk are reasonable. You can usually find the type of product you want without the brand name, although they do carry many brand name products.This is the biggest Aldi store I have ever visited, and it's really nice, clean, and well laid out.Note: cash or DEBIT CARDS only.

4.description: It never ceases to amaze me how ignorant people can continue to be...I.E. 1 star reviews.  You just have to take some time to understand their process.   Next time read about Aldi or watch others shop. Then you'll learn and appreciate the outstanding everyday value Aldi provides.

28.description: Solid Starbucks location.  Lots of outlets for those of us who can't be without our laptops.  Friendly barristas who answer all of my annoying questions (like what flavors of sugar free syrup they have, since it's not on the menu and every Starbucks seems to have different flavors available).  And they're always willing to give me a cup of water, and they even do it with a smile (which is NOT the case everywhere).  Bring a sweatshirt - it can get a bit chilly.

1.description: This place is awesome because they allowed me to order the two new frappucchino's that were available for a limited time today even though they had transitioned to the fall pumpkin spice flavor!

9.description: This has always been my Starbucks of choice. Friendly staff & just about what you'd expect from a Starbucks. Gripe is, the inside was never very inviting and after the remodeling it just became worse. It's all good and well, I usually got my redeye to-go & walked to Earthfare which always has plenty of seating. Better bakery, too.

29.description: Me and my sister walked in to grab some coffee after a movie, and we weren't even greeted. Instead the two female employees were just complaining about how behind they were with their work, and no matter what they were leaving at 9:30 and blah blah blah.. yeah that's not exactly what I want to be hearing about while waiting for her to take our order. Finally, she does, her attitude seemed like she realllly didn't want to.Then some regular I guess came in and they were talking while she finished our drinks, and when mine was ready she just slid it at me and practically threw the straw across the counter. SO RUDE!We just walked out, and definitely our last visit there. Only 2 stars because at least our orders were correct.

23.description: I like this Starbucks location.  It sucks you have to pay for street parking though.  Some of the employees are great and some are just ok.  Once when I was there a barista was smoking right outside the door and every time it opened her smoke blew in on me.  Besides that the service has been good.  I like that they have some snacks other then sweets.  The protein platter is good with some cheese, fruit and a boiled egg.

5.description: Probably my least favorite Starbucks to have to go to but there aren't many choices on the far northwest side of the city. The employees here always put off a weird vibe, they're not mean or anything, just kind of off, maybe their brains are scrambled due to the perpetual sewage odor that has stunk this place up for years. Meh. Parking sucks too.

31.description: Nice neighborhood place to study, get a cuppa, and go online. I admit that I'm more of a DD fan, but the free internet and comfy surroundings makes things worth it - they got some new people too, so that's a big plus

25.description: My personal favorite Starbucks.  Family friendly great neighborhood place.  Of get a cup and head to the train.  Cozy seating and perfect ambient music.  Exactly what it's supposed to be.

12.description: I go every weekend and the staff is great. Even though I'm only there twice a week they know my name and order. Sometimes my coffee is ready by the time I get to the counter. I just wish they had a drive thru and it was bigger.

21.description: I don't like to be "that guy"--but I am with respect to cleanliness.  Once in awhile, sure I get it that the garbage cannister fills up, but I have been here a number of times and it never really seems clean.  Napkins on the floors, residue on the tables and the bathrooms . . . yeah, let's not go there shall we?

16.description: I'm a regular at this Starbucks, I'm there at least once a week on my way to play group Wednesday mornings. The staff is always super friendly and FAST, which is pretty important when you have an impatient toddler in tow. I have only ever had a wrong drink order once, and they were extremely apologetic and offered me a free beverage for my next visit. My only complaint about this location is that it is VERY small. They're a pretty busy store and I frequently see lines out the door/almost out the door on my Wednesday morning visits.

17.description: Terrible! The four of us waited in line forever for iced tea that tasted like water with splenda in it. They forgot to charge me for a blueberry scone so they interrupted the customer ordering so they could charge me again. I wish I hadn't paid for it bc it was stale and terrible. Everyone hated everything they made us. My friend was so disgusted that he asked them to remake his and he Never does that. It was still bad the second time so he threw it away. Get it together! They also gave him a huge attitude when he asked for another one. They are giving Starbucks a bad name! I know I have no desire to go back to one after today...

10.description: This 1 star review is specifically for the evening staff. The morning staff is phenom! I have had a lot of attitude and disrespect from the evening crew, one example: Last evening I went in and was barely acknowledged as they were too busy gabbing with one another. I ordered a pumpkin spiced latte, she even asked me if I wanted whip, so I feel fairly confident she heard me. Then I was given a plain latte. I politely said "Oh, I'm sorry, I actually ordered a pumpkin spiced latte", the male barista gave me some serious shade, and snipped at me. Made my drink with 2% when I asked for skim, and then curtly gave me my drink. I didn't have the energy to mention that my drink was still incorrect. I felt that I was very polite to him about the first error, and regardless there's no real excuse to be rude to a customer for bringing up an error made on their part. Disappointed.

11.description: My personal favorite Starbucks.  Family friendly great neighborhood place.  Of get a cup and head to the train.  Cozy seating and perfect ambient music.  Exactly what it's supposed to be.

26.description: Very good place to spend some time working on a laptop. Friendly staff, good little tables with outlets by each one. Iced coffee is good. Music is mellow, and it's not crowded.Great place to wait out the rush hour before driving.

27.description: Good location, competent service, great coffee and snacks. Free wifi, cozy seating, nice ambient music. Isn't this what Starbucks is supposed to be?

0.description: Great to find a favourite coffe shop on my way home. Vanilla late will keep me in a good mood till the end of the day for sure. Thank you for perfect service and tasty coffee. Will come again next time.

20.description: The staff is very friendly.  This particular location is often busy, but we still receive our drinks within a reasonable time.

19.description: I came in here today at 9:30am. There were 2 staff who moved very slowly; there was a long line, some people with children. Several customers actually ended up leaving. The staff just seemed very disinterested in interacting with anyone, far less the waxing & waning crowd present. Ordered a Grande Peppermint Mocha. It was lukewarm at best, and the cup had been filled up only 2/3 of the way! I didn't even bother to ask if they might redo my order. I'd probably STILL be there :(

33.description: Close enough so that you can grab a cup of Joe before boarding the Metra. Easy to find parking along Devon and nonexistent parking along Central. They can't seem to ever make me a decent chai latte, always too light. Often times you can find neighborhood locals soaking up the fresh brew and lounging. Never too busy, just local.

2.description: Nothing special about this starbies that stands out. My drink was sitting there in a counter and I had to ask the person if this was my drink before she said it was. She didn't properly screw in the cap and it exploded on me in the car. Booo.

34.description: I am fortunate, or unfortunate (depending on how you look at it) to work directly above this Starbucks location and although I had to break up with Starbucks for financial reasons, this location will always hold a special place in my heart.  This location is always clean and not so busy that you can't find somewhere to sit and relax.  The best part though is the staff-they are phenomenal!  Until recently, I started every workday with a Starbucks coffe.  Regardless of who was working, they always knew my drink, my name, and greeted me with a friendly smile.  One morning, they saw me crossing the street and had my drink waiting for me when I walked in the door.  Now that's service!

32.description: Well, this Starbuck's is HOPPING!We went at 8:15am, which I thought would be a little slower time, but not so.  This isn't a bad thing, necessarily, as the service was quite good (and typical), but yeah... seems to be the place to be in this little strip of early morning opportunities!I am not a coffee guy (usually), but my colleagues enjoyed their Chai Latte's and scones (this is a review-by-proxy).One small thing.... the turn-in to get into the Starbucks is quite narrow, and with all the huge trucks and SUVs on the road, it was actually difficult turning into and out of the lot.  Or perhaps it was the blue-haired drivers of said giant vehicles that made it so, but I/we noticed it both coming and going.Don't blue-haired people get up at 5am and do their thing?  Apparently not in Akron/Fairlawn, OH. :)

18.description: Solid Starbucks location.  Lots of outlets for those of us who can't be without our laptops.  Friendly barristas who answer all of my annoying questions (like what flavors of sugar free syrup they have, since it's not on the menu and every Starbucks seems to have different flavors available).  And they're always willing to give me a cup of water, and they even do it with a smile (which is NOT the case everywhere).  Bring a sweatshirt - it can get a bit chilly.

13.description: This is a great example of a well run Starbucks, I've been here many times and have always had a great experience. It can get really crowded at times but the line moves quickly. The staff has always been professional and extremely friendly.

4.description: "Hey Siri - how many Starbucks are there in the United States?"As of this review (and this could be off a bit) there's 11,563. That being said, there's more consistency from Starbucks to Starbucks and the real variation is in the service that the baristas provide - so if service is the "make or break" point this location definitely made it! I've been a regular here for about a month now and my usual visits are early morning as a part of my commute to work along with many others. At no surprise the line can get fairly long and the staff handles it promptly and accurately. I can't recall a time that I've seen the staff get an order wrong. On top of that, they're quick to learn your order if you do visit frequently enough. For the record, most of the baristas have my order down and one even had it after two days (that might be a record!). The real icing on the cake for me at this location is that if your drink requires a straw, said straw is waiting next to your drink when your name is called. No this is not the biggest gesture in the world but I really appreciate the baristas going the extra mile to provide a straw and saving me from having to join the heard of customers doctoring up their beverages - and for that I can recommend this Starbucks location!

24.description: I came in here today at 9:30am. There were 2 staff who moved very slowly; there was a long line, some people with children. Several customers actually ended up leaving. The staff just seemed very disinterested in interacting with anyone, far less the waxing & waning crowd present. Ordered a Grande Peppermint Mocha. It was lukewarm at best, and the cup had been filled up only 2/3 of the way! I didn't even bother to ask if they might redo my order. I'd probably STILL be there :(

6.description: Your wanting me to rate Starbucks? Well I found out with all the names of coffee if you just want a plain reg coffee ask for a Tall Blond. I always thought this was a Pretty girl   Lol, I guess it's a coffee here in the US.Go and get your Blond and enjoy

22.description: I love Starbucks, but these guys and gals are super friendly and the barista was top notch!  The bakery items seemed fresh as well.It's a quaint little place inside the mall and not a stand alone cafe. This being said, there are plenty of tables & chairs for two to enjoy your coffee.  If you have kiddos, there's a little indoor play area right next to it.  And if you're waiting on your Apple device to be fixed by the genius' at the Apple Store, this is a great 1 minute hop-skip-and-jump to grab a coffee and run back before they realize you were gone!

15.description: I love Starbucks, but these guys and gals are super friendly and the barista was top notch!  The bakery items seemed fresh as well.It's a quaint little place inside the mall and not a stand alone cafe. This being said, there are plenty of tables & chairs for two to enjoy your coffee.  If you have kiddos, there's a little indoor play area right next to it.  And if you're waiting on your Apple device to be fixed by the genius' at the Apple Store, this is a great 1 minute hop-skip-and-jump to grab a coffee and run back before they realize you were gone!

7.description: The staff is friendly and fast.  We get our order in a fairly reasonable time, despite how busy they get here and they are always clean and neat.Close to the Apple Store and the Simon desk, so you have your choice of WiFi's to use.  The play area is right next door, so you can sit at a table and enjoy your drink while the kids run off some steam!  Can't complain!

8.description: The service was quick  and good the staff was  friendly and spot on i like it here always attentive  to all the customers  needs

30.description: I like this starbucks near the metra, post office and closeby home! : )

3.description: Love this Starbucks! Always easy to find street parking right out front. There is never a crazy line in here even on weekends. It is a smaller Starbucks - not a ton of seating inside but always clean. The staff here is the best! Always friendly and in a good mood. They also do a great job at crafting the perfect drink!

14.description: Not the usual Starbucks experience.  Wife ordered a 20 oz. Tea and got a half full cup (no joke).  Very confused girl making the drinks couldn't believe I said something.  As if their profit margins aren't enough I should pay for 20oz. And get 10?  I should have watched cause I think she just added more ice and water.

28.description: 1. It was very difficult to get any information re costs for any skin care services either on phone or email.  all they want is you to make an appt and come in.2. I make an appt and it was canceled by the staff because Dr. Mayer was ill. I said i would call to re schedule.  then the staff calls me to confirm my appt for laser hair removal.  i said i dont have an appt for laser hair removal. and they said well its here in the book.  I never made that appt.  i didnt want laser hair removal3. i made a sat 10 am appt4. I went to the office at 10:00 am.  5. at 11:00 am, one hour later, i had not seen the dr.  even though staff told me she "will be right with you", i left.  can i bill her for my wasted time?6.  If this is how poorly this woman runs her business, stay away.  do not trust her inject your face with anything.

1.description: Not even 1 star !!! HORRIBLE !! THE WORSE PLACE I EVER VISITED. Please read all negativity about this place and make wise decision about going to this place. Apparently I am not the only one who had terrible unprofessional experience there. I'm surprised this spa is still in business after literally scamming and lying to their customers about their services.  The biggest problem they have is customer service. I have paid full price for my microderm package service last year , as of today i had only one treatment out of 6. In 9 months I was able to schedule and visit only 1 appointment - how ridiculous it can be ??? The rest of the times they called me day prior to cancel and reschedule my appointment for the next 2-3 months from that day. It happened several times.  I could have done all of these treatments at another place for much cheaper and guaranteed time and day. After I asked for my money back receptionist said they have no return policy.. WHAT ?? how about delivering their promises that they charged my credit card for almost a year ago ?? I also ran into a few double booking appointments where they offered me to reschedule my next appt in 2 months. I will definitely report all these issues to BBB and/or local media sources. I hope my feedback will prevent many potential clients from negative experience  and help to choose trustworthy place to go to.

9.description: I purchased a 12 month laser hair removal groupon and my first two appointments went fairly well.  I travel quite a bit for work, so scheduling appointments 6 weeks out can be rather difficult and I called in this afternoon (mind you their website and voice mail says they open at noon on Wednesdays and no one picked up the phone until almost 1:00 PM) to reschedule my appointment that was booked next Thursday.The receptionist that I spoke with was incredibly unhelpful.  Now I understand that they are busy, however you would think that they would keep some appointments open for clients who need to reschedule.  I was told that I can't be rebooked until July (I already have an appointment scheduled for July 31st and you need to wait 6 weeks in between sessions) and I am going on vacation at the end of June.If you aren't aware of this, you aren't allowed to be tan in any of the places you are receiving laser hair removal until the treatments are completely done...so I explained to the receptionist that I am going to Mexico at the end of the month and that I need to reschedule my Thursday appointment sometime in the very near future due to my vacation and the restrictions about being in the sun within a certain period of your treatments...her response to me was "don't go in the sun", to which I replied, I'm going to Mexico, that's unavoidable and asked if there was any way she could squeeze me in.  Her response to me was "no" and I explained that I purchased the 12 month groupon and if I wait until my next appointment at the end of July, I will be missing one full appointment and her response was "uh huh".I will also say that it's taken no longer than 15 minutes total for me to have my treatments done...you would think they would be willing to squeeze a potential long term client in at the beginning or end of the day for 15 minutes...I was told that I could be "put on a waiting list" in case of a cancellation.I agree with Melanie and HOPE that the spa will recognize that their scheduling process is a mess and that those of us who purchased a groupon should receive a full year's worth of treatments and not be penalized for poor organization on their part.I'm giving this place 2 stars because the technicians are fantastic and I'm starting to see some results, but the customer service and scheduling process here are a nightmare.They need to get it together and concentrate on the satisfaction of their clients rather than selling more Groupon's then they can handle.

29.description: I've never reviewed a business that I never actually was able to set foot into, but based on their recent Groupon fiasco I thought I'd write a review warning other potential customers of this Center's complete lack of availability and rude phone staff.Number one rule of putting your business up for a groupon: make sure you can handle the demand. Or, DON'T SELL SO MANY. You've lost hundreds of dollars in my business (and others, judging by the groupon thread) by not being prepared for new business. After I had called a special number after originally not being able to book an appointment (first slot was in JANUARY for something purchased in OCTOBER) I received the offer of being put on a "last minute" list. My schedule is flexible so sure, I thought. I was called a few weeks later booking me for an appointment this coming Saturdy. This was a few weeks ago. I get a voicemail yesterday, stating that the person who booked me for that appointment "screwed up" (way to throw your coworkers under the bus) and they're not actually opened on the 13th. So, I emailed Groupon, hoping for a full refund but being satisfied with Groupon credit. I called the office back today to tell them that they needn't worry about rescheduling with me because I cancelled my package. A cave-woman like grunt of "oh. Sorry." and a dial tone. You're right, I guess. I mean, I wouldn't waste my time with a non-client either. And to be fair, she was probably fielding calls like that all day. And, to end this, for anyone who may respond with "appointments are usually hard to get right at the beginning and end of the deal period"... Yes. I know. That's why I called immediately. Laser hair removal takes MONTHS to treat one area. I didn't want to start at the end of January. I wanted to be half way done by then. Hope you can get your act together for next time before saying yes to business that the spa can't accommodate.

23.description: I got to Dr. Bernadette Mayer MedSpa through Groupon. I'm doing the Laser hair removal. I'm only doing it because i got the package and i've already paid for it. The receptionist is rude and the esthetician was also very rude. I dont know if i was treated so bad because i bought the groupon deal, but it sure didnt make me feel welcome.

5.description: The best kelly is so gentle and explaining everything to me and D r Meyer is so nice llove this spa and they have obagi product

25.description: I purchased a Groupon for laser hair removal, in October.  I was apprehensive because a) I didn't read reviews before purchasing the Groupon and b) knew that I probably wouldn't see results right away.  When I called in October I was told that they weren't taking new Groupon clients until January, that was disappointing, so I waited until January to make an appointment.  When I did call to make an appointment the MedSpa was pretty booked so I had to wait about a month to get an appointment...this all sounds terrible, but...I finally got to go to my appointment in February.  The esthetician was great! One reviewer mentioned the lack of gel or anything other than ice to numb the area being treated...I think I'll take an aspirin before I go but it wasn't terrible, and it is so fast! She was aware of what I could and couldn't tolerate and adjusted accordingly.  I was there about 45 minutes total...if that, and was very satisfied with the services.  To my amazement I have already seen great results and can't wait for my next appointment !  Overall I was very happy with my services! I wish I would have made an appointment earlier, but I think that both the receptionist and I were misinformed.  I'm not upset with that mix up and when I went to my appointment the receptionist was very nice and knowledgable. Not sure if she was the same person I spoke to, but I think it's worth noting that the receptionist was also helpful and added to the positive experience.

12.description: I also bought the groupon and regret it as well..on every single appointment that I have had, the tech was late...not 5 mins late, but 30 mins late.  And there is a big note in the office saying that if the customer comes 10 mins late, they will have to reschedule..maybe that note should be removed because it made my blood boil today as I was waiting for my 9 o'clock appt which turned out to be 9:30..they act as if they are doing me a favor....Hello.....I'm a paying customer!  Save your money...find a better, more reputable place that has better reviews..

21.description: Horrible Experience!!!!First of all: I came early for an apppointment (as there is a late fee if you are late - which I've never been).  An old women with big black hair and lip liner all over the place was at the desk and she was so RUDE!! She said "you know you're 45 minutes early!" I said "I know...I just wanted to get checked in and sit in the waiting room". She then said "Well we're not taking you early"...I again said "I know...I Just didn't want to be late".  I have never in my whole life, had a business complain about a client being early???!!! Second: After 5 treatments, I didn't have any difference. Come to find out, they have 2 different lasers.  One that will get you done in 6 visits and one that will take much longer. (so I would have had to buy more of course). I found this out from a client and verified it from one of the techs.  I THEN TRIED A PLACE DOWNTOWN AND GOT EXCELLENT RESULTS! I WON'T SAY WHO IT IS (AS I DON'T WANT PEOPLE THINKING I WORK FOR THEM, ETC)but I will say  I was happy to know I could get the results I was hoping for.I would NEVER RECOMMEND DR. BERNADETTE MAYER'S SPA!!! Horrible staff, horrible results!!! In fact, I'm going to ask for my money back from Groupon and have decided I probably won't use groupon until they do better background checks on the businesses they offer deals with!

16.description: I recently bought a groupun for laser hair removal, after attending 4 sessions there is no results because its not laser its IPL .This place is a joke and the groupon for this is false advertisment You might be better off throwing your money on garbage instead ,This place is scamming people and groupon is helping them with this.I will never use groupon nor this stupid business again.

17.description: Like many others bought a Groupon. Initially the place was disorganized, that issue did resolve over time. My biggest complaint here is their laser hair removal is absolutely pointless. You might as well throw your money down the toilet. The laser hair removal techs as nice as they were BOTH assured me that six sessions is all I would need and that that using two different lasers would indeed provide the best results. Overtime I kept saying the hair is growing back the same and they BOTH kept reassuring me that just wait until the sixth session for the full results. Well at the last and final session the tech tried to sell me an additional package and changed her tune and stated six sessions is never enough to see results! I reminded her of the previous conversations we had and she just stared at me with a blank look. This place makes promises they can't keep and is a complete waste of time and money. I have friends that have gone to different places and have much better results. My only advice is to look at the reviews of so many others on the so-called med spa and go someplace else; this place is a complete let down.

10.description: So disappointed in the place. Not a good experience. The receptionist is very rude--never had a decent experience with her! I missed out on my last appoint since they no longer do confirmation/reminder calls--I thought my appointment was later in the month (it was early this time) since I always made them later in the month. So when I looked at the card, I realized I missed it.  They said they no longer call, it is the client's responsibility to know their appointment, so there you have it--I lost my last appointment--they don't even care!  I purchased the year of laser treatments through Groupon...ha, ha to the year of appointments...I couldn't get in most of the time because they are so booked up and when you do get an appointment it is book way out--so the YEAR appointment thing is marketing BS.  In the beginning I didn't get any results since the machine wasn't working right...they finally got a new one, but I was already 1/2 way through the year! Got the 3 area and one area...no results what so ever.
