I have to go finish my treatments some where else, because I still need more to finish what I started.  So disappointed.  There are a lot of Laser places out there,  I would skip this place!

11.description: Like all the other bad reviews, I was introduced to this med spa via Groupon. I simultaneously had laser hair removal at another med spa in on another treatment area with fabulous results. Half way through my treatments with Kelly, I brought up the fact that I wasn't seeing any results. She ensured me that I had to go through all 6 treatments before results are conclusive. At my last session, She even tried to sell an additional 6 treatments for a ridiculous amount of money if I signed up that day. The laser hair removal is very disappointing. The Groupon was even more expensive than others I've seen. I certainly don't recommend this place to anyone who wants good results with laser hair removal. I don't have much to complain about the service I received. The receptionist was nice, though I did have to wait 20-30 mins a few times. It's even more disappointing having to wait and get unsatisfactory results. It certainly says something about the level of effectiveness of the laser used for treatments since multiple clients are experiencing poor results.

26.description: I'm starting to think that Groupon needs to create more selective criteria when negotiating their deals to ensure that a business can actually handle the volume of sales they receive from the deal.There was nothing positive about my experience with this place and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone looking for these services.*It took 8 weeks to get an appointment*- This is where I think that Groupon is partially at fault.  There are expiration dates on th certificates, but there doesn't seem to be anyone making sure that the business can accomodate people within a reasonable amount of time*No appointment confirmation*- If you are taking appointments this far in advance, there needs to be a confirmation call or email!  Fortunately I had it in my calendar, so called before going to make sure that I did indeed have an appointmtent*Not enough staff*- My appointment was at 9:15 AM, I was there for 30 minutes before anyone even came up front to greet me and tell me the receptionist "didn't show up." It was clear the assistant had no idea how to manage the front of the office because she said hello to the two women, who were clearly regulars, that arrived after me in an attempt to service them before me!  *Clueless*- When I asked why she was taking the 9:30 and 9:45 AM appointments before me, she reinforced that she had no idea what she was doing by saying "they were here on time" --- I reminded her that I was as well, but that no one was in the front to greet me and she said, "okay, I'll be right with you" -- AFTER the later appointmentsFortunately Groupon gave me a full refund, but rest assured this isn't the type of thing that I'd look for a discount on again.

27.description: I received the underarm and Brazilian laser treatment at Dr. Mayer's Medspa.  I was initially frustrated with my treatments because I felt that they were poorly done and incomplete.  However, the aesthetician who previously did my treatment has since been replaced with a more experienced and more thorough aesthetician.  Additionally, after hearing that I was unsatisfied with my experience, the staff at the Medspa were incredibly accommodating and made effort to rectify the situation.  I really appreciated their responsiveness.

0.description: Let me start by saying that I have been going here for years...Kelly (technician) & Dawn (receptionist) are 2 of the NICEST people you ever want to meet. Kelly is PHENOMENAL and great at what she does. I have had GREAT results with the IPL laser hair removal. My ONLY complaint is that this laser is broken more often than not. I am in the middle of a 12 month Groupon & 80% of my appointments have been cancelled due to the IPL laser being broken. Then the worst part is that there are rather large waiting lists to get appointments (no problem when you make them 6 weeks in advance but to get an immediate appt to make up for the cancelled appt is not easy) and because the appointments are 1hr appts for large areas, I generally don't get in until my next appt. I am assuming and hoping that they will extend my groupon due to being on a 12 month time limit & this week was my 4th cancelled appt since August (due to the IPL being broken). I have not yet asked about this so I cannot say yet, but I will write another review either way. Due to the large response to groupon, (I know the businesses don't make much from groupon) but I would wish that they would buy a new IPL machine rather than dealing with this one and having to continually cancel appointments. I will also add that due to the fact that I am not having regularly spaced 6-8 week appts on these areas, I am NOT having the good results that I was having with my face. In response to the other reviews I've been reading on here...most of them don't make sense to me. I've NEVER waited more than 5 minutes, I've never had a problem getting thru on the phone, I've ALWAYS gotten reminder calls (Dawn is great about that), and whoever said they were unprofessional I find hard to believe. Yes there is a wait to get an appt, but let me ask you this...when I call a salon and they can give me any date or time I want, I would wonder why..when a salon is good, it is hard to get an appt. Also to the ppl that were saying that they didn't have good results, it may be related to the hair color, skin color, etc, but you do need more than 6 months, it's not magic. I had a face full of hair (like a guy) and I did 2 years straight of laser here and it's about 90% gone!!! To get rid of it I would do 10 more years if I had to! It's embarrassing and no price is too high to make me feel good about myself. I have referred people to this spa and they have all been very pleased--but all with the same complaint as me, THEY NEED A NEW IPL LASER! ;)

20.description: I indicated after my last appointment that I prefer one particular machine as it is less painful and more effective on my skin tone/hair color. They decided to let another client use the machine for a tattoo removal and I was not pleased. I expressed my discontent especially since I do not live in the state so rescheduling is nearly impossible. They apologized and told me there was nothing they could do and used the other machine on me anyway. As expected it was painful and uncomfortable--I had a burning sensation for the rest of the day (never experienced this with the other machine). On top of that, it was ineffective and a waste of my time. I hope the next appointment will not be a repeat of the last.

19.description: I'm starting to think that Groupon needs to create more selective criteria when negotiating their deals to ensure that a business can actually handle the volume of sales they receive from the deal.There was nothing positive about my experience with this place and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone looking for these services.*It took 8 weeks to get an appointment*- This is where I think that Groupon is partially at fault.  There are expiration dates on th certificates, but there doesn't seem to be anyone making sure that the business can accomodate people within a reasonable amount of time*No appointment confirmation*- If you are taking appointments this far in advance, there needs to be a confirmation call or email!  Fortunately I had it in my calendar, so called before going to make sure that I did indeed have an appointmtent*Not enough staff*- My appointment was at 9:15 AM, I was there for 30 minutes before anyone even came up front to greet me and tell me the receptionist "didn't show up." It was clear the assistant had no idea how to manage the front of the office because she said hello to the two women, who were clearly regulars, that arrived after me in an attempt to service them before me!  *Clueless*- When I asked why she was taking the 9:30 and 9:45 AM appointments before me, she reinforced that she had no idea what she was doing by saying "they were here on time" --- I reminded her that I was as well, but that no one was in the front to greet me and she said, "okay, I'll be right with you" -- AFTER the later appointmentsFortunately Groupon gave me a full refund, but rest assured this isn't the type of thing that I'd look for a discount on again.

2.description: Doesn't even deserve one star.I went in for my first appointment, it was the first of the day ... they opened late. Upon walking in I was greeted by the sign 'Attention Groupon users, groupon does not include tip.' Not professional. I always tip, but if I am TOLD to tip, that just leaves all sort of bad feeling behind.Then the girl that did my treatment (laser hair removal) walked into the treatment room REEKING OF CIGARETTE SMOKE. Not professional. The lady could not answer any questions about her equipment and why it is their laser equipment of choice.I made my follow-up (6 weeks later), they NEVER give me a courtesy reminder phone or email.Service is horrible. Go elsewhere.

18.description: I indicated after my last appointment that I prefer one particular machine as it is less painful and more effective on my skin tone/hair color. They decided to let another client use the machine for a tattoo removal and I was not pleased. I expressed my discontent especially since I do not live in the state so rescheduling is nearly impossible. They apologized and told me there was nothing they could do and used the other machine on me anyway. As expected it was painful and uncomfortable--I had a burning sensation for the rest of the day (never experienced this with the other machine). On top of that, it was ineffective and a waste of my time. I hope the next appointment will not be a repeat of the last.

13.description: My first horrible experience with a Groupon offer over the past four years!  The receptionist cancelled many sessions due to employees quitting and have me a hard time about extending the offer. Fortunately, Groupon is aware of their shortcomings and gave me a partial refund.

4.description: My review was hidden go check it in not recommend reviews 2 weeks and still the doctor or office manager hasn't returned any calls from my daughter or myself

24.description: Very unprofessional. No one picks up the phone,  returns your calls, or evidently cares. Groupon had no problems with refunding me my money. This place is a joke.

6.description: I wish I could give them ZERO stars. I made the huge mistake of buying a groupon from them for 3 areas of laser hair removal. I have had more than 7 appointments of mine cancelled on me for various ridiculous reasons. The receptionist Lori is the WORST receptionist I've ever come into contact with. I called to tell her that I'm running late for my appointment That was rescheduled bc of their canceling and she hung up the phone on me with a very nasty attitude that they wouldn't see me if I was late. When I arrived Lori spoke to me as if I was a 5 year old child being punished. She grabbed her bag and told me they were closed...at 4pm?! I call bullshit. If this isn't enough to avoid doing business with them, then maybe their actual service will. As far as their laser equipment, it sucks. They have 2 machines, and you can't decide which one they use. They're both old and outdated. I've done laser hair removal at other medspas and none of the equipment has made my skin evoke smoke and smell like fire. I could straight up see smoke coming from my skin. And the other laser equipment hurts like hell from the zap. I've had that equipment at other places but they put a gel on your skin to avoid the shock. Not these guys. Cheap as they come. Don't buy that tempting groupon. Don't.

22.description: Overall nice spa. Professional receptionist, clean environment and attentive service.

15.description: If I could give zero stars I would! Groupon really needs to start having higher standards for their so call ''deals''. I'm starting to think Groupon is just a place for a lot of horrible businesses to lure you into their ''deals'' so that you can spend money on horrible services that aren't even as great as they claim to be. Not all of them are bad but mostly they're all a headache.On to the main part of this review. I purchased a laser hair removal deal from this place through Groupon. I thought what a great deal! I couldn't pass this up. I was sadly mistakened.1. They were horrible with booking appointments. At one point they wanted me to come 2 it 3 months after a treatment. Ummmm wouldn't that defeat the purpose of this treatment if I only got it done every few months or so?2. For me the laser hurt so bad (assuming cause it's the first time I've ever done anything like this) yet no results at all!.... What's the point?! I'm going through all this pain, traveling, and headaches for something that isn't working. Even though I was told I was a good candidate for laser removal. Yeah okay....3. Why are all your technicians always asking me (not sure if they pressure all clients) to add more places to get lasered like I'm chubakkha or something. I would like to see how my results are before you pressure me into adding more so that I'm ready for the summer time with all the areas I want lasered thanks. Good thing I didn't fall for this hoax! Since I got laser removal absolutely no results!!! And even after I asked the technician why there hasn't been any results she would always say the next few treatments should see more results.... What a lie!All in all I definitely do NOT recommend this awful place at all. Ever wonder why they were on Groupon in the first place??

7.description: The worst!!!!  Trashy & AWFUL customer service.  I drove very far only to get cancelled & told to reschedule (& paid for parking).  They can eat my groupon because I will NEVER go back & am telling all my friends to call groupon & cancel their groupons.  Consider yourself warned!!!

8.description: I purchased a groupon for laser hair treatments a year ago. I wish I would have checked Yelp before I purchased it.  I saw all the negative reviews and thought what am I getting myself into, but then I said ahh, it cant be that bad....well, yeah, it was. It has been hell trying to get an appointment with them. They are always booked and appointments are months away. I was finally able to make it in only for them to tell me they could not do the laser hair removal since I was on antibiotics.  No one ever made any mention of this in the first place. I was told I had to get a note from my dermatologist that it was ok to get the treatments before they were even able to start them.  Ok fine, I went to my dermatologist, got the letter saying it was ok and then made another appointment, which again was like 3 months out....I get there and once again I was denied treatment, this time it was because I did not shave the area good enough. I was told to shave 2 days before, which I did do. The technician LAUGHED at me when I told her I did shave. She said there was "NO WAY" I shaved  Seriously, was she calling me a liar? Unbelievable! Very unprofessional and embarrassing to me. So once again, I was told I would need to make another appointment to come back. Needless to say I never went back. Groupon was kind enough to give me a refund. Ladies please do yourself a favor and find somewhere else to go.

30.description: Dr. Mayer has recently become my primary physician, and I'm glad she has. She's very personable and I have her complete attention. Even as one of the last appointments in the evening you can tell she genuinely wants to take time with you. The only downer - (or not, depending on how you see it) her office is also a medical spa so it can get busy and you might have to wait a bit.Her staff is also pleasant and helpful. I recommend Dr. Mayer to anyone.

3.description: This place is by far the WORST place to go to. If you are planning to buy their services " PLEASE ....I HONESTLY RECOMMEND DONT" ...EVEN if it's groupon ......you are better off paying $100 more and going to a much professional spa else where. Not only I was foolish enough to still go there after reading Yelp reviews but now I believe that sometimes you must listen to what others say blindly. 1) The receptionist(Alisha)-never answers the phone nor ever returns your calls, on top of that she blatantly lies to your face that she never got your messages.  She is loud, very rude and highly ugly personality & attitude. . On top of that one of The aesthetician(Cathy) - is the worst of the worst .... Very rude, very harsh with her work & rushes you through your appointment  ( she burnt my skin during laser treatment)  God forbid if you are 10 mins late for your appointment they purposefully will not accommodate you even though if another client does not show up for their appointment but they will rather make you come back another day or threaten you to pay extra " the receptionist literally said to me to pay " $100 extra if you want your appointment today ...since you already are 10 min late " and missed your time slot. I waited an hr in their office to see if they would accommodate me,  in place off another client who canceled or did not show up for their appointment ..... Instead they were sitting and arguing with me to reschedule ( no matter how much I told them I cannot reschedule as i took a week off to get a peel )the receptionist said either you pay or reschedule  or leave .....if I don't leave she will call Police" Never in my life I had ever encountered such unprofessional and totally disgusting person as such" my honest opinion who ever reading this ...this place is not worth your money. I hope this doctor Mayer realizes how disgusting her staff is ...and if she cares about her business , she better hire a professional and well trained staff, also update her old broken equipment..

14.description: I would give this Med Spa  zero stars if possible. Buyer beware, you get what you pay for. I purchased a Groupon for 3 Fraxel facials and was assured that I would have three days of down time.  I went in on a Saturday and expected to have a doctor or, at the very least, a nurse perform this procedure since it is a laser treatment and does penetrate the dermis. I should have trusted my gut and run when I was introduced to an aesthetician.She assured me she was skilled using this equipment and asked about areas of concern, one of which was my chin area. I went home and the dots were not even but I didn't think much of that. By Monday my skin appeared severely burned. I called and was told everyone is different and not to be concerned. By Wednesday there was no improvement so I sent pictures and asked if I should come in and see the doctor. The aesthetician called back and said AGAIN everyone is different and it didn't concern her.I had done my research and new what "normal" is and this was not normal. It took two weeks before I could go out and I skill had scabs on my chin. I have permanent scars on my jawbone. On my forehead I have two clear mole-like areas that developed after the facial. Originally, I considered  going to a dermatologist whose specialty is lasers but it was very expensive. I wish I had saved up and gone to her. If it sounds too good to be true, it is.  I met a woman who had been a rep for Fraxel  and when I showed her my pictures she said that the head must have been old.Thanks!

3.description: I had gone to Edgebrook Nail Salon in May and was very pleased with the manicure and pedicure I received. I went back again this month and it was probably the worst manicure and pedicure I have ever received. When I called to make my appointment I told the woman who answered that I wanted a manicure and pedicure and that I currently had a no-chip manicure on my nails. When I arrived for my service a young man was brought over to do my pedicure. It was the quickest pedicure I've ever had done (total time 15 minutes from the time I sat in the chair to polish being completed). The guy only trimmed my nails - I had to ask for him to file, push back the cuticles, clean under the nails, use a foot scrub, moisturize. He then kept commenting on how bad the tan on my feet was (weird tan lines from sandals I wore). I laughed it off, but how rude!When it was time for the manicure he complained for a full ten minutes not only to me, but to every other employee and customer in the place because I had a no chip manicure that needed to be removed. He didn't soak it off, he just peeled the manicure off. When I asked him to soak it off he said he didn't have time because the salon was closing soon. When he was done PEELING the no-chip off my nails he proceeded to complain about how bad my nails were. He kept getting up from the manicure station to walk around, complain to the other employees about my nails, and do a bunch of heavy sighing. I asked him to just trim the nails and put a clear coat of polish on. Prior to painting I paid for the service using a Groupon I had. He complained that I was using a Groupon and then proceeded to tell me, multiple times, that I should tip off the cost of the service ($40). I had given him a 15% tip to reflect how terrible of an experience I was having. As soon as he hastily painted the last nail he told me they were closed and I had to leave and then got up and walked away. With wet nails I changed my shoes, dug out my car keys, and left. I will never come back!

1.description: I don't know what spa Mary has been to, nor the others, but their reviews don't sound like they've been to Edgebrook Nails Spa and Salon!!!! More like the salon at the corner of Devon and Central, Lee Nails, which I've been to also. NEVER AGAIN.Love coming here! Have been a client for over five years. The price is reasonable ($36 for mani/pedi), the place is bright, airy, and spotless, and the girls very friendly. I get a mani every week and a mani/pedi once a month. The mani lasts more than a week if I go longer, and the pedi lasts a whole month! And I'm NOT talking about gel mani/pedis either! You don't need an appointment, and they are VERY accommodating. A shoulder massage is given at the end of every mani. Perfect way to end it! They've recently added facials and massages, do eyebrow waxing and chair massages also. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!

2.description: I tried out this salon for the first time this week, and it's definitely my new neighborhood spot! I was hesitant given the reviews, but I really enjoyed my pedicure here. They took my appointment although I came in just before close, and the technician did a wonderful job!

5.description: My mani typically lasts 1-2 days before chipping.  This time, I lost half the polish on 2 nails just two days after.  They're overpriced for the quality, and service is not friendly.  There's a shop across the street, just a few doors west.  It's small, but their service is the friendliest, & if it chips, they fix it.

6.description: I've written a review of the mani/pedis before (which I adore) but this one is for the massage that is now offered at Edgebrook Nail. Her name is Tina (supposedly) and her small frame had me worried that my massage might not be all that awesome. But I was (thankfully) so so very wrong. This pint sized woman did things to me that I've only read about in books. Ok, not that dramatic but it was a hella good massage. I especially liked that she mixed different forms of massage. It started out very Swedish and then moved into deep tissue and shiatsu. My neck and shoulders tend to be my problem areas so she used some hot stones there. Finally,  she climbed on my back and did some thai massage type of stretching and pulling on my arms and legs. Once I got over the surprise, I realized how great it felt. The massage felt very customized to my needs and I certainly didn't expect that from the back of a nail salon. Plus first time customers get a free 30 min facial after the massage. And all that for $65! Get over the back of the nail salon environment and you'll enjoy a kickass massage. It's worth it. Oh, and free parking behind the salon.

7.description: I went to Edgebrook nails for the first time and it will be the last time.  I hope many potential customers read this and they do  not go.  The place is dark and dirty and smells.  Most of the girls cannot speak English well enough to understand them.  The manicures are simply terrible and also over priced.  I think this shop employs workers who do not know what their doing.  Cheap Labor!!!!  If I saw the picture that was left with the review before I went I would have never went.  IT IS A TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY.  THIS NAIL SALON BETTER GET THEIR ACT TOGETHER OR THEY WILL NOT BE AROUND MUCH LONGER

8.description: My mother and I have been visiting this establishment for about 2 years. When we first arrived, our experience was astounding. Both of us never had been more pleased. However, as the years passed, I'd have to say their quality has gone down. There used to be a small staff of 3 very hard working women. Now there are about 7 women (one of which is part of the original three) who are just mediocre. The price is a fixed $36 mani/pedi rate. However, it would be in your favor to search elsewhere, if you are looking for a mani/pedi. I have also received a back massage once and a bikini wax multiple times. The back massage was nothing special. However, the bikini wax was never awful. The woman is one of the original three who is very careful with what she is doing. I can't remember the rate, however it was cheap compared to other places. Overall, I'd have to unfortunately say that there are better nail salons in the same area for the same price.

0.description: Best no-chip manicure I've ever had. Also they are very polite with good customer service. I'll definitely come back and they have free parking spot at the back which makes easier.

4.description: Been here twice for simple manicures.  The first time was OK, except while I was under the dryer, this guy in a white lab coat comes over and starts rubbing my shoulders.  I am not a "touchy-feely" person so needless to say, this came as quite a shock since I was not forewarned.   Second time I had this very tiny girl giving me the manicure & back rub.  Now, I dont know if this was done on purpose or not, but when I paid for the service up front ($14), no change came back.  I had to ask twice for it.  Now maybe they are in the habit of just keeping the change as tip, but to me, that is about 45% and I think I should have the say in whether or not I give that out!  She seemed weirded out when I swapped the $6 for $2.   Otherwise, the salon itself is very neat & clean and done up in bright, cheery colours.  They offer massage (obviously, unless my lab-coat guy was just a creep, haha) as well as waxing,  all of which seem to be very decently priced.  Unless you are handing out 45% tips though.

3.description: This place is is not good.  I got a jacked up haircut and the person who cut my hair had to have known because as soon as I got home my girlfriend who also is a stylist noticed a big patch of hair that should have been cut there were also a lot of other imperfections with it (some areas shorter than others, loss of my bangs, went too dang high on my fade, took an hour plus and i swear it wasnt me she said she had carpel tunnel).  Maybe it was the older person cutting my hair but she shouldve seen it!I tried to fix my haircut to the best of my ability but without clippers it was a fail.  I went to vegas the next day to be laughed at by a bunch of girls who also noticed my haircut.:(

1.description: They advertised free hair cuts for veterans  on veterans day but this store does not participate. They would let you think they do with all the military propaganda they have hanging up in the store. Oh well it would have been all of ten minutes for my bald head and a $10 buck tip.Veterans Stay Away!Edit: Just had a free haircut at the downtown Parkridge Sports cuts they did a great job and went above and beyond . I highly recommend the Parkridge store. Clean nice staff . They honored the Veterans day promotion.Thanks

2.description: I have been going to Mariana for much of this year after my stylist at the Park Ridge location left. Mariana is excellent, professional, very friendly. She really listens to the kind of haircut I want to make sure to get it just right. Several times now I've gone there weeknights when I've been available, showed up around 7:15/7:30, and there were people waiting. Both times my turn came up at closing time, and she still cut my hair and took the same amount of time as if it had been 3:00, never rushing. Can't ask for better service than that, and that's a great way to keep me coming back! Thanks, Mariana.

5.description: Real friendly stylists.  Never had a bad cut out of here.  I usually go for the triple play

6.description: Went back for a trim, and it was quick and easy and comfortable.  Jaquelyne, whom cut my hair... rocks.  That is all.

7.description: Had good success at the city locations but this one is not the same   went there more to save time & paid for my decision  location was rundown not fresh like others i had been too  I shouldve known when the lady's nametag was upside down upon my arrival  She sprayed water all over the front my shirt during shampooing and barely apologized or offer a towel until I asked for one.  i gave specific directions  which were basically ignored  she rushed thru my haircut leaving it choppy & uneven which she hid by styling it with alot of gel  I was unsure when I left Wife was not happy when i got home     I will stick to city locations

8.description: I went to SportClips after hearing about it from a mailer I received.  It's basically a men's hair salon with a sports theme.  You enter in an area that has wood floors that feel like a basketball court and then there is green tile in the cutting area which is supposed to look like a baseball field.  There's a plasma TV in the waiting area and each of the stylist chairs has a flat screen TV inside the lockers that surround the mirror.I got the MVP service which is a haircut, followed by a scalp massaging shampoo, a steam towel treatment and then back in your chair, they give you a neck and shoulder massage with one of those electric hand massagers.  It's a completely different experience than any other place I've had my hair cut.  They don't have perms or hair coloring so it doesn't smell like a bunch of chemicals either.  During the shampoo, they use this Tea Tree Special Shampoo that smells great and literally cools your scalp.  At the end, of course, they recommended that I buy the shampoo.  On my first visit, I didn't buy it at all.  The second time I went, I decided to try the shampoo and I'm addicted to it.  It's easy to wake up in the morning when you're taking a shower with that shampoo helping to wake you up. I've been going there since they opened now and I'm happy with the service.  Since they take walk ins and no appointments, one of the viists had a little bit more of a wait than I wanted. Since you get to watch sports on the flat screen televisions, it wasn't a big deal.

9.description: This location mysteriously closed a little over a month ago, which is a shame because the girls there really knew how to cut hair, especially Lydja.  I found out that the same owners own the Lincoln Park location on Fullerton, and she's working there along with a couple of the other girls too!

0.description: I've also visited this SportsClips, and I have to say, it's a great place to get your hair cut.  The staff is friendly and attentive and the MVP treatment is a great value.  The extra pampering is nice.  It's perfect for me, because I'm not the type of guy that would pay $40 for a hair cut just to get some extra pampering, plus my hairstyle is simple (bad), so it comes out the same whether I pay $20 or $200.  But for a few extra bucks, compared to Hair Cuttery or SuperCuts, you feel like you're getting a lot more with the MVP, so go that route.Ladies, I give you my word, that as long as your man is intelligent enough to tell the stylist what he wants done, they will not screw up his hair.  So please, if you're guy is like me and doesn't want to pay big bucks, then send him to SportsClips.  Maybe you write down the instructions for the stylist and Sparky just hands them to the nice stylist.  Either way, you'll be pleased.  They won't jack up his hair.I've also heard that a SportsClips is going up in Lincoln Park, near the DePaul campus, I believe.  I'll be sure to get to that one too, to review it when I can.

4.description: Let me preface: my husband is an articulate and intelligent man. But, when I met him, he wore a cowboy hat, cowboy boots and sweat socks. It took years of sculpting to get him to be the metro sexual he is now and I take a lot of pride in my work. So, in the past, when he needed a haircut, I wouldn't just leave him to sink on his own. I would go in with him, explain to the stylist what "he" wanted and then wait to see the finished result. We were in a hurry, running errands in Skokie/Niles. We were leaving on a short vacation the next day and my dude desperately needed a haircut. When I spotted Sport Clips, I pulled over, went in with him and explained to the woman that she needed to make sure that his bangs were longer than the rest of his hair to cover his large (sorry, Babe, I love you) forehead. I showed her what "he" wanted done... then I left to continue more errands. When I came back to pick him up, my husband was returned to me looking like Mo Howard. Bastards. We took a lot of pictures that vacation too... Just before our wedding, I put him in the hands of our gays and they took him to Halo and they made him pretty. Now I won't trust anyone else to ever touch his hair again. Maybe if you're going for a buzz cut or some other funny looking male cut, this is the place to be?

1.description: I've been having Sue G. cut and color my hair for about 4 years, and I can't imagine going somewhere else.  My hair has historically had issues with holding color.  Sue took the time to figure out what I wanted, she listened to my prior experiences, and she found a formula that stays in perfectly!  Like a prior reviewer said, this isn't a young, trendy salon, but who wants that anyway?  Here you get experienced competent stylists who want you to look good and who charge a fair price (not cheap/ not expensive).  Works for me.

2.description: Yes - 5 star!  The shop is cute and oh so clean, the stylists are all friendly and welcoming and Anna gave me the best haircut ever!  I wear my hair very short ~ and if it's wrong, well it just looks like a chopped short haircut.  Anna spent an hour with me asking, advising, counseling.............I couldn't be happier!!!!!  Do ask for Anna - wonderful experience!

0.description: A very nice little salon that does it all -- you can even get tanning done here! Its a great salon and you get really personal attention here. Their services are great and their prices are reasonable too.

3.description: I discovered this quaint shop just doors down from my hair salon, Aqua Salon. I had walked by it numerous times before finally stepping inside. I immediately fell in love with the store!I love supporting local businesses and purchasing locally made products. I did 75% of my Christmas shopping this year at Local Goods Chicago. I found some beautiful cuff links for my husband made with old CTA tokens, handmade cards, locally made soy candles, and jewelry and other Chicago themed items. I got to meet the artist who made the pieces I purchased. I love hearing the artist's story behind their product and how much pride they take in their work.Local Goods Chicago is one of my favorite stores in all the Chicagoland area. There are always unique gifts to find here! Support your local businesses!

1.description: Great shop. My go-to place for hand made cards. Lots of letter press choices. Love the local foodstuffs as well: Spice House spices, Grown Up Kids Stuff chocolate sauces, Co-Op hot sauces and out of this world caramels by Chocolate Twist.All this and locally made jewelry, artwork and wearables to boot.Do some shopping and grab a coffee or a bowl of delicious soup and catch up with friends at the table in the front of the shop.

2.description: What a great idea! I stopped in last week to check it out and I think this place has such potential. Not only do they sell cool crafts made by local artisans, but they conduct classes in various crafts and also encourage folks to socialize and share. I see it as a work in progress, but what a great start. I bought a tasty pastry and a small 3D art piece of koi. I loved both.I can't wait to see this place blossom and become a real focal spot for the area.

9.description: Love this store!  Such cute things, local artists..   Love the defloured gluten free foods - they are delicious as well as the hot chocolate!

10.description: This is the newest addition to Edgebrook.  Great hot spot to meet local artists, support local goods, and handmade items.  I enjoyed a great cup of coffee, strolling down the aisle with showcased jewelry, fine soaps, sauces & spices, to Handmade Sea Salt Scrubs, clothing and more.  Greeted by the store owner, Laura who is personally hands on and involved in the community.  She really brought a nice vibe to our neighborhood of Saugansh / Edgebrook.  Stop by for a workshop or host your own creative art inspired event.  You may even see Auntie Rose, a 90 year old Italian lady crocheting her knits she sells there with her niece, Josie.  As, an artist you can also rent a booth to exhibit your craft.  Come and check out the fantastic space, I am still waiting to try one their incredible savory or sweet "puffs of Doom."  Artists and friends, and children are all welcome.

4.description: One of my favorite Chicago stores!I just attended a soap-making class, where Deb was generous in sharing her vast knowledge. We had a terrific time, and it was well worth the price of the class!We've been customers for a long time- I love to give gifts of the baby soap, oil, and butter. My mom loves the balm in small tins, Lizzie is never without the lip balm, and I'm a HUGE fan of the Body Butter. If I have a problem, it's that I can't decide among the many terrific scents they blend for their soaps! Current faves - All That Jazz, Carrot Ginger, Mango, and Earth.Lizzie and I are going to sign up for the butters and oils class next!

6.description: I can't say enough great things about Local Goods Chicago. My family and I are very much into the "local" culture so we were thrilled when this place opened. Their names says it all, they are VERY much into supporting local artisans, food and beverage vendors and even their wood counters were built by the local organization Rebuilding Exchange. How awesome is that?This is the kind of place that I love seeing in a neighborhood and definitely the first place I'll spend my money. I definitely recommend stopping in and checking it out. Have a chat with Laura (the owner) she's a total sweetheart.

12.description: My daughter loves the classes and workshops held at Local Goods Chicago. While she is in her class, my son can enjoy a snack and hot chocolate while I shop around. There is something in the store for everyone. Local goods is a wonderful asset to our neighborhood.

5.description: This place is a hidden gem! Great place to find a gift - love the Spice House gift pack, the Chicago CTA soaps & candles, and great the  tshirt collection.  They always package up the gift and looks special.  Spread the word - SHOP LOCAL!

13.description: This is one of my new favorite places in the city! Great place to pick up a gift and I can drink a local coffee (not Starbucks!) while I shop. Can't wait to take one of their cool classes they offer.  You have to check out this place...it's worth the trip to the northwest side.

11.description: Definitely one of my favorite stores! They offer fun engaging classes for all ages, have delicious treats and coffee and beautiful locally handmade items that make great gifts!

8.description: This place is darling! Unique gifts and jewelry.  Awesome that it is supporting local artists. Love it.

0.description: I've been shopping here for about 3 years now and I just love it! They have great, original gift ideas that you won't find elsewhere. I especially love the handmade jewelry selection! Also the caramels are awesome and the Spice House spices and Co-Op hot sauces are my go-to gifts for my foodie friends!

7.description: Such a cute shop.  I really like the programming Tuesday and Laura are putting together with all the book readings, faerie house making, and food tastings.

28.description: My sister's closet is great little shop. I've found high end designer clothing, brand new at great prices. The last time I shopped I got Seven jeans for under $20 and some great cashmere sweaters Judy, the owner is super friendly and always willing to lend a hand or get you something from the back that she has been saving for loyal customers. Also a great place to get vintage and unique jewelery. My Sister's Closet has always been a go to place for great clothes at an affordable price.

1.description: I love this store, but they do an annual Super Bowl Sunday Sale where they slash prices, but their systems are so bad, I waited 3 hours to pay for clothes.  They only had one register open. They could have used card scanners on smart phones and saved tons of time.  And they kept telling customers to be patient, that we should know it would be busy.  Please don't disregard technology, just because you are busier than usual.  Great clothes, a poor attitude, and poor communication. There was a wait for a dressing room and to check out and if that was explained when walking in the door, it would have made a big difference.

9.description: I love this place!I agree that some items are overpriced but that can be the case at any resale shop, sign up for their emails and you will get notices for their sales, which can be phenomenal!Also, I guarantee you that most of the people that complained about the prices did not notice that they have color tag discounts like they do at Village. Big difference is the quality of items, My Sister's Closet is meticulous about the items they take. You will not get any stained, ripped, broken products like you can get at some resale shops. I have been here many times and always get great deals and service, most clothes have been like new that I have purchased. I feel they are well organized and you can find many cute, unique items!

29.description: I really like this store.  I try to get in there at least every couple of months. Yesterday I bought three items-all designer-with the tags still on.  I also bought a new hat and two pairs of pants for my kids.  All of this was only 50 bucks.  I never leave empty handed.  The people who work there are all friendly and helpful.  Last year I got a 100 dollar coat for 12 dollars at the superbowl sale.  Most items are current and everything is clean and in good condition.

23.description: Forget what I've said before were my favorite stores, this is the best resale shop I have ever been to.  For years I've admired my girlfriend's Anthropologie-like boho chic finds from here but never made it over.  I often find consignment shops overpriced, dated and disorganized.  This one is none of that.  The clothes are all practically new and, for the most part, up to date.  I especially like the Chico's rack.  It has more selection than the clearance rack at an actual Chico's.  I bought 8 blouses and jackets for casual Fridays at work and spent  $90.  The most expensive item was a like-new $14 Chico Jacket that originally sold for about $100.  I am not sure the younger 20 somethings are going to like this place.  The neighborhood and the store are for a bit older crowd.Also, the two staff working didn't seem to like each other at all and were kind of rude to each other which was wierd.

5.description: The women who work in this store are extremely rude. They make it very difficult for consigners to bring in their items because they change the drop-off days and times frequently; many times it seems just because they don't feel like being bothered. They say that they only accept between 10-4, 3 days per week which also makes it difficult for people who work to consign. You are not "allowed" to bring in items in boxes or bags. You MUST bring items in a plastic bin with your name written on the inside. They also tend to take items that I'm actually on the fence about brining but leave the $800 pristine 1 year old jacket in the bin to take back home. I'm really not sure how hey stay in business.

31.description: One of the better resale shops I've been to.  If you're a fashionista, or aspiring to be one, this is a cheap way to acquire some decent pieces.Some of the brands I saw here: Three Dots, Marc Jacobs, Cynthia Rowley, Prada, J. Lo, Sweet Pea, Laundry by Shelli Segal, Diesel, Chico's, Express, by Joseph, DKNY, Karen Kane, Sutton by Bloomingdale and Betsey Johnson. Everything I saw was in good condition - nothing ripped or stained. Womens clothing is sorted by size and color (all the mediums in the reddish tone are grouped together, for instance).  They have maternity clothes, baby/kids clothes, shoes, purses, toys and housewares. There are some treasures to be found here. If you sign up on their mailing list, you'll get notice of sales and sample sales (a sales woman told me their biggest sale, on Super Bowl Sunday - 50% off the lowest price of everything - is not advertised).

25.description: Over-priced junk.I really don't get the positive reviews. This is a resale shop for old ladies.I drove out here because I heard they have maternity clothes. They have a few, but most of it is hideous. I didn't find a thing I could wear.My friend and I browsed the rest of the selection as well. They may have designer labels on some of their clothes, but everything is overpriced and butt ugly. They were charging $20 for a shrug sweater from Anthropologie. Are you kidding me? I was thoroughly unimpressed and would prefer sifting through the piles of crap at Village Thrift than trying to find something cute at this place.If you want high quality second-hand clothing, just shop on eBay instead. This place really isn't worth the drive out to the NW side.

12.description: I always leave here with a few neat things!

16.description: Over-priced junk.I really don't get the positive reviews. This is a resale shop for old ladies.I drove out here because I heard they have maternity clothes. They have a few, but most of it is hideous. I didn't find a thing I could wear.My friend and I browsed the rest of the selection as well. They may have designer labels on some of their clothes, but everything is overpriced and butt ugly. They were charging $20 for a shrug sweater from Anthropologie. Are you kidding me? I was thoroughly unimpressed and would prefer sifting through the piles of crap at Village Thrift than trying to find something cute at this place.If you want high quality second-hand clothing, just shop on eBay instead. This place really isn't worth the drive out to the NW side.

17.description: Any business that is going strong after 30 years, with many of its original customers and consignors, must be doing something right. The range of merchandise, from toddler to misses clothing, high-end to economical, new samples to vintage, accessories and everything in-between makes this a true resale "boutique". Merchandise arrives daily; there's always something to tempt the savvy shopper. And, if, by chance, your experience is less than "5-star", the owner would want to know; she'll make it right. In this day of chain stores, it's refreshing to shop this local (the owner is Chicago born-and-raised) one-woman-owned store. Nomi R.

10.description: I love this shop!  They buy things from my closet (and we all have brand new items never worn or worn once, right?) and I have never not found a bargain while I am shopping there.  They are expanding their shop, so plenty of dressing rooms.  There is always a sale, you just hunt for the sale colors (clothing tag colors indicate 10%, 20%, 30% discounts, etc.).  I have gotten cocktail dresses, great jeans, jewelry and many trendy tops there.  From sidewalk sales to academy award parties, it's a fun place to shop.  They have a sharp eye for current trends and great clothes and the owner and staff work hard to keep it organized. Found a great piece of silver jewelry there the other day (missed the Mother's Day weekend jewelry sale but it was still a bargain).Have fun!  PS there is FREE parking in the lot behind the store and pay meters in front.

11.description: I've shopped here throughout the years and I rarely ever leave empty handed-- I've found some very cute things for myself as well as for others. (You can find some unique gifts and accessories here). I have yet to visit them since they expanded, but I look forward to doing so soon. As far as the ladies: very pleasant. I recently consigned some clothes with them for the first time, and they took many of my items. The transaction was smooth, and they complimented me on much of my clothes. Further, I just received my 1st check from them--some nice extra cash, just in time to do some holiday shopping with it--yippie!

26.description: I was pleasantly surprised by this store. I had read some of the reviews, which weren't super positive so I wasn't really that excited about this place. After years of driving by this place, I finally stopped in. I really, really liked it! Granted, it's a little more "pricey" than the resale shops I'm used to. However, I'm used to those bargain basement crazy warehouse places where things are messy and under $5. This place had a variety of items from $7-$50 but, I have to say, it was clean, quiet and organized. Plus, they did a great job selecting more quality / brand name merchandise so you are paying for the benefit of not having to search through a bunch of ugly stuff. I got a really nice pair of New York and Co. dressy / work capri pants, a Rue 21 blouse and a George (Walmart's career separates line) all for $25. Really not bad. That's averaging $8 a piece -a small "higher" price to pay for quality clothing. I would definitely revisit this store. They have some really nice stuff!

27.description: for being in the suburbs, i guess this place is okay. the people that work their are quite a bit older, so it only makes sense that the selection is going to run more along the lines of chicos and coldwater creek. the maternity section is about 3' long and consists mostly of XL-XXL sizing.i had a serious allergy attack while in there, so i was anxious to get out but that does say something about the cleanliness of the clothes and/or the store itself. i did appreciate how everything is grouped according to color and then size. looked like they had a lot of cool jewelry, but with all the crap they have strewn over the top of the counter, it's impossible to take a good look without bothering the help and the help made it perfectly clear they weren't in the mood to help.after all is said and done, i walked out with one maternity dress for $5, two liz clairborn "dressy" sweaters for $9 each and, my big purchase,  one super cool 100% cashmere, black, bat-wing, cowl-neck sweater for $58.(for trendier clothes and a huge selection of designer jeans, i rock buffalo exchange on milwaukee in wicker park.)

0.description: I can't even think of words to express how much I love this store. Usually, I'm not really a consignment kind of girl and I prefer to go to the Burberry/Chanel/whatever store to purchase my items brand new, but I've found a new love for this store.I came here searching for a costume for my character in the play I'm in, because I'm playing Susan in the production of Don't Drink the Water (by Woody Allen). I needed some '60s-looking or authentic '60s clothing and had no idea where to start. The owner Joanne was extremely helpful, considering she lived through the '60s and knew what all the fashion trends were. I'm planning to go back next Sunday for their 50% off everything Super Bowl Sunday sale, because I saw the cutest Givenchy blazer for only $40!! Needless to say I'm definitely buying it if it's still there ;)

20.description: Excellent resale shop. I decided to check it out today and I was pleasantly surprised. Tons of great brands like Diane Von Furstenberg and Marc Jacobs. They even provide dressing rooms. Reasonable prices and lots of cute jewelry. The super nice ladies helped me check out and I will definitely be back. Great shop.

19.description: I was pleasantly surprised by this store. I had read some of the reviews, which weren't super positive so I wasn't really that excited about this place. After years of driving by this place, I finally stopped in. I really, really liked it! Granted, it's a little more "pricey" than the resale shops I'm used to. However, I'm used to those bargain basement crazy warehouse places where things are messy and under $5. This place had a variety of items from $7-$50 but, I have to say, it was clean, quiet and organized. Plus, they did a great job selecting more quality / brand name merchandise so you are paying for the benefit of not having to search through a bunch of ugly stuff. I got a really nice pair of New York and Co. dressy / work capri pants, a Rue 21 blouse and a George (Walmart's career separates line) all for $25. Really not bad. That's averaging $8 a piece -a small "higher" price to pay for quality clothing. I would definitely revisit this store. They have some really nice stuff!

33.description: You never know what treasure you'll find in a resale shop!My Sister's Closet carries clothes, housewares and gift items.Hours:Monday - Friday  10AM - 6PMSaturday              10AM - 5PMSunday                 11AM - 4PM

2.description: This place is awful.  If you look close at the jewelry it is damaged.  The tarnish of the metal is coming off and discolored.  The Druzes were fake.  A lot of stones are plastic or glass.  It has also been there for months.  They do not even change the inventory.The clothing IS damaged.  Again, you have to look closely.  There are tears and threads coming loose.  I cannot believe this store has been around with the fake crap and damaged goods they sell.The owner is rude and the old hags that work there are mean as hell.  This place is also shady.  Be very careful because when you drop stuff off you then find out consistently that things are always missing. Not trustworthy at all.  This is not a place I would shop.  You get better quality at Walmart.

32.description: My Grandma's sister is always talking about shopping her. Now my Grandma is obsessed with going. It's funny, becuase my Grandma would slit her wrists before she EVER went into any of the MANY thrift stores that surround her own house. Ha.

18.description: I never shop here-I only consign-I used to bring in my baby itmes but found that they were selling them for so little it wasn't worth the time to bring them there. The woman who look through the clothing act like they are bothered to be looking through your items and claim to be very familiar with brands-They will take anything that has a designer name on it even if it looks like it is falling apart and pass on newer items without the brand name. Don't bother trying to sell them your shoes-they are great for selling dresses and purses to. Don't bring your kids there is no room!!! It is packed to the brim so make sure you have time to look if you are going to shop. Don't bother selling them your baby items-take them to once upon a child.

13.description: It's good and I like it but it's a bit expensive. The owners are a bit strange. Their clothes are varied.

4.description: I just found out about this place today. Paid a visit and fell in love with the store! Not sure how I have lived in Chicago for nearly 20 years and I had never been to this fine establishment. The clothing,  jewelry,  shoes, and other items are all in great condition. The prices are perfect and I benefitted from a major sale today! Woohoo! Joanne is the owner and she is very friendly and passionate about her store and it's operations. Designer clothing for a mere fraction of big department stores. I will hit this place up at least once a month now. If you park on the street, throw at least an hour of change in meter. They do have parking in the back lot but that can fill up quickly. Such a great place! Oh and they also gave me a little goodir bag today for my first visit. Sweet! Thanks for this gift of a store!!

24.description: This is a pretty good consignment shop. I don't get what some of the other reviewers are saying about the prices; they seem reasonable to me. For instance, a Banana Republic wrap dress, with tags still on it, was $28. They have a wide range of styles, so yes, there may be some "old lady" clothes, but everything is in great condition. No stretched-out Target Mossimo tees for $18 here. If it's a Gap tee, it's in perfect condition and priced  - at the most - at $8. They have plus sizes, kids clothes, and household items, as well. And a good shoe selection.  Lots of handbags.

6.description: You will not find a better consignment store! Joanne, the owner, takes pride in her store and it shows! Love her and love everything about the store. A don't miss if you're in the Chicago area.

22.description: I've been going to My Sisters Closet since it opened (about 28 years ago!)   One of the best resale shops around, and they are always having sales, so you walk out spending under $100 and get bags full of great things.  Yes, its true, you do have to get past the piles on top of the counter- but the clothes are organized by color and size.  I'm under 40 and think i'm pretty trendy, and I always find things that are cute, and also professional.  I don't look at any of the brick-a-brack since thats not my thing, but there is something for everyone.  The owner, Joanne is one of the sweetest people -she loves what she does and loves her customers.

15.description: I love this place, the people whom shop there are nice. Thus the people who work there! A nice overall experience!

7.description: Update: I take back my comment on the ease of  the consignment policy. And they really need to get their shit organized elsewhere, not on the retail floor. If it isn't for sale, don't put it on a fucking rack and then harp at me for not knowing it wasn't for sale. I'm surprised they haven't been shut down for fire code violations, with all the disorganized mess clogging the aisles. These old biddys can go to hell. In fact, I'm so pissed, I'm not sure I'll shop there anymore.I've shopped consignment and thrift and all sorts of resale all over the country since I was a kid. This is by far the best I've ever been to. I spend an average of $12 an item, which is kinda pricey for used, but the names, current styles, and super organization of styles, colors, sizes make it worth it. Their consignment policy seems very user friendly too. There is free parking in the back.And they are open til 8 on Fridays.

8.description: I have been here a few times and the only thing I ever buy is something new!  It  is in my EDGEBROOK neighborhood, not Lincolnwood.  I keep thinking it will be better.   Good, not great, selection of jewelry.  But, pricey and I'm not cheap!I have brought items here and I have no idea what their criteria is because I shop at Nordstrom, Ann Taylor, Chicos and what I consider good stores and it seems want my Target finds more.  I end up leaving with most of my items not wanted.  It's crowded and messy.  I keep wondering why they don't expand into the empty space next to them.

30.description: This store it great!  They have nice clothes in good condition.  They don't have any mens clothes, but they have women's, children's, and maternity clothes.  There is a small selection of shoes, lots of jewelry, and some cosmetics.  It's great to catch them during a sale.

3.description: You'd think if a store takes an ad out in the local paper to celebrate their 3rd Anniversary in their expanded space and said ad mentions refreshments and music, that when I arrive an hour after opening, I'd be met with a cheery hello and an offer of refreshments. You would be wrong. They didn't even have the radio on. I spent over half an hour browsing and not once did anyone smile at me, make me feel welcome or bother to unwrap the cookies and other foodstuffs sitting on a counter. I even mentioned to the elderly cashier how nice it would be to have a cookie since lunch time was approaching. Clueless. Also, my friend and I stumbled over containers placed along the aisles up front. Really?! Why risk a law suit? Jut put your bins in back! I found only 3 things somewhat reasonably priced (compared to ebay) and it was nice to try them on in the ample well-lit dressing stalls (can't do that online). All we got was 10% off. Big whoop. Will I return? All signs point to "NO."

14.description: Forget what I've said before were my favorite stores, this is the best resale shop I have ever been to.  For years I've admired my girlfriend's Anthropologie-like boho chic finds from here but never made it over.  I often find consignment shops overpriced, dated and disorganized.  This one is none of that.  The clothes are all practically new and, for the most part, up to date.  I especially like the Chico's rack.  It has more selection than the clearance rack at an actual Chico's.  I bought 8 blouses and jackets for casual Fridays at work and spent  $90.  The most expensive item was a like-new $14 Chico Jacket that originally sold for about $100.  I am not sure the younger 20 somethings are going to like this place.  The neighborhood and the store are for a bit older crowd.Also, the two staff working didn't seem to like each other at all and were kind of rude to each other which was wierd.

1.description: Has Tropical Beach closed??  I drove past the other day only to see a For Rent sign in the window.  :o(  Hoping it's just a move to a bigger location!

0.description: VERY disappointing but YES I do believe that after more than 8 or 9 maybe even 10 years this awesome tanning facility has shut its doors."Monty" was the owner and trust me, this man was the last HONEST man in the tanning industry.His beds were well maintained but most importantly he was always honest about keeping the bulbs up thus this was the ONLY tanning place where I actually got a tan!!!He was a genuinely friendly person, honest and hardworking, plus his longstanding employee (female, but sorry cannot remember her name) was honest and friendly as well.Sorry to see this place go, I won't waste my dollars anywhere else -beware ladies if the bulbs have too much graying at the ends they are only exuding light but you are throwing your money away.Somehow Monty just kept his beds working great - the place was always clean as well with convenient parking in the back.Hopefully he will re-open at a future time and location.

58.description: this place is meh.  not terrible...not great.  just good enough for some bar food in the middle of the day or if you're in the neighborhood.  we did some beers all around and some appetizers.  thought it was weird they had some sort of irish spring roll.  but everything was ok and the service was good.

56.description: Pretty good bar food, great deals and good selection of beer. It's nice to have an independent place like this in Edgebrook.I've been here a few times and have always been pleased with my visit. They don't do anything incredible but they'll satisfy your needs. Edgebrook needed a watering hole desperately to give us haven from the chains over in village crossing. If you're looking for a place to knock a few back before going home, stop by Moher.

29.description: My favorite dish is the Irish Breakfast. It is not always served in a consistent form, which seems to be the biggest issue with most of their dishes.Shepherd's Pie can use a little more flavor. Corned Beef & Cabbage is also inconsistent in taste.The Irish Nachos are a really tasty appetizer but probably more so because I like to eat that type of dish.The drinks are quite good- they know how to make a good Spicy Bloody Mary and Mimosa. I swear they used to have Boddington's on tap but they said they never had it when I ate there a month ago.Good place to eat breakfast and to relax and watch sports. Good Irish pub ambiance that is never too crowded. I don't enjoy waiting for my meals unless they are earth-shattering!

42.description: Moher now has new owners and a new chef.  He was the chef at Pier 57 on Elston Avenue by Central for years.  We went on the 1st day of new ownership; the food was good even then, and that is a tricky time.  The new owner (Gus) swears they are going to get healthier food than just a bunch of bar/fried foods, which will be nice.  Then we went 11 days later.  I had some of the best soup; it was salmon and crab, really good, fresh, and homemade.  Not the gelatinous mass that chowders so often are.  We split the chicken/rib combo, which was enough for both of us and then some.  Very good rendition.  The other special which I will try next was white fish with a lot of veggies/stuff (technical term) on it that sounded good.  We look forward to going more as they transition to the new theme of good bar, good food, good prices, and good company.  And the Guiness was excellent.  Sometimes bars have beer that is past its prime, but this was just right.  Guiness sure does fill you up!

23.description: I was at Moher last night.  The band was so loud , I couldn't think straight.  Terrible. The owners gave us the private back room , which was nice,  but we still couldn't talk.

47.description: I've been here a number of times, first time writing the review. The ambiance is very friendly and welcoming. There is a decent selection of beers on tap and by the bottle, the menu has a decent sized selction of items for you to order from. I tried the burger, when ordering it they told me they couldn't make it rare for me, at this red flags should have beern popping up in my head but it didnt. When the burger came out, it looked like a frozen patty someone tossed on the grill. The burger itself lacked flavor, whole lotta juice and fat and nothing else. On other occasions I have tried the steak boxty, which I have to admit was quite flavorful and juicy.  I recommend the all you can eat fish and chips on Fridays, the fish is tender and not overcooked in batter like other places I know.  Lastly on Thursday nights is trivia night, great for groups or individuals, if you are among the top winners you get a certain amount taken off your bill.

8.description: Awesome and friendly places...customers and staff alike.  Really relaxing experience and the owner is quite social and very much into help the community of Edgebrook.   Live music sounds fun, and I hear food is good too.

31.description: Changing of the owners did this place alot of good!  Out with the old and in with the new is what I always say.   Everything is different about this place now - the menu, the waitstaff, and the decor.  I am sad to say that the U2 poster is now longer there however (the previous owners must have took that with them!).  Bummer!So the menu:  A+.  I am a huge burger fanatic and this one is top notch.  They use fresh buns and don't toast the bread!  The meat is tender and juicy and the fries are great as well.   I heard the fish and chips is all the rave.  The service is excellent, and there is never an empty glass when we dine here.  Keep up the good work! :)

34.description: I don't know what happened to this great neighborhood place but...went there for lunch yesterday and my friend ordered a beer. HELLO!!! IRISH PUB...the beer was flat.  We looked at the date and the bottle was from August of last year. REALLY?  6 months old?  I should have said something but didn't because my friend drank the beer anyway and I didn't want them to think I just wanted something free.  I feel bad because I want our neighborhood places to be successful but they need to be good!

16.description: Give Moher's another look. We've lived through a few owners and this group is rockin it. Last night, I had the Moher's burger and it was one of the BEST burgers I've EVER had, anywhere.  My wife had the veggie sandwich and refused to share. Our daughter had mac and cheese and  loved ir. We carried out, though Moher's pub vibe is always good.

13.description: Has become my new go to local place. Really good food and the best tasting Smithwick's I can find (currently my preferred beer). Triva on Thursday nights is a good time. The whole staff and owners are really friendly. Great place to go with some friends for a chill night.

11.description: I went here with my friend for a few drinks and lunch over the summer. The Guinness was excellent and food was good, I loved the warm environment. Everyone seemed very nice. My friend is blind and he was treated well. When our food was delivered, the waitress described what was on his plate and where everything was on the table. That was some excellent service.

39.description: If you live in the neighborhood, you must check this place out! Great food, fast service and cheap beer. My husband and I went with my daughter at 6:30 on Friday night, all you can eat fish night. The place was crowded but we were sat quickly and had a Snakebite ($5) in hand within minutes. The fish ($11.95) was very good as was the shephards pie($10.95).  The owner and chef came by our table to ask if everything was ok. We will definitely go back.

37.description: After reading about a "Kidnapping/ Murder" plot in the Tribune and that the nefarious ex-cop, who was attempting to the perpetration of this crime, would pick up food here... I had to check it out.It's a nice looking, neighborhood place. Lots of clean and lighter colored woods, booths, good looking bar. Several TVs for the games.Turns out that Monday is $5.00 Burger Night and it comes with ALL the trimmings... Mushrooms, Bacon, Grilled Onion and choice of Cheese AND Fries. Some of the places that do a "$5 Special"... You get a puck of meat and a bun. Not here... And it's a very solid burger. Their Chipotle Mayo is really good.Guinness is a bit too cold, but properly poured pint. It's a nice neighborhood place. A bit West of my 'hood, but I like it. Glad to have stopped in and had a very tasty burger.

0.description: First and foremost this is a neighborhood bar, so I wouldn't go out of your way if you live in Lincoln park to get here.  But if you live in Edgebrook / wildwood / Sauganash and you haven't been here you need to get here.So I first stopped in here pretty soon after I moved here as I literally have to walk by it everyday from the train, and from the start the staff was nothing but welcoming.  The owners Gus and Jim do a great job of being friendly and welcoming to the new guests.Now that I'm a regular I am biased, but yes the food is great for Irish bar food.  If you go in expecting bar food, you will be pleasantly surprised.  It is kid friendly, my family goes there for dinner.  Tuesday's rock with their open mic and jam and the owners have really done a good job of getting decent bands in on the weekend.For the local neighborhood folk it's a great place to have fun on the weekend or to just stop by for a quick one on the way home from work.

51.description: WORST RESTAURANT IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD. If You're in the mood to be harassed by drunks this is the place for you. Food SUCKS, staff is rude, discourteous and nasty and the patrons are all drunks that will harass you if you're not partying with them. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. This is why Edgebrook should NOT have a Liquor License. If the alderman had any sense they'd revoke their license.

27.description: I don't typically expect much from pub fare but moher left me particularly dissatisfied. The waitress was completely clueless and somehow the kitchen managed to screw up everything that came to the table. Juice? Watery. Salad? Wilted. Soup? Filled with things I'm allergic to, after I asked about its ingredients. Shrimp? Sharp enough to cut my mouth open. Then our waitress seemed to make a point of avoiding us until we eventually came to the bar to pay. Steer clear of this place.

32.description: We stopped here on a snowy night when most people were tucked in their homes.  As a matter of fact, we were the only customers in the pub on this particular Tuesday evening.  It's an attractive pub, kept spotless and the service was terrific the night we were there.  I had the Guiness Beef Stew which was very good with nice chunks of beef in a hearty stew gravy.  It came with a nice puff pastry on top.On the downside, my wife ordered the corned beef sandwich.  The corned beef was dry and not very flavorful.  There wasn't much of it either.They pour a perfect pint at the right temperature.  I would come back for the libations and atmosphere but I'm not so sure I would order food again.

54.description: Came here with my family for a Sunday brunch. Everyone was excited at the prospect of eating a traditional Irish breakfast: Black and White pudding, baked beans, eggs, etc. For those who ordered the breakfast it was just OK. Nothing really special. I had the Chicken Club which had nothing memorable about it and neither did the Sullivan Steak Sandwich. I guess we should have had fair warning as there were only 2 other tables eating there. Can't say much good about this place other than the fact they have a fair selection of Irish beer on tap.

48.description: Well for starters let me just say I KNOW good food, and this place...Great!!I'm going to try and make this short and sweet.  Curry Fries- AwesomeWings w/ BBQ- DeliciousBut my favorite thing i had there all night was the Irish Sausages!!! These should be given to you when you get to the gates of heaven!! DEEP FRY + Sausage= Match made in heaven. So all in all, the food had much originality to it and I would recommend this to anyone just off the food...If that was all there was to compliment about, but its not. **The Staff**Now when I go into any place for the first time I am very picky about mostly everything because I hold a high standard. This place exceeded that above and beyond single handedly because of the staff.  When I went, there were two people working.  Niamh (who was my waitress) and Trish (who I believe was the manager and worked behind the bar).  These two people are so incredibly nice, attentive, and were so very helpful to accommodate me even though my indecisiveness can be annoying, they took it in stride! My food was served fast; my drink wasn't finished before I was asked if I wanted a refill. Which reminds me of there beer selection.  IT WAS EXCELLENT! Very in trend with the times and had everything I drink, plus more! Both Trish and Niamh were great and the both of them will be reason enough for me to come back and for all of you to go!!! Enjoy

44.description: We happened upon this place while house hunting in Edgebrook the other day.  We pulled into the parking lot on the side of the building around noon and saw a sign proclaiming "No parking here before 6pm."  However, there were several cars there, so we parked.  I ran inside and asked the waitress "Can we park out there...there's a sign that says we can't."  She said "Of course you can park out there, it's Saturday" as if this was clearly evident from the sign outside that mentioned nothing about excluding Saturdays or weekends.We liked the Irish pub feel of this place and settled into a booth near the front.  The restaurant was chilly inside and we soon wished we had sat closer to the fireplace.  My wife devoured her fried mashed potatoes and I loved my Turkey burger.  The buffalo chicken wings were just so-so.  I tasted the heat, but wished for more buffalo flavor.  The fries were quite good though.  The one somewhat annoying thing was that they only had 1 server for the entire restaurant and bar and the place got a bit crowded.  We had to wait quite a while for refills and service as she was busy attending to all the other guests.  I think if we had found a house we liked in the neighborhood, we'd likely be semi-regular visitors to this place.  It was a nice and laid-back pub that seemed family-friendly during the day.  I'd love to come back and try it for beers at night sometime.

24.description: Great, clean pub with friendly staff. Food is good and the atmosphere is inviting. Definitely give it a look.

7.description: The food is great pub fare, the beer selection could use some more crafts. However the friendly service and energy of the place make up for it.

49.description: would love to go here more often, especially on Friday or Saturday nights, as it's my neighborhood bar,  but the live music is way too loud to have a conversation. It's a small neighborhood  tavern, not a concert hall. Tone it down and you'd have more neighbors coming in on a regular basis.

40.description: While it pains me to do this, this place has gotten worse! The new owners have completely changed the menu and the food is not good anymore. The food seems very similar to what I would get at a Greek diner. I hope it changes for the better because I have loved going there for years, but it is gone down now!

53.description: Moher, it's been a long time and I'm happy that I stopped back in... You fed me with your delicious Spinach and Artichoke Dip (which is baked kinda like French onion soup) You're special of the night was Talipia with spinach and that's exactly what I wanted... Thank you Moher, you're so comforting, delicious, and your outfit is clean and cute (wink), way to go! I'll be back for more of your hospitality someday soon.

30.description: I am a huge Friday Fish Fry fan and in Chicago I have not found a great fish fry until I tried Moher last week. I did take out, but the fish was still outstanding when i got home. The batter is light and tasty. The fish is flakey and quality. The fries and coleslaw was good. The best part is it comes with soup or salad and I highly recommend the seafood soup! It was better than standard clam chowder. Overall, great place for friday fish.

46.description: A good enough bar for Edgebrook's only bar. It is yor typical Irish bar with above average food. Not the hugest place in Chicago, bt the place trys to be a msic joint with bands from time to time.

1.description: Went to Ireland several months ago, and this feels almost like a real Irish bar in some respects.  The servers are casual, dressed in street clothes, jeans, etc.  There were several regulars that seemed to know the staff by name, and the bartender knew them as well.  It's a cozy local bar.  The Guinness of course, was excellent.

55.description: Awesome atmosphere, stop by on thursdays for trivia night! If you win, you get a certain percentage off your tab

9.description: Love this place.  Great food, great music and awesome people.

26.description: The drunken cook has been removed so I may try again, although an Irish restaurant run by Greeks? I don't know. Wouldn't that be like a Greek restaurant owned by the Irish? Just seems like its an anomaly.

25.description: Chicago is full of Irish pubs, but what sets this one apart from the rest is it's hospitality. You don't need to be a "regular" to get the "regular" treatment.
