I have only been here a few times but it seems like they are very active with the local community, hosting a variety of events. Great mix of your standard Irish beers with local, craft beers. The place was booming on fish fry Friday. If the soup of the day is the creamy fish, definitely give it a try. The reuben sliders are killer too.

12.description: Really the best fish sandwich I have ever had. Fresh, not fishy. And the fruits were crazy good.

59.description: I have only been here on Saturday nights to see the Kingfish play, but always have a good time.  Their food is really good and they have some great drink deals.  The blueberry martini is quite good.I like that it has a neighborhood bar feel and the servers are all really friendly and don't have skin tight clothes on like you usually see in Northside bars.My only suggestion- that they put the meant underneath the cheese in their nachos.  Those nachos are impossible to eat b/c they have the cheese on the chips and you can't keep any meat on them.  I love the nachos but got frustrated that I had to eat the toppings with a fork and have the chips and cheese separate.

21.description: Great to have a nice Irish Pub in the neighborhood.Our kids love their kids menu - it's a nice family friend pub.Thursday night trivia nights are fun!

17.description: We stopped here on a snowy night when most people were tucked in their homes.  As a matter of fact, we were the only customers in the pub on this particular Tuesday evening.  It's an attractive pub, kept spotless and the service was terrific the night we were there.  I had the Guiness Beef Stew which was very good with nice chunks of beef in a hearty stew gravy.  It came with a nice puff pastry on top.On the downside, my wife ordered the corned beef sandwich.  The corned beef was dry and not very flavorful.  There wasn't much of it either.They pour a perfect pint at the right temperature.  I would come back for the libations and atmosphere but I'm not so sure I would order food again.

10.description: Great lunch joint.  cod sandwich with awesome Bloody Mary .  Kid friendly and pleasant service.  Don't let the location sway you.

5.description: Positives:The waitress and bar service were great.  They were both polite, knowledgeable, and personable.  I would definitely go back for their fish and chips plus the portion was a good size.I thought the interior decor was old school, but perfect for an irish atmosphere.  The restaurant was kid-friendly which is great for families in the area that want to go out to dinner.  The home-made soup was delicious but slightly over-salted.  They had Revolution IPA on tap.Negatives:The buffalo chicken flatbread was very dry and salty.  I know blue cheese can be a salty cheese but everything on it tasted salty.   Would not order again.I would have liked a few other craft beers on draft and maybe some drink specials other than the plain domestics.  All in all, we will be back.

3.description: This is a place you go to if you live in the neighborhood/area.  Not a "destination spot".  They do the perfect pours of draft beer and have good cocktails as well.  The burgers, sandwiches and soups are the best food items.  The fish is average and entrees are ok.  The service is always very nice and accommodating.  I would give four stars if the fish, sides and entrees were better.

35.description: - Have been there many many times.- Great service. Waitstaff and bartenders attentive and NICE!- Comfortable.- Parking is a breeze.- Food could be a little better ... would go much more often if food was better.

19.description: I got sick from whatever was in my curried fries last night.  I spit out a french fry and if I didn't know better, I would have sworn it was feces. It smelled very distinctly of feces but it looked like a normal french fry covered in curry sauce. I don't know what could have happened to make it smell and taste like that.  The owner was very nice about it and comp'd the meal, but that doesn't change the fact that I had this filth in my mouth and went home and threw up.I won't be returning.The waitress was really nice!

28.description: -Good staff.-food is terrible even for bar food.-no outdoor area. windows don't even open.-really dark almost too dark (that might just be a personal thing)-Order a red bull vodka and get something that doesn't even resemble red bull yet get charged the same.

45.description: I have made this mistake before. I will never use my groupon on the last day again. This place was packed. We had to stalk an elderly couple to take their seat as they got the bill. That's how packed it was. Our experience this time was not so good. I'm giving the service a pass since it was busy, but our food was pretty lousy. We went for the mussles...I know..poor choice for this place. The shells were busted up and the mussels were the opposite of fresh. They try to mask this by using some skanky clam chowder base as a broth. Tasted store bought. The shepard's pie which was good last time was pretty dry around the edges and not terribly warm. I wanted something different and the boxty seemed popular. Potato pancake in a savory sauce with meat and veggies. Sounds good on paper. but the potato pancake was a flavorless crepe, the veggies were cooked to a mush, and the same store bought clam chowder soup was ladled over it. Disappointing. We took most of it home to dump out. I'm giving them some leeway because of the amount of people, but this is more like a 2 star place. Should be named Lehess in stead of Moher..hehe..I know that's terrible.

33.description: Went here after a movie with 7 mature women from a book club. It was clean, the staff was very friendly and attentive, and we were able to talk around a table without shouting. It was great to be able to talk at length about books and movies without blaring music, servers in hooker garb, and creepy men looking for a hook up. Some drank alcohol, others soda, some ate appetizers. The food and drink selection was excellent and a good deal. So glad we found this place on the way back from Village Crossing Theatres!

43.description: My friend and I found ourselves around Forest Glen on a Sunday evening looking for a reliable meal and some cold beer. He's from Oregon, I'm from New York, and we were relying on reviews to steer us to something good. I'm glad we found the Moher!Wasn't too busy on a Sunday night and that was fine by us. The decor was warm and cozy, exactly what you'd expect from an Irish style pub. Beer selection was good, and the food menu looked interesting. I had a chicken boxty, which is a potato pancake rolled and stuffed with grilled chicken, vegetables, and sauce. It was delicous! It really hit the spot on a rainy, chilly evening.Bottom line: Service was good, the food was very good, and the prices were reasonable. It was very enjoyable, and if I'm in the area again, I hope to return (even on a Friday or Saturday night when I imagine its more lively). It's also not far from the Edgebrook Metra station.

2.description: Thursday, late lunch.  The lunch crowd was gone. The service was attentive and friendly.  I had the double bacon burger w fries and my vegetarian friend had a flatbread.  The burger was really good and the flatbread had more than enough toppings and resulted in a happy vegetarian.  Good value, very good meal.

18.description: I came here the day before St. Patty's Day and it was really crowded, which is awesome. I had never been here before so I came at the right time. Some girls did a dancing jig, I had a good burger and it was an overall great experience!

41.description: New chef and menu! We live right around the corner and I can't tell you how happy I am to see this place get a new chef. The food used to be terrible but the new menu is great and the food is delicious! If you live in the area you have to check it out.

52.description: We ordered sandwiches (veggie and pub burger) and the corned beef sliders appetizer,and all were very good, as was the service.  My son ordered peach cobbler and it was really disappointing, canned peaches covered in broiled torn white bread with a small scoop of ice cream, not very tasty and certainly not worth $4.99. =(

50.description: Good Irish sports pub. The menu is very Irish. The beer selection is varied, but all macro-brews. Great local pub very close to the Edgebrook Metra station and downtown Edgebrook. Fish and chips are pretty good. The burgers are good. The rest of the menu is Irish, which I am not, so I shall not judge. -1 star for this visit. One girl running the whole service spending time on the phone instead of cleaning and serving.

4.description: First time here had the 6 doller lunch special cheesburger with fries it was huge and very filling great location and good fun atmosphere  with good music and really good food

6.description: This is always a good pick for my wife and I when we are looking for a quick bite out.  I usually get the Shepherd's Pie and am never disapointed and my wife likes the coconut shrimp.The portions are large and you get good value for money.

22.description: I got sick from whatever was in my curried fries last night.  I spit out a french fry and if I didn't know better, I would have sworn it was feces. It smelled very distinctly of feces but it looked like a normal french fry covered in curry sauce. I don't know what could have happened to make it smell and taste like that.  The owner was very nice about it and comp'd the meal, but that doesn't change the fact that I had this filth in my mouth and went home and threw up.I won't be returning.The waitress was really nice!

15.description: I have to say the food has been 5 stars since Gus and Jim  has taken over..I have to recommend the burgers and fish and chips. The service has been excellent and so has the food... Keep it up gentlemen ...!!! You have a Sunday weekly customer ... Don't pass this one up on the top of our list !!!

57.description: I went here for dinner.I had the Pub Burger. The burger was very good. It was juicy and full of flavor.  The grilled onions and other toppings were all very good.The fries were pretty good.The restaurant / bar was clean and pretty quiet for a bar. The staff was really nice and helpful. I went fairly early, around 6pm and it wasn't busy yet.They do have a parking lot along the side. It can be used after 6pm. The problem is the lot is tight. I watched someone bump a car on the other side of the aisle. No damage, but I will not be parking my car there.I will return to try some of the other items on the menu.

20.description: I came here the day before St. Patty's Day and it was really crowded, which is awesome. I had never been here before so I came at the right time. Some girls did a dancing jig, I had a good burger and it was an overall great experience!

36.description: Everything about this place is good.  I have  ate there several times and always order the Irish BLT(so tasty), but my girlfriend actually tries different things.  She loves the burgers and  Irish Stew.  The service is great and the prices are reasonable. It's also a pretty good bar and has parking.

14.description: Been there twice with a friend who is a regular, so they are friendly as can be to us. Like the selection of beer, and whenever I can have my hackershore I am a happy camper. Food is good as far as bar good goes, and it's timely and priced right. It's my new local bar, so if I am not home look for me there with Patrick!

1.description: I have been going to this hair salon for many years now.  Edie is the best stylist I've ever had.  She listens to what I want and is very attentive to my hair needs.  She is pleasant and friendly and the shop is very clean and neat.  I can always get an appointment in a reasonable amount of time and she is very accomodating in that respect.

0.description: I walked in one day after watching several patrons leaving with great looking hair - of all ages. I love going to a salon where suggestions will be made by the stylists. Teresa is taking good care of my hair.  The staff is fun as well as professional. Great location. Parking behind at no charge.

58.description: I worked in the restaurant and bar business for about 15 years, in places ranging from Mother's to Nick's Fishmarket, and I like to think that I have developed a discerning eye when it comes to restaurants and bars. I have been to the Wildwood Tavern twice since they opened, and have come away with a smile on my face both times. Despite all the negative reviews that I have seen on Yelp about long waits, we did not experience this. In fact, the bartenders were extremely attentive and the wait staff gave prompt service with a smile, and the food was awesome. To me, if I have to wait for a table or for my food, just make sure that I have a drink in my hand and give me a nice place where I can decompress, which is exactly what we and everyone who was there with us got. I was also extremely impressed by how the owners dealt with the inevitable glitches that come with opening a new restaurant amid obvious excitement by the local clientele (as evidenced by the full parking lot both times we were here). These are seasoned restauranteurs and perfectionists who have an obvious love of the business and of taking care of their customers.    We will be going back again and again, and recommending it to family and friends.

56.description: The food, service and atmosphere here was great.  The restaurant must have worked out its kinks since opening because everything we ordered was delicious and did not take long to get.  Our server was Frank.  He was very hospitable and provided great service. Frank was very knowledgeable of the menu and knew how things were cooked and seasoned. The beef brisket and fish were delicious.  I would highly recommend this place for a gathering with friends and/or family.

29.description: Forget the early reviews, the opening night jitters are over, the food is fantastic, my go to place with a great bar for sports too.  We went sampler style, had a buffalo chicken pizza that's the best in the area now, so that was exciting to discover.   The smoke was outstanding, the brisket melted in your mouth and indeed was the best thing I've put in my mouth for some time.  Everyone shaking hands and visiting there, highly accommodating, truly pleasing.

42.description: Where do I start, no reservation when you call in. Not a big deal. The place looks cool from the outside then when you come into the restaurant it is plain as can be. High ceilings for very loud convos. It took sometime for the waitress to show up to our table. Once she did we tried to order drinks and the first two beers were out, one cider was out and so by the four try we got one In Stock. Why wouldn't you cross them off the list  or even better have them in stock.  You have been open for like three months and the waitress said there on back order. These beverages you can get a local liquor store. It took forever to get our drinks and then we see the bartender dancing behind the bar. The food took sometime to come out and the fries were soft. "Not cool." The pulled pork was salty as hell. At the end the bill was pretty expensive to say the least. This place I thought was going to be the place for BBQ.? I was sad over my experience

23.description: if you like being ignored by the waitstaff, Wildwood is the place for you! Would someone please tell me why--where you have an establishment on a corner where the previous four or five have failed and failed quickly--when you are seated at a table, you have to chase someone down to wait on you? So they're doing you a favor by passing you by and then taking your money after deigning to wait on you when they might feel the urge to do so? Spend your hard-earned money somewhere else.Ellie:  You're wrong.  You offered to buy us a round because we had been so shabbily treated, but you did not actually buy us a round. There's a difference.  We paid for everything we had.  So much for that.

47.description: my husband and I went to Wildwood Tavern on Friday night.  Service was terrible.  Very loud.  We ordered the chopped liver platter since we loved the chopped liver at Myron and Phil's it took a very long time for our waiter to bring it to us I had to ask him it was the worst chopped liver I have ever had.  I ordered the pork chops and my husband had the skirt steak sandwich.  My dinner came with a salad I asked for creamy garlic dressing on the side the dressing was so watered down it looked like colored water.  I asked for a dinner roll I was told that they are out of them.  We waited for a very long time for out dinner the owner was walking around stopping at the tables asking how things were I let him know service was terrible he asked what I ordered I let him know Pork Chops he said that takes 15 minutes to cook well we had been waiting an hour already.  They looked like they were cooked in a microwave and throw in a skillet for a minute it came with a cold baked potato and frozen butter.  my husbands sandwich was ok but luke warm and cold soggy fries.  Not once did the owner ask what he could do to make things better we paid out bill and left a small tip.  I am not sure if I will give them a second chance very doubtful.

8.description: Excellent food, nice atmosphere...attentive. A bit pricey but worth every bit!  Friendly staff. Will be back, recommended!!

31.description: Simple the best ribs I have ever eaten!!Service was even better!!Meet mark the manager and chief what a nice older man. Will be back many times this is are me favorite place!!!!

34.description: In a word....TERRIBLE!  I took my mom there today for a late lunch, dining room not very crowded at all, service should have been swift (it was not).  Menu looks fantastic, we were to find out otherwise.  Ordered 2 sandwiches, corned beef and the pulled pork.  It took forever to come out of the kitchen and when it did, the fries were cold as ice and mushy, not crisp.  Corned beef served on some kind of weird, thick sliced white bread which felt stale, and the meager serving of meat was tasteless...who ruins corned beef?   Pulled pork served on a pretzel bun with greasy cold fried onions, the pork was as tasteless as the corned beef.  Complained to the manager, who scurried away quickly, saying he'd bring out new sandwiches, which I really didn't want.  He didn't offer another choice, just brought the same bad sandwiches a while later and when I said I didn't know why he brought out new, he mentioned that we should take them to go.  I said I didn't want them and he said "just go".  An experienced & proficient manager would have found a way to turn a customer's dissatisfaction around, but he was just RUDE.  Even the busboy tried to apologize for him.  Never going back.

16.description: Decor - blahFood - blahAtmosphere- blah and oldBar - ColdMenu - is odd and very cheap looking.  It's only been open for a little while and the menus looked old and dirty.Cheap food with expensive pricesChicken Cesar salad - chicken was moist but rest of salad - blahRuben - corn beef was good but the rest was blah. Menu said thick cut rye, mine was not. Bread was soggy!Overall view....they need to work on decor, menu and get rid of their weird booths and old tables and chairs. Add some bar height tables in bar.It feels like a diner!  You have a beautiful building and your inside does not match.The 2 stars is because our waitress was sweet and even the bus man was helpful.Will wait to watch reviews, hopefully they are just figuring things out and will get better.

13.description: I not sure about this one.If I grade on a curve, the neighborhood really needs a bar like this that serves food. In reality, I stopped in for lunch and had the brisket. $19 for a fairly sparse plate- just meat and fries.  The meat was colder than it should have been and the mouthfeel was a little too gummy for me.  I love brisket and frequent Blackwoods downtown and Smoque BBQ in Old Irving Park. Don't get me wrong, Wildeood is a serious effort and a handsome room, but the food, especially for the price is just not that good. I'll visit again, but they are on negative watch.

11.description: Well what can I say but good things! We had such a good time here!! The waiter was soooo friendly and spot on!! The food was perfect!! We had skirt steak sandwiches and fried onions! Wow steak was done perfect and the bread was sooo fresh!! Congrats to Mark for opening this new place! We will return for sure and tell friends about this new gem!!

39.description: After reading the mixed reviews this restaurant has had since opening, my husband and I waited to go hoping they had worked out the kinks. As it was early this past Saturday we had no trouble being seated. Noticed how loud the music was in the bar so was glad we didn't have to sit in there. First negative thing I noticed when we were seated in our booth by the side windows was how dirty the shelf was next to the windows...not very appetizing while eating. Also my husband's seat was dirty so he had to use his napkin to wipe off.My husband ordered the fish and chips which he said was mediocre and not even close to the fish and chips at Moher's so that was a miss. I had the beef brisket which was pretty good although could have been hotter when served. Fish and chips was pricey @ $19; the brisket $18. So with one beer, our bill was over $47.We'll try it again to see if more kinks have been worked out. Also maybe they'll have the wall decor up by then.

37.description: Best food I have had in a really long time! We ordered the black bean soup, and brisket sandwiches. So tasty! Our service was incredible as well. I honestly am so impressed with our first experience. I cannot wait to return!

0.description: Went back twice in January, once with my daughter for a late lunch and once with my husband for dinner on a Friday night, and both were great.  All positive experiences so far.  I'm close to changing my rating to five stars -- Another good trip or two and I'll do it.I had the Reuben when I went for lunch, and it was great -- lots of corned beef, moist and flavorful.  I brought along my daughter for the first time (a college student, who's still pretty picky!), and she had the Adult Grilled Cheese.  She said it was AWESOME!  She's kind of a grilled cheese connoisseur -- She's ordered them all over the country pretty much all her life -- and she said this ranked in her top two best ever!  She showed it to me as she was eating it, and it was absolutely loaded and oozing with cheese.  She had the mac and cheese as a side, something she's especially extremely picky about, and she said while it was nothing remarkable, it definitely at least exceeded her basic standards.  From her, that's a great compliment!  I thought the best indication was that she told her brother, also a college student, that he would HAVE to go there the next time he's back in town!My husband was with me on the other visit, his third trip with me, and we both tried the Wildwood Tavern Ribs this time.  (The Myron & Phil's ribs, a carry-over from the owner's previous restaurant, are of the "chew off the bone" variety, which I don't care for, but I was anxious to try the "fall off the bones" WT version to see if I liked those better.)  I always ask for my ribs "dry," and get the sauce on the side.  I like the sauce okay, I just don't like ribs that are dripping in it.  To me, it's about the meat, not the sauce.  Our server cautioned me that they would have a bit of sauce on them, because they slow cook them and don't have any dry ones, but she promised they would be "almost like dry," and she was absolutely right.  I was very pleased.  On a scale of 1 to 10, where 1 is chew off the bone, and 10 is completely fall off, these were about an 8 -- still close enough to falling off for me, and very tender.  They were very easy to pick up and eat, and because they were "almost like dry," I didn't get a mess all over my hands, either.  My husband had sauce on his (we both chose the sweeter sauce) because he likes them that way, and he agreed that they were excellent.My only disappointment was that they were out of the Amarena cherries that are supposed to come in the Rye Guy Manhattan (my favorite of their cocktails that I've tried), but they compensated by bringing me four extra Maraschino cherries on a cocktail toothpick when I asked about the Amarenas.  I'd call that a fair trade!

38.description: Where do I start.  We heard that the owner is the Myron & Phil son.  Had to try it for that very reason and the fact that it's close to home.  Great location but for some reason restaurants never succeed here.  This one will not likely be the exception.  You walk in to a huge bar with televisions.  Lots of standing area.  Is it supposed to be a sports bar?  Not tonight.  It was empty with only a few people sitting at the bar.  Not much decoration.  Nothing really on the walls and nothing halloween.  Despite the boring decor and much older crowd, we remained optimistic and started off with the nachos after a long wait for a first greeting from our server.We should've left after eating the bland appetizer, but we carried on.  Not the worst nachos ever.  At least it had real cheese.  But a small portion and we all agreed to cross them off the list.We love french onion soup so we ordered it.  It tasted like they added marsala wine.  The taste was so dramatically changed from what we know as french onion soup that we couldn't eat it.  The uneaten soup was picked up later with no mention by anyone there.  Service continued to be very unattentive. My burnt onion steak sandwich wasn't bad but the fries were a little soggy and again the portion was a little on the small side.The Carolina Pulled Pork Sandwich sure sounded good on the menu but came up as bland as the restaurant decor.The menu really looks good and it seems like they are maybe trying to be the L Woods of Wildwood.  The BBQ selection looked good but with a couple of outstanding BBQ places not all that far away we would for sure eat BBQ elsewhere.So from our one visit it doesn't look like the Wildwood crowd approves.  And we won't be back.

51.description: My husband and I dined at Wildwood Friday evening, October 2. We thought everything was great. The large bar area is very impressive. As crowded as it was, it was easy to get a seat at the bar and have a cocktail while waiting for our table. I ordered a Merlot and it was 4oz., not 3oz. As someone posted. We were told it would be a 45minute wait for our table which is reasonable for a large busy restaurant without having a reservation, as anyone who dines out frequently knows. My husband had the salmon which he said was excellent, I ordered a cheeseburger medium rare and that's exactly how it came. The fries very good and our meal was hot and delivered in a reasonable  amount of time.  I noticed Mark the owner, went to every table checking on how everyone was doing. It was a very pleasant experience all around, and we will definitely by going back often.

27.description: Went there 4 times already and can't wait to go next Saturday. The food is great and the people are friendly and energetic. The first time I went was with friends, 4 of us, and we had a great time. I also took a group there when my son was in from CA. 14 of us, and the service and food was excellent. Keep up the good work!

32.description: Not sure why this place is getting such bad reviews. I don't know the "old place" or the old owners or how they are all related nor do I care. We had the tater tots for an appetizer and they were the best thing. I give them 10/10. I had the wildwood turkey club and my husband the chicken sandwich. They were both large portions and tasted good. We will 100 percent be back for some drinks and apps and to watch sporting events. The bar is set up perfectly for eating, drinking, and watching some good football. Service was fine for us. The place was full and we were in and out in like a hour. Any faster and I would have felt rushed! Come on people let's just take this place for what it is! It's not the "old place" it's a new place offering some great American food! You want people tending to your every need and fancy salads and 5 star steaks go to Ruth Chris or Gibsons  and pay 3× as much!

54.description: We had an excellent experience tonight at Wildwood tavern! My 1 year old loved his Mac and cheese and my skirt steak was outstanding. First time here and we will definitely be back! Excellent service and great beers on tap! Even the bus boys were at the top of their game. My in-laws had the ribs which they said were phenomenal.

48.description: aside from a friendly, energetic bartender wildwood does nothing for me.  ribs were absolutely mediocre and my steak was cold - aside from taking an enormous amount of time to be prepared,  i knew we were in trouble when the salad arrived and was "diner" quality.  the concept smart, the execution abysmal.  apparently, all of the thinks that myron and phil did well went up in smoke with the building.  once is enough - if you want good food.

44.description: Had drinks and dinner here on a Friday night.  The decor has potential but seems unfinished. Terrific drink and beer selection- the Spiegl is a must-drink beer. Server Frank was amazing- funny, gracious, knowledgable and helpful, a true host.  Other reviews raved about the bacon cheese tator tot appetizer; they were good but not at all what we expected. (Just not as fabulous as we felt led to believe.) There was no special presentation of any of the food. Just put on a dish and served, no garnish, nothing.  The brisket sandwich was Greek diner quality, not worthy of a bbq place. The ribs were good and the bbq pork pizza had potential but was a bit bland. Excellent crispy crust though.  We'd go back for the terrific beverage selection before the food.

24.description: Wow, that was definitely the worst $15 skirt steak sandwich I ever had, no flavor, few burnt onions, and very chewy. My sides were coleslaw, which was drowning in water and mac and cheese, it tasted like canned cheese sauce. My friend ordered the "BBQ" brisket, no taste of smoke at all, I think they try passing off the braised brisket as "BBQ". This place is not worth the money.

7.description: I went to lunch here with my friend today and we had such a great time! The owner was so nice and welcomed us with a smile to our table. We sat by a beautiful fireplace and enjoyed the warmth while we ate. Our waiter was a really smiley and nice guy who gave us the recommendation of eating the BBQ Brisket for lunch. Both of us followed his advice and we are so glad that we did, it was phenomenal. The pretzel bun was cooked to perfection and the brisket was delicious.  The right amount of sauce, the perfect texture to the meat, and SO much flavor! It was served with french fries and cole slaw that were really good. The fries are better than Portillos (which are my standard when it comes to fries). I don't eat coleslaw, but I ate the entire dish on my plate. I usually am offended by the flavor of coleslaw, but this just a really nice addition to the meal. I can see some people reviewed this with harsh thoughts and I have to say that I didn't share in their experience. Our food came out quickly, the environment was delightful, and the restaurant was full of people. I want to go back for their pizza sometime with my kids. I would say give it a try and I hope you will have as great of a time as we did.

49.description: Restaurant is newer but they have a long way to go.  Really wanted to love it but food was mediocore, service was terrible and tvs in bar area were awful if you're trying to watch a game or sporting event.  We were a group of four and sat in the bar area at one of the high tables as one of our party needed to sit there due to a leg issue.  We had to go to the bar to get our drinks refilled.  We waited an hour and 45 to receive our food and then when we got it not warm at all.  Waitress seemed to be trying but she was swamped with tables.  Bus boys did a good job of clearing plates.  Granted it was a Saturday night, but we arrived at 6 thinking it wouldn't be an issue to get in eat and get out, boy were we wrong.  Then games were on the bar tvs and they kept freezing up or going to blank screens.  Maybe a different provider for the tvs guys? Really wanted to like it as we loved Myron and Phils and we are in the neighborhood but was impossible.

40.description: I not sure about this one.If I grade on a curve, the neighborhood really needs a bar like this that serves food. In reality, I stopped in for lunch and had the brisket. $19 for a fairly sparse plate- just meat and fries.  The meat was colder than it should have been and the mouthfeel was a little too gummy for me.  I love brisket and frequent Blackwoods downtown and Smoque BBQ in Old Irving Park. Don't get me wrong, Wildeood is a serious effort and a handsome room, but the food, especially for the price is just not that good. I'll visit again, but they are on negative watch.

53.description: Stopped in for lunch during the week, got a seat at the bar, nice beer selection, plenty of room, after a couple of drinks decided to order lunch, ordered the skirt steak sandwich and must say it was excellent, came with fries and coleslaw and a pickle, the steak was tender and the onions were a perfect match, my new favorite place for steak sandwiches,great service, can't wait to go back

30.description: Stopped in for lunch today.  Fairly full. Nice holiday atmosphere going on.  Chicken noodle soup and a burger. Both were excellent.  Soup had a nice flavor of homemade chicken soup.  Burger on a pretzel bun, cooked perfectly and nice presentation. Some of the best fries I've had!   Food came out quickly and hot!No complaints here!

46.description: We were very happy with wildwood tavern and look forward to coming back! We live nearby and have seen several restaurants try here without much success. We were very hopeful to try wildwood tavern. We did try to go a few Saturday evenings but there was always a wait and so we kept putting it off. We just tried tonight on a Friday at 6 and while it was crowded, we didn't have to wait at all. As others have said we were non plussed by the decor. It reminded us of Shaker Village, very sparse, but my understanding is that they're still adding to the decor. Everything that is there is nice: woodsy and airy at the same time. Just needs more. Also no sound buffers so the noise was a bit much for us. The server greeted us right away and got our orders in quickly. The busser was also friendly and food and drinks came far quicker than we expected. A few minor glitches: we ordered ribs but didn't get paper napkins until we asked for them but that wasn't a big deal. The food was great. We each got a different one of their ribs. I had the ribs that actually have to be chewed off the bone which impressed me since most places in Chicago are fall off the bone ribs and I like a variety. All meat not gristle or fat. Good tangy sauce without being too spicy. My cocktail was delicious - whisky and lime and sweet vermouth, I think. A slightly complex drink with a lot of flavor. Corn bread came with the ribs and it was the kind I like: no chunks of jalapeños or corn kernels. We both substituted the baked potatoes for the fries and the potatoes were delicious- hot with crispy skins and sea salt, perfectly cooked inside. I really wanted to try dessert but we we both too full. We're looking forward to trying other dishes!

1.description: My wife and I came here for dinner on a weekend.  We had been anxiously waiting for the to open for months and were very excited when it finally did.  We sat at the bar and the bartender was very friendly.  It was very nice that when we inquired about a certain beer, he immediately gave us a sample in a very cold small glass.  (beer always tastes better in a very cold glass)  Unfortunately, once we ordered the beer, the larger glass, was slightly warm, which changed the flavor slightly.  One daily special was a half order of the onion strings.  This is great because no one should ever eat a full order of those things.  They arrived hot and tasty, unfortunately they really needed a dipping sauce, or dipping trio.  That would bring definitely improve the overall satisfaction with the item.  But, after eating them for awhile, without anything but ketchup, the flavor got old.   We also ordered the homemade veggie burger.  The fact that it was homemade was appreciated because it's really easy to screw up something as easy a a veggie burger.  Unfortunately, the taste simply wasn't there.  It was very large... but extremely dry.  Again, it was in need of a signature sauce to liven it up.  It needed avocado and something.... to give it some flavor.  Seating at the bar was comfortable although usually we dine with our two kids and wish there was booth sitting for families.  The people next to us at the bar ordered the wings and seemed to really enjoy them.  People were friendly and service was great.  Suggestions:  serve the beer in frosted glasses, have more IPAs on draft, create some more signature sauces and vegetarian options.

55.description: This was my second time here. My first time was the Friday night the first week they opened. Things didn't go well from a service standpoint. However, tonight when we went back it was excellent! The food was super delicious. We had ribs, skirt steak and whitefish. All were fabulous! The service was also fantastic. Our waiter was quick and attentive. They have an awesome bar with many craft beers on draft. The ambiance is very warm and inviting. We will be back often! Awesome place. Don't listen to any reviews on this place that were written the first month they were open.

9.description: Solid neighborhood spot. Great bar area with lots of new TV's. Homemade ribs are hit. Burgers, big salads  and good entrees. Locally owned and friendly staffed.

26.description: The $15 burger had a mushy soaked bun which made it impossible to eat with your hands as it slid apart. The wait staff removed the plates while we were still eating. The white fish ordered Cajun was very fishy tasting. We were looking forward to the French onion soup which was not that special but tasted ok. Overall the restaurant is overpriced.

25.description: Solid neighborhood spot. Great bar area with lots of new TV's. Homemade ribs are hit. Burgers, big salads  and good entrees. Locally owned and friendly staffed.

12.description: I recently took my family to Wildwood Tavern for the first time.  I have been a long time fan of Mark's family's prior restaurant Myron and Phils.  I was very happy to see a lot of the items from the old restaurant on Wildwood Taverns menu. Some of the items were the Myron and Phils barbecue ribs which my wife ordered and said they were fantastic. The original chop liver, Skirt steak with burnt onions which is one of my favorites. Mark also added a lot of new items onto the menu including their smoked ribs, pizza and a lot of other great items.  I had the hamburger with the burnt onions that night and it was absolutely fantastic. I let my daughter try some of the burnt onions and she kept eating them all off my plate.  The service was fantastic and I highly recommend that you try this restaurant. If you want to watch a sporting event they have a gigantic bar with multiple TV screens.

59.description: The restaurant is nice, service was slow but servers very friendly. The steak sandwich was tender with flavor. Stay away from the corned beef sandwich. Very dry and no flavor. I would eat here again.

21.description: Absolutely love the atmosphere. It was very cozy and comfortable. I went there for lunch with my cousins, husband and 2 1/2 year old daughter. Our server was knowledgeable and attentive. Food is definitely above the average bar food menu. Kids menu was a plus. Some of our favorites: pizzas, fried pickles, steak sandwich, the Reuben and anything off the BBQ menu. Oh, and I can't forget about the bread pudding for dessert. The best I have ever had. There is a big beautiful bar area separate from the restaurant, so we will definitely be back to watch some games. Can't wait to come back!

17.description: I worked in the restaurant and bar business for about 15 years, in places ranging from Mother's to Nick's Fishmarket, and I like to think that I have developed a discerning eye when it comes to restaurants and bars. I have been to the Wildwood Tavern twice since they opened, and have come away with a smile on my face both times. Despite all the negative reviews that I have seen on Yelp about long waits, we did not experience this. In fact, the bartenders were extremely attentive and the wait staff gave prompt service with a smile, and the food was awesome. To me, if I have to wait for a table or for my food, just make sure that I have a drink in my hand and give me a nice place where I can decompress, which is exactly what we and everyone who was there with us got. I was also extremely impressed by how the owners dealt with the inevitable glitches that come with opening a new restaurant amid obvious excitement by the local clientele (as evidenced by the full parking lot both times we were here). These are seasoned restauranteurs and perfectionists who have an obvious love of the business and of taking care of their customers.    We will be going back again and again, and recommending it to family and friends.

10.description: My family and I decided to give WT another chance last night after first trying it this summer and being extremely disappointed (service was non-existent, food was so-so).  Unfortunately, after last night I dont think our family will be coming back.  Service was much improved, but several things bugged us.  First, a fire alarm went off just as we got our food.  Our kids freaked out.  This went on for about 15 minutes blaring in our ears and really not being told anything or what to do (leave? stay?).  Our food was so so again.  I got the WT "fall off the bone" ribs.....they were not fall off the bone.  My wife ordered a chop salad with quinoa.  There was no quinoa, but rather pasta.  The kids had chicken fingers and mac and cheese.  Kind of hard to mess that up.  Anyways, out comes the bill.  No mention of the 15 minutes of blaring alarm going off.  No comps, nothing.  Very disappointing.  We wont be back again.

5.description: Great customer service, seated in minutes when arrived at 5pm, onion loaf delicious, chicken soup -just like grandma used to make!! Brisket really good a lot of meat, great cornbread, Reuben excellent!

3.description: I am really disappointed when it comes to this Yelp review. I've been waiting forever for Wildwood Tavern to open. They have a promising menu but their chefs are inconsistent. See photo of my sad burger. Why oh why have a beautiful delicious egg on top of a burger if you're just going to over cook it. Why order a beautiful medium rare burger when you're going to get one that is well cooked. Not medium rare! Sadly this has not happened to me just one, but 3 times. On the third time I decided to write my review. Please Wildwood Tavern,  you have the opportunity for great things, you just need to get a better cook. Don't over cook your meat and definitely don't over cook your eggs. Also you need help on your waitstaff in the bar area. I feel that he was way overworked, by himself and trying to help way too many people at the bar to give decent service to the rest of us.

35.description: Our new favorite place. Food was amazing! Yes, it has amazing BBQ, but you have to try the Pizza (Yes Pizza!)  FANTASTIC! The Onion Loaf is Great! Coleslaw (sweet) Delish! We also tried Skirt Steak sandwich, Brisket, and Wildwood Ribs. Needless to say EVERYTHING was Great! If you haven't tried it yet, just Go!Great Bar area!Casual comfy atmosphere!2 great party rooms! Super local Restaurant!

19.description: We've been waiting for a year to have this venue open. Gave them a couple of weeks to get the bugs out. 6 of us went last evening. Loved Myron and Phil's and expected similar food...guess not. Bar food is great if done well. Not the case here.They don't take reservations. We waited forever for a table the hostess said would clear soon. 20 minutes later, we asked for another table and were seated.  We were taken to the back of the restaurant, which was so loud we could hardly hear each other, there was also a large party seated in the room. Oversize, crinkled paper menus were presented, only one had wine and beer list on the back. The server who announced she was under 21 and knew nothing about wine (her statement) finally got us a beer menu. Drink order taken,10 minutes later drinks arrive. Beer served in a Cognac glass, don't understand. ** Strike OneDinner order taken. Another long wait for entrees arrive. Chicken order served cold, Corned Beef sandwiches, very dry, no condiments provided, mostly uneaten.  Brisket orders 2 okay, 1 looked like it was shavings from the other two orders...fries were inedible. Coffee ordered, 2 Regular served cold, 2 Decaf were fine...no desserts were ordered.  **Strike TwoAmbiance was just okay, (very clinical looking) artwork sitting on floor not hung. Wall cases, meant for collections of books and objects, empty, no draperies to deaden the loud din in the whole restaurant. Service was mediocre at best, server was nice but needs to be trained. The bill was $210.00 including an undeserved generous tip.  Seems to me the place opened before they were ready. **Strike ThreeSadly, we won't be back. We had hoped for a great neighborhood spot for drinks and casual dining, this is not that place.

28.description: We went to Wildwood Tavern today for lunch for my birthday with my in-laws and preschool age son and had a wonderful meal. They had a nice kids menu and brought our sons food out right away which is always great with hungry little ones. Between us we ordered the club sandwich, patty melts and the pulled pork. All were very well proportioned and tasty. Pulled pork on pretzel roll especially good.  All food and drinks came in a very timely manner. The hostess and our waiter were very helpful and friendly. We brought our own dessert and our waiter had it plated up nicely for us and then brought it out with a candle for me. The owner came out to check on how things were too. Just a really nice meal out. So glad they are in the neighborhood!

45.description: It's Ok but they we least time visit this place Food was not bad, but very greasy and we waited quite a long time ... tight for a lot of tables and service there is no way to work ... you have to go and find out that...

33.description: Enjoyed my dinner, pork chops, broccoli, applesauce.  Loved the chicken noodle soup.  My husband liked the original ribs because he likes them chewy, not fall off the bone.  Cornbread was fabulous.  This was overall a great experience!

43.description: So it appears that opening day was a disaster all around. My family tried it again and it was outstanding.

2.description: Where do I start.  We heard that the owner is the Myron & Phil son.  Had to try it for that very reason and the fact that it's close to home.  Great location but for some reason restaurants never succeed here.  This one will not likely be the exception.  You walk in to a huge bar with televisions.  Lots of standing area.  Is it supposed to be a sports bar?  Not tonight.  It was empty with only a few people sitting at the bar.  Not much decoration.  Nothing really on the walls and nothing halloween.  Despite the boring decor and much older crowd, we remained optimistic and started off with the nachos after a long wait for a first greeting from our server.We should've left after eating the bland appetizer, but we carried on.  Not the worst nachos ever.  At least it had real cheese.  But a small portion and we all agreed to cross them off the list.We love french onion soup so we ordered it.  It tasted like they added marsala wine.  The taste was so dramatically changed from what we know as french onion soup that we couldn't eat it.  The uneaten soup was picked up later with no mention by anyone there.  Service continued to be very unattentive. My burnt onion steak sandwich wasn't bad but the fries were a little soggy and again the portion was a little on the small side.The Carolina Pulled Pork Sandwich sure sounded good on the menu but came up as bland as the restaurant decor.The menu really looks good and it seems like they are maybe trying to be the L Woods of Wildwood.  The BBQ selection looked good but with a couple of outstanding BBQ places not all that far away we would for sure eat BBQ elsewhere.So from our one visit it doesn't look like the Wildwood crowd approves.  And we won't be back.

18.description: Underwhelming.They spent ages remodeling the facility and frankly, the money was not well spent.  What used to be a warm and inviting environment with rich warm colors is now mostly white and clinical looking.  The decorative shelving was bare.  Don't think I saw a single plant or fabrics or artwork.  Considering the Myron & Phil's legacy, a picture of the men and maybe a plaque with their story would have been a nice touch.The menus are flimsy paper and on par with a fast food joint, not a quality restaurant.The menu is rather limited. Don't bring your vegetarian friends, as their are few options. We split a Caeser salad, which was generously sized and can easily be shared.  It took a long time to arrive, and we were less than halfway through before our entrees arrived.  With ribs that were warm, but not hot and french fries that were almost room temperature.I was debating between ribs and brisket and went with the ribs, since they came with cornbread (mmmmn!).  When the meals were delivered, we asked where the cornbread was, and told they were out. The server said he'd 'make it up to us'.  He never did.What would have reasonable would have been to let us know they were out of cornbread when we were ordering and simply ask if we'd like a different side in its place.The ribs were adequate, but only average, and for a place that seems to focus on this as their signature dish, it should have been far better.  Sauce tasted commercial and prepackaged.We had to ask for moist towelettes and were told they were out. This is a staple item for a rib place. The waiter creatively wet some paper napkins and brought them on a plate.  Seriously guys, Costco is 4 blocks away. You couldn't have sent someone to make an emergency run?We had to wait over 15 minutes for the check after we told the server we were finished. When he brought it, he did apologize for the delay and explained he got tied up by the kitchen. They've only been open a few weeks and every place has hiccups, but this is a place run by very experienced restaurateurs.    I'll give it another chance and update this review if things better, but so far, meh.[ALSO: Not that YELP is unreliable and easily abused or anything....Please notice the 5 star reviews from Alaska and California.  These "reviewers" have only 1 posted review.  Totally not a paid posting or a shill review, right?]

41.description: For Thursday night it was quite crowded. The Decore has been redone and it has lightened that being said they can dim the lights a little bit   We were greeted and seated immediately and our drinks arrive within five minutes. Patricia was our waitress and the hostess. Karen had the Wildwood Burger rare and it was grilled to perfection The burnt onions were very good.  The only complaint was that the egg was not runny. I had the ribs and chicken combination and it was Fall off the bone and moist. The coleslaw was good mac & cheese was Velveta and the cornbread was so-so.  We placed a carry out order for the kids at home. Which arrive within 10 minutes. Can't say anything about the beer or other cocktails we just had wine and pop.  No room for dessert either. Portions were decent size. They have an onion loaf on the menu and I would like to try it next time. Based on the previous reviews we were hesitant on coming here but it looks like they worked out the kinks and we would come back.

52.description: I visited this restaurant for the first time Friday evening. We decided to order the half slab ribs and the "famous" Myron and Phils skirt steak which was the highest priced item on the menu for $28.00. We ordered it medium. First we were brought a dinner salad that had romaine lettuce that looked like it was turning brown and a quarter of a tomato. It was a nondescript sad salad. Then came the ribs and skirt steak. The skirt steak was well done and thrown on the plate with no presentation whatsoever. We told the waiter and he had another one made. The ribs had no meat on them and only 5 ribs. Kind of a small half slab - the taste was nothing to write home about. All and all I think this restaurant is overpriced and needs to work on getting the order correct.

50.description: Great craft beer. Good burger. Smoked brisket was not smoked. Service terrible. Maybe won't come back.

4.description: Well, that was a swing and a miss!  Gave newly opened Wildwood a try, despite the mixed reviews because 1) we're in the neighborhood and like to support local restaurants, and 2) we'll try anything once and wanted to see for ourselves.Though the wait on a Friday night was quoted at 20 minutes, we were seated in 15.  Our friendly waitress took our drink and food order, and then the waiting game began.  The clock ticked... and ticked... after 30 minutes, we noted that we hadn't spotted our waitress since she took our orders and hypothesized that she was perhaps helping the (clearly behind) kitchen with the food prep.  Grand total wait time before our food arrived was a whopping 50-55 minutes, and to prevent ourselves from getting hangry, our activities included, but were not limited to: observing that the interior of Wildwood looks like a reformed ski lodge, debating whether to start eating the ketchup on the table, daydreaming about Culver's, and noting the energetic acoustics/noise level. After the painstaking wait for the food, our entrees that arrived did not make it worth it.  Brisket was very bland and underseasoned, the baked potato tasted stale, and the side of broccoli was forgotten.  Had my husband not just come from a grueling crossfit workout, he would not have had it in him to finish his meal.  And that's saying a lot, for someone I've never seen decline any food placed within a 50 foot radius. People tend to eat with their eyes first, and my 10oz prime rib special was not much to look it.  The meat was just as chewy and lumpy as it looked, and something about the mac 'n cheese was off.  Not only did it taste like it was made from a box, but it had a strange banana/fruity off-flavor.  I packed my leftovers to go, but they ended up in the trash the next day.  #justcan't Though this restaurant looked like it could be the L. Woods of Niles, I would not recommend it.  I can't remember the last time I've been so unsatisfied and disappointed in a meal.

6.description: Our first visit was ok. The environment was pretty much the same as the other incarnations of this location. The service was very prompt and friendly. I had the steak sandwich and the hubby had a burger. I ordered a side of chipped liver to take home.The steak was good, the burger was ok and the liver was decent , but kind of skimpy. We'll probably give it another try.

22.description: Wow!  Waited til they got their act together!! Great service. Great bar. Great food.  If you loved m&p's you should give it a try. they took the best of what Myron and Phil's had to offer and added pizza and barbecue to the menu. I hung out to watch the Blackhawks play and it is a teriffic place to watch sports!

15.description: The service was very good. The servers were attentive, as was the management. I had their burger with an egg, grilled onions and bacon.  My wife had a buffalo chicken sandwich and a chicken noodle soup. My aunt had their ribs. All of it was pretty bland. I like my food HOT. Unfortunately the foos was warm. I did like their Carolina BBQ sauce that was available on the table. The decor also seemed very minimal. I did not feel like there was much to create ambiance or make it feel cozy. All in all I would not choose to come back. The service was good.

57.description: Since the restaurant is so new I am giving it a higher rating - but hoping that they will work out the kinks. Our meal (4 persons for lunch) was under-whelming. The waiter was very busy so after our meal was delivered we never saw him again -  we would of loved another round of drinks. Suggestion is to delete some items on the menu and focus on your strengths. A couple of sandwiches were great but the chop salad was all lettuce. Will revisit after a few months. We are really hoping for an improvement - great location, nice interiors and lovely outside dining.

20.description: I went to lunch here with my friend today and we had such a great time! The owner was so nice and welcomed us with a smile to our table. We sat by a beautiful fireplace and enjoyed the warmth while we ate. Our waiter was a really smiley and nice guy who gave us the recommendation of eating the BBQ Brisket for lunch. Both of us followed his advice and we are so glad that we did, it was phenomenal. The pretzel bun was cooked to perfection and the brisket was delicious.  The right amount of sauce, the perfect texture to the meat, and SO much flavor! It was served with french fries and cole slaw that were really good. The fries are better than Portillos (which are my standard when it comes to fries). I don't eat coleslaw, but I ate the entire dish on my plate. I usually am offended by the flavor of coleslaw, but this just a really nice addition to the meal. I can see some people reviewed this with harsh thoughts and I have to say that I didn't share in their experience. Our food came out quickly, the environment was delightful, and the restaurant was full of people. I want to go back for their pizza sometime with my kids. I would say give it a try and I hope you will have as great of a time as we did.

36.description: I recently took my family to Wildwood Tavern for the first time.  I have been a long time fan of Mark's family's prior restaurant Myron and Phils.  I was very happy to see a lot of the items from the old restaurant on Wildwood Taverns menu. Some of the items were the Myron and Phils barbecue ribs which my wife ordered and said they were fantastic. The original chop liver, Skirt steak with burnt onions which is one of my favorites. Mark also added a lot of new items onto the menu including their smoked ribs, pizza and a lot of other great items.  I had the hamburger with the burnt onions that night and it was absolutely fantastic. I let my daughter try some of the burnt onions and she kept eating them all off my plate.  The service was fantastic and I highly recommend that you try this restaurant. If you want to watch a sporting event they have a gigantic bar with multiple TV screens.

14.description: Great menu, food, and service.  Superb bar (Moscow Mules in a genuine chilled copper cup!).  They do have a sound problem (too loud) but supposedly are working on that.  Plenty of parking.  Looks like that corner location will FINALLY work out for a restaurateur.

58.description: Service was great and friendly. (I'm always impressed when the owner/chef comes out of the kitchen to talk with customers!) Started with the calamari which was tasty. Enjoyed the Rigatoni con Zuucca upon recommendation by our server, although my dining partners were more impressed with their chicken parm and Cavatelli than I. Good Italian food is pretty prevalent in the Chicagoland area, but this place stands out in the Edgebrook neighborhood.

56.description: Great service in a friendly space, where everyone is treated like they are a regular. Love the layout that includes a long bar should you just want to drop in. Everyone enjoyed their pastas and main dishes...recommended by more than one neighborhood friend.

29.description: I have been here a half dozen times or so, and this is one of the most friendly, savory, quaint establishments in all of Chi-town area. John the owner rocks, Devon and Greg as servers only add to the ambiance and food quality and presentation here. The meals are outstanding, and I've sampled many a plate. There are few restaurants I recommend and post; this is one of them. Enjoy!

42.description: If you are looking for a well prepared meal in the Lincolnwood area, this is a great choice.  I have been three times now and have had a chance to navigate the expansive menu and try nightly specials. In general, it is well prepared, contemporary Italian.  Some of the specials are more ambitious and worth a try.  We have had pasta, risotto, meat and fish dishes and across the board they have been well prepared.  The wine list has solid, moderately priced options.  My one knock is the room itself, which has little character and together with the bright lighting provide an atmosphere that doesn't match the well prepared food.   That doesn't seem to deter a crowd comprised primarily of locals who pack this place on weekends.

23.description: The food at this restaurant is mediocre.  I don't understand the raving reviews.

47.description: I love the bread..  and crab cake appetizer. It's really delicious. :) the ravioli is good and doesn't make you feel to heavy.

8.description: Really enjoy this place! Close to the burbs which is helpful for us individuals longing for better, non-chain food options.My favorite thing was the grilled octopus appetizer. The octopus came with a nice half of grilled lemon and a wonderful salad with roasted peppers. It was so good that we ended up ordering another one to share during dinner.We went with another family whose daughter is in the same class [at pre-k] with ours. I was so happy because although the place is small and quaint the wait staff was so warm and welcoming to children. I really appreciate when I can get the best of both worlds [kid friendly and good food!].The options for the kids was simple but good: choice of pasta, choice of sauce and then a choice of a meatball or not. The meatball was delicious.For the adults we ordered the handmade Cavatelli alla Boscaiola [which was good but probably could have used one more minute in the boiling water - I know handmade pasta is a different texture/consistency and more delicate to cook, but i stand by when I think it could have used one more minute], an order of the Linguini alla Pescatore con Finocchio [which smelled really good but I did not taste] and finally Gnocchi alla Prosciutto e Pisselle alla Gorgonzola [which was also good].All in all a wonderful option for anything from date night to bringing in your family. Service was good as well.

31.description: This place was beautiful. And the owner and chef, John, was very friendly and accommodating. We asked to have no wine in any of our meals and he made sure that everything we ordered was fine. Food was delicious and beautiful place!

34.description: ... Walked in and thought perfect the place was empty...walked up to the host stand and said table for two.  In a Very rude to she said she was booked for the evening...I was shocked bc there wasn't even 6 people in the whole restaurant.  She said we can sit at the bar when there was about 25 tables open.... I no they say don't judge a book by it's cover well so we walked out and  went to the Thai restaurant and were treated awesome and well as the food.

16.description: In town from Phoenix and did not feel like the usual tourist pizza and hot dogs. This place was very good! I got a seafood dish that was absolutely delightful. I was accompanied by eight others who all enjoyed there meals as much as I did. If you get dessert try the pana cotta - so good.

13.description: I was deeply disappointed !I expected better than that /15min we were waiting for a bread basket !We ordered a fish and after 15 min server lady was  informing us that wasn't available !She suggested other dish what I didn't like .I chose salmon like better alternative/I WAS WRONG I It tasted like lake !The vegetable and sauce was disgusting both ways -presentation and taste -EVERY SAUCE WHAT I TRIED THAT NIGHT WAS BLAND AND WATERY !!From whole dish I only liked the baked bed of risotto /the dish prices-menu - on the restaurant's website  and inside didn' t match  ??????!!!SURPRISE!!!!It was more expensive !!!!!!The salmon dish was about $19 !!!Total waste of money !!I will come only for pizza -taste and price was amazingly OK !

11.description: Excellent food, staff and atmosphere! Of the 8 dishes we tried on our recent visit, a thinly-sliced and crispy pork parmigiana, (one of the nightly specials)  was the star. The menu does skew a bit tomato-ey, but there were still plenty of creamy sauces and seafood options to choose from. Portion sizes were reasonable for the price, and on a bustling Friday night, many of the other diners appeared to be regulars. Nearly every other table stood up to hug the owner and greet him by name, as he circulated the dining room periodically to check on the crowd. We got good bottle recommendations from our server, along with a couple generous wine samples and it's a plus that the restaurant usually offers discounts on deal sites like Living Social, Groupon, etc. I was too stuffed to try any of the desserts, but my friend ordered a tiramisu that looked quite good. Two thumbs up :-D

39.description: We have always enjoyed the food very much. Specials are always great.  Have never had an "off night", and the service has always been very nice.   Our son is picky and loves the marinara, so kids like it (big plus).  A great local dining option.  John, the chef and owner,  always comes out to ask how things are and makes you feel at home. Can't beat half price wine night (Tuesday).  Get up and go.

37.description: Went to dinner at Mia Figlia . The food is OK, nothing amazing. Pasta was too saucy, the flavor was lost within the sauce. My Rigatoni was too chewy. The place is worth trying , but not for a special occasion. The grilled squid was nicely done. The bread pudding is awful , I will stay away from desert as much as I can. We tried 3 different ones , none were good.

0.description: We LOVE this Restaurant!!! There's not enough of these family owned restaurants around anymore, which is why this place is so special.It's clean, great service and the food is delicious and flavorful. The owner came around introduced himself and was very sincere about how we were enjoying our meal and if there was anything we needed to let him know.Who does that anymore? Very warm feel good restaurant. We had a lamb dish and the gnocchi both were delicious. The entire experience was amazing we can't wait to go back!

38.description: I absolutely loved the grilled Octopus appetizer!  In most restaurants you receive just the grilled Octopus with a lemon wedge.   Here, on a rectangular plate you get the grilled octopus, half a grilled lemon as well as a small mixed green salad.  Beautiful presentation, healthy and delicious!Have returned for meals here many times and I'm never disappointed.

51.description: You cannot ask for better food. The chef is the owner, and wow he is an excellent cook. The best chicken limone I've ever had in my life. His pastas are extraordinarily balanced with ingredients and flavors. My friend's fish of the day was mahi mahi served atop a bed of sauteed vegetables and lentils; it was perfect in every way.This is a great restaurant, so much so, that I hesitated to write this review because it has this local neighborhood feel as a "best kept secret" kind of place. The chef and staff seemed to know almost every customer in the place. It's got a clean, cozy, but subdued atmosphere. Live music on Wednesdays, great soundtrack otherwise is piped in low enough for decent conversation without raising your voice. Very comfortable. Friendly, helpful staff; never obtrusive. They go out of their way to make you happy here.Priced just right... not cheap, but certainly not overpriced. You're getting a real artisan here who designs his menu's items and cooks them himself. He has really impressed everyone I've brought here.

27.description: Mia Figlia the long awaited trek to try one our neighborhood restaurants.  Maybe my expectations were too high after seeing a lot of the earlier reviews & one of the restaurants I book marked on Yelp.  Honestly it was a bit of a let down for me.The restaurant is located in a nice area on Devon Ave in Edgebrook.  It's a nice facade with an open storefront with French doors.  It has a nice interior, nothing too fancy, but clean and decorated with Tuscan colors of red & gold w/a bar to the right as you come in the restaurant.It was fairly crowded when we got there on Saturday night around 8 pm (usually a good sign).  The tables are in fairly close proximity to each other and a bit noisy.  The front seating is close to the open French doors in the front.  We were seated in the back where most of the people were sitting.  The owner/chef prepares a few specials for the day so they have a few different options to choose from each day.  Each of the staff are given samples of the special of the day (nice touch to know your menu).  The waiter came to take our order & told us what each of the specials were for the day.  We asked for a little more time to make our decision.  Well we waited for at least 10 minutes before he came back.  I went with my wife and sister.  We decided to go family style so we could share and try different items.  We ordered 3 dishes.  I ordered the Tilapia con Carciofi e Pomodorino (try saying that 10 times).  The Tilapia was pretty good and was served over a bed of spinach, pan roasted artichokes, sun dried tomatoes, white bean ragu, garlic & white wine sauce.  The flavor for these items was ok, but for me lacked flavor that really wowed me.  My wife ordered Ineudi intregrlli con Verdure.  This was home made wheat & ricotta pasta with roasted seasonal vegetables seasoned with a light tomato basil sauce.  Ehhhh again not too much flavor or taste sorry to say.  My sister ordered rigatoni con Zucca.  This had roasted pork, roasted butternut squash, sun ripened tomatoes, pancetta, roasted garlic walnuts in a delicious parmigiana cream sauce.  This was by far the best dish & so health and fat free (not), but excellent.  Near the end of our meal the owner/chef came by to welcome us and the meet and greet us as this was our first time at Mia Figlia.  Next time maybe he will try one of the specials of the day.

32.description: We happened to look on Yelp Saturday night for a place to eat and came across Mia Figlia. We called to see if they had room. The person on the phone said they would hold a table for us. When we arrived, the person we realized that the person we spoke to on the phone was waiting for us. Best part was that he was also the owner and head chef! I ordered the seafood pasta which was amazing and my fiance ordered the rigitoni with chicken. We also had a cesar salad as well as the beef carpacio. Although the carpacio was good, I'm not too sure if i'd order it again. Overall the service was also very good!

54.description: Lisa behind  the  bar  has a excellent  personally. The food and service is excellent.

48.description: My wife and I went out for a Friday night date to Mia Figlia.  When we showed up for a 7:30 reservation, we were seated by the door, and the cold air blew in & around us the whole time - we seriously had to keep our coats around our legs until the dinner was over to stay warm.  An extra heater near the entrance could have made it more tolerable.  The food was not great.  I ordered the first pasta dish on the menu, which had sun dried tomatoes and butternut squash.  It was a salty, amateurish dish for which I paid top dollar.

44.description: My Boyfriend and I were here last night for dinner. Hands down one of the best/ cutest place I've ever eaten at. A tad bit small of the place but the food is all worth it. From food to the staff and the very friendly owner that greats you at your table. You defiantly feel the great vibes. And as they say save the best for last.. Their Nutella petta con is out of this world. Filled with favors and very light at the same time. It was all beyond words. We will defiantly be coming back !!

24.description: A must dine for any occasion.  Whether you want a casual dinner to walk to in the neighborhood or celebrate a special occasion.  The northwest side needed this nice Italian restaurant and it continues to delight. There is also a nice bar in front that is fun to meet friends after work.

7.description: This chef owner cooks with love and passion. Great custom/unique Italian recipes. I normally sit at the bar and watch the smiling faces as the guests leave super satisfied. Pizza is solid, veal and lamb dishes are top notch and the salads burst with flavor. Today it was brunch and even though the place was jumping I still got great service. I went with the Tuscan baked eggs with a grilled Italian ham n cheese that came on the side. Off the hook taste, well presented and more than fair on the $$.Way to support your local Edgebrook/Sauganash.!!

49.description: Our second visit to Mia Figlia. Arrived last night w/out a reservation at 5:45 and were told we'd be seated if we'd leave by 7:15; ok by us. Were seated at perhaps the worst table with a view into the storage/serving area. Other diners squeezed past to get to their tables all during our meal. Across from us, diners WITH reservations were vocally unhappy about their table but were not moved. Tables in the front of the restaurant remained available during our meal. Our table rocked, standard in cheap diners, unacceptable in a place with $16+ entrees. It's an easy fix: just sit down at your tables, restaurant owners, and lean on them. It would take just a few minutes.Water and a good firm bread arrive quickly. Wait staff grinds cheese for the bread, in very small portions that don't last if you plan on eating all the bread. You must ask for more cheese. I don't like that waitstaff picked up my water glass to refill it, that's a hand that's been touching water glasses all over the restaurant, bringing other people's germies to our table. Staff should fill glasses without touching them.The chef-owner delivers some dishes and asks if diners are enjoying their meals. That would work better on a less busy night, we didn't feel we should detain him to suggest lowering the salt levels.Starter: Granchio con Finocchio e Spinaci (pan roasted crab cakes w/baby spinach, shaved fennel and lemon caper dressing) ...delicate and delicious. Pastas: Rigatoni con Zucca e Maiale (pasta w/slow cooked pork, roasted butternut squash, sun dried tomato, pancetta, roasted garlic/parmigiano cream sauce and toasted walnuts). Lovely co-mingling of flavors, wish there had been more squash and walnuts and less salt in it.Cavatelli alla Boscaiola (handmade eight finger pasta with sausage, wild mushrooms, tomato herb sauce, shaved Pecorino Tartufati, and truffle oil). This is a very rich, heavy pasta you might want to share instead of eating it as an entree. Heavy hand on the salt.CHEFS, PLEASE LISTEN. Why keep salt ON the table? So diners can add if they want. There's no way for us to remove salt from an overly-salted dish! Cook with half to 3/4 LESS salt than you're using now, please! Any dish containing cheese or pancetta does not need salt added to any other component.We found the noise level this visit to be rather high. Sound-absorbing room dividers and plants in the dining room would make it feel more intimate and Italian.We dined here using Restaurant.com certificates, to make it affordable.

40.description: I am a returning customer to this establishment and it saddens me to write about such a negative experience.  We chose this for a special Mother's Day brunch.  We arrived at 1:40 and brunch is served until 2 o'clock. The entire front of the restaurant was wide open and yet the hostess had to go and check to see if we could be seated because we didn't have a reservation. And we noted that while we sat and ate there was one only one other table that filled. I asked for coffee and when they brought it was cold. Okay no big deal right? We placed our order which included one of my favorites lemon ricotta pancakes. When both entrées were delivered to our table there was no butter or syrup for my pancakes or for the toast included in the my partner's entree. Also the toast arrived cold, hard, and dry. We wait to hail someone and wait. We finally decide to call over the hostess because she was closest to us and our waiter was nowhere to be seen.  The hostess disappears and I continue to wait and wait for butter and syrup. Finally she comes from the back with a small pitcher of syrup and shards of butter slapped onto the same small plate used for the syrup. By now my pancakes are cold. Still no sign of our waiter. Finally our waiter appears and we explain our disappointment to him. He offers to bring more toast but so much time has passed we decline. He had never even bothered to stop and ask about our meal or even to inquire about reheating my coffee. Which I thought was standard procedure.  Then while the waiter is at our table my partner discovers a hair buried in his food. Shows it to the waiter and decides this is unacceptable and the waiter offers to bring a replacement. After such POOR service my partner declines the offer.  But never an apology.  As I'm still eating, we notice the young hostess outside at the front door with very large Starbucks drinks in her hands. Apparently she had left and now she can't open the door so mouths for my partner to come and let her in because we are the closest people. Really?? Your employee is allowed to bring in drinks from outside let alone have customers leave their table?! Then the waiter returns and offers us free tiramisu.  We declined. At this point this offer isn't going to change a ruined meal.  I never reviewed on Yelp before but this entire experience was so disappointing and aggravating I'd had to share it. And yes they comped the meal but we insisted we  pay for what we had consumed. However, I wonder if the waiter didn't take it for himself. We made it clear we were paying for the food only. The bad service and mediocre food ruined the entire experience. I'm not sure if we would ever go back. My Mother's Day bruch was a bust.

53.description: Hidden gem in Edgebrook. Homemade pasta was excellent. Very courteous service. Chef John greeted us at the door with a hearty smile and welcome. Lively atmosphere and conversation. Very enjoyable evening.

30.description: We had a party for 36 people this morning for brunch and the service was fantastic and so was the food.   We arranged for a variety of brunch items to be served on each table family style.  The favorites were the green eggs and ham and lemon pancakes.  This place is a new favorite restaurant.  I'm looking forward to trying them for dinner.

46.description: Great everything!This was one of the better restaurant experiences I have had in a while. From reserving a table over the phone, to changing the reservation time to dessert. Being greeted by name when I came in and told them I had a reservation was a nice touch.We were a party of 2 for a birthday. Nice ambiance in the place.
