What I mostly heard was the chatter of all the patrons. The lighting was just right.The grilled calamari to start was great. Then I ordered the roasted pancetta wrapped pork tenderloin which was a great choice. I usually don't order pork at restaurants because it always seems to disappoint, but not here. This was probably the best pork I've had. Medium is the temp to get it at; still juicy and tender.Dessert was a lava cake ala mode. I wasn't as impressed with the presentation, but it was still chocolate decadence. It was hard to stop despite being pretty stuffed.It was a great experience for me. The server never told me his name so I don't know who to give credit to....oh wait, it's on the receipt....JD. The owner John came by to check in on us also and he was the one to greet and seat us. Always important in my eye.It was a Friday night, they were pretty full but by 9:00 half the tables were already gone.I would not hesitate to come back. They earned the 5 stars tonight.

1.description: The NW side is rich in fine neighborhood Italian restaurants and Mia Figlia  is truly a gem.  We normally dine out on Thursdays, well because Saturday nights are a can be a shitshow as the kitchen gets slammed and the staff can be stretched as well. That said, we ended up here an a Saturday night and they were quite busy.  The owner asked us to consider Tuesday's since everyone wants to go out at 7:30 on Saturday and Tuesday is ignored.  We now include Mia Figlia on our "A" list of NW standouts along with Zias, Pasta D Arte, Nonna Silvia's and the DiMaggio cafe.

55.description: I was seriously disappointed at this place. A friend of mine suggested it for dinner, and as I am a huge fan of Italian, I was eager to try it out. I was seriously let down. I ordered chicken and asparagus over pasta. What came out was bland, gamey chicken that tasted like the bird had been boiled without any seasoning whatsoever. The 'asparagus' was really only one spear chopped up into little pieces-what a joke! I had to force it down, it was so gross. I will not be returning here. I'd rather go to Olive Garden where their food is consistently good.

9.description: Mia Figlia the long awaited trek to try one our neighborhood restaurants.  Maybe my expectations were too high after seeing a lot of the earlier reviews & one of the restaurants I book marked on Yelp.  Honestly it was a bit of a let down for me.The restaurant is located in a nice area on Devon Ave in Edgebrook.  It's a nice facade with an open storefront with French doors.  It has a nice interior, nothing too fancy, but clean and decorated with Tuscan colors of red & gold w/a bar to the right as you come in the restaurant.It was fairly crowded when we got there on Saturday night around 8 pm (usually a good sign).  The tables are in fairly close proximity to each other and a bit noisy.  The front seating is close to the open French doors in the front.  We were seated in the back where most of the people were sitting.  The owner/chef prepares a few specials for the day so they have a few different options to choose from each day.  Each of the staff are given samples of the special of the day (nice touch to know your menu).  The waiter came to take our order & told us what each of the specials were for the day.  We asked for a little more time to make our decision.  Well we waited for at least 10 minutes before he came back.  I went with my wife and sister.  We decided to go family style so we could share and try different items.  We ordered 3 dishes.  I ordered the Tilapia con Carciofi e Pomodorino (try saying that 10 times).  The Tilapia was pretty good and was served over a bed of spinach, pan roasted artichokes, sun dried tomatoes, white bean ragu, garlic & white wine sauce.  The flavor for these items was ok, but for me lacked flavor that really wowed me.  My wife ordered Ineudi intregrlli con Verdure.  This was home made wheat & ricotta pasta with roasted seasonal vegetables seasoned with a light tomato basil sauce.  Ehhhh again not too much flavor or taste sorry to say.  My sister ordered rigatoni con Zucca.  This had roasted pork, roasted butternut squash, sun ripened tomatoes, pancetta, roasted garlic walnuts in a delicious parmigiana cream sauce.  This was by far the best dish & so health and fat free (not), but excellent.  Near the end of our meal the owner/chef came by to welcome us and the meet and greet us as this was our first time at Mia Figlia.  Next time maybe he will try one of the specials of the day.

26.description: Went for the first time - classic neighborhood Italian place, but more upscale (white table clothes) and quieter.  Great and comfortable bar with good selection of reasonably priced (always a relative term, I know) Italian wines.  The chef has given the classic dishes a tweak and they all look interesting - my eight finger cavatelli dish was both unique and delicious, and the tuna appetizer tasted as good as it looked and had the added benefit of not being filling. The chef obviously prides himself on his work, and we enjoyed it and put it on our list of neighborhood places to return to.Miker

25.description: Food is excellent...along with the service.  Owner is great. They went above and beyond making taking care of us. Definitely plan on visiting next time I'm in town!

12.description: Authentic Italian food in the edgebrook area of Chicago. We had the prosciutto with mushroom pizza, cheese ravioli, and fried calamari. We liked everything we had. I thought the calamari was the best I've ever had. It tasted fresh with a light and crunchy batter. I loved the thin crust pizza which had a lot of cheese with every bite and the ham with the mushroom added great flavor. It was nice how our serving of ravioli was split in two portions without requesting it. Overall, we will return again.

59.description: This is a solid, little, local place. We went there on a Monday for dinner with friends. We were seated right away, service was prompt, and kids eat free on Mondays! My daughter got a BIG bowl of pasta, all the bread she could eat, and a scoop of gelato.  My husband had the Risotto special, I had the Mahi Mahi special, and we ordered fried Calamari and the Ricotta with marinated olives as appetizers. We all left full and happy!

21.description: What a gem!  What a find!  I was originally taken here for my birthday, last November, and what a treat it was.  We have been coming back ever since.  The food is phenomenal, the service is top notch.  I love the personal service, and the fact that the owner comes around often during your visit and makes you feel special.  Our absolutely favorite dish is the Osso Bucco, which is outstanding.  We have never been disappointed by anything we've ordered.  So glad to have found Mia Figlia, it has quickly become one of our favorite spots to dine!

17.description: Great food and a loving chef! I've been to this place for 3 times and I enjoyed it surprised me every single time!

10.description: Really disappointed that I need to leave this review... 1. Food was mediocre at best. The fish was so salty it was inedible.  Everything else was okay, sort of bland. Nothing special.  I have been here before and considered it a neighborhood gem. Maybe it was an off night, food wise.  2. The service was terrible. The severs name was "Devan" according to the receipt and she was simply awful. Made a not great dining experience worse by her attitude.  This is why I had to go one star. She didn't care about giving correct information about the menu, she was sloppy, rude, and unprofessional.  The way she threw down the dessert menus without a word was the last straw. I felt like I was at Denny's.  The owner should know - she is bringing down your business!  Get rid of her immediately.

5.description: We came by to try this Edgebrook business using a Living Social deal.  The deal included an appetizer, two entrees off of their pasta menu, and a dessert.  We found Mia Figlia to be a nice neighborhood gem that borders the peaceful residential section of Devon Avenue.  The quality of all of our servings was very good.  We had fried calamari, Linguini alla Pescatore (seafood linguini), Cavatelli alla Boscaiola (eight finger pasta with sausage and mushrooms), and their lava cake.  The bread was warm and fresh.  The calamari was delicately breaded, nicely prepared, and a generous serving.  The seafood linguine was also a large dish, excellent, and the better of the two pastas.  I don't think I've ever had eight finger Cavatelli pasta (large and fingerlike as described, and it was ok), but I also did not see or taste much sausage in this particular dish.  We had leftovers from both pasta dishes.  Overall, Mia Figlia is a nice vibrant and friendly place and I would not hesitate to return.   I like seeing local businesses in nice neighborhoods like Mia Figlia thrive.  The only drawbacks here though are that it can get quite loud, and the tables are situated a bit close to each other.Don't forget (as I did) that you can park in the nearby church parking lot just to the east and across Spokane Ave.  The sign confirming this is a bit obscure from the lot entrance but it's there.  Otherwise, there is also easy and free street parking nearby.

3.description: Pasta with slow cooked pork,roasted butternut squash,sundried tomato,pancetta,roasted garlic,parmgiano cream sauce, toasted walnuts was very tasty.Tilipa was good sauce was a little flat Was cute inside had French doors that opened to the full blue moon.

35.description: Came on a Sunday afternoon when they only servers brunch which was a bummer because I'm not to into brunch foods. The drinks were very good, Bloody Mary and beermosas were delicious. We got the best seat in the house, the table that sits outside by the opening window-wall.  Everyone liked their food and their service was good.

19.description: My husband and I ate dinner today (yes, at 2:30, we are old and this was really early bird, even for us) at this wonderful, warm restaurant today - armed with a Living Social voucher.  I had looked online at the available dishes, so we pretty much knew what we wanted.  We split the warm lentil and spinach appetizer with olives, goats cheese and dried tomatoes.  We both loved it!  For our two entrées we both so enjoyed the linguini with marinara sauce and tons of delicious seafood - mussels, calamari, scallops and shrimp.  A little spiciness was perfect.  We wound up taking around half to enjoy at home tomorrow.  Our shared dessert was the freshly baked apple and fresh berry crisp, with a lovely dollop of vanilla gelato on top.  Service was lovely, and frankly it was outstanding (but we were the only folks in the restaurant that early, no surprise!).  I already cannot wait to come back, everything was super great.

28.description: Pasta with slow cooked pork,roasted butternut squash,sundried tomato,pancetta,roasted garlic,parmgiano cream sauce, toasted walnuts was very tasty.Tilipa was good sauce was a little flat Was cute inside had French doors that opened to the full blue moon.

45.description: Great food! Decent service and lots of parking.

33.description: Always interesting specials and great service. Actually a great place to take kids too.

43.description: Nice Italian place that we went to today. Had the linguini with seafood, chicken parmigiana and the rigatoni with meatball. Ambience was good - a few kids there.Menu was your traditional meals. Dessert was a cup of chocolate gelato.

2.description: What a wonderful family owned Italian restaurant. I was very pleased with my experience here. The owner came over and introduced himself to my table which spoke volumes about his character and love for what he does. We loved the fresh baked bread! The pasta was also homemade. Portion sizes could have been a little bit bigger but we were still full. Quality ingredients and a homely feel thanks to the wait staff and owner will definitely go far with MIa Figlia.

18.description: My absolute favorite restaurant on the north side.  You are treated like royality, with a smidge of North side cunning. Food is fresh and fabulous, and the servers are awesomely educated. Great variety of gf and vegetarian meals.  They are located on Devon, but if you blink, the trees hide the restaurant.  .

41.description: Awesome food, great service and very affordable!! I love this place!!Rick Leyba

52.description: I received and e-mail from Restaurant.com letting me know that some of the places that I purchased the gift cards to either closed or were no longer participating with Restaurant.com.  Thank God they give you an option to exchange them for other places and I do not lose your money!  And this is how I came across this place...My husband and I love to try new places, but we usually like when they offer some sort of Groupon, coupon or promotion.  So if you don't like the place, at least you did not pay full price :)I am glad that we found this place.  We were by window and were able to be away from everyone and had our intimate dinner together.  Our server Lisa was very nice.  I thought that the wine list was little bit overpriced.  We ordered Calamari for an appetizer - they were a little bit too greasy.  For our entrees we ordered a lemon chicken dish and a tilapia - both were very delicious.  For desert (which we almost never get), we got tiramisu and pistachio gelato - both were wonderful!I think the most memorable thing about the evening is when the chef himself visited out table and wanted to know if we enjoyed our food and how nice it was to have us there that evening.  It was truly wonderful.It is not a very big place, but it is romantic.  I think around 7 pm, they have a gentleman playing a keyboard; which is very nice (but not when you sit right next to him and try to have a conversation).  It wasn't too loud, unless you are rubbing elbows with the performer...  I just wouldn't recommend anyone to be seated right next to the gentleman playing; unless you don't want to speak with your spouse and enjoy the music.We will definitely be back.  Thank you!

50.description: Really enjoy this place! Close to the burbs which is helpful for us individuals longing for better, non-chain food options.My favorite thing was the grilled octopus appetizer. The octopus came with a nice half of grilled lemon and a wonderful salad with roasted peppers. It was so good that we ended up ordering another one to share during dinner.We went with another family whose daughter is in the same class [at pre-k] with ours. I was so happy because although the place is small and quaint the wait staff was so warm and welcoming to children. I really appreciate when I can get the best of both worlds [kid friendly and good food!].The options for the kids was simple but good: choice of pasta, choice of sauce and then a choice of a meatball or not. The meatball was delicious.For the adults we ordered the handmade Cavatelli alla Boscaiola [which was good but probably could have used one more minute in the boiling water - I know handmade pasta is a different texture/consistency and more delicate to cook, but i stand by when I think it could have used one more minute], an order of the Linguini alla Pescatore con Finocchio [which smelled really good but I did not taste] and finally Gnocchi alla Prosciutto e Pisselle alla Gorgonzola [which was also good].All in all a wonderful option for anything from date night to bringing in your family. Service was good as well.

4.description: Let us start with the good:The White Cloth Italian concept has always been very pricey in America. It is the only reason dumps like Olive Garden do any business.  For many working class American, a night out at an Italian Restaurant is not Affordable.Mia Figlia provides some really great value and very reasonable prices.  Quality ingredient starter salads for 7 to 8. 10" Artisinal Style Pizzas with pricey ingredients for $10.  Pastas from $13-17. Bruschetta with Fresh Mozz for 6. Calamari for $8.  My pork tenderloin entree for $18.  This is straight up 2003 prices. As a restaurant owner, I applaud them.  Keep it affordable and keep them coming and loyal to you.  But this has become nearly impossible in today's high inflationary climate on food goods.  Portions were generous as well. Service was very warm and efficient.  The BAD:Food was very bland and lacking in bold flavor. Calamari was on the rubbery side and fried perhaps 3/4 of the way.  No salt, pepper.My bigger issue was Mia Figlia's red sauces were very bland and it is hard to love an Italian place whose marinara or meat gravy is weak.  Both Pizzas featured nice textured crusts but red sauces that required us to salt the top.  We asked for well done, and both seemed to barely melt cheese on top.  Perphaps it is the style of oven they use for these pizzetes. The Homemade Cheese Ravioli was just ok. Not enough Ricotta inside and red sauce is lacking.The Pancetta wrapped Pork Loin was very good all around.  Salads were priced well and respectable portion. Ingredients were quality.  But again, dressings were bland and lacking kick, giving salads  no distinctive flavor or personality.Im not going to make a beef on ambiance for these prices but surely they can give the dining room some personality with more interesting art, some plants, and colored paint.Also, it was cold.  Almost like thermostat was on 68/69, instead of 72.Overall, not a bad experience. They need to use more salt, garlic, and spice back there. Just not delivered a good enough experience to compel me to give them another shot. But who knows....

6.description: We must have dined here on an off-day as we look at all the positive reviews. 1. While seated right away due to a reservation, it took 20 minutes to be asked if we wanted a drink. 2. Extremely crowded and cramped. Don't come here for a romantic date night.  3.  Ants on our table. Wtf?4. Portions are tiny and food is ok but boring. We had the chicken pasta with asparagus bits (yes, bits) and beef tenderloin.5. Noisy!!!

22.description: Went for the first time and tis place was absolutely the best! The service was great and very accommodating and the food was delicious. I had the pancetta wrapped pork tenderloin with wine sauce. They have a good variety of dishes and the prices were affordable. Will definitely be going back. Karen

15.description: My friend Carol who owns Carol's Beauty Salon went to Mia Figlia with her 4 friends yesterday.  She told me they really enjoyed the food and had a great time.  But, she lost her money pouch somewhere after dinner.  Carol looked everywhere and called Mia Figilia communicating her loss.  Thankfully the chef and owner found her money pouch and told her she could pick it up anytime.  He mentioned to her that it was not his business to open it so he was not sure what was still in the pouch.  This was unbelievably honest and professional.  Carol asked me to write a short note on her behalf.  Thank you for being honest and providing wonderful food to my friends.  My husband and I look forward to eating at your restaurant very soon.  Sincerely, Irene

57.description: We have lived in Edgebrook for a year and coming from downtown we were looking for a top notch Italian place.  Mia Figlia is it!  From everything on the menu being great to delicious specials.  We love the friendly atmosphere and fantastic food!

20.description: This is my favorite Italian restaurant on the north side. My fiancé knows I love it so much that he decided to propose here :) I'll never forget it. Typically we try something new as they always recommend the chef's special. My all time favorite meal off the menu is the Rigatoni con Zucca e maiale. It is so flavorful with the pork and butternut squash! Service is great and there is not one thing I have eaten there that I haven't liked!

36.description: We didn't have a reservation but we figured at 530 it wouldn't be busy. Our waiter/host was rude from the start. As he began to seat us, he said he needed our table by 7pm for someone else. Okay... never been told that before. For the remainder of our meal he was just rude. He acted as if we were a nuisance. The tables to the right and to the left of us he was smiling, joking. He gave them the "special of the day" spiel. He spoke to us in a mocking tone, not a smile. I have never been to a place where I was treated so indifferently. Will not return and will NOT recommend to any of our neighbors (we live down the street). The food was good, but would not go back after being treated so poorly.

14.description: Nice Italian place that we went to today. Had the linguini with seafood, chicken parmigiana and the rigatoni with meatball. Ambience was good - a few kids there.Menu was your traditional meals. Dessert was a cup of chocolate gelato.

3.description: Got a great haircut as usual.  This place is great and if there is ever a wait its minimal. Friendly, fast, and sports.  Can't beat the MVP.  Will definitely be back.

1.description: Sports Clips what a joke!  I went there yesterday because I had a free MVP haircut coupon (normally priced @ $24.00).  The MVP also comes with a shampoo & scalp massage.  I tipped the stylist $7.00 (probably because the haircut was free)I asked the stylist (should have got her name) for a number 2 around the back & sides and to trim the top and feather the hair so it shows as a smooth transition from short on the back and sides to the longer hair in top (pretty basic cut right?).  When I got home I was looking at the cut in the mirror and realized that the transition was very poorly done.  The left side had uneven hair lengths where parts were cut to the number 2 length and in the front side there was an uneven patch of hair that was noticeably longer (unacceptable).  I had to go back today and get it trimmed to even the hair length out.  Unfortunately the same person wasn't there to correct her mistake so I had a different stylist named Terry.  Terry did a decent job correcting the uneven cut from the day before.  I appreciated the fact that she corrected the other persons mistake so I tipped her another $2.00 (its not much (sorry Terry) but I shouldn't have had to go back a 2nd time if it was done correctly in the first place). Thank You TerrySo in all it cost me $9.00 for a haircut.  I normally go to a $5.00 barber shop and tip the person $3.00.  Will I be going back?  Probably not.

2.description: Be clear which package you're paying for.  I went in with a friend and we were both charged for the MVP package, without getting the benefits.The haircuts were fine, but we won't be back.

0.description: It was really fast and the time spent there was pretty awesome....it had been a little time since i got a haircut there but the towel on my face helped with the stress.I am upset I forget her name....Bulgarian if I remember...did hair back in her home country also.  Nice person. :)

3.description: Great place to shop for ALL your Irish needs and wants!!!!!!

1.description: Bought a ring for my daughter a couple years ago here. The band broke so I brought it back to see if it could be fixed. The owner of the shop replaced it with a brand new ring! A wonderful experience. Highly recommend this store.

2.description: This place is a hidden GEM!  I love it...  I got hooked on a discontinued Waterford pattern.  I searched a lot of stores closer to my house, but none of them ever had the pattern in stock.  And since I only do things last minute, I didn't really have the chance to order the glasses in advance.  But every time I called, they had exactly what I needed - like 3 Chrismas eve's in a row!  So next time you need to buy a set of discontinued Waterford pattern wine glasses on Christmas Eve becasue you couldn't think of anything else to get for you soon-to-be, cheating ex-partner, I'd go to Donegal Imports!  PS. just in case you care, I kept the glasses in the break-up :-)

5.description: Need some imported Irish goods? Some Irish made items for the home? They've even got Irish Cadbury, yes.. Cadbury does taste different from country to country.I found the prices to be a little higher in comparison to some of the other Irish import stores.  irishtours.com for more Irish import stores.

6.description: A nice Irish import store.  They carried a good selection of stuff, comparable to other Irish import stores I have been in.  The pricing looked pretty good in comparison.

0.description: Love this little shop!I bought a Christmas gift here for one of my friends and let me tell you, he's as Irish as they come.  He loved the piece that I bought him and he's pretty qualified to decide what's quality Irish goods and what's not.Very friendly staff and large selection of goods.  They also offered to order something for me if I wasn't able to find exactly what I wanted.  The store itself has a very quaint, neighborhood charm to it - nothing ultra modern or over the top.  Very simple, which is perfect for a shop like this!

4.description: Donegal Imports is the only shop I go to when I'm needing a special gift, such as the trinity necklace that I've been purchasing for each of my niece's for one of their milestone birthdays.  It's not something that I'd get at just any jewelry store.  I visited the shop one day a few years ago while passing by and the shop owner was just so nice an informative.  I went back to see about a gift for my oldest niece and he's the one that helped me find the perfect gift.  Unfortunately (or fortunately for my wallet) I'm not close enough in distance to go there all the time, but it is the only place that pops out of my mouth when anyone is looking for truly authentic Irish pieces and a welcoming atmosphere.

1.description: Essence spa was by far the best spa I have been to in a long time. Once you arrive their is a parking lot on the side of the building. Which is even a plus. When entering the building you are greeted by the front desk team. The lady at the front desk was so sweet. She even asked if I parked in the lot because she didn't want me to have to worry about getting a ticket. After feeling on a small amount of paperwork. She then gave me a tour of the facility.The facility is beyond beautiful and very clean. I was given a locker with a key it had a fresh towel and robe in it with flip flops. I was also informed to have a seat in the sauna to relax before my message. I decided to opt out on the sauna, when entering the relaxation room it was so peaceful you could fall asleep in it. I was greeted by my masseuse and she escorted me to the room. I received the hot stone massage and it was amazing. I only get the massage for 50 minutes but the 50 minutes were just what I needed. Once the massage was over I was exported to the relaxation room so further relax for however long I need it. Overall I give this entire spot in the facility and staff a five star rating it was more than I expected and I am truly relaxed. I definitely will be going back soon.

9.description: A huge and beautiful facility, offering everything from chemical peels, to microdermabrasion, to stone massages.  I went for the Pretty in Pink special, which was laser hair treatment.  The girl who did the treatment on me went a little overboard in describing what was going to happen. She made it out to be like there was going to be an extreme amount of pain (maybe I just have a high pain tolerance?) and it really just felt like a slightly more painful tweeze.  My chin looked and felt great for the day or two after, but now the area is rough and looks like nothing has changed - amount of hair-wise that is.  I realize they said you should expect to come back more than once, but I thought for certain I would be able to see a noticeable difference right off the bat.  Oh well, thats why I bought the discounted package, to see if it was worth it or not.  And another irritating thing, they offer all these other things, like mesotherapy, yoga, nutritional planning and martial arts, but neither on the website or the brochure they gave me had any indication of price.  This leaves me with two impressions:  1) if you have to ask you can't afford it or 2) they do this on purpose so when you do inquire you get the hard sell.  Both of which stink!I would like to frequent the Essence Med Spa, especially to take advantage of the great rain showers and lounge area, but there are some definite kinks in the information relay that need to be worked out first.

23.description: This place is just what the Chicago area needed.  They offer the highest quality of services and they use the latest technology as well. I have been active in the beauty industry for over 30 years and I have been to many nice places throughout the world but rarely have I ever encountered a place that excels in merging Medical Spa & Relaxation Spa.  This doesn't even begin to describe the experience that you will have when you walk into this beautiful mecca of Spas.  Immediately when you walk through the door your mentality will change and your stress will be left behind you.  The staff is very kind and gracious, and the sights, sounds and aura will make you feel as if you have just honored yourself with a much needed vacation from our fast pace Chicago living.  This is truly a day spa where you can spend an entire day to refresh and rejuvenate whether you are going in for a spa package, massage or simply relaxing with a nice facial and steam... or even just a quick Botox pick-me up- they have it all.  The place is lovely and words cannot describe my wonderful experiences with this spa.

12.description: I hate to give this place a bad review..the girl that did my microdermabrasion was very nice and friendly, but the procedure itself was done in 15 min ...whereas a normal professional micro takes atleast 45 min to an hour. There were no extractions done, no facial mask, i had to wash my own face at the end....MAJOR waste of money and I would never go back there. If you want a real and thorough microdermbrasion, with the extractions, facial mask, etc...go somewhere else!! Highly disappointed....!!!!!

21.description: I first came here thanks to Groupon with their 85% off on hair removal treatments. I have to say, at first I LOVED the place, it is very magical. Once you come in you are immediately greeted and offered water, tea or coffee (I enjoyed the coffee). It's a great spa and the girls are extremely friendly. I'm giving this place 4 stars because on the morning of my second visit I got a call from I guess one of the managers asking me if i would like to change my reservation for an earlier time. I explained to her that I was with two other people in different reservations and would prefer to leave it as is. As the time went by she kept insisting that I should move my reservation because otherwise my treatment will be shorten to 30 minutes instead of 60 minutes. I was annoyed at that point as it was my mother's day gift and I was taking my mom and mother in law with me. I wanted them to have the best experience. I told the lady that I was paying for 60 minutes and not 30 and she had the nerves of saying that either way that particular treatment was on a promotional price like saying "you're already getting it for cheap! (what did that had to do with it, IDK). Anyways, she placed me on hold for a while and then came back telling me that they weren't going to change anything. I asked her if she was sure they were not going to shorten my treatment and she said no. Once I got there that same day, the magic was back! The sweetness of the girls was there. I love it AGAIN! My treatment was done by the same girl that did my hair removal treatment and she's AWESOME!! My treatment was not shorten, in fact, I think the girl went over the 60 minutes. My mom, mother in law and I left the place feeling relaxed and enjoyed every piece of it.  Kudos on the relaxation room although I would LOVE it if you guys had a fountain or something with running water as I love to hear it while I relax. I definitely will be going back and not just for my hair removal treatments but for other services as they have monthly promotions.

16.description: Had a great massage, but it's the atmosphere that is amazing! It is incredibly clean and truly transports you to another place. Staff are gracious and helpful and I I'll go back to try something else.

17.description: Unbelievable space! (nice meditation rooms and rituals). No need to drive to the suburbs for larger spa rooms.  Compare to downtown is much spacious and less crowds.  (Also, they have a parking lot). I live close by but didn't even know it existed.  I bought the Groupon special for Honey body wrap treatment for my friend and I.  We both had a really good experience.  The front desk was so nice and respectful.  I would go back for sure and would take other friends. What a good discovery today! So happy.

10.description: The atmoshere is very serene and calming. Definately a great place to put your mind and body to rest. However, I was not very pleased with there Deep Tissue massage. I have gotten many Deep Tissue massages from other places, and they were really good. I told the Massage Therapist that I want her to work on my shoulders and neck area the most. She did but I was not completely satisfied. She was very soft on my neck, it felt like she was just rubbing my neck and shoulders and not really working on my knotted muscles like I expected. I was definately not satisfied. I feel like I got a Swedish Massage and not a Deep Tissue as I requested.

5.description: This place is beautiful.  They have the best zen relax area ever!  My gf has rented out the space multiple times for baby showers and jewelry parties and it's amazing.  The massages are great and so is the prenatal yoga.  The showers are awesome and they provide all the products you need!Absolutely the perfect place for the perfect spa day with the girls!

11.description: My update - I had my second session of facial spider vein "zaps" - I still have some, but there are less of them. That being said, the technician kept on urging me to purchase more sessions. I kind of felt like she could have gotten them all if she tried.The place was nice, the prices are comparable to other med spas. I may come back for something simpler like a massage, with a girlfriend or two.

22.description: Been here twice. No need to go downtown for a beautiful spa and great treatments. 1st class all the way. My only negative was the steam room was being repaired last time. Highly recommended. It doesn't look like much from the outside but wait till you get inside!

0.description: I've been here a handful of times, always for a massage, so I can't speak to the other services they offer, but the massages here are amazing and the place is just beautiful and relaxing. All of the employees I have encountered have been very nice and welcoming. When you first arrive, park on the side of the building and not in-front so you do not have to pay a meter. You can arrive a bit early before your massage to use the sauna or relax in the Oasis room. You will be asked if you'd like a beverage or you can visit Cafe Cleo which is attached for a freshly made juice or smoothie. You will then be taken to the locker room, where you can change into your robe and slippers and either use the sauna or wait in the Oasis relaxation room. I have paid $25 dollars just to be able to come and use the saunas, Oasis room and showers all day, which is really nice when you want to just get away for a few hours. I grabbed a fresh juice and rotated between the saunas and the Oasis room before showering for a few hours. Don't bother bringing a book though, the Oasis room is much to dark to be able to read in. The massage rooms are very lovely and always smell nice and the beds are heated. I have always had Julianna for a masseuse and she's wonderful. She listens to you and will actually pay more attention to areas you tell her to, not like other masseuses that will ask if there are any areas you'd like to focus on and then just give you the normal massage without focusing on those areas. That happens a lot for some reason.Once your massage is done, I would recommend the sauna and also the shower with the nozzles on the side of the walls(it's closest to the sinks). The shower has stone floors that massage your feet as you step around and the nozzles on the sides are like an extra little massage. They have toothbrushes, mouthwash, deodorant, razors, and Q-tips for you to use when getting ready to head out. I always leave feeling so relaxed and refreshed.

20.description: A friend and I booked a spa package here on a whim and were we glad that we did. The facility is kind of tucked away- so you wouldn't notice it unless you were looking. However, once you get inside it's huge. The locker room is easily one of the nicest I've ever been in. The steam, sauna, and relaxation rooms are amazing (they even let us bring wine to drink while using the relaxation room). As for the treatments, we each got a massage and a body wrap. While the body wrap was good, the massage was easily the best I've ever had and I've been to a lot of different spas. It was so relaxing that I fell asleep within the first 15 minutes of it. I've been going back for routine massages ever since. Definitely a great spa and I highly recommend the 80 minute massages because it's worth every penny.

19.description: Been here twice. No need to go downtown for a beautiful spa and great treatments. 1st class all the way. My only negative was the steam room was being repaired last time. Highly recommended. It doesn't look like much from the outside but wait till you get inside!

2.description: The smoothie place is closed but I was able to walk into the door so I stood at the cafe waiting to get someones attention. It took awhile but I found out it was no longer in business:(

18.description: Ok so I had a relative from out of town who had never been to a SPA, yes- that alone is a crime.. so of course while she was visiting I made it my job to get her to one ASAP.. I wanted her first experience to be good so being that I've been to plenty of spas I was really conflicted in narrowing it down to the best one to take her to.  While doing a quick search on Yelp I noticed one spa that I hadn't been to- Essence.  I checked out the website and it looked beautiful but everywhere I looked for reviews there wasn't any.. there was 2 in Yelp but I thought that's too little for it to be any good I mean there must be a reason why there's no reviews but I kept replaying the images I've seen on the web and thought I would chance it and I'm so happy I did..  When you get there the outside is well not what you would imagine would be a place of relaxation but as soon as we opened the doors you could smell the candles and sense how relaxed it was going to be.. I was super excited.. We were escorted to the changing room and while walking there everything was visually beautiful.. the lockers were roomy and nice and had a robe, towel and slippers.  We were asked if we wanted anything to drink, I asked for water and my guest asked for tea.. I got my water but they forgot the tea.. after we changed into our robes we were told we could either take advantage of the Steam room, Sauna or relaxation room.. We went to relax and it was beautiful, peaceful and just what you would want a spa to be like.  Unfortunately the person that was going to give us a massage was not there due to a family emergency so I had to wait but there was no complaining on my end- I completely fell asleep and that never happens to me.. It was my turn for my massage and the rooms were designed beautifully.  My massage was great- perfect!  After, my masseuse gave me a quick tour of the other rooms and treatments they offer- very nice.. I then went to the steam room for a while and then took a shower in their spacious 5 jets shower- all was provided.. shower caps. shampoo, conditioner, body soap, tooth paste, toothbrush, lotion, mouth wash, makeup removers, combs, I can't think of all but they put thought into it..  I really enjoyed my time and recommend it to anyone- surprised we haven't heard more of this place.!

13.description: Forget the Gold Coast or the Four Seasons~ this is a hidden secret up here on the far northside but so easy to get to and there is parking! Really this place is like no other yet to be found in Chicago, the space is huge and all the intricate details are really amazing. It is beautiful, the entire design of the place has very specific components chosen from around the world and you can really escape and believe you have traveled far for this getaway. I had a body wrap that was just out of this world. The details and the courtesy of the entire staff really are so welcoming, so unlike your snobby downtown spas! It is an amazing oasis on the inside and there is an endless menu of services. Love it, cannot wait to return!

4.description: I came here for laser hair removal services that I bought on Groupon. The service was quick and I only came here for 5 sessions out of 6. I was tired of driving SO far! I was normally taken cared by one "technician" who happened to have a BSN (it was labeled on her tag). I thought that was peculiar. The laser hair removal worked for my underarms. I definitely brag about it to others.  As for the ambiance, it feels awkward to me -- the backroom is way too dark and the there is a Buddhist shrine on the way out of the backroom/spa area. That's awkward for me... I feel like I have to bow every time I walk out to the front end of the building. Something that everyone should know, you don't have to pay for parking. I paid for the meter the first few times in the Metra parking lot. How did I know? It was right in front of the entrance! Their private lot is on the left of the building. P.S.This place is uber clean.

24.description: A huge and beautiful facility, offering everything from chemical peels, to microdermabrasion, to stone massages.  I went for the Pretty in Pink special, which was laser hair treatment.  The girl who did the treatment on me went a little overboard in describing what was going to happen. She made it out to be like there was going to be an extreme amount of pain (maybe I just have a high pain tolerance?) and it really just felt like a slightly more painful tweeze.  My chin looked and felt great for the day or two after, but now the area is rough and looks like nothing has changed - amount of hair-wise that is.  I realize they said you should expect to come back more than once, but I thought for certain I would be able to see a noticeable difference right off the bat.  Oh well, thats why I bought the discounted package, to see if it was worth it or not.  And another irritating thing, they offer all these other things, like mesotherapy, yoga, nutritional planning and martial arts, but neither on the website or the brochure they gave me had any indication of price.  This leaves me with two impressions:  1) if you have to ask you can't afford it or 2) they do this on purpose so when you do inquire you get the hard sell.  Both of which stink!I would like to frequent the Essence Med Spa, especially to take advantage of the great rain showers and lounge area, but there are some definite kinks in the information relay that need to be worked out first.

6.description: This place has gone down dramatically. when they opened their customer service was something that was important to them as they tried to establish themselves in the area. I went to them for 3 years and finally stopped going a year ago because I was tired of either waiting for more than an hour to see the tech for my scheduled botox appointment (my Internist doesn't even keep me waiting an hour) or tired of the appointment getting cancelled last minute after I took off work to go there. I feel the girls at the front desk, although trying to be accommodating, are being put in a bad position of having to make stories up about where the tech is or why he's running late. They can only do so much. Something just doesn't feel right about this place anymore...

15.description: Terrible customer service!!! I had an appointment for a massage, they left a voice mail one hour before the appointment cancelling. I tried unsuccessfully to reach someone when I tried to call back and reschedule I left a Voice-mail a week ago and no one has returned my call. . This went on for several days- no one answered their phone from Wednesday - Friday. They mysteriously closed down for those days without explanation- very fishy operation.

7.description: I started going here for laser hair removal.  Despite the removal working not 100%, the spa is quite clean and well kept.  The friendly staff will get you free coffee or tea from their shop when you arrive.  The service is quick despite painful.  The downside for me is that it is a far drive from where I live in Lakeview East.  It can take up to 45+ minutes to get to the spa.  I wouldn't say that this place is in Chicago at all because you have to drive through some suburbs to get there!

8.description: What a perfect escape from the cold! On a whim I decided to find a spa that offered a day pass as I just wanted to steam. Yelina was so sweet and professional when I arrived (free parking too!) and the space was above my expectations. Without having to go to a hotel downtown, I got the level of service and cleanliness without the hassle. I ended up deciding after a steam to see if they could fit me in for a massage, and they said of course! Yelina did an excellent deep-tissue. I cannot wait to go back again!

3.description: This is for the Cafe Cleo which I believe is closed on Tuesday's. They have a great selection of smoothies and juices. I've had the Berry, green machine and the Buko with cocoa added. All were amazing and this is my go to place for smoothies/juices in the area.

14.description: Fantastic amenities but could dramatically improve customer service. Twice I've had massages cancelled at the last minute. They need to either add more therapists or better manage their bookings.

1.description: Marty gives excellent haircuts! (even for young mens' styles)

2.description: Marty the Barber is moving to 4716  W. Touhy in Lincolnwood. Next to New York Bagel! Please call him to schedule your next haircut!

0.description: I have been going to Marty for years! He's the best

3.description: Bruce is talented. I always admire his work he puts up at Starbucks down the block. They are expertly put together and unique with combinations of floral and greens you usually don't see in mainstream. Two days ago I ordered an arrangement for my mother's 60th to be delivered at her work. Unfortunately, it never arrived there!!!! It was delivered to a residential north of her. He did redeem it by offering to deliver another arrangement the next day... But who ever is he is using for his delivery service, may it be in house or 3rd party service, it's not good for his business. It killed the surprise and some part of her birthday spirit.First, I understand the conversation I had with Bruce may not have been translated to his delivery service and they followed the address they were given. Perhaps in the future mark if the delivery is business or residential so THAT might be the first clue it's wrong place.Second, didn't the delivery guy confirm the person to receive the arrangement was there???! I know every flower we have received at work has been confirmed. Third, TIME of delivery. Usually when they say business hours, it gets there latest by afternoon. They did call my mother on the second attempt in the morning and confirmed her directions and said they were right around the corner. 3 pm pass, and no show! Being holiday weekend, most were ready to leave by 3. Unfortunate for my mother, she had to call Bruce herself to confirm if something was even coming!!! Finally at 3:30 delivery showed up! I never really heard of end of day delivery unless noted. I still gave the business 4 stars because he does wonderful work and direct customer service has always been great. This delivery fiasco definitely left a bad taste and hopefully he can re-evaluate who/how he chooses to deliver in the future!

1.description: Again a marvelous job! The Mother's Day bouquet was breathless. Have been a client for several years and they amaze me everytime!

2.description: If you want beautiful artistic arrangements shop from this terrific flower shop.  The owner Bruce does beautiful work!!  He did our flowers for a wedding shower and everyone commented how beautiful they were!

5.description: Bruce at A Vintage Bloom was so easy to work with, truly talented, and most importantly made my wedding beautiful!!!  I gave Bruce a vague vision or theme for the floral arrangements and he went above and beyond anything I could have imagined.  A Vintage Bloom were willing to work within my budget while still making the decor magical.  Highly recommend!

0.description: Great customer service!  A Vintage Bloom created a beautiful floral piece for my Father's funeral.  For a personal touch they used flowers from his garden and provided an extra vase with the balance of unused flowers.  We were very pleased, highly recommend!

4.description: Bruce is truly an Artist!!! His floral arrangements are absolutely beautiful as well as all of the other pieces in his shop. I have used Bruce exclusively for all of my children's dances and his vision and artistry are stunning. I love his work and plan on using him forever. The Holidays are quickly approaching and needless to say, A Vintage Bloom will be one of my first stops. He has wonderful, unique gifts and always wraps them with a taste of elegance. Cherie Lauer

3.description: We had a top notch mattress shopping experience on Friday night w/Vince. It was a quick and painless-and, most importantly, budget-friendly. Vince knew his stuff, and got our new bed delivered the next morning (just over 12 hours later)-overall a perfect customer service/shopping experience. Thank you, Vince-we love our new bed, mattress cover, and frame-and will be telling everyone to come and see you for their bedding needs!! (BTW, the bed is a dream, and we have slept wonderfully since delivery!!)

1.description: Needed a box spring for one of our Queen beds because our mattress was not supported enough w the old wooden slats.  We had such a pleasant experience dealing w Victor. He comes off as not pushy, very knowledgable and overall a very nice n honest guy. We  purchased an interior metal supportive frame and a box spring. I would definitely come back n refer my family and friends if need to purchase a bed/mattress/ box spring. We received our delivery the following day. The delivery men were quick, clean and polite. However the box spring was a tad too tall for our frame. I called Victor and he immediately took care of the issue w/o any hassle. He ordered a shorter box spring to be delivered w/o an extra delivery charge.

2.description: This place is amazing. Aaron helped me and my daughter find the perfect bed for us. I purchased the mattress 3 months ago. It was a little too firm for my liking so I decided to return to the store to exchange it for a softer one. I was 2 days past the last day I could have returned it. Aaron made a phone call and got the okay that I could do an exhange. He let my 15 month old run through the store and even brought the huge stuffed animal sheep for her to play with. He was kind, professional and warm hearted. I'm super happy with my experience and will be recommending this store to everyone in the area. Thanks!

0.description: Update - ended up not liking our memory foam decision, gave it a couple weeks but couldn't get use to it. Went back and talked to Victor (my guy) about an exchange. He helped us out with everything and I couldn't be happier. Went back to the pillow top. Ask for Victor - so helpful :)

28.description: Very nice nail salon with prompt service and friendly staff. Cami did my mani/pedi. She was very outgoing. It was my first time there, on a Saturday morning with no appt. & she took me right away. I got the no chip manicure and it still looks great 4 days later even with heavy use! I will go back.

1.description: Positives: Overall, great experience. This is my second time here and they have remodeled and expanded since my last visit. The interior is beautiful and very clean with the possibility for high capacity. They have an immense amount of colors to choose from, both regular and no chip. I simply came in for a pedicure and my nail tech did a great job. (Cost was $28 plus tip) Huge parking lot. I will be back! Critiques: The customer service could be a tad bit friendlier. My foot massage could have been longer with more pressure. (It did not meet the 5 minutes listed in the menu description) I wish my nail tech had initially handed me one of the professional menus because I would have upgraded my pedicure. I believe she may have had an appointment she was trying to meet.

9.description: Very disappointed with the wait time on early Sunday.  Came at 10am, told it was going to be 15 min wait for a manicure, but almost an hour later I was still waiting.  I don't mind waiting if I was told the true estimate.  But since I was limited on my time, I wouldn't have waited.  I was told "10" more minutes 3x.  Annoyed after an hour I left.  There's a nail salon right across the street on Devon.  Went there and got in immediately

29.description: Gosh, its a good thing I did not read these reviews BEFORE I went!    I have long nails and I am very particular about the shape, thickness (of the gel), and the cleanliness of the salon.  Lee Nails met my exacting stancards.  But, I can only speak to the services provided by Nee Nee, but she is exceptional!   Her manicures and pedicures seem to last forever!  Her acrylic nails are very, very, very nicely done...not too thick and perfectly shaped.  She is not a "talker", but I much prefer you pay attention to what you are doing...rather than chat.  As someone else said, there are plenty of magazines.  As for the waxing station...I don't have a clue.  I much prefer Moreen at Geo Style Salon...a bit further east on Devon. She is exceptionally good!  Yes, I am particular about my eyebrows and Moreen does an outstanding job.  The girls at Lee Nails all have severely...and I do mean severely thin brows, so I would fear that's all they know???

23.description: I see some bad reviews of this nail salon and I am surprised. But then again in the world of women's beauty, even if affordable nail salons are the equivalent of fast-food drive throughs in the restaurant market, we don't want to settle when it comes to how we look and feel. This lady included. That being said I enjoy going to Lee Nails and would recommend it. I shoot for the $35.00 mani pedi around these parts, and this place is slightly more costly, but they make up for it in other ways. Let me just share with you some things that might help you. I know nothing about fake nails, gels, fills, or any of that stuff. So I can't speak to that market. I haven't even yet ventured toward a no chip manicure. I'm a basic mani pedi girl, semi short soft squares. When it comes to nails, I'm all organic. (As if there is anything natural about it!) That being said, I've been getting my nails did all freakin' time for ten years, and I have frequented a respectable number of joints. Enough to know that this place is top notch. It's clean, and they have TVs, which I really like because trying to read those magazines is always annoying when your hands are beings soaked and held in rotation. I have never had to wait here, which is nice. And the one time that I did, one of the girls put me in a chair and ran the water and salts for me so I could soak while I waited. That of course made the delay a thousand times more tolerable. Also, this place is slightly annoying because although they take credit cards, they won't let you tip on your card. That's a cash only thing, and it was greatly flustering the first time I planned to pay with a card, asked if they took them, and then was paying just before the polish went on, and she told me cash only for a tip. With a dry bank account for a few days, I had to run to my parent's to grab ten bucks and go all the way back. So remember to bring enough cash for a tip! The last thing I want to mention is in reference to the eyebrow comments I saw. I have dark eyebrows and am particular about them. Over the years I have learned a couple things and one of them is never to get your brows done in a nail place like this unless you know exactly how they are going to turn out. Especially if you have dark hair and features, or rarely spend much time grooming your brows and are accustomed to that style. A quality brow design is only going to occur if you a) don't really care, b) knowingly want them thin, or c) if the person doing them is talking to you about them and what you want. That doesn't happen in nail salons like these. They should also be starting small and showing you as they groom. These ladies at most of these places are not trained stylists or estheticians. If I were to sit down in a chair and close my eyes and hope for the best, I personally think I'm a moron for being angry when I don't get what I want. And, finally, if you insist upon doing this, take a look at the girls brows doing it. In this case if you don't like her's, you aren't going to like your own.

5.description: yen is awsome i get the majestic pedicure and the massage is great. super clean and very competitive prices worth the drive

31.description: The place looks nice on the inside, but their service is terrible and my no chip manicure chipped after 2 days! I went here for a mani/pedi. The manicurist spent the first few minutes yelling at someone on her cell. I spent $35 on a no chip manicure (which is supposed to last 2 weeks without chipping) and it chipped badly after 4 days. Don't come here!

25.description: Enter at your own risk!Although everyone there was very pleasant, I had a terrible experience. First off, my no-chip manicure chipped after 3 days. Secondly, since I was going out for dinner with the hubby that night, I asked for an eyebrow wax but just a clean up. My specific words were, "Just a clean up. Not thin. Just a clean up, ok?" My brows ended up uneven and significantly thinner on one side. When they saw me crying and saying. "No, no!" they offered to fix it - which the only way would have been to make the other brow thinner, so I said no, thanks. They didn't charge me for the brow wax but who cares; my brows are still uneven nearly one month later.I went back to get my no-chip manicure fixed and that was a disaster. They couldn't find the color until I got up and found it myself and then put it on so thinly that it didn't match the initially done nails. It didn't matter anyways as it all chipped in a few days.

12.description: I was treated poorly and am very unhappy with my nails. The tech put so many layers of polish on. The no chip lasted two days before starting to peel off ( from the nailbed); it should last a few weeks!

37.description: It's not close to my house, but it's my go-to nail spot.  I don't go get my nails done for the chit chat.  I don't go so that I can spew my worries and problems in my life on some poor manicurist a-la Legally Blonde.  I go to get my nails done... and I'd rather just skip the chitchat.  That's why I bring my iphone and/or a book.  I brought a bunch of ladies in here when I got married... Mom, bridesmaids, etc.  They were good to us... were able to take us all at once and did a great job.  I have brought children in there and they have been patient and friendly.  Some places roll their eyes at a manicure for kids and when they do things like requst painted flowers and sparkles, flat out sigh.  Not this place.  I even had a girl lose her "sparkly gem" after we left... we went back and they gave her a new one, no problem.  Hell... I might head over there right now.  My cuticles are looking a little ragged...

21.description: No customer service skills! These ladies really behaved as though they have gold bars stacked in their closets and they didn't care if you liked their services or not! Everyone was treated the same way, there was no attempt to be friendly, or ask us to move our feet or hands, they expected us to read their minds. Hopefully they'll read these reviews and wake up! I hate poor customer service!

16.description: Popped in at noon on a Sunday with some time to kill, hoping they'd be able to squeeze me in for a mani-pedi.  Happily, they had time for me right away and I sat down in the (massage) pedicure chair immediately.  While the chairs themselves were nice, the foot basins looked a little old and dingy.  Pedicure was decent.  I don't know the girl's name, but she was pretty rough on my cuticles (which still hurt a few days later) but otherwise did a really nice job.   It was actually a more thorough process than I expected, given the price.Manicure was also decent.  I don't like the chairs they have - I'm pretty short and climbing up and down from those chairs is not exactly easy when you've just had your nails done.  Plus, my feet didn't reach the little place to dry your toes while you have your nails done.  Oh well, maybe it works for other people.  The manicure has actually lasted pretty well.  She did try to up-sell me on the no-chip, but didn't push it when I declined.My biggest complaint is that when she was taking off the toe separators, she (badly) smudged one of my toe nails and then REFUSED to redo that toe.  Who does that??  Especially when it is HER FAULT!!  So now I have a smudged toe nail and am unlikely to go back, even though the rest of my experience was perfectly fine.

17.description: There is really nothing good to say about this place. The person who answers the phone has an attitude. They never keep your appointment time, their chairs are broke and their techs are sub par at best. Shame on me, I should have known better after the last time here.

10.description: This place is on my list of " I"m never going back" places.  My biggest complaint is all of the talking they do to each other in another language.  That's just rude! (Seinfeld anyone?).Another major factor is that I mysteriously developed a horrific ingrown toenail on one of my big toes the day after my pedicure.  I am not exaggerating when I say it took well over a year to totally heal with no pain. I could not sleep on my stomach if that toe was rubbing against the mattress. So I'm thinking probably a rush job on my foot, digging too deep and /or dirty utensils.  This place is so close yet I have not been there in over two years and could care less. There are too many better nail places in the area to give this one another chance.I do want to add that one time I took my girls in (pre-teens) for mani/ pedi they started to paint flowers on the nails (of course for an extra charge) without asking me first.  They asked the girls if they would like pretty flowers on their nails. Of course they would!  They're girls!  The next  time ask the parent first. Anything to make a buck.

11.description: I went here while trying to find a different salon in Edgebrook. After looking all over I finally decided to pop in here.  Not an awful choice, but not a good choice on my part.I got the no-chip manicure and an eyebrow wax and signed in at the front. Honestly, I thought I'd have to wait because all the techs were sitting in the pedicure chairs yapping away.  Not an issue, but just seemed a little unprofessional to be doing that as clients walk in.I was taken to my seat at the manicure table first, which surprised me.  Typically salons will wax first so the redness goes away by the time you leave.  My experience in the chair was fine.  The unprofessionalism continued as all the women kept talking (in Vietnamese).  At one point one of them even sat down beside me and started doing her own nails.  It also got so loud in the salon (I was still the only client) that I couldn't hear what my nail tech was asking me; from 2 feet away. Yikes.My manicure looks okay. It's not the greatest no-chip I've gotten.  It's darker at the tips because of her pushing the polish back.  Not awful but it just looks like I have gunk under my nails all the time.The eyebrow wax was horrible and I would not recommend it to anyone.  She used pre-waxed strips, not hot wax.  I had to pluck so much out of my eyebrows by the time I got home, it just was not $15 well-spent.Overall I just feel like I spent way too much money here for the service I received.  Would probably stop in if I were in a pinch, but won't seek this place out again.

26.description: So I've passed by this nail place for about a year or so and had never gone in, however I always saw tons of people there, even in the winter.  i figure then it must be a good nail salon.  Boy was I wrong.  I went on a Saturday and when I asked about price they said $40+.  Even with the price being high I still thought to give it a chance. My friend had a french manicure and not only did the lady rush her through she wasn't very detailed on her work.  The curves in her nails were all wacked out.  As for my nails, I got that new crackle nail polish OPI came out with, so you can't really see too many mistakes, well i could still see my natural nail through the polish.  Also the polish they had there was very liquidly which I found kind of odd.  We didn't get the no chip polish however, I've gotten my nails done at other salons and it usually lasts me about a week.  Well my friend's french was already chipping the same day and mine started to chip two days after.  That 1st week i started to take off the nail polish and noticed my nails had been ruined.  They must have used a cheap base because my nails were dry and completely brittle.  By the way I came in with very healthy long nails, now their dry and chipping away. Needless to say I'm extremely disappointed.  Never will i go there again.  Thankfully there are a ton of other choices on the same block, I will try my luck with the others which by the way cheaper.  One thing I will say that I did like was that when i was getting my pedi, I was asked if I wanted a flower drawn on my toe, and I went with it, I thought how nice, uuuh yeah she forgot to mention to me that she would charge $5 extra for that.  Maybe i should have known better but still. Oh well, bad experience never returning.

27.description: Popped in at noon on a Sunday with some time to kill, hoping they'd be able to squeeze me in for a mani-pedi.  Happily, they had time for me right away and I sat down in the (massage) pedicure chair immediately.  While the chairs themselves were nice, the foot basins looked a little old and dingy.  Pedicure was decent.  I don't know the girl's name, but she was pretty rough on my cuticles (which still hurt a few days later) but otherwise did a really nice job.   It was actually a more thorough process than I expected, given the price.Manicure was also decent.  I don't like the chairs they have - I'm pretty short and climbing up and down from those chairs is not exactly easy when you've just had your nails done.  Plus, my feet didn't reach the little place to dry your toes while you have your nails done.  Oh well, maybe it works for other people.  The manicure has actually lasted pretty well.  She did try to up-sell me on the no-chip, but didn't push it when I declined.My biggest complaint is that when she was taking off the toe separators, she (badly) smudged one of my toe nails and then REFUSED to redo that toe.  Who does that??  Especially when it is HER FAULT!!  So now I have a smudged toe nail and am unlikely to go back, even though the rest of my experience was perfectly fine.

35.description: I am no expert on manicures BUT I have had a few and this one had some effects on my nails I am not happy with.  I will admit that I went on a VERY busy night.  I did not have an appointment and asked how long I would have to wait...5 minutes.  I should NEVER believe anyone when they say 5 minutes because I waited 20 but you really do hope its 5 & when 5 goes by you think, "OK I'll wait 5 more" & then you're committed.My issues w/ this establishment:1.  It reeks of some chemical; my guess is from fake nails being done.  This means no ventilation and I felt like I was being poisoned...NOT RELAXING.2.  I was not instructed to pick out a color & I wasn't sure what to do (again only had a few manicures in my life) so when I was being called I asked the girl if I should go pick a color (since she was setting up some things) and the manager lady actually yelled at me that it was my turn.  I felt I need to hurry & get my color & get over to my seat less she scratch my eyes out.3.  The woman who did my nails was all business not the least bit friendly although not unpleasant but NOT even smiling.  Scary.4.  She filed the TOP of my nails where the paint goes.  When she did it I was shocked b/c why do that?  To make the paint stick better?  I guess but it was a really course file not a buffing file.  I am STLL growing out these file lines & when they get to the end my nail breaks.  Needless to say this pisses me off as I have never had this done to my nails.5.  The polish started chipping the next day.  Maybe they would have done a re-touch but really I don't have time for that & I feel it should last at least 2-3 days.Never again.

8.description: I don't understand how this place stays open.  My manicurist was so unenthusiastic about her job..  My nails look horrible. It was the most lack luster, lazy manicures I've ever had.  Do yourself a favor and go to  one of the other 6 nail salons in Edgebrook.

0.description: Totally remodeled. Beautiful. Tracy was great. Very sanitary. Auto clave   Impressive.

38.description: So I went here because from the outside it looks like a realllllly nice nail salon ~ I went inside and it's pretty top notch as far as others in the area (or at least as far as looks go).  The lady that greeted me was pretty rude, they don't have a very big color selection, and the lady that did my nails didn't say 1 word to me until she asked me to pay at the end. WTF! Really? They are pretty over priced too...  I'll take a pass on this place.

20.description: Before I had a baby, I got my nails done pretty often so I think I know what I'm doing in a nail salon.  So I went here about a week ago because someone had gotten me a gift card.  This place is super close to my house which is great and when I got here I was really surprised by how nice the place looked once I was inside. So on to my experience...  I really hope the owner reads this. I wish I had asked the nail girl her name but I didn't - I'll never go back because of her. First, completely unfriendly. Second, if I had read some of these reviews before going I would have known they don't allow you to add a tip on your credit card but I had no idea and I never have cash, never. So like the other reviewer said the only thing she said to me was, "do you want to pay now?" So I did. Then I asked her to run my card for $10 over which I normally do at Swan Nails but she insisted cash only for tips.  Then I explained how I'd never been here before and I persistently asked again, just this once and she refused. So she finishes my nails which turned out really nice. Then she goes over to her co-workers who are all sitting in the pedi chairs and extremely loudly re-enacts our conversation. No, I don't speak her language but it was obvious, very obvious. I sat there for quite a while drying my nails and she never came back. No one even said bye when I left, it was really uncomfortable. After I left I went around the block, got cash at an ATM, and ran it in. So I decided to write this review hoping someone there would read this. So just so we are clear. That was really embarrassing. I wish I had not gone back and tipped because you are not entitled to a tip you earn it with great service and my nails turned out great but my experience was terrible. Lastly, as a business owner, you do not have a business without your customers. If you are going to have particular policies in place issues are going to arise.

19.description: I will never go there again for a number of reasons:1. My nails were yellow after I removed nail polish from my hands ( I'm still waiting for them to grow back to my normal color)2. I've just removed nail polish from my toes and I've discovered that my nails feel andlook as if they were sanded with large grain sand paper3. Woman who did my nails was very pushy trying to persuade me to do no chip mani and pedi4. She made me bleed5. She talked to other workers while taking care of me-kind of rude since I did not understand what they were talking about5. No massage chairs

33.description: I went to their new location which is maybe 5 minutes from here. It's next to the Dominick's on Nagle and Devon (across from super dog) I like this place convenient, well priced, clean, jet free pedicures which is great because it's easier to sanitize (and i vow to try them one day), and I've never felt rushed or that the people are rude. $15 for a manicure is fantastic in my eyes (there are other places in the area that charge $10 but believe me it's worth the extra $5) They always do a nice clean job, the massage is fantastic, and a nice hot towel feels amazing and super soothing. My manicures have ALWAYS lasted about a week which is amazing because my job requires a lot of cleaning and washing of my hands. If you want a nice manicure and don't want to pay the over priced spas in the city give em a try.. but please stay away from Rose Nails down the street!!

2.description: Beautiful place and I love how clean it is. However, they do thin out their nail polishes, even the no chip. Just keep that in mind. Other than that, I really don't have any other complaints. I'd be bringing in my own nail polish next time.

34.description: I have been looking for a new place to go since I am getting bored with my usual spot.  I tried to hit Spa Nail City on Peterson, but they refused me at 35 minutes prior to their close time.  (See my review on them next!)I ended up at Lee Nail out of desperation - I walked in there at 20 min to 8:00 (closing time) and they had no problem taking me.  They even asked if I would mind getting the toes/hands done simultaneously.  I said no problem!  I think the place is very attractive inside and comfortable.  The spa was very clean and comfortable and these two ladies worked MAGIC on my hideous finger/toe nails!!!  The pedicure was really top notch - buffed the hell out of my overworked feet and did a great exfoliation - then got foot/leg and hand massages.  It was HEAVEN.  Then they used hot towels on hands, feet and legs - that's something I've never had in any salon!  Truly, I walked out of there feeling like a million bucks.  Granted, the nail techs didn't speak much, it was very down to business, but whatever, I am not there to chat the weather.  I bring a friend to chat with or a book when I get nails done.  All in all, I thought it was a GREAT experience, and I really appreciated that they took me that close to closing time - I would have hated to head out to Vegas with funky toes and bitten fingernails!!!  I will definitely be back!

32.description: WARNING: DO NOT LET THEM NEAR YOUR EYEBROWS.Do I have your attention?  Good.I've frequented this establishment over the past 6 months because they offer a very affordable no-chip manicure.  Professionally, I can't go to meetings with chipped nail polish and raggedy nails.  Personally, I can't afford a $55 manicure every two weeks, so Lee Nail Salon is my affordable solution at $35 per no-chip mani.  It's all about that life-work balance, right?Well, I normally go elsewhere for my browscaping needs, but on my last visit I was in desperate need of some grooming but not enough time to make two stops.  The nail tech, who didn't say more than two words to me during my manicure other than to ask me about my brows, was very pushy in suggesting a wax.  Geez lady, I get it, my brows were a little out of control.  So I agreed.BIG.  MISTAKE.I've never seen anyone apply the wax to the muslin strips INSTEAD OF the brow area, THEN pressing the wax laden strip on the brow area.  But this woman did.  And she massacred my eyebrows.  Apparently she didn't understand "just clean up" - she took it to mean "remove almost entire brows."I think it was a trick - remove most of my brows, ruin the shape of the arches then I'd have to come back and get them tattooed on.  NOT HAPPENIN' SISTER.  Even if I were going to get tattoo makeup, Lee Nail Salon is the last place on earth I would go.I deal with their impossibly small assortment of no-chip colors, but this last experience has me thinking of ways to scrounge up the extra $20 every two weeks so I can go back to Cici Nails.  If you need someone to walk your dog or pick up dry cleaning, please contact me - apparently I'm going to need the extra dough.

18.description: Gosh, its a good thing I did not read these reviews BEFORE I went!    I have long nails and I am very particular about the shape, thickness (of the gel), and the cleanliness of the salon.  Lee Nails met my exacting stancards.  But, I can only speak to the services provided by Nee Nee, but she is exceptional!   Her manicures and pedicures seem to last forever!  Her acrylic nails are very, very, very nicely done...not too thick and perfectly shaped.  She is not a "talker", but I much prefer you pay attention to what you are doing...rather than chat.  As someone else said, there are plenty of magazines.  As for the waxing station...I don't have a clue.  I much prefer Moreen at Geo Style Salon...a bit further east on Devon. She is exceptionally good!  Yes, I am particular about my eyebrows and Moreen does an outstanding job.  The girls at Lee Nails all have severely...and I do mean severely thin brows, so I would fear that's all they know???

13.description: Went here a couple of years ago and wasn't pleased but since it's convenient I thought I'd give it another chance. Mistake. First of all the technicians are constantly paying attention to each other or whatever but not to what they are doing to my hands. It was Halloween and my technician kept looking out the door for trick or treaters. Then her daughter came in and stood there talking for several minutes. Well the tech managed to cut my cuticles at least two times. I think someone who is working on your hands or feet with sharp instruments should be paying CLOSE attention to what they are doing. Also carrying on constant conversations with others is just plain rude. This place is not by any means the cheapest in the area. Having been to many salons, these technicians are the rudest and the most careless of any I've been to. On top of that, the manicure started chipping as soon as any I've had.

4.description: Horrible.Rude front desk lady. Manicurist literally talked on her phone most of the time she "did" my nails. Other than that she occasionally grunted at me. She went way too fast to get me the hell out of there.

24.description: Will never go back!!! I had been there for pedicures a few times and thought they did a decent job. On my last visit I told the woman to just file my nails and not to cut them. All the sudden I feel pain! She took the clippers and cut out the corner of the nail on my big toe. She didn't cut it across but down on an angle in the corner. It hurt so bad I had tears! I said why did you do that! She said "oh don't worry it's fine".  My toe hurts so bad today it's actually hard to walk on it.
