Who I guess was the owner or manager came over to see what was wrong and didn't say a word to me except how was I going to pay cash or credit!! Don't go there!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

6.description: Im not sure how the other girls are but Rosey is great! She's been doing my nails for years.  This place was just remodeled so everything is new. They have a big polish selection and I really like that they use disposable bowl liners on the pedicure chairs.

22.description: Good not great.  I go here on occasion but it is not my first choice. The place is clean and attractive.  Most of my mani-pedis have been fine.  The no-chip lasts close to 2 weeks.  It lasts 3 weeks at another place which I actually prefer. So why don't I go to my preferred place exclusively?  Because I cannot always wait a few weeks for an appointment.  Lee is always there.  I also think they are a bit pricey for the area.The techs are polite but not particularly friendly.  Be warned - you can no longer put your tip on a credit card.  I felt terrible when I was not allowed to tip last week but I plan to return with the cash when I have a chance.

15.description: I get my nails done weekly and I just moved to the area. My usual place was closed and judging from Lee Nails appearance I thought this place may be great to try out. The waiting time wasn't bad at all. However as soon as I got into the pedicure chair things were bad. The girl I got, who by the way was dressed like a stripper was rushing and hurting me. When my husband got up to tell her manager that my toes were bleeding the manager said "she knows" and then walked away. When the "technician" got to my nails, it went even worse. She drilled my skin, my skin then tore off, cut me a few times, and asked me not to move. I never complain, I politely asked her to stop hurting me, and explained that I understood that they were closing. Everyone was counting their money and getting ready to close up, but I was told the hour prior from closing that they had no problem getting me in. So my tech was rushing and being sloppy. I was hoping the manicure would at least look good. My nails were all different shapes, with bubbles inside the dry polish (because they weren't polished properly), and bloody. I own a few small businesses on that same block, hence me moving to the area -- therefore I will make sure everyone knows how terrible this place is. I never got an apology, and I tipped out of being the decent person that I am. I was then rushed out.

7.description: Miserable experience. The management staff was rude and constantly yelled at the techs in Vietnamese while they spoke native English among themselves. My tech cut my toe and was so afraid that the managers would notice that she was teary. I received no apology as I was paying, in fact there was no conversation at all. Very rude..... NEVER AGAIN!

36.description: I have been very happy with my pedicures every time I go here.  The ladies who work there are pleasant enough but are not the type that will chitchat with you, which I am 100% okay with.  I don't mind enjoying the massage chair and trashy magazines in peace.  One pedicure I got, the lady answered her cell phone three times during it which is a little weird, but whatever, I liked the way my nails came out.  I will continue to go here because my pedicures always last a long time, the prices are reasonable, and the location is convenient for me during my commute home from work.  I have never had problems finding street parking either.

30.description: this was the worst manicure i have ever had.  i was a walk-in so i expected to wait, and i waited about 10-12 minutes to be seated by a manicurist, and then another 10-15 minutes while about three different manicurists sat in front of me, got up, brought a soaking bowl (2), and left me hanging there without any instruction to soak or anything else.  i was finally started by "Rosie" who barely looked at my nails as she was filing, and hence missed the nail altogether frequently.   she was too busy talking to the other manicurists, or answering the phone.  She also was very focused on selling me a pedicure or a wax for eyebrows (which there is no evidence that i needed).   I chose two nail polish colors.  She couldn't open either one, and instructed me to pick a third.  She didn't even try to ask someone else to pen, or use a rubberband to grip the top, as i have seen in other salons.   Despite a lack of permission to take my credit card (which granted was on the manicure table where i was seated), she took it and charged it after instructing me to wash my hands.   She got no tip as a result of the horrible experience.  It'd be unlikely I'd come again as I live else where in the City, but I have family members who live close by, and I will tell them never to go.  And I don't think $15 is any particular bargain.  Nail salons are a dime a dozen, and I have much better choices who appreciate my patronage.  Oh, and btw, she left cotton pieces sticking out of my nailpolish.   I ended up taking the nailpolish that she left and touching it up myself.  So pissed.

3.description: Wow they have really stepped up their service since the remodel. Good service, nice environment. ..very nice!

14.description: I don't usually like writing bad reviews. May be I just had a bad nail technician so I am not trying to through off the entire business. But I would like to share my experience as it was not very pleasant. First of all while I was served the technician was on phone the entire time and using ridiculously inappropriate words. I wouldn't care about this so much if she was paying any regards to what she was doing to my nails. She kept hurting me as she was really into her interesting conversation and didn't apologize even once. End result was ridiculous. My nails were super uneven. They charge fairly high then any other place as well.  I didn't try them again after this experience and not planning to.

3.description: Do not get your nails done here! I was on my way home from work and drove by Fantastic Beauty Salon and decided to avoid the traffic by getting myself a no chip manicure. Big mistake! The lady who did my nails did not know what she was doing. Mind you, I am not a nail technician but I have been getting my nails done for over 15 years. I asked the tech to trim down my nails. So, she cut them down real short and jagged. Then she did not bother to file them so that they were no longer jagged. She did not clean up my cuticles either. She proceeded to paint my nails but only in the center of my nail and completely avoided to paint the sides of my nail. I noticed that she was not painting the whole nail so I asked her to make sure to cover my whole nail with polish. So indeed she did. However not only did she get my whole nail she also painted the skin all around my nail. I brought to her attention then that she had painted all of my skin and that the ends of my nails were jagged and asked to file them straight. Seeing that I was not happy with the results she decided to repaint all of my nails. So instead of soaking off the polish she filed the polish off with an electrical metal round filer. Needless to say it was very painful and she files the tops of my nails down raw. She redid my nails and they did not look any better then the first time she did them. As a matter of fact they looked even worse! I told her I can not pay $30 for such a poor no-chip manicure. I asked her if she would pay $30 for the way my nails looked and she could not answer me. All she said was that my finger nails were too small. To small for what? To paint my nails? Are you kidding me! I told her as long as I have been getting my nails done no one has ever told me that my nails were too small to paint. Nor have I ever had such a horrific paint job. She told me to talk to the owner. So I did. I showed him my nails and he just shrugged his shoulders and had no solution for me. He blocked the door way as to keep me in the shop (as if I was going to run out or something) I told him. Listen, I will pay for my pedicure but I will not pay for the manicure. Not with the way they look. He told me that if I won't pay for the mani then the tech must take it off. I said that's fine, "take it off then". So the tech proceeded to grab the electric nail file and I told her "No, you need to soak them off" because she already filed my nails down raw and I wasn't about to would out of there with bloody fingers. Needless to say she had another tech soak off the nail polish and she went and hid in the back and could not show her face. So much for trying to avoid traffic of the way home. I was in there for 2 1/2 hours.

1.description: Decided to get my nails done here since its on my way home from work! Haven't had a pedicure done in a long  time and to surprise they soak my feet with paraffin wax and given a hot stone massage!! I will definitely come back and DEFINITELY recommend to other peeps!!!

2.description: This place has gotten way better after being taken over by 2 sistersin the past year or so. They offer very affordable services from massages to mani pedis to hair treatments, they have it all! I have gone there on multiple occasions and they are always very friendly and courteous. The pedicures are my favorite because you get to sit in a massage chair and they give you a hot stone massage :-) I highly recommend to go there if you get the chance!

0.description: Great salon. I get my hair and nails done there. The two sisters are wonderful. They're great with my elderly mother too. I highly recommend making this your permanent nail salon.
